We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

Frontiers catalog is growing. Every month we need to handle more journals, articles, and research topics, to process more data and enable new features for our users.

We are looking for a Data Scientist (Graph) Team Lead with experience leading teams, to join our business and manage a Data Team formed by Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

You will define, plan and coordinate internal technical projects related to our Data Products. The development and evolution of knowledge graphs, and the creation of a solid data foundation to empower our data scientists and our machine learning team.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach and evolve your team, creating a culture of excellence that will allow them professional growth.
Plan and coordinate the activities for the creation of data products and features that extract value from data in our different systems.
Lead the work in a complex data-intensive environment, handle the integration with systems built by other teams.
Map business and technical requirements into actionable initiatives, reporting and analyzing results in a timely manner, and learning from any mistakes
Work close to the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team, to help them to extract the maximum value and empower their initiatives.
Collaborate with other leaders to identify and capitalize on opportunities to leverage new technologies and create novel solutions to our organizations challenges.

What we are looking for:
Minimum 5 years experience as a Senior Data Scientist or Senior Data Engineer with at least 3 years leading teams
A natural leader, proactive and hands-on
Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios who can understand priorities and balance them
Strong knowledge of current industry-wide Data Engineering and DS/ML practices, tools, and techniques
Our technical stack is based on GCP, Google BigQuery, Kafka, Databricks, PySpark, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and therefore knowledge on any of these would be highly beneficial
These are some of the data challenges we are working on and therefore any experience with these would be beneficial:
Knowledge of Neo4j
Knowledge of Cypher queries
Experience working with knowledge graph
Familiarity with Agile framework
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Guardian Industries, a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian’s diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian’s vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.
 Guardian is looking for a Data Engineer (remote work) 
 Data Engineer is the subject matter expert on dimensional modeling techniques and data integration from external partners into transactional systems and through to the data warehousing and analytical platforms. The individual must be able to communicate in written form and manage workload dependencies. Strong analytical and problem solving skills are required.
 What You Will Do In Your Role
  Participate in analysis sessions to understand functional and non-functional requirements
Design DW tables base on dimensional modeling techniques (Kimball)
Create/develop code and jobs in Talend while following enterprise best practices
Provide technical insight and develop work estimates to project planners
Should be responsible for building extraction and mapping rules for loading data from multiple sources for data warehouse implementation based on AWS Snowflake
Must have strong knowledge on Data Warehousing (DWH) concepts, ETL concepts, data analysis capabilities and experience in the Talend Big-Data Real Time ETL tool.
Work with business users to translate requirements into system flows, data flows, data mappings etc., and develop solutions to complex business problems
Maintain workload and time tracking within Azure DevOps
Development experience working in Agile Scrum environment
 The Experience You Will Bring
   Experience as a Data engineer with strong data architecture knowledge around data warehousing concepts, SQL development and optimization, and operational support models
Must have experience with Talend Big-Data Real Time Studio.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment that requires quick turnaround and quality output.
Experience with Azure DevOps
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision

¡Buscamos profesionales Power BI!
 En Avantgarde ¡seguimos creciendo! y en esta ocasión, estamos buscando ampliar nuestro equipo Power BI con profesionales de diferentes niveles de experiencia. Profesionales senior con más de 3 años de experiencia en Power-BI y profesionales junior con al menos un año de experiencia en PowerBI. Todos ellos con un buen nivel de inglés.
 ¿Quiénes somos?
 En Avangarde IT ayudamos a las empresas que están transformando el mundo a resolver sus problemas tecnológicos para que puedan llegar hasta el infinito y más allá 🚀
 Nuestros orígenes están en el Centro de Innovación de BBVA, y desde entonces no hemos parado de aportar soluciones tecnológicas desde una perspectiva #PeopleCentric. 🤟
Nuestro objetivo, formarnos de tecnologías de manera temprana y así crear ventajas competitivas a nuestros clientes.
Nuestro mayor desafío, la actitud ante la innovación.
Nuestro mayor valor, las personas. Trabajamos en una cultura colaborativa, creativa y de valores, fomentando el desarrollo profesional y personal de cada empleado.
 ¿Qué hacemos?
 Estamos especializados en tres áreas:
Hiperautomatización: RPA, LowCode, Microsoft 365.
IA y Analytics: PowerBI , Microsoft Azure, Machine Learning, análisis de datos, predicción de errores.
Digital Channels: Intelligent Assistants, UX & FrontEnd, Movilidad y XR.
 ¿Cómo es nuestro candidato ideal?
 Nuestro Power BI debe ser un apasionado de la tecnología y que tenga mucha inquietud en las nuevas tendencias y en la innovación tecnológica.
 EXPERIENCIA AVANTGARDE...
Junto con la alta especialización técnica de nuestros proyectos damos mucha importancia a nuestros empleados, aportando valor a través nuestras políticas destinadas a lograr su desarrollo profesional:
Cuentas con un cheque de formación anual de 1000 euros para invertir en tu formación: Idiomas, formación online, cursos especializados.
Contamos con un Plan de Carrera acompañado de un plan de Formación individualizado, mediante el cual podrás desarrollarte y asegurar tu actualización tecnológica.
25 días de vacaciones al año + el día de tu cumpleaños.
Te ofrecemos divertirte con tus compañeros en nuestros eventos periódicos donde podrás compartir experiencias del sector.
Accede a nuestros packs de beneficios sociales.
Benefíciate de nuestra apuesta por la estabilidad y flexibilidad. Disfruta del teletrabajo.
  ¿Hablamos? Este es nuestro proceso de selección:
 Envíanos tu CV, y si tu candidatura cumple con los requisitos exigidos te llamaremos para un máximo de tres entrevistas que incluyen una personal, una técnica y en ocasiones alguna prueba técnica.
 Por supuesto, para cualquier duda o más información sobre la oferta, no dudes en ponerte en contacto a través de nuestro correo selección@avantgardeit.es
 AVANTGARDE IT SERVICES. S.L, en cumplimiento del artículo 13 del RGPD, le solicita su consentimiento para el tratamiento de sus datos personales, con la finalidad de incluirle en nuestros procesos de selección de personal. El tratamiento se encuentra legitimado en base a su consentimiento expreso (art 6.1.a) RGPD), que presta mediante su postulación a la candidatura de empleo. En determinados casos, podrá ser necesario comunicar sus datos personales a nuestro cliente para que valore su candidatura. Sus datos personales serán conservados durante el plazo de 1 año desde la finalización del proceso de selección. Puede ejercer sus derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, oposición, limitación, portabilidad y a no ser objeto de decisiones automatizadas en protecciondedatos@avantgardeit.es, Le informamos igualmente, de que tiene derecho a presentar una reclamación ante la AEPD en caso de considerarlo oportuno.

Position at Premier Research At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today. We’re looking for a Data Management Reporting Programmer to join our Functional Services team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success. 
Works with cross-functional study team members in a programming capacity to create reporting solutions that support the quality and timely delivery of data management reports and visualizations required per standard and study specific data review plans
Creates, enhances, and decommissions data management reports in accordance with applicable standard operating procedures
Ensures timelines and milestones are met in collaboration with cross functional teams
Creates any needed documentation for reports and ensures proper filing
Works across the portfolio to increase automated reporting (e.g. - JReview, Spotfire) and review in order to streamline effort on data intensive studies
Enhances available reporting tools or creates new ones to support the review of clinical trial data and trial status information for cross-functional use
Provides input on data management reporting standards as required 
Bachelor’s degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a programming, technical, clinical, or health-related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1 to 3 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems (eg – Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, Datalabs, etc) or data visualization reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire, jReview). Alternatively, must have proven experience in all primary job functions
Practical experience with SQL or similar programming language required
Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the
Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)
Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership 
Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities 
Why choose Premier Research? 
 Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need. 
 Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.
 Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful. 
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve. We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others. Premier Research is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is compliant with all federal guidelines. All qualified applicants will receive equitable consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

A US-based early-stage venture fund that is investing in companies through data-driven evidence and analysis, is looking for a Data Scientist. The selected candidate will be a member of the team that develops and analyses machine learning models to discover investment candidates, while also being in charge of building the investment analytics platform. The firm uses advanced algorithms to narrow down on promising B2B, AI, cloud storage, and eCommerce startups to invest in remotely. This will be a full-time role that requires 4+ hours overlap with the PST time zone. This is a great opportunity for developers to work with a leading firm while meeting exciting companies, and amazing entrepreneurs from all over the world.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Lead the research and development of the company’s latest products and services
Apply quantitative analysis, data mining, and machine learning techniques to build models that make sense of user needs, usage patterns, factors that drive deeper adoption
Influence product development, strategy, and roadmap prioritization
Design and implement machine learning pipelines that improve the company’s data-driven decision-making capabilities
Tackle complex problems that require innovative, elegant, and creative solutions
 Job Requirements:
  B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Science, or other related majors
At least 2+ years of relevant experience as a Data Scientist
Extensive knowledge and experience working with Python
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and system architecture 
Relevant experience with large data set analysis
Experience with Python and machine learning applications (Scikit, Tensorflow, etc.) is nice to have
Experience as an entrepreneur or in the venture ecosystem is desirable
Strong English communication skills

job_title: Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics - Home based - EUROPE
description:
Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives. Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for. Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives. Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know: WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE Why Syneos Health 
 We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
 We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
 We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong. 
 Plans, organizes, manages and monitors the sector’s activities/operations according to his/her field of expertise, strategic and tactical alignments, and the needs of the organization in order to achieve the expected results.
 Manages all operations activities related to the Pharmacometrics sector.
 Provides quotes for all services provided by the team (e.g., Pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics analyses, toxicokinetics analyses, additional analyses not included in the original scope of work, etc.)
 Provides other consultation services in clinical pharmacology field.
 Acts as a pharmacometrician.
 Acts as a scientific consultant/clinical pharmacologist for clients, proposing methodologies or performing pharmacometrics analyses (e.g., PK/PD analyses).
 Ensure proper training and development of pharmacokineticists and pharmacometricians.
 Review/prepare pharmacometric section of study protocols and/or Pharmacometric analysis plans for preclinical or Phase I to IV studies.
 Manages human capital including workforce planning and hiring activities, performance management and the daily monitoring of productivity; facilitates knowledge development and transfer; and ensures the efficiency and mobilization of the team in order to achieve the expected results.
 Helps develop and analyze the sector’s performance indicator systems according to the established objectives. Identifies opportunities to improve the division and/or service’s master plan and processes. Determines, as needed, the necessary actions in order to increase efficiency.
 Contributes to the development of the sector’s budget, ensures that it is being adhered to, performs budget follow-up for pertinent stakeholders and recommends actions in an effort to achieve the expected results.
 Communicates the necessary information to keep the team, the organization, and external clients abreast of the sector’s work plan, policies, projects processes, results, and actions and recommendations taken to meet arising needs and to achieve the expected results.
 Advises internal/external clients of the division and/or service’s particular areas of expertise by assessing needs, and carrying out analysis and follow-up.
 Acts as a consultant and resource person for external clients and Business Development employees with respect to pharmacometric issues.
 Acts as a clinical Pharmacologist.
 Represents the sector, both internally and externally, as a source for consultation and/or information and/or reference.
 Promotes clinical pharmacology services.
 Fosters the company’s scientific outreach by attending seminars, writing scientific articles, participating in conventions, interacting with the academic community, etc.
 The employee may be called upon to perform other tasks related to their skill set, and for which he/she has been trained. 
What we’re looking for 
 MSc or PhD in Biopharmaceutical Sciences, Pharmacology, Experimental Medicine or in another relevant field.
 Word, Excel, and software used in pharmacometrics analyses: WinNonlin, SAS, NONMEM, etc.
 Required bilingualism includes communicating verbally and in writing on topics that are often technical, and writing procedures or technical reports.
 Candidate who does not possess the required training and/or experience may be considered under different criteria. 
Get to know Syneos Health Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients. No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Desde ASTEK IBERIA, queremos presentarles una oportunidad de QA Software Engineer, para trabajar con nuestro partner líder en turismo a nivel global.
 La sede está en Madrid y tiene un centro I+D importante en Francia.
 Trabajarías en un entorno internacional con un stack actualizado y puntero.
Por supuesto, tendrás la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente y estar rodeado de gente experta en el sector del IT para poder aprender bastante.
 Si tienes.. :
- entre 0 y 3 años de experiencia en QA Engineering (con herramientas del tipo de Selenium, Cucumber, RESTful API, Postman, GITlab, JIRA...)
- testing en parte backend (API validation tools)
- un inglés de buen nivel
- un grado en informatica (Computer Science)
 ...entonces puede que encajes perfectamente !
 Trabajarías con horarios flexibles en un entorno que cuida el bienestar del trabajador.
  100% remote
 En el caso de que quieras participar al proceso, me puedes confirmar tu interés a , incluyendo un CV en inglés (detallado por favor) y así te cuento más

Our Data platform is handling real-time data from dozens of services. Imagine a modern data stack that needs to be deployed to utilize real-time data. Think of custom-developed applications which support data integrations from various sources. We do not hesitate from developing our own frameworks to make processes more effective. Sounds interesting?
 We’re looking for someone who:
Is eager to learn new things and aspires to bring new ideas to life
Has some programming background and a general understanding of data architectures
Knows how to write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code that adheres to best practices, with an emphasis on performance, scalability
 Bonus points if you are:
Familiar with cloud-based technologies
Experienced with Kubernetes
Experienced in Python
 What you’ll be doing:
Managing Data platform on Kubernetes (ArgoCD)
Develop processes that will make the Data platform scalable and enable data integrations with other systems (developing custom applications/frameworks mostly in python and CI/CD pipelines with Codefresh)
Communicate with other data engineers, product owners, and development teams in order to understand business processes and system architecture for specific product feature
Doing code reviews and assuring the best quality of the platform through collaboration with other team members

Meet our Team 
 We represent Hitachi Vantara to enterprise clients across industries, establishing business relationships to understand customer challenges so that we can deliver profitable business for Hitachi products, services and solutions. We collaborate as a team and cross-functionally to ensure the success of our customers; success that is celebrated and shared. Our solutions bring value to every line of business and we need people like you to build those deep relationships and to passionately articulate our value proposition.
  What You’ll Be Doing
 As part of our Data Automation team, you will:
  Provide programming and best practice consultation directly to our clients for the integration of our Enterprise Data Automation products and services with large, complex datasets.
Drive the partnership with other teams to understand client requirements, communicate product improvements, and assist with all client development needs.
Adopt and embrace our cultural and innovative best practices and solutions in order to quickly and accurately identify and address highly technical problems.
Be solution focused, able to quickly and accurately perform detailed and meaningful diagnostic work and troubleshooting, developing additional tools where you see a need internally or for our clients.
Work closely with technical and data operations teams at client firms to understand their requirements and help them to build out solutions using our Data Automation Technologies.
Actively identify potential areas of improvement or gaps in internal tools & monitoring systems and propose solutions.
Apply good interpersonal and presentation skills to work in a fast-paced environment across multinational teams.
Collaborate with peers, sales, technical account managers and service delivery teams to drive critical client on-boarding initiatives, technology partnerships and highly technical projects.
Proactively identify ideas to help drive stronger product performance and implement those ideas from start to finish.
Provide technical development guidance, leadership and structure to Enterprise Data clients.
Cultivate deep technical partnerships with key members of the client development community.
Building strong stakeholder relationships with clients, engineering and product development teams to resolve issues or build out enhancements.
Administer training to clients for coding to our API during the pre-sale, implementation and adoption phases of an engagement.
Support the developer community around our data delivery mechanisms.
Provide timely and informative feedback to the Enterprise Data Automation Product teams.
Take ownership of complex questions and issues reported by clients as a second tier of technical support via phone calls, ticket systems, email, and in person.
  What You Bring To The Team
  Highly proficient in at least one programming language, e.g., Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, C++, C.
Expertise in data manipulation: use of structured data tools (e.g., SQL), & unstructured data tools and platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, NoSQL)
Experience with relational and non-relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, or DynamoDB.
Familiarity with visualisation tools (e.g. Grafana, D3, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik).
Good interpersonal and presentation skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment across multinational teams.
Strong client facing experience, be presentable & able to articulate complex technical concepts to all skill levels.
Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple technical streams / lead client engagements whilst collaborating across different teams.
Degree in Computer Science, Data Science or related STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, & Mathematics) field - nie to have. 
  Our Company
 Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.
 Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we’d love to hear from you.
 Our Values
 We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.
  With Japanese Roots Going Back Over 100 Years, Our Culture Is Founded On The Values Of Our Parent Company Expressed As The Hitachi Spirit
 We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
 Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect
 Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity
 Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge

job_title: Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. We are looking for reinforcement at the earliest possible date Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d).
 Sounds interesting? Then we look forward to receiving your application via our partner Workwise.
 Smart communication with artificial intelligence is our specialty. To remain on the road of international success with innovative products we are looking for reinforcements of our international development team as now of.
 Your tasks
  You will take full ownership and produce a clean, readable, and well-tested front-end code.
You have an eye on the look and feel of our UI and will participate in planning meetings with our UX team to create the future of our virtual assistants.
You will also build up automated cross-browser testing procedures.
You will implement and improve our front-end development pipeline to increase productivity and automating time-consuming build-jobs.
You support our code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
 Your profile
  You have a solid understanding of JavaScript (ES6/7), HTML, and CSS.
Experience with React, Vue.js, or similar frameworks.
You have “a feeling for good design” – padding and margin are not just CSS properties for you, and you love to create pixel-perfect user interfaces.
You are familiar with the Node.js ecosystem.
You know how to use modern development tools, such as JIRA, Confluence, Git, Gitlab, Docker.
You have experience with testing frameworks and libraries such as Jest or Cypress.
You are familiar with real-time communication protocols such as WebSocket or WebRTC.
Experience in debugging client-side browser applications.
 NICE TO HAVE
  You are familiar with code bundling and optimization by using e.g. Webpack, Eslint & Eslint
Familiarity with CSS preprocessors such as SCSS, SASS, or LESS.
Collaboration with other team members in our agile development environment.
 OUR STACK
  Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
WebDev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 We offer
  You get the opportunity to take the next big leaps together with us. Let’s shape together technologies of the future. You will grow with us and receive your own projects right from your start.
Your tasks are broadly diversified and offer you enough challenges and variety even as an experienced developer.
At our company, you can arrange your working hours flexibly on a basis of trust. You can also move into your home office by prior arrangement.
Attractive salary models are a matter of course.
Your workplace is located in a generously equipped old building. Your own Desktop-PC and laptop are part of the basic equipment.
You will have your own parking space or can use our good public transport connections.
A good working atmosphere and good coffee complete our offer.
 Our job offer Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

job_title: Principal SAS Programmer - Fast Progression– Remote – Fully Remote
description:
Principal SAS Programmer - Fast Progression– Remote – Fully Remote
 Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.
 Looking for an experienced Statistical Programmer who will be fully responsible for leading multiple complex projects across oncology and other therapeutic areas – phases I-III. You will remain the point of contact for all client meetings/queries and dependent on your experience level will also be responsible for leading/managing the project teams.
 Role Responsibilities:
Programming Lead contributing to global projects
Develop and maintain project timelines as well as budgets.
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and the Pharma industry
 We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.
 Desired Skills:
5 years’ experience in SAS Programming
2 years of experience as a Senior SAS programmer – Leading projects and studies
Experience mentoring and supporting a team of SAS Programmers.
You have advanced SAS programming and CDISC standards knowledge
You possess excellent interpersonal skills
 Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working
 Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.
 Title: Principal Statistical Programmer
 Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.
 Please apply below or email your CV to at Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com
 Associated Keywords: Principal SAS Programmer / Principal Statistical Programmer / Principal SAS Analyst / Principal SAS Developer Principal SAS Consultant / United Kingdom / London / Manchester / Remote / Home based / CDISC / ADaM / STDM / CDASH / TLF / SAS Certificate / SAS Certification / Clinical SAS Programmer / Clinical SAS Programmer / SAS Programming / Statistical Programming / Submission / Specifications / Regulatory Authorities / Data manipulation /

Security Vulnerability Management provides the support infrastructure for IT systems from Cyber Security perspective. It is a part of Cyber Hygiene, a function that provides executive level analysis, reporting, compliance support and oversight for security vulnerability remediation activities across all platforms. It ensures compliance delivery as per policies, review and timely remediation of vulnerabilities/configurations of servers' Network IP, Operating System, Middleware, Database hosted on prem/ Cloud infra along with other IT assets.
We are building a team of Big Data Analysts with understanding of IT Infrastructure and preferably Cyber Security. Some team members will work more on the technical side, while others will combine Data Analysis with Business Analysis - it's up to you what you choose and where you feel better, over the time you can also perform BA activities.
 Responsibilities:
• Accountable for compliance of assets hosted in client's environment
• Must track and be able to report cradle to grave the full life cycle associated with vulnerability identification to remediation
• Handle massive data sets, analyze & report
• Identify deviations/discrepancy in security vulnerability data and liaise with multiple teams to fix them
• Drive compliance of patching, configurations of assets as per Cyber Hygiene guidelines
• Ensure all work activities adhere to the bank's policies and procedures
• Generate executive reports on projects/ compliance levels
• Drive end to end vulnerability scanning, detection, and remediation improvement projects
• Liaise with Automation, platform teams, patching teams to increase the infra footprint (cloud, MW, firmware) and further streamline the patching automation
• Identify improvement opportunities in existing process, initiate and drive the improvements as projects
• Escalation of issues/ potential problems to appropriate owners/ streams/ Stakeholders
• Track & Report KPI/SLA/OLA's for all Vulnerability Management related metrics
 Mandatory Skills Description:
• Hands-on experience on handling, analyzing and generate reports out of massive size of data sets
• Knowledge on Analytic tools such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx etc.
• Knowledge on tools such as Nessus Vulnerability Scanner, Tanium, Panaseer, SNOW, RiskIQ
• Knowledge on CVE & solutions released by vendors such as Red Hat & Microsoft
• Well-versed with IT Security Vulnerability and Patch Management Methodology
• Understanding of Cyber Hygiene concept
• Risk Rating Model knowledge
• ITIL Foundation certification, proficient on Release, Change, Incident, Problem Management
• Experience on Process Improvements/Automations to bring in Operational Efficiency
• Strong learning capability, committed to self-development
• Able to adapt to changes and have flexibility in performing the support role
• Bachelor's degree in technology or equivalent higher education in IT
• Experience in IT support role within Banking & Financial services industry
Languages:
English: C1 Advanced
 What benefits have are prepared for our employees?
👩‍⚕️LuxMed health & dental care, life insurance
🏋🏽‍♀️MyBenefit program (sports card, well-being program, etc.)
🏠Remote (or hybrid) work
🖋Stable employment based on an employment contract (or B2B)
🏦Special offer of banking services
🌎Support for relocated employees
🎯Full coverage relocation package for Senior positions
🎓LuxTalent platform (webinars, training, courses with certificates)
🤝paid referrals program
...and even more!

Description
 Perceptyx is the most comprehensive listening solution platform available in the HR Tech world today. It illuminates the employee experience for millions of people globally. Our work helps whole organizations thrive (enterprise level to an organization with 5,000 employees). 
 We are looking for a new team member to join our Platform Services Professionals in Poland (you must be based in Poland). This role will be executing daily tasks to build, configure, and update employee surveys using an internal shared task list. Work will be on the front end of our platform and products.🙌 😊.
 We don't like micromanagement and are looking for a professional who will be in charge of their own daily tasks and will deliver high-quality results on time. Our next colleague will have a passion for data and will be interested to grow together with us! We have a great internal career path for like-minded professionals. Remote work is preferred, however, we do have an office for networking in Wroclaw.
 Our Platform Services Specialist will:
  Receive tasks from the Customer Solutions team aimed at loading, updating, and personalizing the platform for customers
Focus on front-end configurations (toolkit builds, English email setup, dashboards, etc.)
Work closely with other team members
Successfully complete configuration tasks across Perceptyx products to solve the customers’ business problems. This is not a client-facing role but will involve completing work for our clients
Support Perceptyx internal Customer Solutions Partners, Implementation Experts, and Customer Care Coordinators
Follow procedures based on best practices for the daily customer tasks
Present task completion reports to the Manager, Platform Services bi-weekly to be used at the internal sync ups
 Requirements
 We would like you to have:
  Minimum 1 year of relevant experience with strong technical, data, and configuration skills in data management or configurations
Passion for technical data and interest to grow in tech and data-related industry
Understanding of HTML, SQL, CSS, Excel, and grep
Explicit attention to detail, ability to pick up new systems and processes quickly, and ability to navigate tasks and technical work quickly
Good time management, organization, and personal effectiveness skills
Good written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of an organization
Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Good written and spoken English skills to communicate with international teams
 We would like you to be:
  Quick learner, self-starter, able to work efficiently with minimal supervision
Confident, ready for a challenge, and be not afraid of sking questions. This position is a great learning opportunity 
Comfortable with using new systems and technology, specifically in web-based systems
Adaptable to change within the process, workflow, or systems
Willing to work with people from diverse backgrounds and experiences
 Benefits
  Working remotely from home (based in Poland) with the possibility to network in person with our other team members in Wrocław, Poland, and remotely with your manager in the USA and the team in Europe
Premium healthcare package
Fitness reimbursement programme and internal wellness initiatives
Opportunities to grow with like-minded professionals in a truly international tech environment. We offer continuous learning and development in interesting projects (people analytics, employee survey, and customer service) while providing you guidance and support throughout your journey with us
You are in charge of your daily work. We provide the tools and training- you make a meaningful impact, your way
A diverse and inclusive culture. You will be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others
 Perceptyx Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:We celebrate diversity and an inclusive environment. Perceptyx is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Fandom is growing! We are looking for a Data Engineer II to grow our Data Warehouse and ETL Infrastructure. This position is for you if you are passionate about scaling entertainment and gaming websites with 350 million unique users per month, billions of pages views, and hundreds of billions of events. You will report to our senior manager of data engineering. We are open to this position working remotely in Poland or if you prefer hybrid in our Poznan office. Why Fandom Engineering? 
You work at SCALE - 300K databases supporting our wiki communities
Your code goes to production with mature and fast processes
The team is collaborative with experienced engineers
You get to solve interesting and difficult problems
Our foundations are from from Wikipedia and Wikia 
You Will 
Work and define our projects to improve our data infrastructure
Collaborate with our experienced data engineering team on data flows
Support the data science team with productization of machine learning models 
You Have 
3+ years of data engineering experience
Python and SQL coding
Create and troubleshoot the AWS stack (e.g. EMR, IAM, VPC, Lambda, CloudWatch, Athena, Redshift, EC2)
BigData processing technologies (Spark, Hive, Flink, Hue)
Infrastructure as a code solutions (Terraform)
Passion about growing your expertise in the following areas:
Data Pipelines
Data Warehousing
Statistics
Metrics Development 
Bonus Points 
Java
PHP
Containerization technologies (Docker)
Experienced in K8S solutions
Terraform
Airflow 
Premium private medical and dental healthcare for you, your partner, and your family - it is fully paid by Fandom
Private life insurance - UNUM - includes medical child assistance and general medical assistance in Poland
Stock options
Cafeteria Benefit Plan - 180 points every month to spend on Multisport or cinema tickets or prepaid shopping cards (Allegro, Zalando, IKEA +)
Copyright % based on your level
MacBook Pro and all the gear you need for work 
Fandom is the world's largest fan platform where fans immerse themselves in imagined worlds across entertainment and gaming. Reaching more than 315 million unique visitors per month and hosting more than 250,000 wikis, Fandom.com is the #1 source for in-depth information on pop culture, gaming, TV and film, where fans learn about and celebrate their favorite fandoms. Fandom is an equal opportunity employer. Fandom values diversity, and all employment decisions are made on the basis of job requirements and individual qualifications.

Job Responsibilities Primary duties may include but are not limited to: 
 Work with global business, support and development teams (HRIS and integration vendors, developers, QA and Product Owners) for ongoing production support and enhancements

OneMarketData is continuously searching for bright talent with the skills to make an impact.
From developers to data scientists, at OneTick you will have the opportunity to develop and enhance your problem-solving skills using a combination of analytics, imagination, and talent.
 This position should be filled in EEA countries, all full-time employees, all ‘remote work’. Depending on the country of residency, we may, at our discretion, employ you as a contractor directly attached to OneMarketData LLC, or by way of an ‘Employer of Record’ / ‘Agent of Record’ that has an office in the country.
All positions will require a background check, signed NDA, signed contract, and signed GDPR processor passthrough agreement (since we act as a data processor under GDPR). Salaries will be commensurate with experience, education, skillset, and local norms.
 We’re seeking experienced Python developers to help enhance our products and hosted regulatory services. 
You’ll be using the most advanced Python-oriented software stack, including programmatic code and query generation. Our Python developers communicate a lot with our customers’ and partners’ technical teams.
Our stack:
Python 3, pytest, Pandas, advanced code-generation libraries 
Redis, Celery
Docker & friends for containerization
Airflow for scheduling, Kubernetes for orchestration, AWS autoscaling for resource scaling
The OneTick time series database & streaming analytics engine - Python is the query programming language for this DB engine.
Machine learning and MLOps framework
Django / Postgres
Grafana / Prometheus / Loki and extensions, and Sentry
Modern CI/CD environment (GitLab, GitLab CI), modern approach to deployment packaging
Microservices-based architecture
IDEs popular with the team include PyCharm, MS Code, and JupyterHub
What will you do:
Back-end microservices design, development, test coverage, code review
Many of our projects involve pipelined processing of large data sets (i.e. ‘big data’)
Key aspects of development are solved using Python code that generates parallel time-series processing queries that execute in the OneTick engine.
Many tasks require the ability to develop efficient algorithms
Technical requirements:
2+ years of software engineering industrial experience (not studying in parallel)
1+ years of Python (we use recent Python 3 versions)
Git, Linux
Analytical, algorithms-oriented mindset
Willingness to understand the business and take initiative to suggest technical solutions
Familiarity with Docker is a plus
General requirements:
English - Upper-Intermediate or higher.
Good communicative skills, being able to explain difficult things in simple words.
Being eager to learn new technologies (including area-specific).
Attentiveness, hard-working and goal-oriented mindset (to have the tasks done), opportunity to work both in team and independently.
We offer
A full-time in-house job, fully remote from the EEA
Work in a middle-size company with supportive colleagues and a cozy atmosphere, you will be feeling valued and can create impact without unnecessary bureaucracy
Challenging tasks for financial market players: national regulators, central banks, and quantitative hedge funds
As we hire people all over the EEA, our perks and benefits may vary. We will definitely discuss this topic with you at first HR screening call
 Additional information
Interested candidates can send their CVs to , subject – “Senior Python Developer”.
All interested applicants are appreciated for sending their CVs, however, kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Persona is the company top startups use to hire people from all around the world. Our vision is a future where each person can find the best role for them and companies can discover the world’s best talent. Founded by two Stanford University graduates, Persona works with the world’s fastest-growing technology startups. Our clients are funded by some of the world’s top investors, like Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz.
 Persona is a talent agency that recruits, trains, and staffs talented remote professionals such as yourself. This is an opportunity to work closely with the future Googles, Facebooks, and Amazons of the world—building out their organizations and helping them reach the next level of success.
 We support everyone we hire with training, mentoring, and technology resources so they are enabled to do their best and are as happy as possible in their roles. We have a large international team dedicated to supporting and taking care of new Persona team members, and our goal is to provide excellent long-term career opportunities for everyone who joins the team.
 Who’s building Persona?
We are a global team of passionate problem solvers who love to build new things and make our customers happy. Our team is made up of motivated, hard-working people spanning the globe, united by a culture of learning and continuous improvement.
 What we’re looking for:
We are looking for Assistant Project Managers to help our clients operate and scale different parts of their growing businesses. As an Assistant Project Manager you'll be a general problem solver, collaborating with different teams at our client company and helping them with various projects.
 Responsibilities—what you'll do:
Business-to-Business Communication
Client and Vendor Management
Data Collection and Analysis
Reports Generation and Documentation
Project Management Tools
Process Optimization
 Requirements:
Fully fluent in English
Skilled in the use of apps and technology
Ability to commit long-term and full-time
Ability to work U.S. business hours (Pacific Time, Central Time, or Eastern Time)
No work experience is required, but we will take any work experience you have into account
This position is for serious, career-oriented candidates
 Other qualities we look for:
Track record of success at work or in school
An ability to solve complex problems with minimal guidance
Experience in high performance work or school environments
Skilled at anticipating team members’ needs
Willingness to work hard and persevere
Intellectual curiosity and resourcefulness
Professionalism
 What we offer:
Best salaries in the industry
Permanent ability to work from anywhere in the world
Opportunities for growth and advancement
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Warm and friendly company culture
Full benefits
 Benefits at Persona:
Health insurance
Unlimited paid time off (paid sick and vacation leaves)
Annual bonuses based on performance
Monthly tech allowance
Opportunity to be paid in your currency of choice
Others depending on seniority
 This is a full-time and long-term role, dedicated exclusively to serving one of our clients. We are looking for individuals who are ready to fully commit their time and energy to one company and grow and develop along with that company. All roles at Persona are 100% work-from-anywhere (work from home or wherever it suits you best). If this is your first time working for a U.S. company, that’s okay; we provide guidance and assistance getting set up as a remote professional. Once hired, we will carefully match you to a client company of ours that perfectly suits your career background, skills, and goals.
 In case you or any exceptional people you know are exploring other roles, our rapidly growing company is also looking for new team members with backgrounds in administration, bookkeeping, accounting, finance, project management, operations, recruiting, human resources, content writing, social media management, research, executive assistance, customer service, customer support, technical support, data management, video editing, sales, account management, marketing, and design.
 Visit our website for more information: https://www.personatalent.com/

Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?
 The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Service Delivery department in advanced data analysis and reporting. You will participate in projects that partner with multiple areas of the business, as well as help with goal setting and KPIs. Your strong analytical and reporting skills will allow you to report on Service Delivery metrics and make meaningful recommendations that advance the priorities and efficiency of the team. You’ll work closely with Service Delivery leaders on target setting, capacity planning, customer experience reporting, performance reporting and other data analysis projects.
   Accountable in being the subject matter expert as it pertains to data governance for Service Delivery. 
Create moderate to complex reporting solutions (Tableau, SalesForce) based on existing datasets 
Run, interpret and share data and performance results with stakeholders, including standardized reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis from various inputs (Salesforce, JIRA, telephony solution, etc.) using various outputs (Excel, PPT, Tableau). 
Surface insights and contribute to planning through accurate reporting and data analysis for our Service Delivery teams. 
Assist in the discovery work needed for Service Delivery Operations programs, including but not limited to, data collection, scrubbing and presenting. 
Report on departmental and team goals, maintain dashboards, and provide data analysis to your leader to make strong recommendations that meaningfully contribute to Relativity’s Service Delivery strategy. 
Adhere to best practices in reporting and data quality that allow the Service Delivery team to accurately report on key activities. 
Participate in business-critical operational projects that partner, collaborate, and strategize with teams inside and outside of Service Delivery. 
Run ad hoc projects as needed that are data driven, focusing on success metrics specific to teams. 
   Experience with a SaaS or subscription-based software company. 
Intermediate knowledge of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com 
Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Excel 
1+ years experience building or enhancing dashboards within data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik) 
Familiarity with SQL and relational databases
