job_title: Senior SAS Programmer – Fast Progression – Remote Working
description:
Senior SAS Programmer – Global CRO – Fully Remote
 Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer / Senior SAS Consultant / Clinical SAS Programmer
 Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.
 Looking for an experienced Statistical Programmer who will be fully responsible for leading multiple complex projects across oncology and other therapeutic areas – phases I-III.
You will remain the point of contact for all client meetings/queries and dependent on your experience level will also be responsible for leading/managing the project teams.
 Role Responsibilities:
Project lead clinical studies
Develop and maintain project timelines
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and Pharma industry
 We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.
 Desired Skills:
3 years’ experience in SAS Programming
Some experience Co-leading / Leading Projects and Studies
Experience mentoring and supporting a team of SAS Programmers.
You have Good SAS programming and CDISC standards knowledge
You possess excellent interpersonal skills
 Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working
 Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.
 Title: Senior Statistical Programmer
 Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.
 Please apply below or email your CV to Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com
 Associated Keywords: Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer Senior SAS Consultant / United Kingdom / London / Manchester / Remote / Home based / CDISC / ADaM / STDM / CDASH / TLF / SAS Certificate / SAS Certification / Clinical SAS Programmer / Clinical SAS Programmer / SAS Programming / Statistical Programming / Submission / Specifications / Regulatory Authorities / Good Clinical Practices (GCP) / Data Manipulation

QUEM SOMOS
O Float Group é o maior grupo português de comunicação integrada e especializada na área da Saúde, trabalhando há mais de 20 anos com os maiores players da indústria. Com escritórios em Portugal e no Brasil, mantemos a ambição de apoiar os nossos clientes a comunicar saúde com rigor, criatividade e impacto.
 QUEM PROCURAMOS QUE SE JUNTE A NÓS
A reportar ao Group Digital Director, procuramos um(a) Full Stack Developer altamente qualificado para se juntar à nossa equipa. O(a) candidato(a) ideal terá experiência comprovada no desenvolvimento de websites e aplicações web, nomeadamente usando a plataforma Wordpress. Ele ou ela será responsável por criar e manter websites e outras aplicações web, garantindo a sua segurança, escalabilidade, rapidez e fiabilidade - ambicionando sempre a excelência nos testes de performance.
 RESPONSABILIDADES
Desenvolver e manter sites e aplicações web de acordo com os requisitos dos clientes.
Criar e personalizar temas e plugins em Wordpress, garantindo que sejam compatíveis com as versões mais recentes do Wordpress.
Realizar testes de desempenho e segurança em sites, garantindo que sejam rápidos e confiáveis.
Trabalhar em colaboração com outros membros da equipa, como designers e gestores de projeto, para garantir que os sites atendam aos requisitos do cliente.
Manter-se atualizado(a) com as últimas tendências e tecnologias em desenvolvimento web, especialmente em relação ao Wordpress.
 REQUISITOS
Experiência comprovada no desenvolvimento de sites e aplicações web
Conhecimento avançado em HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery e PHP.
Implementação de layouts / UI / UX
Experiência em personalização de temas e plugins em Wordpress.
Familiaridade com bases de dados MySQL, linguagem SQL e JSON.
Conhecimento das boas práticas de segurança web e de gestão de projeto em software.
Utilização de controlo de versões com Git
Excelente habilidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa.
Valorizamos conhecimento em VUE.js, ReactJS, NodeJS
 Somos uma agência em franco crescimento, disponibilidade imediata / de curto prazo será valorizada.
Nível salarial a propôr alinhado com a senioridade demonstrada.
 Se acreditas ter as habilidades e experiência que procuramos, e estás ansioso/a para fazer parte de uma equipe criativa e empreendedora, envie-nos o teu currículo, portfólio e expectativa salarial.

This could be the Opportunity of Your Life! 
Working at Signant Health puts you at the very heart of the world’s most exciting sector - a high-growth, dynamic company in an extraordinary industry. We’re radically changing the clinical trial landscape, driving change through the technology and innovations we create and the services we deliver to our customers.
  Where do you fit in? 
We're on the hunt for a new Project Specialist for our team, who will handle daily project assigned tasks and correspondence with internal stakeholders. This role supports Associate Project Managers (APM) and Project Managers with internal and external project meetings, creating, reviewing, and updating project documentation, status reports and other material as needed.
  Want to join the Best Team of Your Life? 
We’re looking for people who are excited by the potential to make a difference in the world. You don’t need to have a clinical background to thrive at Signant. You need to be decisive, open to celebrating mistakes, able to communicate transparently and inclusively, and someone your team can count on. Most of all you need to be yourself!
  As part of our team, your main responsibilities will: 
Support efforts associated with successful execution of all project tasks as directed by the project APM and/or Project Manager.
Own discrete, delegated project tasks during the project lifecycle.
Maintain detailed project documentation including meeting minutes, action items, issues lists and risk management plans.
Escalate project escalations as appropriate in a timely manner and assist in resolution with internal stakeholders.
Embrace and contribute to our culture of process improvement with a focus on streamlining our processes adding value to our business and meeting client needs.
Be responsible for compliance with Company Procedures in support of client deliverables
Recognize, exemplify and adhere to the company values which center around our commitment to People, Clients, and performance 
  You’ll need to bring: 
Bachelors’ degree or equivalent or relevant experience
Ability to multi-task and work with multiple team members
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Solid MS Office Suite experience – Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Must be detail orientated 
  We’d be thrilled to hear that you also have: 
Background in Pharmaceutical, Medical education and/or CRO
Experience of clinical trials/pharmaceutical industry/life sciences 
  And finally, here are the ways of working that will help you succeed at Signant: 
You enjoy problem-solving and have a constructive can-do attitude.
You’re motivated by working in a fast-growing global company.
You’re self-driven, active and want to continuously learn new things.
You have great communication skills in English, both spoken and written, and can articulate technical details succinctly.
You like to share knowledge as a way to advance organisational learning. 
 Does this sound like something you’d like to explore? Then we’d love to hear from you!
Please apply below.
We review and respond to every application, keep an eye on your inbox for our reply.
Please note that Signant does not accept unsolicited resumes from Third Party vendors. 
 At Signant Health, accepting difference isn’t enough—we celebrate it, we support it, and we nurture it for the benefit of our team members, our clients and our community. Signant Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.

¿Quieres formar parte de una compañía especializada 100% en proyectos propios de#Data & #Analytics? Sí es así, ¡Sigue leyendo! 👀
 Aunque somos poco conocidos entre el gran público, en SDG trabajamos para la mitad de grupos del IBEX-35 y en multitud de empresas internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento y desde 1994 ayudamos a nuestros clientes a entender y analizar sus datos.
  ¿Cuál será tu misión? ✍
   En nuestro equipo de Project Management Services tu misión consistirá en acompañar a los clientes en la gestión de proyectos que permitan a las empresas converger hacia un modelo de organización Data-Driven. 
Contribuirás con tu conocimiento y experiencia en la práctica de Project Manager de SDG, formando parte de un equipo con expertos en la gestión de programas y proyectos y el uso de metodologías ágiles.
Al igual que el resto del equipo, te ayudaremos a estar al día de las últimas tendencias tecnológicas en el ámbito de Data & Analytics para que puedas ofrecer las mejores soluciones a nuestros clientes.
Impulsarás el buen ambiente y las sinergias entre tu equipo, tratando de generar las mejores prácticas y animarles para poder ofrecer la mejor experiencia a nuestros clientes.
 ¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición? 👇
  Experiencia de al menos 3 años en el campo de la consultoría como gestor de proyectos, aportando experiencia en el área de Data&Analitycs.
Formación en Ingeniería, Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Economía, gestión de proyectos etc.
Trabajamos en entornos ágiles, por lo que valoramos que cuentes con Certificación Scrum máster y/o SAFe, si aún no la tienes, te la proporcionamos nosotros!
Habilidades analíticas y mentalidad problem-solving ya que te enfrentarás a entornos cambiantes.
Poder tener una conversación fluida en inglés ya que hablarás con compañeros de otros países.
 ¿Qué nos hace diferentes? 🧐
 En nuestros proyectos, los datos y la tecnología son los protagonistas, te formaremos para que puedas trabajar con lo último del mercado (tenemos un área de innovación dónde impulsamos nuevos partnerships con fabricantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D).
 Tendrás todas las oportunidades para alcanzar tu mejor versión, con un plan de carrera totalmente personalizado en el que aprenderás por ti mismo y además, contarás con el apoyo del resto de compañerxs.
 Tu mismo te marcarás tus propios tiempos, semestralmente hablarás con tu responsable para compartir feedback y nuevos retos, y en base a tus resultados, habrá una revisión salarial.
Somos una gran familia, desde el minuto 1 trataremos de hacerte la vida más fácil. Tanto tus compañerxs como el resto de equipo siempre tendrán una sonrisa y estarán dispuestos a ayudarte y ofrecerte todo su apoyo.
 Colaborarás y trabajarás en tu día a día con grandes referentes (técnicos y/o de negocio), estarán encantados de enseñarte todo lo posible y se sentirán orgullosxs de verte crecer.
 Con nosotros el Smartwork es posible. Vivirás una forma de trabajo en la que cada uno gestiona su propio tiempo. ¿Quieres trabajar 100% en remoto?¿Quieres un modelo híbrido? En SDG podrás elegir cómo quieres trabajar, aunque creemos que es importante ponernos cara más allá de la pantalla ¡Te esperaremos en los Afterworks!
 Somos una marca con propósito. Creemos que la diversidad y la inclusión ayudan a promover una cultura de creatividad, permitiéndonos superar nuevas situaciones y desafíos.
 Metiéndonos un poco más en temas más formales, pero no menos importantes, ofrecemos contrato indefinido, ¡queremos que te quedes con nosotrxs mucho tiempo!, salario competitivo de acuerdo con tu nivel de formación y experiencia (no te preocupes, ya qué, en la primera entrevista, trataremos este aspecto y te informaremos si tus expectativas están alineadas) y te ofrecemos una ayuda económica para gastos ocasionados por el teletrabajo.
 Podríamos continuar detallando que nos hace especiales, y nos encantará hacerlo en una llamada telefónica. Por el momento, vamos a mostrarte algunos detalles que estamos seguros que te podrán interesar ✌️
 Por último, queremos contarte los pasos de nuestro proceso de selección
 En nuestros procesos realizarás 3️ sesiones:
  Primera toma de contacto con nuestra área de People First (donde trataremos temas de crecimiento profesional, banda salarial y definiremos qué áreas se adaptan a ti).
Segunda sesión técnica donde podrás sorprendernos con todos tus conocimientos y habilidades en entornos tecnológicos (y así poder ofrecerte un proyecto que encaje con tus conocimientos e intereses).
Reunión con el responsable del equipo en el que te incorporarías para poder solucionar todas las dudas que te hayan podido surgir en el proceso.
 ¿Has superado todas las fases? ¡Buenas noticias! Recibirás una llamada de People First donde te presentaremos nuestra propuesta para que te unas a nosotrxs, y poder resolverte cualquier duda que tengas al respecto. Cuando nos confirmes que quieres formar parte de la familia SDG, empezaremos a preparar todo para recibirte con mucha ilusión.
 ¿No te puedes incorporar ahora, pero tienes curiosidad e interés en SDG Group? No te preocupes, puedes realizar ahora el proceso de selección y te tendremos en cuenta en las próximas vacantes que encajen con tu perfil profesional.
 INSCRÍBETE AHORA ¡ESTAMOS DESEANDO CONOCERTE!

Summary This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, Golang and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes. You will bring Kubernetes to a wide range of use cases across public, private, and hybrid clouds. The Canonical Kubernetes Software Engineer is a developer with a passion for providing the best Kubernetes experience for any use case. On the Kubernetes team, you will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers. What You'll Do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events 
Who You Are 
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have interest and experience with Kubernetes
You are a python programmer with interest or experience in golang 
Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. #stack

We are an international IGaming, software and development company aiming to help improve the efficiency and workflow by designing and implementing unique solutions that answer our customers business needs.
Our fun-packed crew of young and dynamic professionals will be by your side every step of the way. Simply showcase your very best side and instantly gain access to the mandatory ingredients for a delectable success recipe.
  Your main job duties:
Planning and management the implementation of projects from start to finish
Defining project’s scope and goals with key stakeholders

 Professional requirements:

  We Develop and Invest in our people:
Here, at Reevo, we allow you to create your own career. Opportunities are only limited by your ability, motivation and imagination. We pride ourselves on our fun and flexible working environment and in our commitment to developing our employees.
Below are only few of the advantages of working with us and the benefits we provide our employees:
  An opportunity to work in a rapidly innovating industry
A challenging, fast paced environment working with very smart highly skilled companions
An eye-catching salary package.

Your mission: Build extraordinary products that customers can’t live without.
 Since launching in 2013, Bending Spoons has served around half a billion people across the globe through our suite of cutting-edge products. Still, we’ve only just crossed the starting line on our mission to make an enduring positive impact on our customers, on our fellow Spooners, and on society at large.
 With our product line improving and expanding and our sights set on becoming one of the greatest companies the world’s ever seen, we’re committed to raising the bar on our strategic product management. That’s why we’re looking for that single-minded someone who’s obsessed with building extraordinary, enormously impactful high-value products. You need to come expecting lots of hard work, massive development, and great responsibility.
 A few examples of your responsibilities:
Investigate the world through the customers’ eyes with the goal of understanding them and solving their problems. This entails extensive customer, market, and competitor research as well as close collaboration with our customer support team in the hunt for improvements and opportunities.
Study and improve the business model of your product, prioritizing initiatives with the highest potential to unlock significant value. Push teammates to do the same, so that as a group you realize the greatest ideation and implementation power possible.
Know your product’s numbers inside out and continuously analyze the data to solidly support your decision making.
Distill all the inputs into a strategy and a roadmap for your product, marrying wild ambition with rationality and pragmatism. Plan carefully and guide all stakeholders in executing the vision.
Deeply evaluate and ponder the impact of your experiments and initiatives and follow up on them to iterate an always-better product strategy.
  A burning ambition to build amazing products. You’re obsessed with building extraordinary products that unlock business value and that customers just can't live without.
Logical-analytical abilities. You’re a quick learner who’s able to investigate and effectively pick up new concepts on your own. You can solve unforeseen challenges with creativity and structure, and can do so independently.
Drive. You’re energetic and hard-working, and you persevere through adversity until the job is done—and done impeccably. You’re massively into getting results, and always aim for excellence in what you do.
Curiosity and initiative. You love exploring, and are forever hunting down new opportunities and testing fresh ideas. Rather than waiting to be told what to do, you go seek.
Tenacity. Once you have a goal, there’s no stopping you! Failure doesn’t discourage you—after every stumble, you get right back up and try again.
Common sense. Your judgment and intuition are sound and well grounded in reality.
Pragmatism. Far from being too academic or obsessive in your perfectionism, you understand that speed is often as important as quality when getting things done in a competitive world.
Confidence in your role. Once onboarded and up to speed, you won’t wait to be told what to do or require constant positive feedback to know you’re on the right track.
Communication skills. You can pose questions with clarity and explain your reasoning concisely.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
  Make a difference. Be the owner of your effort—from day one, you’re one of the team and fully trusted to take responsibility for your tasks. You’ll have every incentive to make a major impact.
Real impact. We automate most menial tasks, freeing you up to focus your expertise where it can make the biggest impact.
Unique career opportunity. By joining a fast-growing company on a mission to become one of the world's greatest, it’s an unparalleled opportunity to turbocharge your learning and career prospects.
Talented, knowledgeable colleagues. Learn from (and teach) some of the brightest and most skilled people you’ll ever meet. Your talent is going to blossom here.
International reach. We’re a global company, and your work will have worldwide exposure.
The finest tools. You get the best hardware on the market and all the software you could need. We can't wait to introduce you to our high-tech approach and our cutting-edge workflows.
Continuous education. Spooners get unlimited backing for learning investments, including Italian or English lessons and things like courses, conferences, and books. There’s no permission or approval process—you’re fully trusted to use the company’s resources efficiently.
Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose. Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. You’ve always got the freedom to decide where today’s office is.
Competitive salary and stock options. Our compensation package is highly competitive, and can grow rapidly and include stock options, depending on your performance and seniority.
 Permanent or fixed-term or internship. Full-time.
 Milan, Italy or fully remote.
 If you successfully pass through our screening process, we’ll invite you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach and solve unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful there, we’ll invite you to take part in some interviews. We welcome applications in English and Italian.
 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment all applicants and we provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.
 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, we look for talent and potential—not just experience and expertise. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it, go ahead and apply.

AvatarUX is an award-winning game studio that creates innovative games of exceptional quality. We are popular not only for our unique games, but also for our ground-breaking, in-house developed game mechanics- PopWins™, Multipop™, ZapReel™. 
 We are looking for super talented and passionate people to join our rapidly growing team.
 The ideal candidate is a great frontend developer with a bit of game server experience (or just willing to learn some basic elements of Game Server logic). If you have a passion for rich audiovisual gaming experiences and aren’t afraid to look on the game logic side of things, you are a perfect fit!
 Responsibilities:
  Implementing both Low and High fidelity Game Prototypes based on GDD requirements using Phaser or other game development frameworks
Working closely with Mathematicians, Product team, Artists, QA Engineers, Game Producer and other Developers on creating the best Player Experience in the market
Translating requirements into clean and efficient game code
Implementing audiovisual assets into the game client in collaboration with all team members
Looking at the design specifications of slot game designers and mathematicians
Implementing Game Servers based on math docs using our internal GDK written in TypeScript
Requirements:
 Must Have
  Great knowledge of Typescript and/or vanilla JavaScript ES6 proven with a minimum 3 years of experience in game development within the iGaming industry
Good knowledge of HTML5
Prototyping Mindset
Experience in game development for mobile and desktop browsers
Experience in any 2D and/or 3D game engines written in JavaScript such as Pixi.js, Phaser, Babylon.js, PlayCanvas, Three.js
Deep knowledge of OOP and practical usage of Design Patterns
Passionate about clean code and experienced in maintaining large codebases for long term projects
Familiar with version control system and Continuous Integration workflow
Good English and communication skills
Nice To Have
  Experience with any other OOP language as Java, C++, Python
Experience in Game Server development for casino games (slots)
Passionate about math and algorithms
Experience in front-end libraries like React or jQuery (to build simple prototypes)
 This position is offered on a full-time basis and the candidate can be based anywhere. On request, a relocation to Warsaw, Malta or Barcelona can be offered to the right candidate.
 More info about the role can be found here: https://avatarux.com/careers/game-developer/
 Does this sound interesting? Feel free to reach out to us! Apply by sending your CV and Cover letter via email to: recruitment@avatarux.com

We are looking for a mid-senior Backend Developer who can write reusable and clean code and work with foreign code in a CI environment to help us build a revolutionary smart packaging solution based on color-changing QR codes to reduce food waste.
 The role:
You will participate in the deployment/design of our REST API solution for computer vision and colorimetric measurement into production in cloud solutions. You will be in charge of the back-end software development of our REST API and the deployment of our services with CI methodologies. This job requires your assessment of current cloud architecture, and the design, and implementation of best practices. It entails, among other things:
Scheduling, monitoring, and managing the deployment of our services
Management and generation of Docker images used for deployment
Integration of our color correction and CV algorithms into our REST API
Development of our color-correction algorithms and CV solutions
Management of our CI pipelines, including automatic testing of our proprietary code
Assessment and development of cloud solutions for potential clients
Code documentation
Together with the CTO, define and plan the cloud infrastructure
 You have experience with:
Python3
REST API solutions development with Flask or FastAPI frameworks
MySQL/PostgreSQL and Redis
CD/CI pipelines (e.g. Bitbucket)
GNU/Linux and its ecosystem: git, docker, docker-compose
 You ideally have knowledge of:
Computer Vision: OpenCV, PIL
Testing: Unit tests, integration tests, Postman collections
DevOps environments, such as GCP, AWS, or Microsoft Azure
CV in Python using the NumPy, SciPy, Scikit, and OpenCV stack
 We offer:
full-time or part-time
flexible working hours
remote
25 days of annual leave
training opportunities
entrepreneurial environment: the opportunity to create something big as a team from scratch
immediate incorporation
 About ColorSensing:
ColorSensing is a startup from Universitat de Barcelona, developing a smart label for packaged foods. Our solution combines chemistry, computer vision, and artificial intelligence, and it is based on printing color-changing intelligent inks on an alternative QR code and using it as a multi-parametric sensor to check packaging integrity, food freshness and cold chain breaks. This way, we help food manufacturers and retailers reduce food waste and ensure food safety. You just need a smartphone to read the label, thanks to our proprietary color-correction algorithms. 
We also develop applications that need color correction or quantification for other industries such as healthtech. 
We’re a multidisciplinary young team, always willing to teach and learn by sharing knowledge, and expecting to grow and develop a variety of smart applications offering reliable image color information for any kind of industry. Never get bored.

Summary This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, Golang and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes. You will bring Kubernetes to a wide range of use cases across public, private, and hybrid clouds. The Canonical Kubernetes Software Engineer is a developer with a passion for providing the best Kubernetes experience for any use case. On the Kubernetes team, you will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers. What You'll Do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events 
Who You Are 
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have interest and experience with Kubernetes
You are a python programmer with interest or experience in golang 
Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. #stack

Description
 Learnlight is an EdTech company that provides language, intercultural and soft skills training to leading companies and organizations around the world. We deliver blended virtual, blended face-to-face, and digital solutions to 100,000+ learners in 1500+ clients across 150+ countries. We specialize in the digital transformation of learning programs and the empowerment of talent to excel in an increasingly complex global environment.
 The purpose of the Marketing Specialist is to be a regionally focused, highly organized person who can do the hands-on work of managing logistics and online and offline details for projects taking place in person or virtually in the DACH region this role supports.
 Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and track marketing programs such as email, social media, or digital campaigns, and events
Collaborate with other internal teams (e.g., product and sales) to develop and monitor strategic marketing initiatives
Analyse and report on the performance and efficiency of campaigns
Conduct market research and analyse trends to identify new marketing opportunities
Develop and create marketing materials, such as sales and product collateral, and ensure brand guidelines are met
Write, proofread, and edit creative and technical content across different mediums
Work with external agencies and vendors to execute marketing programs
Other responsibilities as appropriate or assigned
 Requirements
Competencies
Excellent analytical skills and a knack for data analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Skilled in writing and editing content with an attention to detail
Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills
Skills
C2 level of English and German is required
Proficiency in an additional European language is advantageous
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Advanced knowledge of various marketing and analytics tools such as Marketo, Google Analytics, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), and content management systems
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, communications, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in marketing
 Benefits
People-Powered Culture: We have a flat, modern, meritocratic culture that values enthusiasm, initiative, and commitment above all else.
Flexible Working: Learnlight is a fully distributed virtual business with staff in 30+ countries and offices in 9 European cities.
Competitive Remuneration: We offer market-matching competitive salaries.
Learning & Development: Personalized language and soft skills training; ongoing professional development talks and masterclasses; frequent coaching and constructive feedback.
Diversity & Inclusion: Learnlight fosters an open, positive, and diverse community that welcomes talent regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.
Community Events: We offer a range of social events including Virtual Drinks, Book Club, Tea Time and in-person departmental and All Company meetups
 Details
Location: Home-based
Contract: Full-time
Schedule: +/-2-3 hours of European time zones
  The personal data you provide will be processed by LEARNLIGHT in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. Under the legal conditions, you have the right to access, rectify and delete the data, to limit its processing, to oppose its processing and to its portability to our address (Calle de las Huertas 11, 28012 - Madrid) or to the e-mail address privacy@learnlight.com. You can find more information in the Privacy Policy of our website https://www.learnlight.com/en/privacy-policy/.

The Role We are seeking an experienced individual to join our Global Technology team as a Database Engineer. In this role, you work with a global engineering team to design, develop, and enhance database and ETL related code. You will support and refine database coding standards, and work with development teams to leverage them in practice. The ideal candidate would have deep technical expertise in ANSI SQL, ETL, and modelling development, possess strong organizational and collaboration skills, feel comfortable working across distributed teams worldwide. What You’ll Do 
Work across a geographically split team to deliver global data solutions.
Manage development standards for database development (SQL and ETL)
Collaborate with other teams in enterprise level projects and provide support / guidance as needed
Develop key components/templates for offshore teams, evangelize and educate them
Support of multiple SQL & NoSQL technologies; mainly Oracle & SQL data solutions
Examine database workloads and performance KPIs to tune and implement enhancements
Build and improve automation for release pipelines
Determine the most effective ways to optimize performance of existing solutions
Create and maintain technical documentation. 
What You’ll Bring 
Expertise in ANSI SQL programming, particularly with SQL Server and Oracle
Expertise in ETL design and development, SSIS and Informatica are key
Performance tuning experience
Exposure to NoSQL and Graph programming
Strong attention to detail
Champion team success over individual accomplishment
Passionate about learning and continuous improvement
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field required
3+ years of prior technology leadership and development experience
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to multitasking and quick learning.
Commitment to satisfying internal and external customers
Strong desire to win
Intellectual curiosity, and a can-do attitude

job_title: Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics - Home based - EUROPE
description:
Description

Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for.

Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives.

Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health
We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.
Job Responsibilities
Plans, organizes, manages and monitors the sector’s activities/operations according to his/her field of expertise, strategic and tactical alignments, and the needs of the organization in order to achieve the expected results.
Manages all operations activities related to the Pharmacometrics sector.
Provides quotes for all services provided by the team (e.g., Pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics analyses, toxicokinetics analyses, additional analyses not included in the original scope of work, etc.)
Provides other consultation services in clinical pharmacology field.
Acts as a pharmacometrician.
Acts as a scientific consultant/clinical pharmacologist for clients, proposing methodologies or performing pharmacometrics analyses (e.g., PK/PD analyses).
Ensure proper training and development of pharmacokineticists and pharmacometricians.
Review/prepare pharmacometric section of study protocols and/or Pharmacometric analysis plans for preclinical or Phase I to IV studies.
Manages human capital including workforce planning and hiring activities, performance management and the daily monitoring of productivity; facilitates knowledge development and transfer; and ensures the efficiency and mobilization of the team in order to achieve the expected results.
Helps develop and analyze the sector’s performance indicator systems according to the established objectives. Identifies opportunities to improve the division and/or service’s master plan and processes. Determines, as needed, the necessary actions in order to increase efficiency.
Contributes to the development of the sector’s budget, ensures that it is being adhered to, performs budget follow-up for pertinent stakeholders and recommends actions in an effort to achieve the expected results.
Communicates the necessary information to keep the team, the organization, and external clients abreast of the sector’s work plan, policies, projects processes, results, and actions and recommendations taken to meet arising needs and to achieve the expected results.
Advises internal/external clients of the division and/or service’s particular areas of expertise by assessing needs, and carrying out analysis and follow-up.
Acts as a consultant and resource person for external clients and Business Development employees with respect to pharmacometric issues.
Acts as a clinical Pharmacologist.
Represents the sector, both internally and externally, as a source for consultation and/or information and/or reference.
Promotes clinical pharmacology services.
Fosters the company’s scientific outreach by attending seminars, writing scientific articles, participating in conventions, interacting with the academic community, etc.
The employee may be called upon to perform other tasks related to their skill set, and for which he/she has been trained.
Qualifications

What we’re looking for
MSc or PhD in Biopharmaceutical Sciences, Pharmacology, Experimental Medicine or in another relevant field.
Word, Excel, and software used in pharmacometrics analyses: WinNonlin, SAS, NONMEM, etc.
Required bilingualism includes communicating verbally and in writing on topics that are often technical, and writing procedures or technical reports.
Candidate who does not possess the required training and/or experience may be considered under different criteria.
Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

TMF Group is a leading provider of critical administrative services, helping clients invest and operate safely around the world. Our 9,100 experts and 120 offices in 85 jurisdictions worldwide serve corporates, financial institutions, asset managers, private clients and family offices, providing the combination of accounting, tax, payroll, fund administration, compliance and entity management services essential to global business success. Discover the role The new-joiner will be a member of the newly constructed TMF CoE for Anaplan model builders supporting the design, implementation, and scaling out TMF’s Anaplan solution to Private Equity and Real Estate clients and delivering support to internal and external users in conformance to agreed internal SLAs. We are offering learning opportunities to support your career growth in a motivating work environment with lots of flexibility, freedom, and personal responsibility, flat hierarchies with direct contact with management, and international exchange. 
Review client models and business processes
Build customized Anaplan models
Collaborate with the project team to build Anaplan models with guidance from project leadership
Develop inbound/outbound data feeds to and from the Anaplan model
Conduct reconciliations and troubleshoot solutions
Develop end-user reporting and planning dashboards
Deploy solutions to end-users and provide support/training
Enable internal clients through co-model building training sessions
Support Solution Architect/Project Managers in maintaining the health of the implementation
Conceive and develop Proof of Concept models efficiently and translate/expand POC models into detailed blueprints (associated modules, lists/line items, calculations, etc.)
Provide both technical and business implication explanations to client staff and approaches to different modeling alternatives
Liaise with sales to provide demonstrations to clients
Assist in the development of processes and standards that will be applied across the global support team
Part of a global, virtual, support team that collaborates to deliver a consistent service to end users irrespective of their location or time zone 
Ideally, you match the following criteria: 
Bachelor's degree
A background in financial/multi-dimensional modeling
3+ years of experience in end-to-end model building with Anaplan covering at least 4 projects
 Certified Anaplan Model Builder 
Strong understanding of data integration challenges & solutions, such as ETL from various client platforms; experience with standard connectors like HyperConnect and automation using Anaplan connect required. Additional experience using third-party ETL tools (ODI, Informatica, Snaplogic, Mulesoft, Boomi)
Attention to detail
Fluent in both written and spoken English
Interest and experience in automation and Business Intelligence utilizing technology such as Alteryx and PowerBI 
 Nice to have but not essential : exposure to the Financial Services and Asset Management space, ideally within or consulting to Private Equity and Real Estate; experience in Private Equity systems (Investran, Allvue, eFront), industry-leading Real Asset systems (Yardi); experience of Credit servicing and portfolio management tools such as WSO, Black Mountain, Loan IQ a plus. 
Pathways for career development 
 Work with colleagues and clients around the world on interesting and challenging work;
 We provide internal career opportunities so you can take your career further within TMF;
 Continuous development is supported through global learning opportunities from the TMF Business Academy; 
Making an impact 
 You’ll be helping us to make the world a simpler place to do business for our clients;
 Through our corporate social responsibility program, you’ll also be making a difference in the communities where we work; 
A supportive environment 
 Strong feedback culture to help build an engaging workplace;
 Our inclusive work environment allows you to work from our offices around the world, as well as from home, helping you find the right work-life balance to perform at your best
La ricerca è rivolta a progettisti Junior e Senior con esperienza già maturata nelle progettazione di impianti da fonte rinnovabile in Italia

Tasks
Development of Odoo ERP system
Writing new modules for our business
Creation of connectors for data exchange with different sources (Banks, Marketplaces, etc.)
Improvement of current modules (Accounting, Sales, Inventory and etc.)
Assistance in creating effective user-friendly interfaces
Building architecture for safe and fast work with data
 Expectations
At least 5 years of software development experience
Excellent knowledge of Odoo (v14-16)
Expert-level knowledge of Python and its libraries
Experience with databases (SQL)
Git, Unix, REST API, JavaScript, XML
English - Advanced
 Additional advantages
Experience with optimization and acceleration of Odoo processes
Knowledge about optimal Odoo and Postgres configurations
 About Us
At Accel Club, we acquire, scale, and operate e-commerce businesses by integrating them into our platform. Backed by leading investors across technology and commerce, we build a team of A-players and create an environment for everyone to be engaged, challenged, and passionate about the work we do. We value result-driven and adventurous professionals ready to gain new experiences, learn non-stop, and think big.

This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Sappiamo che la persona che svolge il ruolo che stiamo cercando, JAVA DEVELOPER riceve molte richieste, e quindi perché sceglierci rispetto ad altri? S2S S.r.l. è un'azienda IT (di prodotto e sviluppo interni) nata nel 2005 e specializzata nella consulenza e nello sviluppo di soluzioni applicative anche in ambito IOT ed AI, con sede in Roma, ma che ha esteso la sua attività a tutto il territorio nazionale, aprendo nuove opportunità a professionisti di tutta Italia che vogliano far parte di un contesto giovane, in crescita, che offre formazione, tecnologie all'avanguardia, e soprattutto che rivolge particolare attenzione al benessere delle Persone e lo mette in pratica in diversi modi. Cosa facciamo per distinguerci?  Sviluppiamo con continuità il benessere in azienda e la relazione positiva con le nostre persone;  pensiamo che le persone si debbano divertire lavorando;  vogliamo che le persone abbiano modo di crescere professionalmente, attraverso i progetti e la formazione strutturata. 
 Contratto di assunzione (CCNL Commercio);
 Benefit aziendali
buoni pasto giornalieri
assicurazione sanitaria
SIM telefonica
 Formazione continua su tecnologie specifiche, con seminari in sede e presso Centri Specializzati.
 La visita ad alcuni dei siti archeologici della nostra città o eventi culturali. 
 Sono richiesti tra 2 e 5 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo applicativo in ambiente Java BackEnd e/o FrontEnd. 
Lavoriamo full remote o ibrido da tutta Italia! A questo punto potremmo aggiungere la lista di almeno 30 tecnologie, DB, framework, linguaggi, etc. etc. Ma sicuramente salteremmo qualcosa, magari proprio uno dei pezzi forti delle tue conoscenze. A noi interessa di più che tu condivida il concetto che puoi imparare, anche rapidamente, una nuova tecnologia perché hai metodo nell’apprendimento. E noi ti aiuteremo a farlo. Se abbiamo sollecitato il tuo interesse, aspettiamo il tuo CV. Speriamo di conoscerti! Un’ultima cosa: la nostra azienda non è composta da risorse ma da Persone

Test&Quality engineer Lokalita: Praha, Česká republika Název pozice: Test&Quality engineer Hledáme testera (test & quality engineer) pro tým zabývající se webovými projekty. Úkoly pozice budou: definice testovacích strategií a stanovení rozsahu práce na konkrétních projektech, tvorba testovacích plánů a případů, tvorba podrobných bug a issue reportů, realizace různých typů testů - build/integration/regression ad., tvorba frameworku pro automatizované testování, navrhování opatření ke zlepšování quality assurance při vývoji SW ad. Požadujeme: VŠ vzdělání (Bc.) v oboru informatika nebo podobném, praxi minimálně 2 roky v SW společnosti a v testování SW, výborné komunikační schopnosti, schopnost analýzy se smyslem pro detail, schopnost pracovat v distribuovaném týmu, dobrou úroveň písemné i ústní angličtiny, ochotu dále se vzdělávat. Uvítáme zkušenosti se SW usability, zejména ve webových a mobilních prostředích, zkušenosti s Microsoft Test Manager with Lab Environment a s automatizovanými testy. Nabízíme: Zázemí a podporu úspěšné a rostoucí společnosti se sídlem v The Greenline (Kačerov), práci na mezinárodních projektech pro prestižní značky v ČR a EU, HPP na dobu neurčitou, odpovídající finanční podmínky, prostor pro trvalý osobní, odborný i kariérní rozvoj, řadu firemních benefitů (stravenky, příspěvek na penzijní připojištění, týden dovolené navíc, flexibilní pracovní doba, home office...). Nástup možný ihned nebo podle dohody.

Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!
 Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.
 Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.
 Deine Aufgaben
  Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden
 Dein Profil
  Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz
 Unser Angebot
 Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!
 Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

job_title: IT Senior Data Analyst | MUST: S2P, SQL Snowflake, DBT, Procurement/Supplier/Purchase Accounting
description:
Candidate must be open to work in UK timezone and traveling to London from time to time for team meetings.
 MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE
  Source To Payment (S2P)
SQL Snowflake
DBT
Management / Communication Skills
Procurement / Supplier / Purchase accounting.
 WHAT YOU’LL DO
 We are in the early stages of building a centralized Business Intelligence & Analytics function that will simplify and automate information delivery—providing advanced insights and analysis to support decision making. To date, the team has launched and operationalized several global scale products and dashboards, enhancing how our leaders engage in information to manage the business. The next wave of digital reporting is underway which will help to unlock further value for our company’s leadership and functions with best-in-class business intelligence and analytics.
 The Data Analyst role will be an integral part of an Agile team focused on delivering best in class business intelligence. This role will be responsible for helping to define, build and implement new analytic and reporting use cases to support decision making for the firm.
 Responsibilities would include:
  Determine requirements for business, with focus on the reporting and analytic requirements needed to support senior management decision making across the firm (with a focus on Business Objects and Tableau based dashboards)
Acting as a functional subject matter expert for partnering to troubleshooting data issues, redesign processes and develop reports
Refine epics and stories to ensure data engineers have solid requirements to work against.
Working with key stakeholders to gather and document business requirements
Defining the form, content, and capabilities provided in our BI solution
Identify key changes and impacts to our existing reporting capabilities and products
Understanding multiple data sources and putting together practical and viable data model for the analytics reports being prepared.
Assessing the gaps between the prioritized requirements and the current reporting capabilities. Generating possible solution options and, with the use of an agreed set of design principles, selecting the preferred option to move forward
Developing training materials and delivering trainings to end-users
 YOU’RE GOOD AT
 Problem solving and analytical tasks
Ability to structure hypothesis, build thoughtful analyses, develop underlying data model and bring clarity to previously undefined problems
Desire and flexibility to work through details with keen attention to accuracy and interdependencies
Natural curiosity to understand how things work and why, our data, our processes, and our reports. Desire to comprehend root causes when issues arise
Comfortable working with ambiguity and in an iterative environment
 Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
Works positively and collaboratively with others and within team; builds strong and lasting relationships
Working and partnering with remote team members in different time zones
Adapts style to changing situations and audiences with tact, poise, and patience. Demonstrates persistence to drive change. Contributes to a positive and productive work environment
Leverages network effectively across functions, offices, regions and/or externally (existing network within BCG will be helpful)
Experience on data visualization and / or ability to present data analytics in an insightful manner for the leadership will be an added plus
 Work Management, organization, and planning
Must be able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment
Willingness to work on Agile methodology is a must, familiarity will be a plus.
Strong Organizational skills and process management skills
Ability to contribute to multiple work streams at once and prioritize efforts accordingly. Demonstrated ability to drive projects to scheduled conclusion
 YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
  Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or Economics. MBA Preferred, but not required
7-9+ years of finance and procurement reporting relevant experience; less experience considered for exceptional performers
Should have a good understanding of Source to Pay (S2P); experience and understanding of S2P for consulting/services organizations preferred.
Sound analytical and reporting skills combined with excellent communication skills
Proven ability to work effectively in a global environment with people at all levels, preferably in a professional services organization
Strong experience with enterprise software and business intelligence solutions required (Business Objects and Tableau required)
Snowflake and DBT
Experience in SQL and other coding languages a plus
 YOU’LL WORK WITH
 As a member of the Data Tribe Team, you will interact extensively with a diverse range of stakeholders from across the business, both geographically and functionally. This includes, but is not limited to Local, Regional, Global, and Practice Area Finance teams. As well, as part of the overall Data Tribe team coordinating and working with our other core BIA squads and different functions will play a large part in this role.

About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet. As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world 🌎 You may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected. We’re actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end 🧠 These geniuses have created our chatbot – the lovely Rita – and they didn’t stop there 🤯 They’ve also created automated FinCrime quality controls in a few weeks. Yes, they’re just that good! You’ll never work alone, either. As a Python Engineer, you’ll sit within a Product Team – simultaneously working with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers, Product Owners and Operations Managers to solve problems and make our rocket ship fly even higher 🚀 Ready to join? 👇 What You’ll Be Doing 
Building APIs making sure they are properly designed and scale according to the business needs
Creating data pipelines to pull data from production services into our data warehouse - powering reporting, data analytics and data science
Writing event consumers to build new data models in order to provide this data to new flows and processes 
What You'll Need 
5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer
3+ years Engineering with Python as your primary language
An academic background in a STEM subject
Fluency in Python, SQL and other OOPLs
Experience with API development & integration
Practical understanding of distributed systems
Ability to write concurrent code in IO/CPU bound situations
Experience with Docker, K8s, Ansible, Teamcity, monitoring and alerting 
Nice to have 
Experience with prototyping and sketching
Multiple side projects or open source contributions
Exposure to GCP
Experience with Django Framework 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates
