Buscamos UN/A PROJECT MANAGER en la modalidad de trabajo presencial para el análisis,
seguimiento y gestión de nuestros productos/proyectos y asignación de tareas asegurando su realización en óptimas condiciones de calidad, plazos,
costes y servicio para compañía tecnológica de servicios digitales ubicada en A
Coruña.
 TUS RESPONSABILIDADES DE ALTA RESPONSABILIDAD SERÍAN:
• Apoyo en el análisis funcional de los proyectos para garantizar el cumplimiento de los criterios de gestión económica, calidad y servicio.
• Gestión y atención a clientes, apoyo en la toma de requisitos inicial.
• Revisar y entender el análisis técnico para garantizar la cobertura de las necesidades funcionales y entendiendo el flujo de procesos.
• Responsabilizarse de la implantación funcional y de los requerimientos no funcionales tales como rendimiento, escalabilidad, disponibilidad, etc.
• Desarrollar soluciones ad hoc para cliente en el caso de surgir gaps funcionales.
• Colaborar junto con el responsable en el diseño, planificación y ejecución del desarrollo a partir de la concepción del producto/proyecto.
• Colaborar en la creación de soluciones ad hoc con el responsable de área y capa de gestión sobre requerimientos, funcionalidades, etc
• Apoyo y colaboración con el responsable de área y capa de gestión para el análisis de kpis y resultados por/para cada producto/proyecto gestionado.
 HERRAMIENTAS TECNOLÓGICAS UTILIZADAS
Conocimientos del clásico básico tecnológico:
Linux (aunque si quieres Windows para trabajar en tu equipo también nos vale)
PHP desde 7.1 hasta 8.0 y las que vengan!
Apache 2.4+
MySQL 5.7+
MongoDB 4.4+
Conocimientos de las siguientes herramientas:
En cuanto a frameworks y herramientas:
Symfony 4 y 5, esto ya te lo podrías imaginar por el título de la oferta
Laravel 7.x y 8.x. con algún proyecto legacy en Laravel 5.4.
API Platform
Análisis estático con PHP CS Fixer, PHPStan, Psalm
Otras herramientas y tecnologías que te encontrarás por el camino:
PHPStorm
ElasticSearch + Kibana
RabbitMQ
SonarQube
GitLab
 IMPRESCINDIBLE
Experiencia con PHP y muy valorable JavasCript y Phyton. 
 TE PROPONEMOS
Contrato indefinido a jornada completa.
Horario con entrada flexible de lunes a jueves y viernes teletrabajo. 
Salario de 35/40K B/A

Beasy4BIZ opera internazionalmente nel settore delle nuove tecnologie, offrendo soluzioni innovative di sviluppo software. Cerchiamo e vogliamo essere circondati da persone di talento che amino le sfide, con sufficiente esperienza per poter lavorare in modo indipendente ma anche desiderose di imparare dagli altri e insegnare agli altri.
 Posizione
Per ampliamento del team di progetto, stiamo cercando uno sviluppatore backend che preferibilmente abbia maturato un’ottima esperienza soprattutto in Node.js, con le seguenti caratteristiche:
 Software Engineer
· Node.js
· express/fastify,
· APIs and Microservices,
· Google Cloud Platform.
· sono gradite esperienze su metedologie Agile/Scrum.
 Richiesta: Conoscenza approfondita di API, architettura di microservizi e programmazione funzionale. La persona deve aver gestito direttamente almeno un progetto completo, perfettamente funzionante e online, in microservizi con database distribuito, in Google Cloud o AWS.
 Lo stack tecnologico utilizzato sul progetto: 
 · Architecture: distributed on GCP, with GKE Frontend: REACT, connections with Websockets Backend: Node.js, Typescript
· APIs: both RESTful and Websocket
· Data storage: MySQL, MongoDB and Big Query datastore
  Completano il profilo buone doti relazionali, capacità di lavoro in team e problem solving, ottimo standing.
 Gradita passione per il proprio lavoro e l’ambito informatico.
Sede di lavoro: Remote Working.
 Altre informazioni
 Si offre contratto a tempo indeterminato con benefit e premi per una buona produttività.
Remunerazione, in base alla seniority: tra i 2500-4000 euro netti/mese.
 La retribuzione sarà valutata rispetto ai relativi percorsi professionali e accademici.
 L'avvio dell'attività lavorativa sarà in smart working e proseguirà in questa modalità.
 L’offerta rispetta le norme sulle parità di trattamento in materia di occupazione e di condizioni di lavoro.

Job Description
 At NATEK, we are currently creating a Virtual Team of experienced Managers and Senior Specialists who will join very sophisticated and selected projects on our Customer’s side (global manufacturer of office products).
 We will assign the best project matching your experience and preferences, and together as Natek Team we will support Customer to be more competitive.
 Your responsibilities
   Coordinating and managing project teams to deliver personalization & fulfilment solutions in compliant with customer requirements
 Delivering solutions at committed time, with quality and cost control to ensure customer satisfaction
 Maintaining company’s interests (contractual management, costs, amendments, risks, maintainability and other)
 Assessing and analyzing customer requirements in conjunction with internal solutions
 Completing and validating the functional specifications with the customer
 Defining the project management plan and developing all project management related documents
 Providing regular visibility, both internally and externally, on project progress, risks, contingency plan and issues with proper alerts and escalations
 Managing both customer and internal change requests following company’s change request management process
 Ensuring handover to the customer support team after project launch
 Our requirements
   3-5 years general Project Management experience in a Project Management role is a must.
 Knowledge and experience in chosen area: infrastructure (including cloud solutions), network and connectivity services, SAP, Software Development either from a management perspective or from a previous engineering background extremely beneficial
 Should have a thorough understanding of Project Management methodologies
 Project Management trained and experienced / Certification preferred - PMP or Prince2, ITIL/Six Sigma Certified
 Strong skills in Microsoft Project, Microsoft Office & SharePoint in a project management environment
 Must have exceptional communication skills: Written and Verbal, customer facing, running meetings and leading conference calls, collecting information, clarifying and confirming between numerous parties and reporting.
 Able to clearly explain situations/facts to peers and our customers. Provides status reports as required.
 Can operate as an individual contributor or in support of a more senior Project Manager, managing multiple concurrent projects
 Ability to effectively manage relationships and communicate cross-functionally to ensure reporting deliverables are met and projects are driven towards completion
 Business and sales orientation: able to turn customer requirements into workable solutions
 Fluent English
 Benefits
   B2B contract - long-term cooperation
 Possibility to work fully remote ()
 Internal Mobility Program – enjoy many opportunities for career growth, job rotations, diversity of projects & technologies
 International, diverse, and inclusive working environment – get experience in global projects for worldwide leaders and enjoy multinational teams
 Referral Program - enjoy cooperation with your colleagues and get the bonus!
 5/10 years NATEK club – we offer long term cooperation and celebrate each fifth year cooperation anniversary with gifts
 NATEK CSR Events & team buildings - enjoy our values: accountability, partnership and expertise and #workITwithus
 Education – benefit from our know how, learning courses and certificates and IT events – be part of community of leaders of the industry and take part as a speaker or a visitor

Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including: 
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising 
Content, offering a headless CMS 
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions 
Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI-optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com. Become a Program Manager for Bloomreach! We are building a dedicated team for the Content PaaS/On Prem Business Unit, for a product that has 150+ customers worldwide. Become a part of our Product Team, and work out of our Bratislava or Brno office, or from home on a full-time basis. As a Program Manager, you are going to be the first program manager in the team working with customers, product managers, and the professional services team on a daily basis. You’ll be responsible for customer version upgrades and Content PaaS to SaaS migrations. This is a great opportunity for Junior Project Managers who want to take the next step in their careers and create and own this new Program. What you’ll be doing 
Partner with customers to understand their objectives and business goals 
Own all initiatives related to problems and opportunities for our customers regarding version upgrades and PaaS to SaaS migration to make version upgrades and migrations smoother for customers 
Facilitate customer communications for upgrades and migrations 
Guide product management and technical services teams to build product capabilities, features, plugins or addons for smoother upgrades and migrations 
Handle projects that are complex cross-team, cross-functional initiatives. Collaborate with engineering managers and engineers to estimate work efforts, define achievements and manage resources. Track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks and communicate status to project stakeholders. 
Understand technical implementation at the architecture level and propose technical alternatives when vital. Ask questions that clarify priorities and push the team to be highly effective. Develop broad domain and technical knowledge. 
Define and document detailed project plans and requirements to manage technical design, architecture, and implementations for customer deliverables 
Communicate these project plans and requirements to all Stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Tech Services, Account Management and Customers) for sign off 
Required Skills 
Experience in project management. Familiar with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies and able to apply them where best suited 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and outstanding emotional intelligence. 
Ability to influence and empower people across a broad variety of job functions through your relationships 
Strong organizational skills to balance multiple, contending priorities simultaneously, without losing sight of the highest priority items 
Strong technical background, strong project and program skills, and strong stakeholder management skills. 
Relevant work experience, including project or program management experience 
Experience collaborating with developers/engineering teams 
Familiar with Content Management Systems 
BS in Engineering or Computer Science or commensurate technical experience desirable but not required 
Regional benefits: 
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region 
More things you'll like about Bloomreach: Culture: 
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one. 
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication. 
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style. 
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents. 
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead. 
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5 
Personal Development: 
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions. 
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins. 
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)* 
Well-being: 
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.* 
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.* 
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones. 
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other. 
Compensation: 
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.* 
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.* 
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts. 
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!* 
(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.) If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful! Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

job_title: Senior SAS Programmer – Fast Progression – Remote Working
description:
Senior SAS Programmer – Global CRO – Fully Remote
 Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer / Senior SAS Consultant / Clinical SAS Programmer
 Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.
 Looking for an experienced Statistical Programmer who will be fully responsible for leading multiple complex projects across oncology and other therapeutic areas – phases I-III.
You will remain the point of contact for all client meetings/queries and dependent on your experience level will also be responsible for leading/managing the project teams.
 Role Responsibilities:
Project lead clinical studies
Develop and maintain project timelines
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and Pharma industry
 We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.
 Desired Skills:
3 years’ experience in SAS Programming
Some experience Co-leading / Leading Projects and Studies
Experience mentoring and supporting a team of SAS Programmers.
You have Good SAS programming and CDISC standards knowledge
You possess excellent interpersonal skills
 Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working
 Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.
 Title: Senior Statistical Programmer
 Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.
 Please apply below or email your CV to Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com
 Associated Keywords: Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer Senior SAS Consultant / United Kingdom / London / Manchester / Remote / Home based / CDISC / ADaM / STDM / CDASH / TLF / SAS Certificate / SAS Certification / Clinical SAS Programmer / Clinical SAS Programmer / SAS Programming / Statistical Programming / Submission / Specifications / Regulatory Authorities / Good Clinical Practices (GCP) / Data Manipulation

Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billion downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #2 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google.
 The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having raised over $1B and backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL.
 Voodoo is now a team of over 700 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.
 Team
 Our Gaming team is made up of hyper-casual, hybrid-casual, casual, mid-core and blockchain experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
 Our Core games team is divided into Publishing, Partnership and Internal Studios teams. With over six billion downloads worldwide, we are the largest and most successful mobile gaming publisher in the world. Since the creation of the App Store, only Meta and Google have achieved more downloads, and we are the only European player in the top six.
 What will be your main challenges?
 We are looking for talents interested in creating something bigger ! To succeed in this role, you will need to have a good understanding of the hyper casual & casual mobile game market. You will support small and high performing teams. Through your work you will develop your skills and help us to deliver fun and entertaining games to millions of people all around the world!
   Identifying and documenting core mobile games concepts and mechanics that can be built into something bigger
 Designing the game toward engagement: level design, in-game progression, economics
 Building metagames that are modular, versatile and revenue generating
 Exploring new ways to entertain a hyper casual audience with casual/midcore concepts
 Using the extensive game library of Voodoo to understand what motivates a new generation of game player
 The role
   Drive selection of game concepts to support teams transition from pure Hyper Casual to more complex Puzzle and Battle mobile games:
 Analyze game play and users behavior through internal and external models and tools
 Deconstruct and analyze mobile games mechanics to come up with relevant and marketable concepts
 Build on yours’ or others' ideas and create consistent and comprehensive game designs starting from a core mechanic
 Benchmark the market to stay on top of new trends
 Support the creation of new Hybrid Casual Games Hits: 
 Pitch and implement new game ideas and features to the team, through detailed Game Design Documents
 Design games from A to Z: gameplay, FTUE, levels, environments, reward systems, difficulty, balancing, etc.
 Get involved in all aspects of game development: UI,UX, game design, logic, performance, etc.
 Help fine-tune game balancing, pacing and feeling
 Support teams production with relevant tools and good ways of working
 Improve the workflow (building a better pipeline, creating reusable templates, creating procedural level designs, etc)
 Create gameplay prototypes and a database of gameplay concepts that could be used in the future
 Profile
  At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Game Designer (or App Designer) with Unity experience preferred
Experience with game prototyping (including participating in game jams)
Solid knowledge about Game Design including game mechanics, level design, and UI/UX
Experience with balancing game systems (difficulty, reward, economy, etc) and funnel optimization
Experienced with creating mock-ups and design documents
Experienced in communicating with programmers, leading them through the execution of your designs and giving feedback
Creative problem-solving skills to address a diversity of game design issues every day, including but not limited to gameplay, level, interface, etc 
Good level of English (both writing and speaking)
Versatile, can adapt quickly, and move fast
 Benefits : competitive salary and other benefits according to the country you reside.

From ideas to impact
 We are a global digital business services organization with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. Our Consulting, Technology and Learning teams design and deliver transformational digital products and experiences that add value to our clients’ businesses and to their customers' lives.
 Every day, across the world, our teams are pioneering faster, better ways to bring our client’s most exciting ideas to life.
 If you are interested in shaping the future of enterprise solution development, then you might be just who we're looking for: Solution Architect to help us shape Emergn's exciting future and play an important role in our growth.
 We want you to:
Act as the technical advisor in service delivery projects.
Work with technical client requirements (including RFI/RFP) & design solutions.
Work with sales & pre-sales, value proposition development and delivery teams as well as external partners to shape and deliver solutions for our customers.
Support the Solution Architecture practice in developing reusable assets
Contribute to Emergn through thought leadership development with internal & external communities.
 This job might be for you if you have:
Solid & broad technical capabilities by working with Software Engineering team(s).

The Role We are looking for a virtual PMO Group Leader that will be part of the management team of the Solera Global Project Management Office (PMO) and lead a team of project management professionals that will specifically have a focus on projects related to products that Solera markets to its clientele internationally (i.e., outside of North America). The team that this individual will manage may act in traditional project and portfolio management roles and will be comprised of individual of varying levels of experience and seniority in this field. The projects that they will manage will consist largely of technology projects that include a heavy emphasis on all aspects of a software development lifecycle in an agile development environment. In this role, the PMO Group Leader will be responsible for assignment of staff to projects requiring PMO support at any given time, and as such providing the best match of skillsets within the team with the needs of each project and balancing workloads of the team to optimize utilization of staff. In addition, the PMO Group Leader will establish a hierarchical project management structure that will facilitate multiple levels of project status reporting and issue escalation including, at minimum, project, portfolio, and group level. As such it is critical that the PMO Group Leader is highly skilled, experienced, and competent in acting in a group-level oversight role of multiple project portfolios and thus can act in an effective role of oversight, advisement, selective intervention to assist in issue resolution where needed, and as a final point of escalation of issues within the group to attempt to resolve with escalation further up the management chain only on rare occasion when necessary. These job requirements necessitate an individual with several years of successful hand-on experience in managing projects consisting of varying business needs, technologies, stakeholders, levels of complexity, and problem-solving. The PMO Group Leader will require a history of competency and accomplishment in the exact roles of the team members, as they will depend on their manager for expert-level guidance, direction, advisement, and support in successfully managing their own projects. The PMO Group Leader’s overall mission is to manage a group that consistently demonstrates and is reputable in an ability to deliver critical projects of various types, meeting business expectations, and most importantly successfully delivering the intended and expected results, with solid communication and transparency every step of the way. What You’ll Do 
Assume administrative leadership of a group of project management professionals
Drive standard processes, tool usage, and best practices for consistency and reliability of project delivery from group that conforms to corporate-level standards that are propagated globally across Solera
Be part of a PMO management team that is charged with competency, consistency, precision, & success of project delivery on a global scale across Solera
Be able to speak in a thorough, substantive, and accurate manner about the projects under the group’s management responsibility and serve as an effective point of communication of status, as well as escalation of issues to leadership outside the group as needed
Act as an effective backstop for issue resolution and problem-solving related to projects under management responsibility of the group, ensuring that escalations beyond the group on only on rare occasion – the PMO Group Leader should be able to advise, direct, and assist as needed to resolve the majority of issues that are raised for any given project
Collaborate with other PMO leadership to formulate new processes, reengineer existing ones, as well as define and propagate best practices and standard procedures related to project management across Solera
Collaborate with other PMO leadership as needed to establish an effective management model for PMO resource sharing and cross-utilization, as well as resource accountability not only to their direct manager but also a dotted line to their stakeholders (e.g., portfolio managers, product managers, etc.)
Act as a point of escalation for stakeholders regarding any projects within the management responsibility of the group
Serve in administrative management capacity to team members, collaborating and advising them in career planning and management, as well as performance evaluations, and recognition of accomplishments 
What You’ll Bring 
Bachelor's degree (BS/BA) in a related field of study; Masters in a related field is a plus 
10+ years experience of project, program, and project portfolio management experience, particularly in software and information technology in a wide breadth of size & complexity
5+ years experience in the design & definition of project management processes, procedures, and standard practices for an organization
5+ years experience in an agile development environment
5+ years of industry-standard tool usage related to project management and agile development
PMP Certification preferred; agile methodology certification is a plus 
Demonstrated ability to: 
Be results driven – period – and manage your team to be the same
Communicate effectively and transparently in a clear and concise manner with colleagues, direct reports, and all levels of management
Be collaborative in nature with employees, management peers, customers, stakeholders, and all levels of management
Be oriented toward making clear agreements in every aspect of the job, with employees, management, peers, and stakeholders
Create structure where this is none and articulate and establish it in an effective manner so it is recognized and adopted
Lead the team and teach them how to effectively lead – not chase – their projects
Base decisions and judgments strictly on facts – not conjecture, supposition, or hearsay – and perform the legwork to get the facts needed for every situation
Resolve conflict or disagreement among team members, peers, management, stakeholders in a respectful fashion and with the perspectives in mind of not just yourself but of all those involved
Be proactive in problem-solving; treating risk management as the key to minimal problems, obstacles, & blockers that can occur in project execution and teach the team to think and to act in that fashion and modeling the behavior for them
Be accountable, trustworthy, direct, and objective in fulfillment of job expectations, deliverables, performance, and results of the team that they are in charge of
Be able to operate and thrive in an environment that is challenging and can change frequently with aggressive objectives to meet and complex problems to overcome
Manage employees in a fair, consistent, transparent, objective, and constructive fashion, with a genuine interest and investment in their success and career growth, as well as the benefit of your years of experience and insight
Be process oriented and recognize the importance of standardization for repeatability, consistency, and maturity of our project management capabilities across the organization
Be calm and collected under pressure, and as a result keep your employees also calm and collected
Be a team player and have the company’s and its employees success as the main underlying goal driving your actions and leadership

Title: Program de absolvire a ingineriei 2023
 Căutăm absolvenți de Inginerie remarcabili și dinamici care să se alăture programului nostru de absolvenți care va începe în septembrie 2023. Suntem o companie de perspectivă cu dorința de a rămâne atât inovatoare, cât și sustenabile pe o piață din ce în ce mai globală. Căutăm comunicatori foarte motivați, inteligenți din punct de vedere emoțional, muncitori, articulați, precum dvs., care să ne ajute să ne îndeplinim aspirațiile de creștere.
 Cine sunt DS Smith?
Suntem cel mai mare furnizor de soluții de ambalare și cel mai mare reciclator din Europa. Avem o strategie unică pentru ciclul de aprovizionare, cu o abordare de lider în industrie a durabilității: dorim cele mai strălucitoare idei noi pentru a ne îmbunătăți continuu designul, inovația și antreprenoriatul. Acolo intri; fiecare rol la DS Smith joacă un rol în a ne ajuta să reducem amprenta de carbon.
   Locații
În cadrul programului nostru de absolvenți de inginerie pentru 2023, oferim oportunități în următoarele locații*:
· Zărnești, România
 *Locațiile se pot schimba în funcție de cerințe. Pentru a obține cele mai bune rezultate din program, solicităm candidaților să fie complet mobili.
 Despre program
Schema noastră se desfășoară pe o perioadă de doi ani și le va oferi absolvenților bazele pentru a reuși în Inginerie cu diferite locuri de muncă pe parcursul programului. Veți urma un program riguros de dezvoltare pentru a vă oferi seturile de abilități pentru a reuși în aceste domenii, în timp ce vă va dezvolta și pentru a deveni un viitor lider DS Smith. Veți fi asociat cu un mentor și veți primi o pregătire de primă clasă de la partenerul nostru extern pentru a dezvolta capacități de conducere și vi se vor oferi oportunități de a pune în practică tot ceea ce ați învățat.
 În cadrul Ingineriei, veți avea locuri de plasare în întreținere (unde ne asigurăm că mașinile noastre funcționează mereu și mențin fabrica noastră) și proces (unde veți vedea cum maximizăm performanța mașinilor noastre pentru a crește viteza, reducând în același timp costurile și risipa). Veți efectua, de asemenea, o plasare de îmbunătățire continuă, în care veți revizui toate procesele noastre pentru a determina unde putem fi mai eficienți și reduce risipa în misiunea noastră de a fi cea mai sustenabilă companie de ambalare.
 Plasamentele dvs. vor avea loc fie în cadrul afacerilor noastre de ambalare, fie în cadrul întreprinderii de hârtie. Echipa noastră de soluții de ambalare oferă soluții de ambalare durabile, care iau în considerare întregul ciclu de aprovizionare și susțin unele dintre cele mai mari mărci din lume. În timp ce afacerea noastră de hârtie produce materiale durabile pentru cutii ondulate, hârtie de specialitate și hârtie de înaltă performanță pentru producția de ambalaje. Indiferent de afacerea în care ajungeți, veți juca un rol cheie în dezvoltarea strategiilor personalizate și veți oferi un produs durabil de înaltă calitate.
 Pe lângă abilitățile specifice rolului pe care le veți dezvolta, veți fi într-o cohortă de absolvenți și împreună vă vom oferi un program de dezvoltare de clasă mondială care vă va sprijini să deveniți unul dintre viitorii noștri lideri.
 · În primul an, accentul este pe a te înțelege pe tine însuți; abilitățile tale, punctele tale forte și cum să-ți realizezi potențialul.
 · În anul doi, dezvoltarea ta va fi despre înțelegerea celorlalți, cum să lucrezi eficient în echipă și cum să îi susții pe ceilalți.
 · Vei fi apoi responsabil de propria ta carieră, fie că devii lider sau specialist, te vom ajuta să găsești casa perfectă la DS Smith.
    Despre tine
 Pentru a fi luat în considerare pentru această schemă trebuie să aveți cel puțin:
· O diplomă în Inginerie (electrică, mecanică, chimică, civilă, industrială, proiectare structurală sau discipline de proces) sau pentru a obține calificarea înainte de septembrie 2023.
· Vorbește fluent în română și engleză.
· Aveți dreptul de a lucra în România.
· Fii complet flexibil și mobil din punct de vedere geografic.
    Beneficii
   Un salariu competitiv. 
serie de alte beneficii, în funcție de țara în care aplicați.
 *Centrele de evaluare vor avea loc în martie/aprilie 2023, iar candidații vor trebui să poată participa la aceasta virtual.
 **Solicitanții de succes vor trebui să fie disponibili pentru a începe primul lor plasament pe 4 septembrie 2023.

Verde Energy Group are a leading Irish owned and operated Energy Services company providing a range of Capex and financed energy saving solutions to clients. We pride ourselves in delivering industry leading knowledge and market leading professional project delivery with a client first approach.
We are now recruiting for an experienced Project Manager as a new addition to the Project Management Team in Ireland.
 Key responsibilities and Objectives of this role:
·      The Project Manager is responsible for delivering energy efficient & renewable solutions that meet customer's requirement and expectation.
·      Manage and/or complete a comprehensive survey of customer’s facility in compliance with project scope.
·      Manage all aspects from customer contract to completion & Execute project planning, budgeting, scheduling, and implementation in accordance with Customer requirements and approved processes and procedures.
·      Supporting the Sales Team in presenting technological capabilities.
·      Select and sub-contract the electrical works to an approved installation contractor, verifying/approving change orders, daily review with Operations Team on project status, verification of completion of all milestones in the project installation, success in completing each project on time, on budget, in compliance with project scope and to the Customer’s satisfaction.
·      To liaise with Supply Chain Manager and ensure on time delivery of products to customers and/or authorised contractors for installation as scheduled.
·      Investigating problems and handling queries from customer that may arise from time to time during different stages of project.
·      Manage installation projects. Complete project assessments and proposal development consultation with Project Engineering Team and Operations Team.
·      Coordinate and lead final walkthrough to obtain customer acceptance and sign-off at completion.
·      Completing Health and Safety packs prior to Project Commencement
·      Formulation of Operation and Maintenance manuals for the client
 Requirements
·      Minimum 3 years of experience in the electrical or construction industries.
·      Strong lighting background with Electrical experience preferred, knowledge of Solar PV an advantage
·      Advanced knowledge of Construction Management processes, means and methods
·      Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules/regulations, and quality standards.
·      Excellent time and project management skills.
·      Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
·      Be highly organised and detail oriented.
·      Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and Project.
·      Be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work both independently and collaboratively, and function well under pressure.
·      Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and can develop innovative and practical solutions to technical problems.
·      Good at building rapport with customers to achieve a closer working relationship.
·      Are cost-conscious and have a meticulous approach to quality.
·      There will be a requirement to work outside of general office hours. This will be Project Led.
·      Full clean driving licence
 Benefits
·      Competitive salary and conditions
·      Company Vehicle (Tesla Model 3 or similar)
 Location: Midlands or Leinster based preferred but not essential.

OutSystems is the pioneer of the fast-growing high-performance low-code development market. The company empowers organizations to innovate their businesses through software, and we are looking for talented and motivated individuals to join our team. The OutSystems high-performance low-code platform is considered one of the leading application development solutions by customers, analysts such as Gartner and Forrester, and partners around the world. The platform gives organizations – from small and mid-sized businesses to enterprises – the tools to build, deliver, manage and evolve mobile and web applications that are unique to their businesses. With high-productivity, AI-assisted tools, customers can tackle any strategic challenge – from modernizing and integrating their existing applications, to automating business and workplace processes, and creating exceptional customer apps and experiences. Solutions built with OutSystems are secure, resilient, cloud-native, built to scale, and can be continuously evolved. OutSystems is a truly global organization, with customers across 87 countries and 22 industries, more than 400 partners, and a 600,000-developer community. The company is known for creating a culture of innovation inside its customer organizations, with many working with OutSystems for more than a decade. Founded in 2001 in Portugal, we have offices in Lisbon, the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, France, the UAE, India, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, and Australia, and of course a thriving and collaborative worldwide community of remote employees. OutSystems continuously receives leadership recognition from the top analyst firms, the CODiE Awards, SD Times 100, the Cloud100, and other influential groups. Our team members are at the core of a dynamic, industry-leading company that is helping organizations of all sizes across the globe innovate their businesses through the power of software. Do you love technology that solves problems? Do you feel accomplished by helping others achieve their full potential? At OutSystems, the Digital department is responsible for accelerating the company to the next level. We build applications using our platform, drive initiatives with all other departments to key deliverables for the company and deliver a data analytics platform that accelerates data and non-data experts with actionable insights. Data Engineering The Data Engineering team works closely with business stakeholders to give them the needed data and tools to make data driven decisions. Our stack includes a plethora of tools, namely Snowflake, Fivetran and Power BI and a few others for a complete modern stack. Tech Leads are responsible for improving and upkeeping a solid, scalable, and reliable data platform for all analyses and reporting. OutSystems is a data-centric company where everyone is accountable for the success of their activities in a quantifiable way. As a senior member of the team, you will provide direction to other team members by overseeing development, testing and documentation of developed solutions, while fostering strong stakeholder relationships for ongoing business. This role will be responsible for the ownership of the enterprise data warehouse, working closely with business experts to improve the data warehouse in order to have a single source of truth with coherent and reliable data for all company metrics. 
Creating single sources of truth for overlapping data, consumable by business users
Implementing technical and business data validation rules
Align with data scientists, analysts, product owners and business experts to accelerate their exploratory analyses and evaluate a later integration of such analyses into the data warehouse ETL
Improve our best practices, ensuring a reliable and solid delivery process 
Excellent communication skills for different audiences 
Proven experience in data requirement gathering and analysis, with a tech-agnostic approach
Solid knowledge of Data Modeling (emphasis on Dimensional Modeling) and data warehousing
Experience in modern BI systems including ETL/ELT development
Experience processing significant amounts of structured and unstructured data
Programming knowledge to clean and process data sets (e.g.: Scala, Java, Python, JavaScript, etc)
Transparency and ability to establish long lasting trusting and supportive relationships with the team and other stakeholders
Knowledge in data mining, machine learning and/or NLP is a plus, but not a requirement 
5+ years of experience in an Data Engineering or similar role
3+ years experience managing a project with a small (or bigger) team
3+ years of experience creating data sets, reports and dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau or similar analytical tools
Experience managing client expectations and promoting alignment
Strong SQL skills, namely T-SQL (knowing Snowflake is a plus)
Fluency in English, written and spoken (mandatory)
Not required, but a plus when existing:
Knowledge of Pentaho Data Integration, Kettle or Apache Hop
Experience with the AWS or Azure data stack 
What do we have to offer you? 
A company that continues to grow, change and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative. 
Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills. 
Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you – and a team that is global. 
A company culture that is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence (as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules and delivered every day.) 
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way. 
Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we’d love to hear from you! OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law.

Collaborate with internal and external partners on process and operational improvements throughout the project cycle, troubleshooting when discrepancies arise
Manage client relationships and expectations throughout the project life cycle
Conduct project closure processes and contribute to organization-wide procedure improvements using lessons learned
 Qualifications / Requirements:
 Requirements:
  3-5 years of experience in project management
2+ years in operations and/or account management, working directly with clients
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail with a commitment to accuracy and quality
Self-starter willing to support their project teams
 Preferred Qualifications:

PMP, Agile, and/or Lean Six Sigma experience and/or certifications
International vendor management experience
Experience building new sites or launching new geos
Advanced knowledge of email ticketing and cloud-based systems (i.e., 8x8, Aircall, Five9, Salesforce, Zendesk)
 Education / Certifications:
  Bachelor's degree or equivalent business project management experience
 How We Partner To Protect You: TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.
 DEI:In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances.  EEO: TaskUs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. TaskUs people first culture thrives on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, our services, and our community.
 If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
 TaskUs is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Noi adottiamo il paradigma serverless per lo sviluppo di applicazioni verticali e di funzionalità ed integrazioni per i progetti ecommerce che realizziamo, e adottiamo lo stesso paradigma nello sviluppo delle automazioni a supporto delle infrastrutture che realizziamo e gestiamo su cloud AWS.

Tu hai almeno 2 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di API e applicazioni in Node JS in ambiente cloud, con un approccio event driven, e conosci bene servizi AWS (o equivalenti di altri cloud provider) come Lambda, DynamoDB e SQS/SNS/EventBridge.

Conosci l’Infrastructure as Code e utilizzi strumenti come AWS SAM e Serverless Framework, oltre ovviamente a Git.

Hai almeno un po’ di confidenza con strumenti di CI/CD (come Bitbucket Pipeline e Github Actions) e con i sistemi di container come Docker.

Non devi scoraggiarti se non conosci tutte le tecnologie che utilizziamo, abbiamo una forte propensione alla formazione e alla condivisione della conoscenza all’interno del team. E non preoccuparti nemmeno se non conosciamo tutte le tecnologie che conosci o che vorresti utilizzare, perché abbiamo anche una grande passione per la ricerca e l’innovazione, ci piace provare sempre cose nuove e trovare nuovi strumenti e soluzioni.

Lavoriamo da sempre completamente da remoto in maniera distribuita, l’unico requisito è non distare più di un’ora dal fuso orario italiano.

Forniamo il portatile (PC o Mac lo sceglierai tu), oltre ad un budget iniziale per l’acquisto di attrezzatura di lavoro e ad un budget annuale per la formazione (per partecipare ad eventi, corsi, workshop, acquistare libri ecc).

 El candidato ha de cumplir con los siguientes requisitos:
 -Experiencia de al menos 2 años en desarrollo de aplicaciones móviles

-Experiencia en integración con servicios REST

-Nivel de inglés medio-alto

Mirai es una fintech. Nuestro conocimiento funcional del sector financiero sumado a una amplia experiencia en proyectos tecnológicos nos permite dar soluciones innovadoras a diferentes retos de negocio.
 De la mano de un profundo conocimiento del sector y rodeados de un equipo enfocado a la innovación y la excelencia técnica, nació nuestro producto MAT– Mirai ALM Tool – que es una solución nativa en cloud para la gestión de riesgos financieros, concretamente del riesgo estructural de balance o ALM. 
 Actualmente MAT está implantado y en pleno rendimiento en diferentes clientes a nivel nacional e internacional, y nos encontramos en fase de expansión. 
 Somos un equipo multidisciplinar especializado tanto en el sector financiero como en todas las capas de un producto digital [diseño, front-end, back-end, data science, big data e infraestructura]. Si algo nos caracteriza como equipo, es la orientación a la calidad y la mejora continua, por eso MAT está en constante desarrollo adaptándolo y actualizándolo a las últimas tecnologías, así como desarrollando múltiples funcionalidades para dar un servicio cada vez más especializado y de mayor calidad a cada uno de nuestros clientes. 
 Queremos incorporar una persona proactiva con responsabilidades cross a todos los equipos. Punto de encuentro para las mejoras de seguridad y vulnerabilidades, tanto descubiertas por agentes externos como desde sus labores de pentesting.
 ¿Qué buscamos?
  Purple team!
Buenas prácticas de securización de entornos cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Buenas prácticas de desarrollo (OWASP).
Buenas prácticas en desarrollo de software con GIT (gitflow, github-flow, PR, etc).
Conocimientos de pentesting.
Conocimientos en seguridad de contenedores (Docker, Kubernetes, RBAC, ABAC).
Conocimientos de compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Plus: Conocimientos de Zero-Trust.
Plus: JVM y seguridad en Java.
Plus: CKS.
Plus: Supply chain security.
 ¿Qué vas a hacer?
 Se trata de un rol transversal dentro de los equipos, con responsabilidades tanto en entorno Cloud como a nivel global.
 Entorno Cloud:
  Conocer las herramientas de análisis y auditoría de los principales proveedores cloud (AWS mínimo).
Pentesting a nivel código e infraestructura.
Análisis de la infraestructura y código para mejorar la seguridad.
White box testing.
Análisis y clasificación de alertas de seguridad.
Aplicación de cambios relativos a seguridad dentro de AWS (IAM/SSO/etc).
Reportar a los distintos equipos las vulnerabilidades descubiertas.
Coordinar con el management los tiempos de resolución de vulnerabilidades.
 Entorno Global: 
  Promocionar las buenas prácticas de seguridad en los equipos.
Verificar el compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Administración de las distintas herramientas de seguridad dentro de la compañía.
Apoyo ante incidentes de seguridad, planes de contingencia.
 ¿Por qué Mirai?
  Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!
Crecimiento personal y profesional, estamos constantemente actualizándonos y enfrentándonos a nuevos retos.
Creemos e impulsamos la innovación y la excelencia técnica.
Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
“Work from anywhere” Tú decides desde donde trabajas: 100% remote, 50%, etc.
Cursos de inglés, certificaciones punteras y formación a medida.
Retribución flexible con COBEE (transporte, restaurantes y guardería).
Seguro médico y dental 100% financiado por la empresa. Well-being package. 
Hasta 29 días de vacaciones al año.
Salario competitivo.
 Mirai ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

job_title: Software Engineer Data Preparation - Remote Germany
description:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.
 As enterprises worldwide become more and more invested in the cloud, Dataiku looks to expand its services and offerings to adapt to rapidly shifting customer needs. Dataiku brings together Big Data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with user-friendly visual interfaces or code.
 To help us fulfill this mission, we are looking for a talented full-stack software engineer to work on the Data preparation part of Dataiku and other core features of the platform. Our current technical stack is based on a mix of Java, Javascript and Python.
    Data preparation & integration: this includes reading from and writing to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Azure Synapse, and processing data using the latest processing engines: Spark on K8s, SQL with UDFs 
 SQL workbench & Jupyter notebooks 
 Integration with IDEs 
 Help and onboarding experience - Plugins infrastructure 
 Automation & public REST APIs 
    Support new databases capabilities to read/write or process data faster 
 Optimize our layout engine to be able to render flows of 1000 datasets faster 
 Improve our help system to make it smarter 
 Bring spatial joins and isochrone computing to the platform 
 Improve dataset upload experience using A/B testing 
 Add support for graphically explain plans in our SQL workbench 
    You have experience in software development and are interested in data processing. 
 You are "customer-oriented" you want to understand how the product is used and solve actual customer problems 
 You know, Data science is 80% preparing data and 20% complaining about preparing data. 
 You are curious about working 'œunder the hood' and want to learn how things are built. 
 You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) in building a real product. 
 You are humble and kind. 
 You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty. 
 Dataiku's culture is right for you if:
   You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits. 
 You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines. 
 You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more. 
 You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week . 
 You care about giving back - it's what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing . 
 If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy .
  Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.
 Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

LastPass, the #1 password leader, provides password and identity management solutions that are convenient, easy to manage, and effortless to use, helping more than 32 million users and 100,000 businesses organize and protect their online lives. As a pioneer in cloud security technology, LastPass provides award-winning password and identity management solutions that are convenient, effortless, and easy to manage. LastPass values users’ privacy and security, so your sensitive information is always hidden – even from us. We welcome new ideas, support your growth, and recognize your value, if this aligns with what you are looking for in your next career move, Join Us LastPass is looking for a DevOps Engineer role for its Data & eCommerce Cluster: The Data & eCommerce Cluster allows LastPass users to 1) browse the LastPass website and discover the product; 2) purchase LastPass in its different flavors and manage their subscriptions; and 3) benefit from ML-based solutions built with a privacy-first mindset. As a DevOps Engineer in this Cluster of LastPass, you will be responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of our software deployment and IT infrastructure. You will automate the process to build and deploy code into different environments (Dev, RC, Production), set up and maintain those environments, and monitor and troubleshoot production systems. If you are passionate about leadership, charged with complex problem solving and motivated by scale, then this is the role for you! Who will you work with? 
You will be part of a dedicated operations community in a dynamic and fast-paced environment to improve the operation practices of LastPass
You will use technical expertise and experience to generate ideas and guidance for your team and other engineering teams to be able to operate effectively and seamlessly 
Work with architects and security experts to ensure services are secure, reliable, maintainable, and scalable 
What are some of the exciting challenges you will be working on? 
Build, operate, maintain, and improve LastPass’ application infrastructure in datacenters and AWS
Design, implement and work with monitoring and alerting systems which enable the infrastructure to self-heal 
Participate in architectural decisions that impact the future directions of our infrastructure 
Design and build CI/CD systems including the pipeline and supporting environments following industry and companywide best practices 
What does it take to work at LastPass? 
Having a team-player and can-do attitude
Being analytical and curious by nature
Being passionate about what we do
Blending honesty and candidness with politeness and respect
Possessing good written and verbal communication skills in English 
Success in this role will require: 
Good understanding of DevOps tools and technologies used across the industry
To participate in On-call rotations, troubleshoot and fix critical issues in the production environments
To deliver solutions and provide root cause analysis while recommending, influencing, and implementing solutions to operational problems
Operational knowledge of Linux/Ubuntu operating systems 
Hands-on experience maintaining highly available infrastructure 
Solid understanding of cloud technologies such as AWS
Work experience with containerization technologies (Docker, EKS, ECS) 
Infrastructure as a code mindset (CloudFormation, CDK or similar) 
Experience in any scripting language (Bash, or similar) 
Work experience with CI/CD technologies (GitLab CI) 
Hands-on experience with monitoring infrastructure with commercial or open-source monitoring systems (e.g. Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.) 
It's great, but not required: 
Work experience with container orchestration technologies (Kubernetes). 
Work experience with database and caching technologies (Memcached, Cassandra, MySQL, Percona MM) 
Work experience with async dataflow, CDC, or similar technologies 
Work experience with backend technologies (PHP, .NET Core) 
Experience in working in an agile environment with fast development cycles 
Why LastPass? 
Market-Leading Password Manager
High-growth, collaborative environment with inclusive teams
Continuous learning and development opportunities 
If this piques your interest, apply today and chat with our recruitment team further. We’re building an inclusive community that reflects the people of all races, genders, sexual orientations, national origins, backgrounds, and perspectives who share our world. For all US based jobs please review our Applicant Privacy Notice For all EU based jobs please review our Candidate Privacy Notice Please review our CCPA Notice

Venture Team
 Our Venture Team Loady is developing a new industry platform that will become a reliable standard of loading and unloading requirements. It will improve relationships along the supply chain network and efficiency in logistics processes. The venture is looking for a Frontend Engineer to join the growing development team. You get the opportunity to become part of a high-performance startup team that works with enthusiasm and great professionalism in developing a new, world-wide unique partner platform.
 You will work in an agile team with latest technologies to build modern, scalable and high-quality solutions for our customers. Our team has an end-to-end responsibility for the system, including system design and architecture, writing code with high standards, hosting the services in the Azure cloud, monitoring services, measuring quality, and guaranteeing service reliability and security. There is plenty of space for your own ideas to provide the best user experience.
 Passion for our idea and commitment, experience in frontend development or web development, and high motivation for continuous learning is essential in this role.
 Your role
  Be part of an agile DevOps team with end-to-end responsibility along the complete product lifecycle
Design and develop the frontend of our innovative logistics platform according to UI/UX designs and business requirements
Build, test and ship features using modern frameworks such as Vue.js
Take responsibility for high code quality and long-term maintainable software
Participate in frontend architecture decisions
Ensure a great user experience including high performance, reliability, stability and security
Collaboratively work with backend engineers to define APIs and data models
 Your offer
  Remote work - based in Germany 
Experience as a Frontend Developer, Web Developer or similar role
Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript and ideally Vue.js
Experience with developing and shipping scalable user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks
Experience with implementing frontends according to UI/UX designs and mockups
Experience with designing reusable components
Experience with responsive web design
Familiarity with unit testing and testing frameworks
Knowledge of data visualization frameworks would be a plus
Ability to create wireframes, mockups or user flows using prototyping tools would be a plus
General understanding of data protection, data security and governance 
Experience in working within an agile environment
Experience in a DevOps Team with end-to-end responsibility for the entire product lifecycle
Bachelor or Master of Computer Science, Business Informatics, or similar 
Self-organization, team collaboration, agile mindset, problem solving, positive attitude and high motivation
Good communication skills in English, German is a plus
 We offer
  Become part of a great team and enabler of an emerging business supported by the business incubator CHEMOVATOR of a leading chemical company 
Exciting challenges in a dynamic market environment 
A highly motivated and open-minded team 
Attractive working environment
Competitive salary 
Join the founding team of an early venture idea with plenty of space for your own ideas.
 Apply for this position
 About Us
 Chemovator is the business incubator of BASF. We provide a protected space to build commercial ventures from unconventional ideas. Our Venture Teams take full ownership of their idea, creatively explore their business, learn fast and pivot beyond corporate boundaries.
 Apply for this position

job_title: Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics - Home based - EUROPE
description:
Assoc Dir, Pharmacometrics Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives. Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for. Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives. Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know: WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE Why Syneos Health 
 We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
 We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
 We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong. 
 Plans, organizes, manages and monitors the sector’s activities/operations according to his/her field of expertise, strategic and tactical alignments, and the needs of the organization in order to achieve the expected results.
 Manages all operations activities related to the Pharmacometrics sector.
 Provides quotes for all services provided by the team (e.g., Pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics analyses, toxicokinetics analyses, additional analyses not included in the original scope of work, etc.)
 Provides other consultation services in clinical pharmacology field.
 Acts as a pharmacometrician.
 Acts as a scientific consultant/clinical pharmacologist for clients, proposing methodologies or performing pharmacometrics analyses (e.g., PK/PD analyses).
 Ensure proper training and development of pharmacokineticists and pharmacometricians.
 Review/prepare pharmacometric section of study protocols and/or Pharmacometric analysis plans for preclinical or Phase I to IV studies.
 Manages human capital including workforce planning and hiring activities, performance management and the daily monitoring of productivity; facilitates knowledge development and transfer; and ensures the efficiency and mobilization of the team in order to achieve the expected results.
 Helps develop and analyze the sector’s performance indicator systems according to the established objectives. Identifies opportunities to improve the division and/or service’s master plan and processes. Determines, as needed, the necessary actions in order to increase efficiency.
 Contributes to the development of the sector’s budget, ensures that it is being adhered to, performs budget follow-up for pertinent stakeholders and recommends actions in an effort to achieve the expected results.
 Communicates the necessary information to keep the team, the organization, and external clients abreast of the sector’s work plan, policies, projects processes, results, and actions and recommendations taken to meet arising needs and to achieve the expected results.
 Advises internal/external clients of the division and/or service’s particular areas of expertise by assessing needs, and carrying out analysis and follow-up.
 Acts as a consultant and resource person for external clients and Business Development employees with respect to pharmacometric issues.
 Acts as a clinical Pharmacologist.
 Represents the sector, both internally and externally, as a source for consultation and/or information and/or reference.
 Promotes clinical pharmacology services.
 Fosters the company’s scientific outreach by attending seminars, writing scientific articles, participating in conventions, interacting with the academic community, etc.
 The employee may be called upon to perform other tasks related to their skill set, and for which he/she has been trained. 
What we’re looking for 
 MSc or PhD in Biopharmaceutical Sciences, Pharmacology, Experimental Medicine or in another relevant field.
 Word, Excel, and software used in pharmacometrics analyses: WinNonlin, SAS, NONMEM, etc.
 Required bilingualism includes communicating verbally and in writing on topics that are often technical, and writing procedures or technical reports.
 Candidate who does not possess the required training and/or experience may be considered under different criteria. 
Get to know Syneos Health Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients. No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Neon is an open-source company on a mission to create a cloud-native Postgres database as a service for every developer. We’re a close-knit team of 40 people with an ambitious goal to make a cloud-based Postgres toolkit accessible for every developer in building their apps. We are building a game-changing open source PostreSQL, and to make this happen we are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer who will contribute to the core technological architecture of Neon's storage. You’ll have the chance to contribute to an auto-scaling, on-demand database as a service for modern applications, which is an open-source alternative to Amazon Aurora. You will: 
 Join an experienced Golang team and contribute to the development of new features for the revolutionary product 
 Contribute to the overall PostgreSQL community 
 Play a key role in ensuring the code is written cleanly and well documented 
 Formulate new ideas and methods to contribute to Neon via conversations with internal stakeholders and other software engineers 
 We’re looking for someone who has 
 5+ years’ experience developing Golang 
 Experience focusing on backend development 
 Experience with infrastructure components such as Kubernetes, Dockers, Github CI/CD, and cloud technologies 
 Python experience is beneficial 
 About Neon Neon is the first multi-cloud, open source, fully managed, and serverless Postgres. We aim to provide developers with the best Postgres experience in the cloud. Neon was created by a team of Postgres hackers, and led by CEO Nikita Shamgunov (co-founder of SingleStore). Neon is built on open-source principles and is focused on giving back to the Postgres and developer communities. Our Team 
 We are distributed team of 40 people working from North America, Europe, and the Middle East 
 We are team built on open sources cultural principles (transparency, contribution, accountability) 
 Team with decades of experience building databases and deep knowledge of Postgres internals. We are deeply technical 
 We have experienced Postgres committers and hackers on the team (check Heikki , Anastasia , Arseny , Matthias ) 
 We believe in the efficacy of collaborative open source 
 We aim for a diversity of thoughts and backgrounds 
 We are keen to be a fast-moving flat org and avoid hierarchical structures 
 We are startup with all that it implies:) 
 Our Investors 
 Top-tier investors backed up Neon's vision:
 We raised $54.3m from GGV Capital, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, Founders Fund 
 Our angels investors are prominent technologists, and ecosystem players. More than 20 awesome angels supported Neon, including Nat Friedman, Elad Gil, Mike Ovitz, Ajeet Singh, Guillermo Rauch, Søren Brammer Schmidt, and Wes McKinney 
 Our Board includes Quentin Clark, Glenn Solomon, Joe Morrissey, and Leigh Marie Braswell 
Our Offer 
 You have an opportunity to be an early employee in the fast-scaling ambitious team 
 You can work 100% remote: we'll handle all formalities to arrange work from your home 
 We pay top of the market in most parts of the world 
 We grant equity (stock options) for all full-time hires 
 We offer a competitive benefits package in line with all tech companies (top-notch equipment, unlimited vacations, paid parental leaves, med insurance, and much more) 
 We are distributed, yet make our bonds during regular offsites (the last one was in Mexico) 
 Hiring Process We like to keep things and get awesome people fast. Our goal is to get a hiring process done within a week from the moment we reviewed your application. 
 The entire hiring process is fully remote. 
 Once you have submitted your CV, our team will review it and we can contact you to schedule an initial call with a Talent Acquisition Partner. 
 If we move on to the next steps, you will have 3 technical interviews with our Hiring Team. All interviews are 1:1 with our Software Engineers and usually last 45-60 minutes. 
 Once all the interviews are over, our team will swiftly analyze the results of all the steps and present the final decision.

job_title: Senior Biostatistician I,II; Principal Biostatistician - Oncology - Mid-Size CRO
description:
A unique opportunity to join a leading rare disease specialist CRO, where you will be a part of a close, supportive team within Biometrics where collaborative working is highly valued and have seen many successes over the coming years for their forward-thinking approach.
Culture is an important aspect of this company, and they work hard to ensure they offer a healthy work-life balance, as well as offering progression pathways with tailored training and development.
 You will be working on rare diseases and oncology projects across phases I-IV. Depending on your seniority you will also be responsible for leading multiple projects.
This role will suit someone with a statistics background within the Pharmaceutical/Academic industry with experience in clinical trials.
 ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES 
 Offering a permanent (full time) opportunity for an experienced Statistician, this role will be based fully remote across Europe:
  Dependent on seniority level, leading multiple projects as the main POC for clients, timeline & budget management
Provide statistical support in the design, conduct and analysis, working to regulatory standards.
Identify and apply statistical methodology to improve the process and delivery activities.
Project lead, being the main point of contact for internal and external teams.
 Biostatistician I,II; Senior Biostatistician I,II; Principal Biostatistician
  Established mid-size CRO are actively seeking a Biostatistician to join a diverse, collaborative team working fully remote across Europe. With an agile focus, this company have become leaders in rare-disease studies, and have a strong oncology portfolio, where you will be working on a variety of clinical studies across phases I-III.
  ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Offering a permanent (full time) opportunity for an experienced Statistician, this role will be based fully remote across Europe:
   Dependent on seniority level, leading projects - POC for clients, timeline & budget management
Provide statistical support in the design, conduct and analysis, working to regulatory standards.
Identify and apply statistical methodology to improve the process and delivery activities.
Project lead, being the main point of contact for internal and external teams.
Rare-diseases and oncology projects, phases I-III
  COMPANY BACKGROUND
A leading mid-size CRO with a rare-diseases focus.
