Are you looking to have an impact on the daily life of millions of entrepreneurs in France and Europe? Do you thrive in a trustful, fast-paced environment? Do you feel like our Product Principles are aligned with your Product vision ? Then Pennylane might be the right place for you — and you, might be the perfect fit for this role 🙂 Our vision We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of European SMEs. We help business owners get rid of the time consuming hassle of handling accounting and finance, while giving them access to key information that they can use to make better decisions. Meanwhile, we’re helping accountants. By using Pennylane, rather than doing manual and repetitive tasks, they can spend more time advising and guiding their clients. Context Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!) In 2 years of existence, we’ve managed to : 💻 Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants 💰 Raise a total of €84 millions, including from Sequoia 🌲, the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more... 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Grow from 7 cofounders to 320 happy Pennylaners : we’re now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (but also remotely), with a 4,9/5 rating on Glassdoor and an e-NPS of 94. 🌍 Build an international environment with more than 36 nationalities, with a strong remote-friendly culture, where 30% of the employees are already working from all parts of Europe 🤝 Earn the trust of thousands of customers and accounting firms and obtain outstanding ratings WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission Salesforce is considered as a product in itself at Pennylane ; we're building a powerful tool that will enable every team to deliver great value to our users and integrate within our business processes. Therefore, we’re looking for an experienced Salesforce Developer willing to help us build this internal product. You’ll join a wide department of more than 130 software engineers, but as a Salesforce expert, you’ll be part of a small specialized team of 3 people (2 software engineers - including yourself, and a Salesforce admin). As a Salesforce developer, you'll spend most of your time (70%) working on projects to build and expand our CRM capabilities and the rest (30%) on optimizing the existing tooling and processes. You'll be part of the squad which is the main point of contact from a technical standpoint for the Salesforce developments between the Product, Data, and Ops teams. 
 The Salesforce squad, which is already composed of one Salesforce architect and reinforced with external Salesforce consultants ;
 Business owners from Marketing, Sales, Onboarding and Support, Finance, etc. ;
 A dedicated squad to scale Pennylane business processes and internal tools. 
WHAT you can expect from your life at Pennylane : 
 You’ll learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week
 You'll familiarize yourself with the product and the accounting industry, as well as our sales and operations of a Fintech scale up
 You'll get a very deep knowledge of our Product and Business teams organization, methods and processes, and culture 
 You’ll spend time with your customers to understand their painpoints and needs, and design solutions to address them.
 You'll roll out your first projects for business teams using Salesforce on a daily basis
 You will work on incremental tasks such as improving sales cycles, or on automating recurring tasks by integrating with other systems. 
You'll participate to full fledged projects from the tech perspective, that impacts several business teams, such as : 
 streamlining our invoicing processes
 scaling onboarding and support for our customers 
And beyond : This dedicated Salesforce team will inevitably grow in the years to come. Which means you’ll have : 
 A key role in helping the team grow and recruit
 Opportunities to develop your technical skills
 Increasing responsibilities in project leadership 
What do we do to make your work life easier 🏥 You’ll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family 🍜 You’ll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day 🏢 You’ll be able to work from our wonderful office in the center of Paris, or from any WeWork in Europe 🏡 If you have a fully remote contract, you’ll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it 🏝You’ll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year Through our partner Gymlib, you’ll have access to 8000 fitness spaces and more than 300 activities related to wellness 🇬🇧 You’ll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or learn a new langage of your choice 💻 You’ll get the latest Apple equipment 🎉 You’ll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !) What does the recruitment process look like ? 
 You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager
 You will then have a discussion with Grégoire (Lead Technical PM) or Hénoc (Salesforce Architect)
 You will then work on a case study
 And finally, you will have a chat with some of the team members (PM and Ops) 
We make sure we move fast ; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total. Who are we looking for ? You may have noticed that there was no section listing the skills or qualities required to apply for this specific job. Researches have shown that some people are less likely to apply than others, if they don’t feel like they meet the full list of criteria. So we have decided to take it down entirely. We have tried to give you as much details as we could about the purpose, missions and environment of this role; it is now up to you to tell us if you think this is a position in which you could a) have fun and b) bring value to our company. If you’re hesitating, we encourage you to apply anyway: worst case scenario, you might lose a few minutes, and in the best case, it will be the start of a meaningful and long-lasting collaboration. We also want to emphasize that we fully embrace diversity and that we’re doing our best to create a safe and inclusive environment. We are committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are. If anything, diversity makes us a more fun place to work at. To end with a humble illustration of our commitment, we’ve recently signed the Pacte Parité to set concrete goals in building a better and more inclusive workplace in the years to come.

Benefits

Join us if you enjoy being part of a people-centered culture that empowers you to work on the most important product; yourself! Continuously grow with the support of tech experts and maintain a matching skill set to market needs.

360° continuous feedback model; drive your developmental pace

Chapters (internal communities)-share knowledge, create training material, help others grow and shape our technological future
Vast roster of customers/accounts, providing more opportunities for growth and development within the AA ecosystem
Onboarding Buddy-Continuous support from day 1! A dedicated buddy to help you navigate through the first few weeks

In MondoSpedizioni siamo alla ricerca di una figura, fortemente motivata ed appassionata, da inserire all’interno del nostro nuovo team tech.

TL;TR

Linguaggio e Framework: TypeScript & React/NextJS
Competenze: OOP, Clean Code, Design Pattern, Testing
Sede di lavoro: Full Remote o Ibrido (ufficio a Roma)
Contratto: Tempo indeterminato, RAL da 25k a 42k in base all’esperienza (ma con un pò di flessibilità per la persona giusta).

Lavoro

La figura quindi:
si dedicherà allo sviluppo del nuovo sito web e delle piattaforme ad utilizzo interno.
dovrà sviluppare codice di alta qualità comprensivo di test unitari/integrazione/e2e.
lavorerà in full remote o smart working: ci vedremo in ufficio qualche volta per berci un caffè, fare due chiacchiere, fare pair programming e pranzare tutti assieme.

Team

Il Team Tech è di nuova costituzione e con diverse competenze di alto livello. Stiamo riprogettando per intero il back-end ed il front-end (compreso la nuova visual identity dell’azienda).

Abbiamo un’organizzazione orizzontale (non piramidale) e ci sforziamo di essere il più autonomi possibili.

Siamo focalizzati sulla metodologia Lean.

Architettura

Siamo in piena transizione da un’architettura legacy; il nuovo nuovo front-end è costruito sul framework NextJS 13, sfruttando il SSR e le pagine SSG con ISR, utilizzando le State Machines ed il nostro Design System basato su Chakra-UI.

Utilizziamo tutti gli strumenti ed i processi disponibili, al fine di ottimizzare il nostro lavoro e la nostra DX. Per questo nei nostri flussi ci sono Pipeline di CI/CD o di Testing.

Sperimentiamo le nuove tecnologie ed il cambiamento e l’innovazione sono alla base della filosofia del nostro nuovo team.

Requisiti basilari

Forte attenzione alla qualità del codice, alle prestazioni ed all’architettura: Clean Code e Testing, non sono buzzword ma il cuore del nostro nuovo progetto.
Conoscenza di JavaScript/TypeScript
Conoscenza dei framework React.JS e NextJS
Conoscenza di GIT
Grande passione, motivazione e voglia di crescita

Perché candidarti

Abbiamo un mercato da rivoluzionare: in un’epoca dove le spedizioni sono diventate il cuore del nostro commercio, anche al dettaglio;
Cultura da startup ma in una società consolidata e robusta;
Siamo in piena creazione, il tuo contributo sarà determinante!
Budget per partecipare a conferenze, corsi o libri;
Computer Apple aziendale;

Come candidarsi

Invia un’email a jobs@mondospedizioni.com con il tuo CV, il link al tuo profilo linkedin e nel caso tu ne sia fornito, il link al tuo account github.

Iter di assunzione

Verrà effettuato uno screening delle candidature da parte del CTO e del Lead Front-end
Viene organizzato un primo meet di presentazione di 15/20 minuti per una conoscenza iniziale
Al candidato che desidera proseguire verrà somministrato un esercizio da fare in autonomia (non richiediamo attività che possano richiedere più di 2-3 ore) con cui presentarsi al colloquio vero e proprio (in presenza o su meet a seconda delle disponibilità del candidato)
Un terzo ed ultimo colloquio con il management aziendale per la definizione dell’offerta.

Chi siamo

MondoSpedizioni è leader a livello nazionale nel mercato dei servizi di spedizione online.

Fondata nel 2002, la nostra azienda offre servizi di spedizione online dei maggiori corrieri. I punti di forza che guidano il successo dell’azienda sono il servizio clienti in house, la qualità del servizio offerto, l’attenzione al cliente attraverso il contatto diretto e la ricerca della semplicità nella fruizione dei servizi.
La nostra azienda è in veloce e continua crescita e per questo stiamo ampliando il reparto tech con diverse nuove figure.

---
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Together, we can beat cancer.
 At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.
 We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.
 If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.
  We are looking for a cloud-native DevOps engineer with strong interest in information security. You will work in a multifunctional scrum team part of 30 strong product development in Finland. Teams own the whole development lifecycle from design to operations. Depending on your background and interests you will also contribute to developing systems and processes related to maintaining and improving the top-notch infosec posture of Noona.

  Backend in Java and Kotlin with Spring 
Pipelines in GitLab 
Cloud native SaaS running on AWS

 Product
 Noona is Varian’s cloud-based software solution for patient relationships and care navigation management. It’s designed to connect cancer patients with their clinics online throughout the entire cancer journey. Noona is used by 35 000+ active cancer patients and healthcare professionals from leading oncology centers in North America and Europe. 
   Professional work experience in AWS or some other cloud environment 
Experience in DevOps 
Experience in backend software development, preferably in Java/Kotlin 
A “can-do” attitude with strong collaboration and teamworking skills 
Proficiency in English 
 Nice to have 
  Working experience with infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform) 
BSc/MSc in Computer Science or related field 
Front-end, mobile or data engineering skills 
 Join us to work with purpose 
 Work in a friendly and supportive team mostly collocated in Helsinki. Experience startup spirit while being backed-up by a 70-year-old corporation. Work on a cloud native SaaS product built with modern tools with a large userbase. Grow professionally and develop your skills with our extensive learning opportunities. Cash bonus scheme, extensive health care and benefits package. Excellent work-life balance.
  More information about Varian Finland and Noona: 
  Varian Finland 
Noona Product 
Varian Finland Instagram 
 Varian is required to comply with all local and applicable regulations that may be associated with vaccine requirements for certain roles.
 Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.
 We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.
 #TogetherWeFight
 Privacy Statement

Driving causes countless accidents across the world.
 Our software makes a difference.
 Using AI-based technology to create the ultimate driver support, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Would you like to join us in this historic journey?
 Insights from the team
 The Zenseact Data Platforms (ZDP) team is fully responsible for the operations and continuous development of the large-scale compute and storage environment, that is used to develop Zenseact's autonomous driving technology. The solution is a modern large-scale computing and storage environment that currently contains more than 100PiB of primary data and still expanding.
 As a team of four, we work together on most issues, but each member can also focus on areas they have a preference for. We aspire to share knowledge and learn from each other every day. We try to make the best possible decisions with as much data as we can gather. We are pragmatic and accept that what today is the best decision can be disproven tomorrow. Our ways of working are still in flux. We deal with operational issues and long-term design decisions and learn from our user's feedback to improve the system architecture. As a central part of the software and data flow, we are in daily contact with many groups, users, stakeholders, and suppliers.
 What will you do?
 The Tasks Are Divided Into Both Individual Work And Teamwork And Include
 You will work in a small and agile team with IT colleagues from Sweden & China, as well as interact with external parties, suppliers, etc. from across the globe. Your decisions matter and you will be given a high degree of trust and empowerment to solve issues to ensure that the business receives the IT services and solutions needed.
  Working together with developers and assisting with methods/workflow, application optimization, automation, etc. to improve the overall user experience and efficiency.
Assisting in developing and implementing standards in close collaboration with our external service providers.
Participate in Change Advisory Board (CAB) to propose, review and approve standards, exceptions, etc.
Participate in both internal IT and business projects as a Subject Matter Expert (SME)
Work with our external service providers to assist in advanced troubleshooting, reviewing and signing off Root Cause Analysis reports, etc.
 Who are you?
 You have a great ability to cooperate with customers, suppliers, and colleagues. You are a fast learner and have an understanding of administering an HPC solution in an enterprise environment with a modern approach using “DevOps toolsets”. You will be working with standard and automation, ensuring that we have an environment we can easily monitor and maintain, supporting our developers and IT services. Your ability to coordinate, prioritize and manage multiple tasks will help you succeed in your daily work.
 In addition, we believe you meet the following requirements
  3+ years of relevant Linux experience
Experience with HPC environments including networks, servers, clients, storage, etc.
Experience with storage concepts such as scale-out NAS (NFS), SMB, parallel filesystems, POSIX, and object storage (to name but a few).
Experience with parallel computing (HPC/HTC), performance troubleshooting & optimization, and/or operating environments at a large scale.
Understand and speak English at a professional level.
 Now we hope that you send in your application and that we will get the opportunity to know more about each other in the next steps. Meanwhile, here is a bit more about us.
 Flexible-remote way of working: Zenseact has a flexible and modern approach, thus is happy to offer to its employees the possibility for a combination of work at the office and from home. This doesn't include fully remote work from outside Sweden/China.
 More About Zenseact
 At Zenseact we want to make safe and intelligent mobility real, for everyone, everywhere. We develop the complete software stack for ADAS and AD, from pixel to torque. Our focus is to build a single cutting-edge software platform to serve various levels of autonomy and offer unequaled scalability at the same time. We operate out of Gothenburg, Sweden, and Shanghai, China. Zenseact’s first self-driving deployment will be launched on the next-generation vehicle platform from Volvo Cars and Polestar.
 Every year, 1.350.000 people are killed in traffic accidents, and another 55.000.000 people are injured. With the push of our technology and the use of our software, we can move towards zero, faster. That's our purpose and that's why we get up in the morning. We feel that is a goal worth pursuing.
 But technology, software, tools, and datasets would not mean much without the best people behind the wheel to drive them. At Zenseact, some five hundred of the best engineering minds globally, stationed across two continents, are collaborating with the same passion: to bring autonomous driving to the streets for real and create a safer journey for everyone. This is part of our culture and how we work, develop and grow together.
 Zenseact works proactively to create a culture of diversity and inclusion, where individual differences are appreciated and respected. To drive innovation we see diversity as an asset, which means we value and respect differences in gender, race, ethnicity, religion or other belief, disability, sexual orientation or age, etc.
 Interviews are held continuously, so we highly recommend you submit your application at your earliest convenience.
 One purpose, one product
 We’re a software company dedicated to revolutionizing car safety.
 By designing the complete software stack for autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Zenseact was founded by Volvo Cars, and the teams are based in Gothenburg, Sweden, and Shanghai, China.

job_title: Cyber Security Analyst (Supplier Security Risk & Assurance)
description:
Site Name: Poznan Grunwaldzka
 Posted Date: Feb 14 2023
 Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question. 
 We are looking for an experienced Cyber Security Analyst to join our Global CISO team in Poland Tech Hub.
 Cyber Security Analyst 
 As a Subject Matter Expert you will support the Third-Party Security Risk Management processes to ensure cyber security risks that may be introduced by third-parties are understood, managed or mitigated.
 The Cyber Security Analyst will engage with senior stakeholders from Business groups, Procurement, Finance, Legal, and third-party representatives to understand business imperatives and the cyber security risk posture of third-party providers. The ability to analyse cyber security risks and articulate findings to both technical and non-technical functions is essential in order to ensure appropriate cyber security controls are in place prior to the onboarding of third parties. This requires attention to detail and resourcefulness beyond compromise.
 The role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career! These responsibilities include: 
  Complete supplier cybersecurity assessments and reports in line with departmental procedures and processes.
Maintain and mature the third-party risk management process framework for security risk, including necessary standards, procedures, and technologies
Provide clarifying support, where necessary, to internal third-party relationship owners or third-party representatives in their efforts to provide responses to the security risk assessment questionnaire.
Coordinate with Legal and Procurement representatives to ensure proper security and privacy clauses are included in third-party contracts
Effectively translate third-party responses to assessment questionnaire, using sound judgement, into concise risk exposure reporting for delivery to internal stakeholders
Collaborate with internal third-party relationship owners and external third-party representatives to recommend necessary security controls to effectively mitigate risks to Haleon
Ensure robust tracking and remediation of third-party security and privacy risk exposures identified through assessment processes
 Why you? 
 Qualifications & Skills: 
  2+ years of experience in Information Security Risk Management, Cybersecurity, or Third Party Risk Management
Demonstrated experience and understanding of cyber security principles, IT security controls, and related technologies and products
Experience and knowledge across different frameworks and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, CIS etc.
Prior experience conducting risk assessments and applying concepts of inherent and residual risk in order to draw appropriate conclusions and articulate the same to non-technical audiences.
Strong verbal/written communication in English, with the ability to effectively interact with professionals at all levels of responsibility and authority
 Preferred Qualifications & Skills: 
  Ability to operates autonomously in the execution of the third-party security risk program framework
Influencing action across various business lines and geographies to achieve program objectives.
Ability to effectively manage conflicting priorities in alignment with overall business and departmental strategies.
Working and co-operating with virtual teams located in different countries around the world, aligning and adapting different work, culture and communication styles.
An awareness of information and application cybersecurity techniques, common vulnerabilities, and emerging exploits. Broader knowledge of information security and operational technology controls, technologies and processes.
 Opportunities for growth 
 None of us should ever feel like we are standing still. Instead, we want Haleon to be a place where we feel like we are always progressing.
 Improving everyday health takes dedication. Energy. Effort. So we look to reward your contribution with a benefits package that includes:
  Hybrid@Haleon our philosophy to hybrid work – performance with choice or fully remote work
A competitive base salary
Contract of employment
Attractive annual bonuses
Life insurance and pension plan
Private medical package with additional preventive healthcare services for employees and their eligible
Sports cards (Multisport)
Paid Referral Program
Health and wellbeing programs that take care of you physically and mentally
Possibilities of development within the role and company’s structure
 Why Join Us? 
 The future of everyday health is changing. And we’re the people changing it. In front of us is an incredible opportunity to go beyond what any of us have done before. And make everyday health more achievable, more inclusive and more sustainable. For more and more people. So join us, as we build one of the world’s leading consumer healthcare companies. Join us to innovate our category-leading brands. To better understand people’s everyday health needs. To tackle the biggest barriers that stand in their way. To change individual and societal behavior.  Join us to work with colleagues who share your restless energy. To explore your interests. To stretch yourself to do the best work of your career. And join us, as together we build a working experience that encourages us all to lead happier, healthier, more productive lives.  The way we see it, every day is an opportunity for better. And we’re going all in to realize it. 
 Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 
 At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create an unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
 We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
 We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
 Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/
 At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
 As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.
 Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
 Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares. Más de 400 empresas, incluídas Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., han contratado a desarrolladores de Turing.
 One of the world's leading pharmaceutical giants is looking for a Back-End Engineer. The engineer will utilize solid back-end development expertise with object-oriented coding skills to design cloud-based apps and write scalable applications. The NYSE-listed company is active in more than 170+ countries and uses state-of-the-art technology to bring revolutionary advancements to the industry. This is a rare chance for those who want to work with a multinational corporation and climb the professional ladder.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Assist in integrating front-end elements with server-side logic and features 
Work closely with product and engineering teams, including front-end engineers
Optimize built solutions for faster execution and fix scalability blockers
Deploy necessary security and data protection practices to maintain quality
Help to experiment, design, and build APIs, data storage solutions, and other engineering projects
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a back-end engineer 
Experience in working with Python and cloud services like AWS, GCP, or Azure
Ability to work with containerization like Docker and Kubernetes is preferred
Must have excellent problem-solving skills and work with an analytical mindset
Must possess an excellent understanding of back-end development with object-oriented coding skills
Must be able to think through complex problems and ask questions
Excellent English communication skills
Should have a clear idea about algorithms and the ability to breakdown large/complex problems

Grip is experiencing exciting growth and as such we are seeking a client-facing 3D Project Coordinator that will be part of our Grip team! Grip is our SaaS platform that helps especially FMCG brands automate their product visualisation by removing the current pain points marketeers are facing every day: scale, speed and consistency.
 About INDG
At INDG we develop technology that enables engaging, hyper-realistic digital product experiences. Our goal is to make "every product playable", by combining the science of technology with the artistry of computer-generated content. Our offices are in Amsterdam, Bucharest and New York. Clients include Adidas, Yamaha, Ralph Lauren, Electrolux, and Philips. Our CG artists, interactive designers, and developers focus on creating virtual versions of our clients' products, so lifelike it feels like you could reach out and touch them. Our culture brings together creative, tech and business individuals. It’s a heady cocktail that keeps us inspired, empowered and passionate.
 What’s Grip?
Grip supports brands to cope with the fast-accelerating challenge of the exponential grow and need for content. Grip is web-based software that automatically generates visual content. It’s based on photorealistic 3D, capitalising on INDG’s twenty-year-long experience in that field. 3D is good because once your beer or your juicer or your rocket is on Grip, it can be used and re-used for multiple media: images, videos, iOS apps, and such.
 Looking for a 3D Project Coordinator at Grip
As a Project Coordinator for Grip, you will be the interface between our clients (some of the world’s biggest brands) and our internal team that makes the entire “magic” happen: 3D Artists, Developers, Artwork Specialists and more. You are the person who manages multiple projects, spanning hundreds of individual assets or “sub-tracks” that all follow a standard process, who provides clarity internally and externally by using your clear & warm communication style and you nurture the client relationship. You’re also the person who loves to keep track of everything that happens in your projects, whether that’s via Excel trackers, Jira boards or other tools that we use now and in the future. You like being in control without coming across as a control freak.
 What will you be doing?
Simultaneously manage multiple CGI projects, spanning the creation of dozens to hundreds of shapes, for our SaaS platform, from the kick-off and client on-boarding to delivery.
Receiving, validating and registering briefings in our platforms and trackers, and briefing our production unit with clear information.
Actively keep track of the progress of all these assets, providing clear reporting and chasing if needed
Build and enhance the relationship with many clients whilst managing expectations and respecting deadlines.
Coordinate internal and external project resources to consistently meet client deliverables on time and within budget.
Actively contribute and lead team meetings regarding scheduling and deliverables.
Create and distribute timelines, statements of work detailing the project delivery.
Ensure your project stakeholders are kept up to date on the current project status.
Keep an open eye for risks, plan in advance, always think pro-actively and in solutions.
Job requirements
 Would be amazing if you:
Have experience as an Asset Producer / Project Coordinator / Artwork Specialist / Packaging Coordinator in the FMCG, marketing advertising, CG/Gaming, creative/production industry.
Love to work with clients, and building great relationships is your priority.
Have an extensive set of presentation skills.
Understand design and the creative process, and therefore respect & protect quality.
Be accustomed to fast turn-around projects, uncertain scenarios and move through them in an agile way.
Have flawless English communication skills.
Have true respect for deadlines and a strong sense of ownership.
Work well with numbers, and large amounts of (Excel) information.
Be able to coordinate both internal, as well as external teams and resources.
Understand and have ownership over project financials.
Work according to processes, but also be aware to know when to work outside of them.
A plus if you have experience with Jira.
 What do we offer?
With the role being located in the heart of Amsterdam, our environment and our creative space are very important to us. Furthermore we offer a competitive salary, paid annual leave, an office overlooking the Amsterdam canals, get fit schemes, a pool table, darts, fruits, snacks, and dinner options each evening for those staying later than working hours.

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet Who We Are Frontiers is the 3rd most-cited and 6th largest research publisher and we publish groundbreaking discoveries by the world's top experts. Scientists empower society and our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery by making science open. We place the researcher at the center of everything we do and enable the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet. Join the publishing revolution. What we have to offer: Frontiers is a young, technology-driven company with a large IT department that supports its goals. Our publishing platform consists of tens of web applications serving the diverse needs of our users. All the content of Frontiers journals is also available to everyone on our public-facing website that has millions of views every day. We are always aiming to give the best experience to our users, continuously optimizing and improving our websites and applications. About you: We are looking for a senior backend engineer to join us as part of a newly formed team. Here you will contribute to the building of a new version of an existing product, with a new code base and an extended feature set. Key Requirements: 
Minimum 4 years of commercial experience
Excellent programming skills in C#
Enthusiasm for modern approaches to software development and the latest technologies
Passion for clean and pragmatic design
Experience building and maintaining REST and GraphQL APIs
Experience designing and implementing scalable solutions using SQL and NoSQL
Familiarity with distributed systems, e.g. microservices
Excellent English-language communication skills
Driven and pro-active, with a “Get things done” attitude
An appreciation of working as part of a remote-first multi-cultural team 
Nice to have: 
Experience with Dapper
Experience with Apache Kafka
Frontend experience with Vue.js or similar SPA framework 
Benefits With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe. Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees. 100% remote working Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office). Learning and development All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time. Wellbeing We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance. Volunteering opportunities Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya. Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Wir sind heute [movers] und morgen [shapers].
 Als [movers] sind wir strategische und überzeugende Vordenker*innen in einer der führenden europäischen Management- und Technologieberatungen. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden, treiben Ideen voran und inspirieren. Als [shapers] formen wir konkrete Lösungen und gestalten Prozesse. Wir nutzen innovative Technologien und eröffnen so neue Wege. So ist jede*r von uns stets beides: [mover & shaper]. Gemeinsam sind wir in Deutschland und Österreich rund 2.400 [movers & shapers] und uns alle eint das Ziel, mithilfe innovativer Technologien unsere Zukunft und die unserer Kunden in einem digitalen Europa erfolgreich zu gestalten.
 Anti-Financial-Crime & Compliance bedeutet die Einhaltung von Gesetzen und Vorschriften, um illegale Finanzaktivitäten zu verhindern. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden in diesem Bereich, indem wir ihnen bei der Prozessoptimierung und -entwicklung helfen und in verschiedenen Bereichen wie KYC, Transaction Monitoring, SAR Filing, Sanctions & Embargoes, AML Advisory und AML Operations beraten.
 Vielfalt ist eine wichtige Grundlage unserer Unternehmenskultur. Wir möchten ein inklusives Umfeld schaffen, das die Diversität all unserer Mitarbeitenden berücksichtigt und in dem Du Dich bestmöglich entfalten kannst. Denn wir bei Sopra Steria sind davon überzeugt, dass Deine Individualität der Schlüssel zu einem nachhaltigen Unternehmenserfolg ist.
 Bist Du auch ein [mover & shaper]? Dann suchen wir Dich unbefristet als:
 (Junior) Analyst Anti-Money Laundering (m/w/d)
 Das erwartet Dich als [mover & shaper]
  Du bringst Deine Erfahrung aus dem Studium/aus der Ausbildung ein und entwickelst mit dem Team neue Lösungsansätze zur Bekämpfung von verdächtigen Transaktionen in Bezug auf Geldwäsche und Terrorismusfinanzierung
Deine Hauptaufgabe umfasst die Prüfung nach regulatorischer Vorgaben sowie die Unterstützung bei operativen Vorgängen in den sensiblen Bereichen Compliance und Anti Financial Crime / Anti-Money-Laundering bei unseren Banking Kunden
Dabei bist Du für die Erstellung von Verdachtsmeldungen verantwortlich und recherchierst im Rahmen der verdächtigen Transaktionen
Zudem erstellst und aktualisierst Du Risikoanalysen und identifizierst entsprechende Gegenmaßnahmen
Du kommunizierst eigenständig mit den Aufsichts- und Strafverfolgungsbehörden und stehst ihnen als Ansprechpartner*in zur Seite
Darüber hinaus identifizierst Du Kunden (KYC, KYB) und führst Due-Diligence-Prozesse durch
 Das macht Dich zum [mover & shaper]
  Eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Bankkaufmann / -frau bzw. zum Finanzassistenten oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium
Idealerweise bringst Du erste Kenntnisse in den Themen Know Your Customer (KYC), Compliance und / oder Anti Financial Crime (AFC) bzw. Anti-Money Laundering (AML) mit
Du besitzt ein Verständnis von Legal- und Compliance Abläufen im Bankenumfeld und hast die die Bereitschaft und das Interesse an der operativen Fallbearbeitung
Deine analytischen und konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten zeichnen Dich aus und Deine selbstständige, strukturierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise runden Dein Profil ab
Zudem besitzt Du gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Du bist sowohl für den hybriden als auch für den deutschlandweiten Einsatz vor Ort offen und weist hierfür eine entsprechende Reisebereitschaft auf
Aus regulatorischen Gründen ist eine Due Diligence Prüfung Deiner Person (z.B. Überprüfung von Sanktionslisten) sowie die Vorlage eines aktuellen Führungszeugnisses ohne Eintragung zwingend erforderlich
 Das bieten wir [movers & shapers]
  Weiterbildung: umfangreiche fachliche und methodische Trainings inkl. Zertifizierungen sowie vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven innerhalb des Unternehmens
Work-Life-Balance: Arbeitszeitkonto, hybrides und ortsflexibles Arbeiten innerhalb von Deutschland und bis zu 21 Tage pro Jahr in definierten EU-Ländern, Familienservice, Firmenfitness sowie die Möglichkeit zu einem Sabbatical
Flexible Urlaubsgestaltung: 30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit zur individuellen Erhöhung oder Verringerung des jährlichen Urlaubs um bis zu 5 Tage
IT-Equipment: Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Ausstattung von benötigtem Zusatz-Equipment für ein optimales ortsflexibles Arbeiten
Selbst fahren: Firmenwagen und Dienstfahrrad per Gehaltsumwandlung
Unser Beitrag: konzernweites Stipendienprogramm für junge Menschen in Indien und viele weitere Corporate-Responsibility-Projekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Beschäftigung und digitale Inklusion
Unser Mindset: Teamspirit, offene Türen, Duzkultur, gelebte Vielfalt

industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Job Description  About BDP International: BDP International, a member of the PSA Group, is a leading provider of global, integrated supply chain, transportation and logistics solutions. The company was founded in 1966 by Richard Bolte Sr. with global headquarters in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Now, BDP employs more than 5,400 people worldwide and operates freight logistics centers worldwide through a global network of wholly owned offices, joint ventures, and affiliates in 133 countries. BDP serves more than 5,000 customers, including some of the world's leading multinational companies. Clients include: Arkema, Dow, DuPont, HARMAN, The Hershey Company, and more. Charter: Successful candidate will utilize their proven track record in RFP/RFIs, proposal writing, presentation development, and other sales operations support to help the sales team grow BDP’s logistics business. The candidate will support a multi-cultural global team in the industrial, consumer, or life science sectors, although candidate should have capability to extend this to other verticals when needed. Responsibilities: 
 Support in the development of RFI/RFP/RFQs (requests for information/proposal/quote) 
 Assist manager in maintenance/input of RFI sales content library material 
 Development of presentations related to tenders and ad hoc, as necessary 
 Collaborate with various global departments/SMEs for content assistance and information-gathering purposes 
 Creation and delivery of BDP metrics, key reports, process flows as needed (e.g., Qlik, BDP Smart, Visio) 
 Salesforce: Oversight into Salesforce.com compliance and reporting for the vertical 
 Target list maintenance 
 Assistance with sales personnel on-boarding and termination procedures 
 Organization of internal annual vertical sales meeting 
 General departmental administrative duties 
Job Requirements 
 Minimum of 3 years of proposal writing and presentation development experience 
 Minimum of 3 years in logistics industry 
 Professional verbal and above-average written English writing skills, including proficient English grammatical and writing/editing/proofreading abilities 
 Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to prioritize tasks 
 Ability to work independently, remotely, and in flexible working hours (multiple time zones) 
 Ability to learn new technologies quickly 
 Excellent interpersonal and people management skills, as well as ability to work well with various cultures 
 Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio 
 Experience working with commercial/sales personnel 
Preferred: 
 University degree or equivalent experience 
 Operational knowledge of domestic and international logistics 
 Consumer, industrial, or life science vertical logistics experience 
 5+ years in logistics industry 
 5+ years of proposal writing and presentation development experience 
Please note: There is no relocation or immigration assistance associated with this opening. Compensation based on experience. We offer a very competitive salary, full benefits, matching 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and casual dress environment. Please visit our website: www.bdpinternational.com *** This is a great opportunity to advance your career! Come join our growing BDP team!*** BDP International - The Employer of Choice Follow BDP International Career Pages! Facebook l Twitter l LinkedIn

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.
 The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.
 Software Engineers in the data platform and clustering teams strike a balance between forward-looking software engineering best practices, and data engineering infrastructure know-how. This team partners with data scientists, research and product teams, helping architect, create and maintain data pipelines. Software Engineers in the data platform and Clustering teams have a deep understanding of blockchain data, are experts at understanding protocol schemas and nuances, build scalable AWS ingest pipelines, lambdas and services. We measure success by the coverage of data clustered for the various Chainalysis products.
 In one year you’ll know you were successful if…
  Built scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for clustering
Created tools to apply different attributes and heuristics to clustering
Worked with our product teams to ensure accurate data is provided to our customers
Increased coverage of clustering
Contributed to the effectiveness and velocity of team deliverables
You have learned new technologies and shown that you are not afraid to work outside your comfort zone
   Solid understanding of building data pipelines, lakes and streaming services
Some work experience with AWS tools such as S3, Lambdas, and CDKs
Experience with running batch and streaming based ETL/ELT pipelines in production
Understanding of efficient data structures, algorithms and computational complexity
Planned, built, and owned production systems
Experience with Python, Java, and/or Typescript
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences

 You belong here. 
 At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Chainalysis Applicant Privacy Policy.

Don’t guess it – test it! Are you driven by high quality standards and do you want to take responsibility? Next to that, being successful is about being part of our mission to shape and influence thousands of businesses and drivers around the world – making mobility more accessible, smarter and safer. Brilliant minds. Learn from your colleagues – pioneers and experts who are changing the world.
Different cultures. Our colleagues come from all over the world, with 55 nationalities and counting.

Competitive salary.

Plenty of formal training for new joiners + access to LinkedIn Learning.
Once you have earned the merits to warrant it, there will be opportunity to attend trainings and conferences on company budget.
Annual performance reviews, personal development plans, and as much feedback as you want and can handle through regular 1:1 meeting.

Defensics R&D team of Synopsys Software Integrity Group is looking for a Dev/Ops developer. The position is full time and in Oulu, Finland.

 Your role is maintaining and further developing CI/CD infrastructure, pipelines, and processes. Our pipelines have automated builds. Releases are automated using our pipelines. We appreciate all experience in SCM, pipeline and virtualisation technologies.

job_title: Digital Marketing Growth Hacker – SEO / PPC / CRO
description:
Position: Digital Marketing Growth Hacker – SEO / PPC / CRO
Contract: B2B - full time
Location: 100% Remote
Time Zone: UTC/GMT -5
 We are a digital agency with a friendly team servicing clients in the United States. We help businesses grow by effectively managing their online presence; we provide web design, hosting, and online marketing services. Most of our clients are small businesses (25-500 employees) operating in various industries. 
 The goal is to find a Digital Marketing Growth Hacker (SEO, PPC, CRO) that will join and help us and our clients grow. This is an early stage and an excellent opportunity for the right applicant to join, and make a real impact. 
 ABOUT YOU
You are a confident individual with excellent communication skills
Fluent speaking, reading, and writing English (important)
Your attitude is very positive.
You take a problem or unknown as just another challenge.
Working remotely is what you prefer as it gives you freedom (and saves time on commuting).
You are the one that always goes an extra mile and is not shy of reaching out, asking for help, or proving your case.
A hectic environment makes you thrive, not die.
You have no problem leading a meeting
You love learning new things and finding a competitive edge
You have analytical mind and passion for building stories through data
You are an aspiring Marketing Growth Hacker looking for an opportunity to take on new challenges and advancing your career.
 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Create and execute digital marketing strategies that supports the wider business objectives.
Analyze campaigns, draw conclusions, and recommend changes
Create reports of how the effectiveness of marketing activity has helped drive new business, opportunities, and awareness.
Day-to-day management of tasks, deadlines, and commitments.
Build relationships and work collaboratively with internal team and clients.
Build stand-out (including provoking) campaigns to drive new brand awareness and lead generation
Help with sales and lead-generation techniques
Test and optimize marketing tactics for customer acquisition
Conduct and present competitive analyses
Be a part of many calls and brainstorming sessions with clients
Perform on-site and off-site website audits
Set up and analyze Google Analytics (including Enhanced Ecommerce and GA4)
Set up Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console data
Set up Google Optimize and regularly recommend and implement A/B tests
Manage PPC campaigns in Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, Facebook Ads, and Linkedin. 
Prepare, manage, and optimize Product Data Feed for Google Shopping campaigns
Plan and manage CTAs, triggers, frequency, and location.
Perform keyword research.
Prepare creative briefs for designers and content briefs for content writers based on research, competition analysis, gathered information from clients, and best practices.
Test and optimize marketing tactics for customer acquisition – Plan, delegate, publish and syndicate the content.
 REQUIREMENTS
At least 5 years experience in digital marketing (preferably as a growth hacker)
At least 5 years of experience in PPC (mainly Google Ads, then Microsoft Ads, Facebook, and LinkedIn)
Fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English (this is a must)
Strong communication and grammar skills
Strong knowledge of online marketing (SEO, PPC, SMM, etc.)
Believe in White-hat SEO practices only
Good understanding of marketing terms (e.g. ROI, KPI, ROAS, CPC, CPA, CPV, etc.)
Understand the concept of Inbound Marketing
Desire to building and maintaining campaigns with long-lasting results
In-depth knowledge of SEO factors and key algorithm updates
Hands-on experience with web analytics and A/B testing tools (e.g., Google Optimize)
Expertise in UI/UX best practices
High standards of excellence and attention to detail
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and prioritize with little oversight
 HOW TO STAND OUT?
Experience in Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
Experience in Performance Max campaigns of Google Ad
Experience in Server-side GTM (HTTP cookies)
Experience in Google Merchant Center
Experience in Google Tag Manager
Experience in Google Looker Studio (former Data Studio)
Experience in marketing on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
 Location/Language requirements. Please do NOT apply if you do not fit ALL 3 of the below-listed criteria.
INCORE is a completely remote team, but to apply, you must:
Have a high English proficiency level in speaking and writing ("rusty" is not acceptable)
Located within 6 hours time window of the Eastern Time zone (GMT-5).
Available to work during business hours in the Eastern Time zone (GMT-5).

job_title: Développeur de logiciels MATALAB (H/F) at WATERLABS
description:
Souhaitez-vous rejoindre une société de logiciels polyvalente qui développe et crée constamment des logiciels hydrogéologiques de haute qualité ? EN QUOI CONSISTE-T-IL ? En tant que développeur de logiciels, vous développerez de nouvelles applications web à l'aide de technologies web de pointe dans l'environnement MATLAB afin de comprendre les flux de travail et de concevoir des solutions qui répondent aux besoins des clients. Waterlabs est responsable du développement de logiciels hydrogéologiques, y compris tous les domaines du cycle de gestion des données, du terrain au rapport. Plus de 30 clients utilisent notre logiciel pour acquérir, organiser, valider, visualiser et rapporter des données hydrogéologiques. Le logiciel que vous nous aiderez à construire et à développer sera utilisé par notre clientèle internationale. QUE RECHERCHONS-NOUS ? Nous recherchons des ingénieurs logiciels travailleurs et motivés, passionnés par le développement de logiciels MATLAB. Grâce à votre expérience du développement MATLAB, vous travaillerez à la conception, à l'amélioration et au développement des composants essentiels de nos produits BROLAB et DATALAB. En tant que membre clé de l'équipe de développement de WATERLABS, vous dirigerez des projets dès les premières phases de conception et jouerez un rôle essentiel dans leur réalisation. Vos missions 
Développer de nouvelles applications web.
Créer et fournir des recommandations de meilleures pratiques, des tutoriels, des articles de blog, des échantillons de code et des présentations techniques adaptés à différents niveaux de parties prenantes commerciales et techniques.
Fournir une assistance technique à la mise en œuvre dans les environnements des clients, y compris des conseils sur la faisabilité de la mise en œuvre des intégrations entre produits. 
Vos compétences BESOINS MINIMAUX 
Expérience dans le développement de logiciels, développeur backend.
SQL Server, Matlab App designer.
Une licence et/ou une maîtrise ou une expérience équivalente sont requises. 
COMPLÉMENTAIRE 
Maîtrise de sciences ou doctorat en informatique, ingénierie et/ou hydrologie 
Expérience et/ou expertise dans l'un des domaines de spécialisation suivants : 
Architecture logicielle, conception, mise en œuvre, développement d'algorithmes. 
Gestion des données dans des bases de données relationnelles (SQL Server, Oracle,...) 
Développement de l'interface utilisateur (MATLAB App Designer) 
Gestion du portail Microsoft Azure. 
Avantages Waterlabs est une entreprise en pleine croissance dans le domaine du développement de logiciels environnementaux et collabore avec des personnes passionnées et dévouées. C'est l'occasion d'apprendre l'ingénierie et les sciences tout en s'intéressant aux processus de l'eau qui sont de plus en plus importants dans le monde. Nous encourageons des conditions de travail participatives et rationalisées qui favorisent la croissance individuelle et la diversité, en valorisant l'initiative, la collaboration et en récompensant l'excellence. Waterlabs développe BROLAB et DATALAB, deux plateformes logicielles hydrogéologiques utilisées par les hydrologues et les ingénieurs. La société est basée à Amsterdam (Pays-Bas) et Biarritz (France) et collabore avec ses partenaires européens Realworld Systems (Pays-Bas) et GIT Hydros Consult (Allemagne) sur des projets dans le monde entier.

Reporting to the Supply Risk Director, this is an exciting opportunity to work across a global enterprise, delivering financial benefit through the adoption of standardized components.

At Jamf, people are at the core of everything we do. We do what’s right for our customers, our employees, our communities and our world. We take pride in simplifying technology for tens of thousands of customers around the globe and helping organizations succeed with Apple. Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose to work in the office, connect 100% remote from your home, or find the blend that works best for you. This role is remote in the Czech Republic. We are only able to accept applications for those based in the Czech Republic or have sponsorship to live and work in the Czech Republic. What you’ll do at Jamf: At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. We are looking for a Cloud Engineer for our Observability Team. Our platform is hosted on more than 30 globally distributed data centers across 4 different cloud providers. Are you interested in helping us build and scale the best mobile security platform in the market? Then read on. Our Observability Team is responsible for improving, building, scaling and operating all our infrastructure for metrics, logging and tracing. Some examples of past and present projects include: 
Building a globally distributed, centralized logging infrastructure for over 2500 virtual machines and more than 20 000 services.
Building a monitoring stack for >25 million active time series with one year data retention.
Shipping traces to a centralized trace analysis service. 
What we need from you: 
You were born a DevOps Engineer. Sysadmin? yes. Networking? tick. Virtualization? sure. IaC? of course. The command line has no secrets for you, you have a keen eye for automation and the cloud is your second home. 
No challenge is too big or too small for you. You get excited at the prospect of a complex project and at the same time you understand that small improvements can sometimes make a massive difference. 
Some of these technologies sound familiar (and exciting): Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, ELK stack, Puppet, Jenkins, Kafka, Go, Python and Bash. 
Why will you love it here? ❤️ 
Named a Fortune Best Workplace in Technology, 2022. 
Open and friendly culture (yes, everybody says that, join us and see for yourself 😉). 
We offer flexible work-life in a choice-based office model. 
Our house is full of experienced people with passion for knowledge sharing. Check our Engineering Blog: https://medium.com/jamf-engineering out for some inspiration. 
$1,000 WFH stipend to better equip your home workspace, Apple gear, and restricted stock units. 
You will work on a top security product and have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact across a wide range of sectors: education, healthcare and commercial (https://www.jamf.com/resources/case-studies/ ) 
30 days of holiday, paid Volunteering Time Off and of course, training support and other exceptional perks and benefits. 
What is a Jamf? You go above and beyond for others, are willing to help, and support the team around you. You value and learn from different perspectives. You are curious and resourceful, a problem-solver, self-driven and constantly improving. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You are someone who cares about doing the right thing. What does Jamf do? Jamf extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. We believe the experience of using a device at work or school should feel the same, and be as secure as, using a personal device. With Jamf, IT and security teams are able to confidently manage and protect Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV devices, easing the burden of updating, deploying and securing the data used by their end-users. Jamf’s purpose is to simplify work by helping organizations manage and secure an Apple experience that end-users love and organizations trust. We are free-thinkers, can-doers and problem crushers with a passion for helping customers empower their workforce to focus on their jobs, not the hassles of managing technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We have over 2,500 employees worldwide who are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each and every day. Get social with us and follow the conversation at #OneJamf

RADiCAL (https://radicalmotion.com) is looking for a Software Engineer - 3D Character Animation who will play a key role in developing the next generation of markerless motion-capture, human virtualization and 3D animation solutions . If you want to be involved in genuine product innovation that solves actual problems across many industries and is enjoyed by millions of users around the world, we’d love to speak to you.

About RADiCAL:

RADiCAL democratizes 3D motion capture, animation and human virtualization solutions for everyone, everywhere. We use the most advanced deep learning techniques in developing our cloud-based solutions. Our community of creatives in 3D computer graphics, animation, film, TV and gaming, along with futurists, scientists, academics and design enthusiasts, is growing fast around the world.

About you and the position:

RADiCAL is a startup, so we'd like you to be entrepreneurial, nimble, deeply motivated, and goal-oriented. We're looking for a person with strong initiative, technical and /professional leadership, as well as the desire to consistently push boundaries. We are laying down the foundation of an ambitious, fast-growing, and well-funded startup and, for the right candidate, this could be a great opportunity to grow with us and become a senior team member and leader. Given the position you'll be filling, we'd expect that you have at least 2+ years of relevant postgraduate academic and/or professional experience (although we’re open to less experience if you’re exceptionally talented). For the right candidate, the position comes with an equity package commensurate with experience and the level of leadership expected for the position.

Day-to-day responsibilities:

The Software Engineer - 3D Character Animation will be responsible for:
Designing, implementing, and maintaining state-of-the-art consumer-facing tools to support deep learning solutions
Developing and maintaining automatic rigging/retargeting pipelines for our inference results
Developing and maintaining plugins/integrations for 3rd party animation softwares and game engines
Actively interacting with the CTO, CEO, and a highly-motivated full-stack team in a stimulating, collaborative environment

Skills and qualifications:

Masters degree in Computer Science or related
Proficiency with C++
Experience with Python and C#
Strong understanding and experience of 3D character animation pipelines (e.g., modelling/rigging/retargeting/IK)
Strong understanding and experience of 3D computer graphics
Experience with 3D characters and 3D assets creation/manipulation
Experience designing and implementing 3rd party plugins/integrations
Experience working/developing with game engines (e.g. Unreal, Unity, etc.)
Experience working/developing with high-end VFX content creation and animation softwares (e.g., Maya, Blender, MotionBuilder, iClone, etc.)
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and agile startup environment
Strong communication and presentation skills
Pro-active thinking and strong initiative

Preferred skills and qualifications:

Experience with Javascript and Three.js
Experience with game development

Location (in order of preference):

Italy / Europe
(remote)

* * *

If you’re interested, please get in touch here: careers@getrad.co.
We look forward to hearing from you!

  At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. 
  Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

As AEM Backend Developer you are a key player in delivering value with software, delighting our customers and achieving our business goals.  Your tasks:

You write code in a way that your peers love to work with and make sure it is well written and understandable

 Benefits

Professional training programs – including Udemy and other development plans 
Work with a team that’s recognized for its excellence. We’ve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We’ve also received the Great Place To Work® certification for four years in a row

job_title: Requirements Engineer for Power Steering Job
description:
Who We Are
 In our Embedded Technologies department, we are focusing on client projects in the Automotive sector. The top-class services we provide consist mostly of software development and testing solutions for products such as Instrument Clusters and Head-up Displays, Control Units, Active and Passive Safety Systems (with a particular focus on Advanced Radar Systems) or even Low Level Drivers.
 We are a friendly and distinguished community where colleagues are empowered to act, can choose their future development path and are great team players that truly care about the work they do in the industry.
 What You'll Be Doing
  Analysis and Review of System requirements
Analysis of the existing Software Requirements for content and process gaps
Documenting the content and process gaps in the existing Software Requirements specification
Develop software requirements based on customer specifications in Automotive Safety SW 
Working according to the ASPICE process with respect to establishing traceability, verification criteria, working with the correct review process
Must be familiar and comfortable with working in an ASPICE project
Must be aware of the whole V-Model of development
Perform requirements elicitation
Manage and update requirements in DOORS
Ensure bilateral traceability across requirements
 What You'll Bring Along
  Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
Min 2-3 years of experience in SW Requirements Specification and in particular with AUTOSAR based SW
Significant working experience in the Automotive domain with the V-Model of Development and standards like ASPICE, ISO26262
Good knowledge of the C language
Good experience in embedded automotive
Very good Automotive Safety knowledge 
Good knowledge of electronics and microcontrollers
Good knowledge of process flow using IMS(MKS), JIRA
Good knowledge of using Doors
Good written and oral skills in English 
Able to work independently in a structured and process oriented way
Good communication skills and proactiveness in communication with different stakeholders
 What’s In It For You
 ✔ New beginnings can be a challenge. We promise a smooth integration and a supportive mentor
 ✔ Pick your working style: choose from Remote, Hybrid or Office work opportunities
 ✔ Early bird or night owl? Our projects have different working hours to suit your needs
 ✔ Nobody is born an expert. Sharpen your tech skills with our sponsored certifications, trainings and top e-learning platforms
 ✔ We want you to stay healthy! Enjoy our Private Health Insurance ⁠– it’s custom-made for you
 ✔ A clear mind is a healthy mind. Attend individual coaching sessions or go one step further by joining our accredited Coaching School
 ✔ Make the most of our epic parties or themed events – they’re lovingly designed for our people and their families
 NTT DATA Romania is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants regardless to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.
 Should you have any queries, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit. Send them this link!

Sappiamo che la persona che svolge il ruolo che stiamo cercando, JAVA DEVELOPER riceve molte richieste, e quindi perché sceglierci rispetto ad altri? S2S S.r.l. è un'azienda IT (di prodotto e sviluppo interni) nata nel 2005 e specializzata nella consulenza e nello sviluppo di soluzioni applicative anche in ambito IOT ed AI, con sede in Roma, ma che ha esteso la sua attività a tutto il territorio nazionale, aprendo nuove opportunità a professionisti di tutta Italia che vogliano far parte di un contesto giovane, in crescita, che offre formazione, tecnologie all'avanguardia, e soprattutto che rivolge particolare attenzione al benessere delle Persone e lo mette in pratica in diversi modi. Cosa facciamo per distinguerci?  Sviluppiamo con continuità il benessere in azienda e la relazione positiva con le nostre persone;  pensiamo che le persone si debbano divertire lavorando;  vogliamo che le persone abbiano modo di crescere professionalmente, attraverso i progetti e la formazione strutturata. 
 Contratto di assunzione (CCNL Commercio);
 Benefit aziendali
buoni pasto giornalieri
assicurazione sanitaria
SIM telefonica
 Formazione continua su tecnologie specifiche, con seminari in sede e presso Centri Specializzati.
 La visita ad alcuni dei siti archeologici della nostra città o eventi culturali. 
 Sono richiesti tra 2 e 5 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo applicativo in ambiente Java BackEnd e/o FrontEnd. 
Lavoriamo full remote o ibrido da tutta Italia! A questo punto potremmo aggiungere la lista di almeno 30 tecnologie, DB, framework, linguaggi, etc. etc. Ma sicuramente salteremmo qualcosa, magari proprio uno dei pezzi forti delle tue conoscenze. A noi interessa di più che tu condivida il concetto che puoi imparare, anche rapidamente, una nuova tecnologia perché hai metodo nell’apprendimento. E noi ti aiuteremo a farlo. Se abbiamo sollecitato il tuo interesse, aspettiamo il tuo CV. Speriamo di conoscerti! Un’ultima cosa: la nostra azienda non è composta da risorse ma da Persone

Working at Horizon is more than a job – it’s personal.  Home Based With Requirements For Travel
 The Riverbed Solutions Engineer is responsible for leading technical qualification, demonstration and value illustration for the Riverbed portfolio. Working closely alongside Sales, they will leverage their technical understanding to evangelise our products and solutions, accurately articulate our ability to address business challenges and play a pivotal role in achieving technical wins and deal closure.
 Responsibilities
