Azure DevOps knowledge 
Our mission is to help create, develop, and support an environment where great people come to do their best work. We believe there is a balance to strike between “work hard, play hard,” and we strive to improve in both areas every day. We put our customers, employees, and communities at the center of everything we do. 
Be Good - Nitronauts are good humans with big hearts that are respectful and supportive of each other. We celebrate individuality and diversity and strive to foster an environment where people can be themselves and do their best work. 
Performance First - We like to challenge ourselves. We’re passionate about exceeding expectations and stepping outside our comfort zones to get to the next level. It’s our ambition that pushes us to work hard and deliver strong results. 
No B.S. - This one is self-explanatory, but we’re all about transparency, honesty, and authenticity here. We don’t beat around the bush; we tell it like it is. 
Why Nitro? Along with our regular benefits and programs (including health, dental, vision, retirement as standard), we are also very proud to offer a few additional initiatives to future Nitronauts Our goal is to empower our Nitronauts—to make an impact, work better together, and believe any goal is attainable. We take pride in the perks and benefits provided to employees that make their day-to-day lives more enjoyable and secure. Flex Time Off Work-life balance is important at Nitro, and we understand that there are events that we cannot plan for. We are proud to offer Flex Time Off to be used for holidays, spending days with your family, or appointments. Flexible Forever We will offer a flexible work environment forever. This hybrid approach allows our team the flexibility to work remotely and have access to in-person time for collaboration sessions and team offsites. 90 Days Away We offer the opportunity for employees to travel and explore while working from anywhere. Employees can extend vacations and spend more time with family, and work from anywhere for up to 90 days. Nitro Resource Groups Nitro supports our diverse group of Nitronauts who come together to celebrate their passions, share their unique perspectives, experiences, and contributions to make Nitro a more inclusive place to work. Families @ Nitro We have the opportunity and responsibility to ensure the well-being of our employees, which includes offering support when and where it matters most. From generous leave to fertility benefits, Nitro supports team members who may be on or considering a path to parenthood, whatever that looks like. We strongly encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. Nitro provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

Company Overview Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home. We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters. Department Overview The International Upgrade Operations team sits within the Software & Services business. Our team is responsible for deploying hardware & software upgrades across the mission critical customer base in order to keep customer systems on current levels of shipping hardware & software. Job Description This is an opportunity to join the International Upgrade Operations team as a Systems Engineer (SE). The SE is the technical lead in a customer focused team comprising Project Management, Field Engineering and the system integration teams. The SE has the responsibility for all technical aspects of an assigned hardware upgrade project from kick-off through to system acceptance. The role requires a good knowledge of IP network design & architecture, Public Safety communication systems and strong communication skills. This role is based from home with occasional travel to an office location. Travel is required for all project phases, from design through final acceptance The role involves: 
Design and implementation of replacement Public Safety radio communication systems
Optimal implementation & migration planning to minimizing the risk of service disruption to operational mission critical systems
Remote and on site system support for system build and commissioning phases
Technical authority for the system acceptance testing with the customer
Act as the network design authority for internal and external points of contact
Managing demanding timelines to meet customer expectations 
Cascade design standards and best practice from other architecture teams & design authorities 
Plan and manage multiple projects & parallel work streams
Interface to the customer for meetings, knowledge share & technical point of contact
Create system documentation 
Be a strategic thinker who can communicate network concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Continuously apply a lessons learned methodology to improve quality and efficiency 
Basic Requirements Requirements:
Degree or equivalent in Electronic Engineering, Communications Engineering, Telecommunications or related subject
Network specific certifications such as CompTIA Network+, CCNA or equivalent experience 
Good understanding of digital communications systems, particularly mobile / cellular radio networks
Knowledge of Public Communication Systems such as TETRA radio system
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to gain trust, build rapport and influence others
Experience directly working with end-user customers is desirable
A genuine interest in IT and communications and how they can be used to maximize an organization's potential and improve the customer experience
Ability to develop effective implementation strategies, consistent with business needs and reduced levels of technical risk ensuring adherence to relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices
The ability to troubleshoot complex issues, breaking problems down into component parts to identify and diagnose root causes
Advanced routing & switching knowledge
Have the ability to create network architecture designs
Hands on configuration experience of Firewalls, Routers and Switches
Knowledge of OSPF, BGP, VRRP, IPSEC, VLAN
Experience in creating both high and low level design documentation 
Travel Requirements Relocation Provided Position Type Referral Payment Plan No

In MondoSpedizioni siamo alla ricerca di una figura, fortemente motivata ed appassionata, da inserire all’interno del nostro nuovo team tech.

TL;TR

Linguaggio e Framework: PHP 8.x e Symfony
Competenze: OOP, DDD, Clean Code, Design Pattern, Testing
Sede di lavoro: Full Remote o Ibrido
Contratto: Tempo indeterminato, RAL da 25k a 42k in base all’esperienza (ma con un pò di flessibilità per la persona giusta).

Lavoro

La figura quindi:
si dedicherà alla progettazione dei nuovi servizi API con l’obiettivo di dismettere il legacy in breve tempo;
dovrà sviluppare codice di alta qualità comprensivi di test;
lavorerà in full remote o smart working: ci vedremo in ufficio qualche volta per berci un caffè, fare due chiacchiere, fare pair programming e pranzare tutti assieme;

Team

Il Team Tech è di nuova costituzione con diverse competenze di alto livello. Stiamo riprogettando per intero il back-end ed il front-end (compreso la nuova visual identity dell’azienda).

Abbiamo un’organizzazione orizzontale (non piramidale) e ci sforziamo di essere il più autonomi possibili.

Siamo focalizzati sulla metodologia Lean.

Architettura

Il backend è API first (RESTful), in PHP 8.x e Symfony con metodologia DDD.

Siamo in piena transizione da un’architettura legacy on-premise ad AWS, lavorando con Terraform per la costruzione.

Abbiamo adottato PHP come linguaggio di riferimento, ma abbiamo alcuni servizi in Go.

Tutti i nostri nuovi ambienti sono realizzati utilizzando docker, sia per lo sviluppo che per la produzione.

Sperimentiamo nuove tecnologie ed il cambiamento e l’innovazione sono alla base della filosofia del nostro nuovo team.

Requisiti basilari

Forte attenzione alla qualità del codice, alle prestazioni ed all’architettura: Clean Code, Testing, Pipeline non sono buzzword ma il cuore del nostro nuovo progetto.
Conoscenza di PHP 8
Conoscenza di MySQL
Conoscenza di GIT
Grande passione, motivazione e voglia di crescita

Requisiti preferenziali

Buona conoscenza di RabbitMQ

Perché candidarti

Abbiamo un mercato da rivoluzionare, in un’epoca dove le spedizioni sono diventate il cuore del nostro commercio, anche al dettaglio;
Cultura di startup ma in una società consolidata e robusta;
Siamo in piena creazione dei nostri servizi, il tuo contributo sarà determinante!
Budget per partecipazione a conferenze, corsi online o libri;
Portatile Apple aziendale;

Come candidarsi

Invia un’email a jobs@mondospedizioni.com con il tuo CV, il link al tuo profilo linkedin e nel caso tu ne sia fornito, il link al tuo account Github.

Iter di assunzione

Verrà effettuato uno screening delle candidature da parte del CTO e del Lead Backend;
Viene organizzato un primo meet di presentazione di 15/20 minuti per una conoscenza iniziale;
Al candidato che desidera proseguire verrà somministrato un esercizio da fare in autonomia (non richiediamo attività che possano richiedere più di 2-3 ore) con cui presentarsi al colloquio tecnico (in presenza o su meet a seconda delle disponibilità del candidato);
Un terzo ed ultimo colloquio con il management aziendale per la definizione dell’offerta.

Chi siamo

MondoSpedizioni è leader a livello nazionale nel mercato dei servizi di spedizione online.

Fondata nel 2002, la nostra azienda offre servizi di spedizione online dei maggiori corrieri. I punti di forza che guidano il successo dell’azienda sono il servizio clienti in house, la qualità del servizio offerto, l’attenzione al cliente attraverso il contatto diretto e la ricerca della semplicità nella fruizione dei servizi.
La nostra azienda è in veloce e continua crescita e per questo stiamo ampliando il reparto tech con diverse nuove figure.

---
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Teradyne i s a global technology company delivering progressive solutions to complex testing challenges. Without creativity and the diversity of thought, Teradyne’s technological innovations would not leave the ground. Teradyne is a globally recognized leader in the ATE Industry. From tablets to smart phones, we rely on electronics to conduct our business and to connect and enhance our personal lives. Teradyne products protect consumer confidence with thorough, fast test and automation. With innovation at the core of our business, we constantly seek new ways to solve the most challenging test issues. At Teradyne, our employees are on the cutting edge of technology within the electronics test industry every day. If you are excited at the prospect of joining a global team, that is both exciting and dynamic and be inspired to change the face of technology, then Teradyne is the place for you! This person will be responsible for selling Teradyne’s TestStation In-Circuit Test Platform and related hardware and services to leading OEMs and Electronics Manufacturing companies. TestStation is the industry leading In-Circuit Test Platform with well over 1,500 systems installed world-wide. In additional to leading our selling activity, this person will manage our alliance activity with Teradyne Support Network (TSN) members and other complementary solution providers in our market. 
 Dedicated to the selling profession and must work independently as a part of a cross functional team
 Managing existing business and execute sales processes at local and international customers
 Develop and participate in key marketing/sales activities
 Must be able to manage business objectives and manage the Teradyne technical organizations interaction at the lower levels
 The successful candidate will create and implement a sales strategy using strategic tools
 Responsibilities include executing to obtain monthly and quarterly booking targets
 Managing competitive sales process as part of a larger sales team 
 Min 5 years of capital equipment selling experience.
 Have very strong interpersonal skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills
 Have strong negotiating skills including knowledge of structured negotiating processes
 Be willing to travel within Germany and partially Europe
 Knowledge of the PCB Electronics Manufacturing industry and sales experience in a related field is 
highly preferred We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Looking to make an impact? Work on a team that emphasises collaboration and innovation? At SailPoint, we believe our success is directly tied to our corporate culture. Our Core Values, affectionately also known as the “Four I’s”: Innovation, Integrity, Impact, and Individuals inform the work we do here at SailPoint. and because they are independent of scale, they have served us well from our early days as a start-up through today as the fastest-growing, independent identity and access management (IAM) provider. 
Why SailPoint? 
Love what you do. And love where you do it. 
Smart people, fun culture, innovative work, collaborative on-site and remote environments — oh, and everyone’s really nice. That’s what people say about SailPoint. We’re known as the company where everyone wants to work. 
If you’re passionate about outsmarting cybercriminals and working at a company where you can truly have an impact, we want you to join us in either Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands remotely. 
SailPoint empowers the largest, most complex organisations by putting identity at the Centre of Security and IT.  Our 2,000+ customers including global financial institutions, government entities, pharmaceutical organizations, and retail organizations and more. 
What you’ll Do: 
The Implementation Engineer (part of Professional Services) plays a vital role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of SailPoint’s SaaS (Identity Now) service offerings. This role will be working in our German market, requiring proficiency in both English and German. Implementation Engineers begin their journey at SailPoint with product training where they can leverage their professional experience to gain a deep understanding of our SaaS (Identity Now) solution. Within a month or two, they begin serving as technical engineers on customer projects. In these projects, they will employ their industry knowledge, technical and communication skills to implement organisational best practices for SailPoint products and identity governance. Within six months, Implementation Engineers will have established themselves as technically proficient and reliable team members within Professional Services, able to handle large, complex projects under the guidance of a Solution Architect. By the end of their first year, they will have become a trusted resource capable of providing world-class service with minimal supervision. 
Responsibilities: 
Working with customers on the installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint SaaS products. 
Configuring SailPoint product as defined by Solution Architect. 
Communicating to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and/or functional level. 
Delivering technical training designed to enable/educate SailPoint customers and implementation partners. 
Requirements: 
3-5 years of professional work experience as part of a software company or systems integrator. This should include 2+ years of SaaS implementation experience 
Excellent communication skills (German and English) and experience working with clients and partners. 
Experience with some or all the following: 
Angular JS, Java, Bean Shell/JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL. 
Web technologies: XML, SPML, SOAP, REST, Web / Application Servers, HTML. 
Setting up and installing software on both Windows and Unix 
RDMS Database Knowledge: Oracle, Sybase, MSSQL, MySQL. 
Experience with enterprise directories such as Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP. 
Networking principles: SSL/TLS/HTTPS, Certificate Management, Basic TCP/IP troubleshooting. 
Familiarity with cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP. 
Preferred: 
SailPoint or other identity governance vendors such as Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, IBM, or Novell a plus 
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts a plus 
Familiarity with role-based access controls and least-privileged access models a plus 
Experience with project management duties (project planning, resource management, scope, schedule and status, documentation) 
Experience with quality assurance duties is a plus (usability testing, performance testing, automated testing, test scripts, test cases and test plans) 
Security software or IT audit experience 
Other languages such as French, Spanish or Italian are desirable but not essential 
Education: 
Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. J2EE certification is a plus. CISSP certification is a plus. 
Location: 
Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands 
Travel: 
This position requires up to 15% travel, 
 SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

job_title: Remote Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) -1 Jobs | Turing
description:
A top-ranking job listing site is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET). The selected candidate will collaborate with software development engineers and quality assurance engineers to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated test tools to deliver new features. The developer will be responsible for writing test automation frameworks, building the infrastructure and tools to test products. The company records 250 million unique website visitors every month. It is backed by top investors like The New York Times, Union Square Ventures, and Allen & Company. Candidates who are able to develop test plans according to customer usage are suitable for this role.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Write test automation frameworks and build the infrastructure and tools to test products
Write code that automatically verifies the quality of the product and build out testing APIs/services/tools that enable other team members to do the same
Understand software internals, debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement new tools and frameworks needed to streamline our quality process
Work directly with both Software Development Engineers and Quality Assurance Engineers to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated test tools that help deliver quality features with efficiency
Understand customer usage models and develop test plans and test cases that approximate real-world environments and scenarios
Perform detailed source code reviews focusing on the testability of the code to improve product coverage and effectiveness
Provide technical guidance to overall architecture and design
Ensure scalability, reliability, consistency, and performance in production
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s Degree or Master's degree with 5 -10 years of experience as a Software developer or SDET
Experience in writing code and working with technologies such as Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, JSP, JavaScript, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, and JSON
Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the testing process
Strong experience with Agile development incorporating CI/CD, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, and Datadog
Understanding of QA methodologies, life cycle, and processes
Experience in QA with exposure to white box testing, API Testing using REST 
Experience developing high-quality test strategies and test automation
Strong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of the production system
Coding experience with automation framework, tools, and services for mobile
Working Experience in API testing and automation of the services
Able to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly
Knowledge of functional programming, Docker, Kubernetes will be preferred
Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design, and data structures is desirable
Experience in Object-Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD), and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patterns
Strong exposure with Selenium and Appium framework

Before you read the details of this role, there’s something you should know. At Matter Labs, we don’t see ourselves as a company, but as a highly aligned global team on a single mission: to accelerate the mass adoption of crypto for personal sovereignty.
 Our core technology – zkSync – is a layer 2 rollup that uses advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum without compromising on security or decentralization. zkSync is EVM compatible, which means projects on Ethereum and other EVM-based blockchains can easily deploy on zkSync to take advantage of low gas fees and high transaction speeds.
 With a total of $458 million in mission-driven funding, zkSync is the first EVM-compatible ZK Rollup to go live on testnet (February 2022) and be deployed on mainnet (October 2022). As we enter the endgame for Ethereum scaling, we are committed to full open source and building in public toward our stated mission [so that even if we fail, the community and the ecosystem will benefit from our contribution].
 Read more about our core values and principles .
 The Role
 As a Developer Relations Engineer you will play a critical role in supporting the product roll out and product/developer support we will offer.
 We're looking for Engineers who can win the hearts and minds of Developer and Crypto communities by delivering value through developer relations, developer tools, and technical support on our platform and rapid ecosystem growth. You must be a deeply technical storyteller who enjoys connecting with other technical practitioners and influencers and helping them elevate their craft.
 What You'll Be Doing
  Creating and executing plans and processes to improve developer experience
Supporting scaling and curating developer tools
Unblocking developers facing technical questions and issues
Pushing out content targeted towards platform developers, including technical blog posts on new features, platform design, issues, and upgrades
Engaging our developer community on Twitter, Discord, Discourse, Stackoverflow, and Github
Supporting our courses and educational materials
Improving and maintaining documentation so it’s accessible to developers at all levels
Leading a voice of the customer program to ensure we bring feedback from technical customers back into our product roadmap
Cooperating with Marketing and Business Development leads to improve developer-facing product positioning and communications
 What We Look For In You
  5+ years of experience in a direct, hands-on technical community or end-user focused role such as developer relations, developer advocacy, engineering support and technical support or 5+ years of experience as a software developer or engineer
Proven experience of supporting a technical community where you were a key factor in driving measurable positive outcomes
An established presence online as a thinker & leader in this space is a massive plus 
Crypto experience, especially knowledge of Ethereum & L2s is a plus
Strong vision for where the industry is going, and stay on top of new technologies and stacks
Deep familiarity building developer portals and roadmap activity
Excellent communication skills as a strong technical writer
 Working at Matter Labs
 At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. We operate in small, focused teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. Only results matter. We will provide you with anything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.
 Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from different countries, cultures, ethnical and religious backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.
 We designed our culture of freedom and ownership to persist as we scale and to establish the base for a positive-sum community as we move toward full decentralization.
 Apply now if this role sounds of interest and we aim to get back to you as soon as possible.

Klaar om je horizon te verbreden in de digitale wereld? Met onze Young professionals duik je in uiteenlopende projecten én blijf je al werkend leren. Door een kennismaking met verschillende IT vraagstukken, onze klanten en processen kun jij alle kanten op qua ontwikkeling.
 Doen waar je goed in bent
Bij VanMeijel geloven we dat doen waar je goed in bent en jezelf kunnen blijven ontwikkelen zorgen voor plezier in je werk. Jouw persoonlijkheid, energie en ambities is waar we naar kijken. Affiniteit met de wereld van IT en/of de bouw is fijn, geen must. We vinden het veel interessanter wat jouw talenten en interesses zijn.
 Hoe ziet het Young professionals eruit?
Afhankelijk van jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling duurt het traineeship gemiddeld twaalf maanden. Vanaf de eerste dag geven we een vliegende start aan jouw plek binnen VanMeijel. Je begint op de afdeling Customer Care. Hier maak je kennis met onze klanten, onze producten, je collega’s, wie wij zijn als organisatie en onze uitdagingen. Je werkt samen in een team van professionals en je komt veel in contact met collega’s van verschillende afdelingen.
 Je gaat bij ons de komende periode heel veel leren, een gezonde dosis leergierigheid moet je dan ook wel bezitten. Onze collega en wellicht jouw toekomstige collega, Iris van der Heijden, vertelt jou graag hier wat meer over: “ Je vindt het leuk om verschillende soorten vraagstukken op te lossen voor diverse klanten. Afhankelijk van de complexiteit van het vraagstuk, beschik jij over de kennis of verzamel jij intern de kennis die nodig is om tot de oplossing te komen. Je stopt pas als het gereed is”.
 Diverse doorgroeimogelijkheden
Vanuit de afdeling Customer Care maak je kennis met alle teams binnen VanMeijel. Je ontdekt welke uitdagingen en doorgroeimogelijkheden voor jou interessant zijn. Waar kunnen we gezamenlijk ambities realiseren? Zet bijvoorbeeld een volgende stap richting consultancy, sales, productontwikkeling of projectmanagement. Na het traineeship ben jij een volwaardige collega op deze afdeling.
 Wat verwachten we van je?
Je hebt minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding;
Je bent ambitieus en leergierig.
 Wat bieden we jou?
Een marktconform salaris met groeimogelijkheden;
Een premievrij pensioen;
Om de vrijdag een VanMeijel Café met (digitale) presentaties en een afsluitende borrel;
Vrijheid en zelfstandigheid in het uitoefenen van je functie (ook de optie om vanuit huis te werken);
Een nuchtere poldermentaliteit, volop innovatie en fris familiebedrijf.
 Waarom VanMeijel?
Wij zijn gespecialiseerd in automatisering van bouwbedrijven, waarbij innovatie en kwaliteit voorop staan. We zijn een ambitieuze organisatie, we weten waar we goed in zijn maar zoeken ook altijd naar verbeteringen in onze processen en werkwijzen. Binnen de bouwbranche spelen techniek en software een belangrijke rol en zijn er tal van mogelijkheden waarin wij onze klanten als Innovatiepartner graag ondersteunen.
 Enthousiast geworden? Pas jij bij ons en wij bij jou? Wij maken graag kennis met je! Voor vragen over deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Samantha Bal, 06 – 57 60 30 65 of stuur een mail: sbal@vanmeijel.nl
 Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Testing and troubleshooting Blockchain-driven projects

What's on Offer

 Was können sie von FRISS erwarten?

Zugang zur FRISS Academy und LinkedIn Learning
 Apply now
 Wir brauchen Ihre Hilfe, um unser Big Hairy Audacious Goal zu erreichen! Durch die Entwicklung wirklich intelligenter Software ermöglichen wir es Versicherern weltweit, das Risiko von Versicherungsbetrug automatisch zu erkennen. Unser ultimativer Traum ist es, dass der FRISS-Score im Jahr 2025 der weltweit anerkannte Standard für ehrliche Versicherungen ist. Sind Sie bereit für ein Abenteuer? Wir wachsen schnell und um neue Kunden willkommen zu heißen, sind wir auf der Suche nach einem internationalen Projektmanager für die Region DACH / Rest der Welt.
 Du lebst in Deutschland oder Österreich und wirst eng mit Deinen internationalen Projektmanager-Kollegen und anderen Beratern in der Region zusammenarbeiten.
 Deine Aufgabe als Projektmanager
 Du wirst Teil unseres Customer Excellence Teams (Regionalteam DACH / ROW) sein. Dieses Team kümmert sich um unsere Kunden, um die Einführung von FRISS voranzutreiben und den kontinuierlichen Wert der von uns gelieferten Produkte zu demonstrieren. Dies ist eine kritische Rolle innerhalb des Teams, da Du eine wichtige Rolle beim Onboarding unserer Kunden sein wirst. Wir suchen einen Kandidaten, der für die Implementierung von FRISS-Lösungen bei unseren Kunden verantwortlich ist. Du wirst mit dem Rest der FRISS-Organisation zusammenarbeiten, um unser Produkt kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
 Wenn Du nach einem Jahr bei FRISS zurückblickst, was haben Sie erreicht?
 Mit Hilfe Deines Einsatzes und Deiner klaren Kommunikation hat FRISS einen Aufschwung erlebt! Zusammen mit Deinen Kollegen haben wir unsere Lösung bei vielen neuen Versicherungsunternehmen in unserer Region eingeführt. Du hast dazu beigetragen, dass wir auf unserer Reise nach Tokio unser BHAG erreicht haben.
 Du und Dein FRISS Team
 Wir ermutigen unsere Mitarbeiter, die Initiative in ihren Bemühungen zu ergreifen. Unsere Projektmanager lieben es, mit verschiedenen Teams auf unterschiedlichen Ebenen zusammenzuarbeiten. Du bist ergebnisorientiert und kommunikativ.
 Deine Projektmanager Kollegen sind in den Niederlanden und in Nordamerika tätig. Die Arbeit in verschiedenen Zeitzonen hat gewisse Herausforderungen, die wir zu berücksichtigen wissen.
 Ein reguläres Implementierungsteam besteht in der Regel aus Produktberater(n), Data Scientists und einem Infrastruktur-Engineer. Hast Du das Gefühl, dass Du zu dieser Rolle und zu unserem Team passt? Dann komm in unser Team!
 Das bringst Du mit!
  Du hast Erfahrung im Management mittlerer bis großer technischer Projekte in einemkomplexen und dynamischen Umfeld und hast bereits erfolgreich Projekte realisiert.
Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung als Projektleiter
Du versteht es, auf strategischer Ebene zwischen verschiedenen Interessen innerhalb und außerhalb Deiner Projektorganisation zu manövrieren.
Du arbeitest ergebnisorientiert, bist stressresistent, überzeugend und hast ein ausgezeichnetes Planungs- und Organisationstalent.
Du kennst Dich mit gängigen Projektmanagement-Methoden (wie Prince2, IPMA) aus und verfügst vorzugsweise über eine IPMA-B-Zertifizierung.
Du hast ein hohes Maß an Verantwortungsbewusstsein, handelst unternehmerisch und proaktiv.
Du bist eine energische Führungspersönlichkeit, die zur Zusammenarbeit ermutigt und für die die Teammitglieder gerne arbeiten.
Du solltest über Kenntnisse in der Versicherungsbranche verfügen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Schadenmanagement, Underwriting und Betrugsermittlung/Betrugsmanagement.
Fließend deutsche Sprachkenntnisse (Wort und Schrift) sind ein Muss für diese Position
 Lassen Dich nicht vom Imposter-Syndrom abhalten, Dich zu bewerben! Wenn Du Fragen hast, kannst Du uns unter recruitment@friss.com kontaktieren.
 FRISS ist stolz darauf, ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit zu sein. Wir ermutigen Sie, Sie selbst zu sein. Alle qualifizierten Bewerber werden ohne Rücksicht auf Rasse, Religionszugehörigkeit, Geschlecht, Geschlechtsidentität, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung, Alter, Nationalität oder Veteranenstatus für eine Einstellung berücksichtigt.

BackEnd Business Intelligence Software Engineer (OPS)
 What is about?
 Metro Data Warehouse (MDW) is the Corporate reporting and analysis platform, in Metro Group.
Featuring Teradata as database and MicroStrategy as FrontEnd BI tool, enhanced by in-house tools, including ELT tool, our solution has proved to be fast, robust, reliable and qualitative.
MDW collects, cleanses and integrates data from operational landscape of Metro world, thus offering to our users an unique 360 view of the business processes and outcome. MDW is planned to be moved into cloud in the next years and you will learn a lot from this experience.
 What we’re looking for?
 · Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
· Mature and self-motivated professional with the ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment
· Having an agile mind-set to work in scrum team
· A focus on customer service/satisfaction with strong interpersonal skills and responsiveness
· Ability to build strong working relationships and work within a global, remote workforce
· Advanced English Language speaker 
· Have knowledge of managing and automating DevOps tasks for scheduling, monitoring, logging backup, recovery (using Python and/or shell) 
· Be available for 24x7 on-call support on rotation 
 You’re a great fit if you have:
 · Very good RDBMS and SQL knowledge, including performance analyzing techniques
· Good Linux Shell / Python scripting knowledge, Google Cloud Platform
· Scheduling and monitoring tools i.e. Control M, BPPM, Opsgenie, Check MK.
· Good understanding of Data Warehouse concepts, architecture and practice
· Relevant experience with ETL tools and techniques for administration tasks
· Product testing techniques, best practices, methodologies
· Application versioning concepts and tools
· Google Cloud knowledge would be a plus.
 Highly appreciated:
 · Teradata experience or BackEnd administration tool exposure, Shell/Python scripting, BTEQ 
 What we offer?
 · Opportunity to learn and work with a variety of technologies
· Career programs
· Multicultural, Agile environment that encourages new ideas and innovation
· Flexible working hours, Lunch tickets
· Health and life insurance, Private pension
· Fitness centers discounts, sports activities and other company events
· Good transport connections and free parking
· Relaxation area, Bookster.ro account

** PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE ALREADY BASED IN BULGARIA ** Backend Software Engineer Over the past 15 years, we have seen a shift in the focus of business models across every industry – from selling physical products via one-time transactions to monetizing services via ongoing customer (aka subscriber) relationships. This is the “Subscription Economy” a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo, he even wrote the book on it: Subscribed. Companies have realized that the path to growth going forward is to establish direct, digital relationships with their customers, and monetize these relationships through an ever growing set of digital services. Our vision is simple: we call it “The World Subscribed.” It’s the idea that one day every company will join the Subscription Economy -- a $1.5 Trillion opportunity by 2025 according to UBS. Our mission: to power the world’s best companies to win in the Subscription Economy. Newly acquired by Zuora, Zephr’s platform powers nearly eight billion requests a month and dynamic, personalized subscriber experiences. When combined with data from Zuora’s Billing, Collect, and Revenue systems – the resulting solution will empower companies across industries to nurture and monetize their subscriber relationships by better understanding their behaviors, experimenting with the right digital offerings, and optimizing their digital experiences. The Team & Role The core purpose of this role is to contribute, implement and support Zuora’s subscription experience platform, Zephr. You will contribute to the system architecture design whilst working with other parts of the business and vendors to determine functional requirements, collaborate on designs and iterate on technical solutions. You will help the team by taking part in code reviews, contributing to technical standards, helping to implement best practices and improve operational processes. Our Tech Stack: Java, Rest API, Microservices, AWS, Terraform, Vert.x, Docker In this role you’ll get to 
Contribute to development & scaling of a high throughput, high availability, public-facing multi-tenanted application
Design, implement and maintain libraries and abstractions for internal teams to build upon to extend application functionality
Develop & maintain secure, performant and simple-to-integrate APIs for internal, B2B and public consumers 
 Excellent Java (JDK 8 or newer)
 Solid understanding of web technologies: HTTP, DNS, at home in Chrome Developer Tools
Experience running microservices in production
Designing quality APIs (like REST, gRPC, GraphQL, OpenAPI etc.) and integrating with 3rd party APIs.
API Security (OAuth2, SAML, JWT etc)
Strong at the usual best practices stuff: git, TDD, OOP principles (SOLID, design patterns etc) 
Bonus points for 
 Experience with reverse proxies (HAProxy, Envoy, nginx etc)
Terraform+AWS
 Has used simulated load (JMeter/Gatling/wrk2 etc) and JVM profiling to identify and fix performance bottlenecks
 Instrumenting code & analysing production metrics (Prometheus/InfluxDB/ELK etc) 
As the Subscription Economy leader, Zuora empowers today’s innovative companies to nurture and monetize direct, digital relationships. Our award-winning multi-product portfolio now includes Zuora Revenue, Zuora Collect and Zuora Central Platform. More recently, we’ve added subscription experience platform Zephr to our family, further expanding our capabilities to serve as an intelligent hub that monetizes the complete quote to cash and revenue recognition process at scale. Through our combination of technology and expertise, Zuora (NYSE: ZUO) helps more than 1,000 companies around the world, including BMC Software, Box, Caterpillar, General Motors, Penske Media Corporation, Schneider Electric, Siemens and Zoom nurture and monetize direct, digital customer relationships. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, Zuora operates offices around the world in the U.S., EMEA, APAC and LATAM. “ZEO” Culture At Zuora, we’re building an inclusive, high-performance culture that every ZEO wants to subscribe to. We want ZEOs at every level to feel valued, included, and inspired to innovate, connect and collaborate authentically as we pioneer the Subscription Economy. You’ll be empowered to think like an owner, take initiative and together, with the support of your team you’ll push each other to the next level and help transform business models everywhere. To learn more visit www.zuora.com Zuora is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Think, be and do you! At Zuora, different perspectives, experiences and contributions matter. Everyone counts. Zuora is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. Zuora does not discriminate on the basis of, and considers individuals seeking employment with Zuora without regards to, race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)zuora.com.

DXC Technology is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally.
 Responsibilities
This position will have overall responsibility for engineering and day-to-day support of the Linux OS and/or Cloud Environment (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or DevOps processes and tools (jenkins, git, ansible, terraform, k8s, IaC, CI/CD etc).  Requirements
Knowledge any of below areas will be an advantage:
 - Linux administration
 - AWS
 - Azure
 - GCP
 - Jenkins
 - Git (GitLab, GitHub)
 - Docker/OpenShift/Kubernetes
 - Ansible
 - Terraform
 - CI/CD
Communication skills, both towards your team members as well as towards the client
Good verbal and written English communication skills
 We offer a job in a heavily invested area, cooperating with inspiring people from across the world. A place where you can learn, work with experts, share your knowledge, have occasions to enjoy many activities suitable for our Employees and their lifestyles.
 Joining DXC you gain
Work in an international company, full-time job, and permanent job contract
Opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing, innovative, and high-performing team within a truly global and multicultural organization
Friendly atmosphere, independence, and flexible working hours (e.g. possibility of working from home)
Competitive compensation package adjusted to candidate’s experience and qualifications
Opportunity for personal and professional development and advancement within the company by taking part in interesting and challenging projects
A modern and friendly work environment with an open-door policy
Professional technical and soft skill training (internal DXC University and certification program), opportunity to learn and evolve within a team of experienced colleagues
Private medical care, social benefits system, life insurance, Multisport card, Wellness Program, German language classes, relax corner (XBOX games and other), sport communities
Employee Assistance Program (providing help for employees in difficult life situations)

job_title: Software Developer - Machine Learning / Data Science / Python / Remote (m/f/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. We are looking for reinforcement at the earliest possible date Software Developer - Machine Learning / Data Science / Python / Remote (m/f/d).
 Sounds interesting? Then we look forward to receiving your application via our partner Workwise.
 Smart communication with artificial intelligence is our specialty. To remain on the road of international success with innovative products, we are looking for reinforcements of our international development team as now of.
 Your tasks
  As part of our tech team, you will develop methods for natural language processing and natural language understanding in user-centered dialog systems for a variety of tasks and domains.
Furthermore, you may integrate and evaluate NLP components of voice assistant prototypes that you helped to develop.
You will also communicate and coordinate activities with project partners as well as internal and external stakeholders.
You run data science with own data lakes and data from third party providers.
 You profile
  You have a background in computer science or similar.
You have expert knowledge in machine learning using tools such as Keras, TensorFlow, sk-learn, pandas.
Ideally, you know your way around Cloud Infrastructure
You are a team player, curious and proactive in proposing new technical solutions
You're comfortable with DDD (Domain Driven Design), TDD (Test Driven Development), Clean Code, Agile methods (Dailies, Scrum) and Microservices.
As a proactive problem-solver, you leave code and processes in a better shape than when you first encountered them.
You are fluent in English (speaking, reading, writing); German is a nice to have.
 OUR STACK
  Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
Web Dev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 We offer
  You get the opportunity to take the next big leaps together with us. Let’s shape together technologies of the future. You will grow with us and receive your own projects right from your start.
Your tasks are broadly diversified and offer you enough challenges and variety even as an experienced developer.
At our company, you can arrange your working hours flexibly on a basis of trust. You can also move into your home office by prior arrangement.
Attractive salary models are a matter of course.
Your workplace is located in a generously equipped old building. Your own Desktop-PC and laptop are part of the basic equipment.
You will have your own parking space or can use our good public transport connections.
A good working atmosphere and good coffee complete our offer.
 Our job offer Software Developer - Machine Learning / Data Science / Python / Remote (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) powers the industries of today and tomorrow by connecting the people with big ideas to the manufacturers who can bring them to life. Xometry’s digital marketplace gives manufacturers the critical resources they need to grow their business while also making it easy for buyers at Fortune 1000 companies to tap into global manufacturing capacity. To continue our rapid growth on the Benelux & Nordics markets of custom & serial on-demand manufacturing, we are looking for a passionate and fast-moving Marketing Specialist , who will help the company get the word out about its products and services across our target audiences and via multiple digital channels. Responsibilities Overall, you will be responsible for acquiring new leads and improving Xometry’s positions in target market segments using all accessible communication tools and channels. Here’s an example breakdown of what your activities would include: 
 Set up and improve performance ads in paid channels in collaboration with our paid media manager
 Create and manage marketing campaigns (e.g. prepare texts and visuals) in multichannel environment (e.g. social media, emails)
 Organise webinars (both in-house and with partners) for our target audiences
 Analyse efficiency of existing advertising channels, discover and assess new channels
 Find and vet new industry channel partners, influencers, and publications
 Review and improve communication with the target audiences across various touchpoints (existing advertising, website, product, emails) 
Channels You will work with multiple communication channels such as: 
 Social media
 Digital media
 Email marketing
 Event marketing
 Partner and affiliate marketing
 Sponsorships 
Ideal candidate To be able to successfully deal with the responsibilities, an ideal candidate has: 
 Digital mindset and growth focus;
 At least 2 years of on-hands experience in performance/ lead-gen marketing (also in an assistant role);
 Experience in creating promotional content (writing promo texts, creating pictures or videos);
 Knowledge of Google Ads, Facebook and LinkedIn Business Suites;
 Experience in organising webinars and knowledge of relevant tools (Zoom, ClickMeeting, etc);
 Native level in Dutch (knowledge of other Scandinavian languages will be a great benefit);
 Has a background in or interest in learning more about engineering, 3D printing, manufacturing. 
Working conditions 
 Interesting work in a dynamic and fast-growing environment
 A friendly international team from Europe and overseas
 Possibility to work up to 100% remotely from home office
 Salary based on the qualifications and experience plus equity incentive plan 
If this job isn’t for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them! Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

ABOUT US
 eduki was founded in 2016 as Lehrermarktplatz in Berlin. 
Meanwhile, over 1 Million teachers use eduki to prepare lessons. They share their self-created teaching materials - millions of times. This makes teaching better, preparation less stressful and promotes cooperation.
 2016 our journey began - Since then we have grown into an international team with more than 70 people. We work in agile teams, learn new things every day and appreciate every idea, no matter how crazy it may seem at first. 
We are proud of our family culture and our people-first attitude.
 Are you ready? Then join our eduki family!
  US FOR YOU!
 Hey there!
 We have an interesting package for all those who want to create something great with us!
If you haven't found a job that suits you on our careers page, we are always open to new impulses,
which is why you can simply apply here on your own initiative!
 Let's see if we can find a way to take you on an exciting journey!
We are very excited about your application!
YOU FOR US!
It depends on what you would like to do:
  What are your wishes?
What challenges would you like to master?
  THAT'S YOU!
  A human being
Motivation
The will to be a part of improving the education sector
 At eduki, we believe in the power of diversity. We believe in the commitment to equality and inclusion as much as in its added value. We aim to create an inclusive work environment and focus on mutual respect, appreciation as well as fun and motivation. Talents are considered regardless of age, gender, sexual identity, ethnicity, nationality, religion or disability. Develop your personality with us, because we focus on you as a person!

Nitro is looking to hire an experienced Front End Engineer to join our eCommerce Products Team. Nitro is a global document productivity company accelerating digital transformation in a world that demands the ability to work from anywhere, anytime, on any device. As a global player in the eSign and workflow productivity market, Nitro enables organisations to drive better business outcomes through 100% digital document processes and fast, efficient workflows. The Nitro Productivity Platform offers comprehensive SaaS business solutions, including highly secure eSigning and e-ID, powerful PDF productivity and industry-leading analytics, all supported by a superior customer success team. Nitro has over 3 million licensed users and 13,000+ Business Customers in more than 150 countries, including over 68% of the Fortune 500 and three of the Fortune 10. Nitro is headquartered in San Francisco with nine global hubs. Engineering is a critical function at Nitro, developing the products and services at the heart and soul of our business today, and helping us realize our vision of smarter documents in the future. We have an incredibly talented and diverse Engineering team that cares, with a strong culture that believes in building the right things and building them the right way. 
Collaborating with Product Management, Engineering and Design to build a product that will enable our users to purchase our offerings and manage their entitlements on our system 
Building elegant interfaces that deliver amazing customer experiences 
Building modular, testable, and reusable Javascript components 
Building automated end to end tests 
Building deployment workflows to support continuous delivery 
Researching new front-end technologies to drive innovation 
Evaluating the existing application codebase and driving improvement 
Evangelizing best practices and standards 
2+ years experience as a Front End Engineer or equivalent 
2+ years building browser-based rich user interface applications 
Professional experience with CSS and CSS pre-processors (Less, Sass, or similar) 
Ability to translate a high-level open-ended requirement into a working prototype with real data 
Professional experience with end-to-end test automation frameworks 
Expertise in Javascript and Typescript (using modern frameworks) e.g. Angular v7, Vue.js 
Professional experience with responsive design specifically targeting mobile web browsers 
Professional experience integrating with internal and external RESTful services 
Professional experience with npm or similar package management tools 
Professional experience with Webpack or similar build tools 
Good understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and solutions for modern browsers 
Ability to advocate for front-end development standards, design patterns, and best practices 
Our mission is to help create, develop, and support an environment where great people come to do their best work. We believe there is a balance to strike between “work hard, play hard,” and we strive to improve in both areas every day. We put our customers, employees, and communities at the center of everything we do. 
Be Good - Nitronauts are good humans with big hearts that are respectful and supportive of each other. We celebrate individuality and diversity and strive to foster an environment where people can be themselves and do their best work. 
Performance First - We like to challenge ourselves. We’re passionate about exceeding expectations and stepping outside our comfort zones to get to the next level. It’s our ambition that pushes us to work hard and deliver strong results. 
No B.S. - This one is self-explanatory, but we’re all about transparency, honesty, and authenticity here. We don’t beat around the bush; we tell it like it is. 
Why Nitro? Along with our regular benefits and programs (including health, dental, vision, retirement as standard), we are also very proud to offer a few additional initiatives to future Nitronauts Our goal is to empower our Nitronauts—to make an impact, work better together, and believe any goal is attainable. We take pride in the perks and benefits provided to employees that make their day-to-day lives more enjoyable and secure. Flex Time Off Work-life balance is important at Nitro, and we understand that there are events that we cannot plan for. We are proud to offer Flex Time Off to be used for holidays, spending days with your family, or appointments. Flexible Forever We will offer a flexible work environment forever. This hybrid approach allows our team the flexibility to work remotely and have access to in-person time for collaboration sessions and team offsites. 90 Days Away We offer the opportunity for employees to travel and explore while working from anywhere. Employees can extend vacations and spend more time with family, and work from anywhere for up to 90 days. Nitro Resource Groups Nitro supports our diverse group of Nitronauts who come together to celebrate their passions, share their unique perspectives, experiences, and contributions to make Nitro a more inclusive place to work. Families @ Nitro We have the opportunity and responsibility to ensure the well-being of our employees, which includes offering support when and where it matters most. From generous leave to fertility benefits, Nitro supports team members who may be on or considering a path to parenthood, whatever that looks like. We strongly encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. Nitro provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

job_title: Android engineer, internship (Remote or Relocate to Milan)
description:
With tens of millions of active users and hundreds of thousands of daily downloads, we’re one of Europe’s leading app developers. We’re looking for a talented, and passionate native Android developer eager to help us make the best apps on the Play Store and contribute to improving our technology stack.
  Write quality code that’s testable and maintainable. You understand the benefits of code that’s clean and idiomatic.
Follow best practices in terms of coding style, Git usage, commit messages, pull requests, and team conventions.
Perform code reviews and play an active part in tech discussions.
Work on apps, libraries, or tooling, depending on your skills and preferences.
Make proposals to improve our tech stack, libraries, and tooling.
Contribute to the product development of the apps you’ll work on. We’re all about taking a proactive role and ownership of your work.
Help define the software architecture of entire apps or new features—and then develop them. The work spans a broad range, from engineering and coding features to polishing world-class user interfaces.
Constantly improve the quality of our products by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary, as well as adding that wow factor to put smiles on our users’ faces.
Stay up-to-speed with new technologies (particularly on Android), and test the promising ones to make sure we don’t miss out on game-changing opportunities.
  Passion. You love what you do, and your enthusiasm never wavers with the specifics of a given task or team. Whether you’re on a plane, train, or sofa, odds are that you’ll be found with your nose in a book or article on the subject.
Reasoning and depth of learning. You’re structured and creative enough to solve most challenging problems independently, given the necessary knowledge. You learn new concepts and skills rapidly, and love to nerd out and go in-depth.
Accuracy and precision. Your attention to detail is spot-on, and you’re painstakingly accurate.
Logical-analytical abilities. You’re a quick learner who’s able to investigate and effectively pick up new concepts on your own. You can solve unforeseen challenges with creativity and structure, and can do so independently.
Drive. You’re energetic and hard-working, and you persevere through adversity until the job is done—and done impeccably. You’re massively into getting results, and always aim for excellence in what you do.
Curiosity and initiative. You love exploring, and are forever hunting down new opportunities and testing fresh ideas. Rather than waiting to be told what to do, you go seek.
Humility. You’re down to earth, eager to listen to feedback and constructive criticism, and ready to support your team with whatever it needs to succeed.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
 What we offer
Make a difference. Be the owner of your effort—from day one, you’re one of the team and fully trusted to take responsibility for your tasks. You’ll have every incentive to make a major impact.
International reach. We’re a global company, and your work will have worldwide exposure.
The finest tools. You get the best hardware on the market and all the software you could need. We can't wait to introduce you to our high-tech approach and our cutting-edge workflows.
Talented, knowledgeable colleagues. Learn from (and teach) some of the brightest and most skilled people you’ll ever meet. Your talent is going to blossom here.
Unique career opportunity. By joining a fast-growing company on a mission to become one of the world's greatest, it’s an unparalleled opportunity to turbocharge your learning and career prospects.
Continuous education. Spooners get unlimited backing for learning investments, including Italian or English lessons and things like courses, conferences, and books. There’s no permission or approval process—you’re fully trusted to use the company’s resources efficiently.
Wonderful HQ. Natural light, silent rooms, state-of-the-art hardware, fun-filled common spaces...the list never ends! You’ll certainly be in the right environment to do your best work. And, when it’s time to switch off, you can do that in style and comfort.
Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose. Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. You’ve always got the freedom to decide where today’s office is.
Flexible schedule. Our regular hours are 9-6 GMT+1, but this isn’t a “clock in, clock out” company. You’re fully trusted to create the right conditions for your own personal peak productivity. We only ask that you’re available to your teammates a good chunk of the day (six hours or so). That’s why it’s generally best to be based somewhere with a similar time zone—between GMT-2 and GMT+3.
Competitive salary and stock options. Our compensation package is highly competitive, and can grow rapidly and include stock options, depending on your performance and seniority.
 Fixed-term or internship.
 Milan, Italy or fully remote.
If you choose the on-site option, it’s fine if you prefer to work remotely sometimes. We offer substantial support for relocation, including finding an apartment in Milan and paying the rent for 12 weeks.
 If you successfully pass through our screening process, we’ll invite you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach and solve unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful there, we’ll invite you to take part in some interviews. We welcome applications in English and Italian.
 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment all applicants and we provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.
 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, we look for talent and potential—not just experience and expertise. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it, go ahead and apply.

Il nostro cliente, realtà leader nel settore di riferimento, ci ha incaricati di ricercare un Software Engineer (Middle Level), da inserire all'interno del team.
 La risorsa si inserirà all'interno di un team tecnico di sviluppo agile e collaborerà con gli altri membri del team per garantire la delivery di sfidanti progetti di settore, riportando direttamente al Technical Leader.
 Esperienza con linguaggi simili al C (es. Java, Go, C[++])
 Sviluppo di applicazioni sicure (compresa la comprensione delle implementazioni zero-trust).
 Conoscenza di SQL (e conoscenza di database alternativi e dei loro potenziali casi d'uso).
 Integrazione e consegna continue, compreso l'utilizzo di Gitflow
 Completano il profilo: ottime capacità comunicative, orientamento al problem solving, capacità di lavorare in autonomia all’interno di un contesto informale e una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.

About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet. As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world 🌎 We’re looking for iOS Developers interested in every step, stage and release of a feature. Want to work alone? This isn’t for you. We want communicators. One minute you’re chatting to your PO, the next a designer, the next a customer (for feature feedback, we don’t need you on the phones) 📣 Like your projects varied? This is for you. We don’t pigeonhole. We want you to spread your wings and stick your beak into as many places as possible. Fancy it❓ What You’ll Be Doing 
Collaborating closely with product designers with a focus on new feature design and prototyping
Be involved in the user experience design process, from wireframes and mockups through implementation and release
Working closely with designers and business to define and implement elegant solutions to interesting problems
Helping define and maintaining visual guidelines and ensure consistency throughout the app
Fast prototyping of new user interactions and iteration based on feedback from peer 
What You'll Need 
Deep understanding of the iOS SDK
Experience working on apps which support iOS devices
Experience collaborating on software projects with design and backend aspects
Quick learning skill with an ambitious and results driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
The ability to work well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Fluent English 
As a starting point, we should expect to see: 
your active Github account;
at least one published app on the store, that looks good 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

job_title: Big Data Engineer - Mercato: Corporate, Private & Public
description:
RISK ADVISORY
 What impact will you make?
 YOUR OPPORTUNITY:
 Risk Advisory è la società del Network Deloitte che supporta i propri Clienti nella generazione e protezione del valore aziendale attraverso l’analisi e la gestione dei rischi d’impresa, identificando, anticipando e risolvendo le criticità di business.
 In questo contesto, stiamo cercando candidati Big Data Engineer da inserire presso l’Ufficio di Roma, su importanti progetti in ambito Digital Risk con focus su architetture Big Data, Data Analytics e processi di ETL presso prestigiosi clienti italiani ed internazionali, operanti in ambito industriale
 YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Il tuo ruolo sarà focalizzato sull’esecuzione proattiva e responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto. Agendo con progressiva autonomia all’interno di team multifunzionali, sarai responsabile per la qualità del tuo lavoro e del suo pieno allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.
 Avrai la possibilità di condividere la tua esperienza e le tue conoscenze con i tuoi colleghi e di contribuire alla realizzazione della nostra ambizione: “make an impact that matters”.
 OUR REQUIREMENTS:
 Stiamo cercando figure Big Data Engineer da inserire presso la sede di Roma su importanti progetti in ambito Digital di clienti operanti nelle seguenti Industry: Manufacturing, Consumer, Energy, Public Sector, Telecommunication, Life Science & Healthcare, Sport & Entertainment.
 Il/la candidato/a si occuperà di gestire operativamente il disegno e l’implementazione di soluzioni Big Data attravero lo sviluppo di processi di ETL e soluzioni digitali, facendo leva su tecnologie quali machine learning, artificali intelligence e data analytics.
 Il/la candidato/a ideale ha esperienza nell’implementazione di progetti complessi e abilità nel condividere questa esperienza nel team di progetto; ha una forte attitudine al teamwork, al problem solving, spiccate capacità di analisi e ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative.
 Il/la candidato/a ideale è infine in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:
 Mandatory
  Laurea triennale in informatica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata)
Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all'estero
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di Python e relative libreria per la manipolazione dei dati
Buona conoscenza di processi di ETL e di architetture Big Data
Buona conoscenza dei principali tool di Data Analytics (QlikSense, Power BI)
Esperienza nel coordinamento delle attività di un team analisti, consulenti e sviluppatori
Esperienza nel coordinamento del piano di attività di suddetti progetti
Ottime abilità comunicative nei confronti degli stakeholder di progetto (colleghi, cliente, etc.)
 Nice to have
  Esperienza sull’utilizzo del prodotto Talend
Esperienza su piattaforme Cloud
Certificazioni in ambito Big Data e Cloud (AWS, Cloudera) 
 Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l’ambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia , attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l’obiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.
 Join our #iAct movement! Fai il  per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti più responsabili.
 ABOUT RISK ADVISORY:
 Deloitte Risk Advisory è la società del Network Deloitte leader mondiale nell’offerta di servizi alle imprese per l’efficace ed efficiente mitigazione dei Rischi Strategici e Reputazionali, Regolamentari, Finanziari, Operativi.
 Sviluppiamo soluzioni specifiche per le esigenze dei clienti partendo dall’analisi dell’organizzazione, dei rischi e dei controlli, nonché degli obiettivi che essi intendono perseguire.
 Disponiamo di un portfolio servizi globale e unificato, sviluppato per poter raggiungere e soddisfare ovunque i nostri clienti con un approccio integrato, coerente ed efficiente. Le nostre aree di specializzazione sono: Strategic & Reputation Risk, Regulatory Risk, Financial Risk, Operational Risk e Cyber Risk.
 In Italia operiamo con oltre 1200 professionisti con competenze multidisciplinari e specialistiche, utilizzando metodologie e tecnologie innovative per affrontare le sfide straordinarie del mercato.
 Siamo continuamente alla ricerca di persone di talento per rafforzare il nostro team, alle quali offriamo l’inserimento in un contesto inclusivo, collaborativo e premiante. Attrarre e conservare i migliori talenti è per noi fondamentale per continuare ad essere leader indiscussi nei servizi professionali e meta lavorativa di prim’ordine.
 About Deloitte
 I nostri servizi
 Deloitte offre servizi integrati di Audit, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro approccio unisce conoscenze multidisciplinari, esperienza a livello globale, innovazione e servizi di alta qualità. Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a concretizzare le proprie aspirazioni, fornendo loro gli strumenti per affrontare le sfide più complesse del business, in Italia e nel mondo. Crediamo fermamente che il nostro lavoro possa influenzare positivamente la comunità in cui operiamo.
 Il nostro purpose
 Make an impact that matters. Questo è il nostro obiettivo, e ciò che ci definisce. Significa fare la differenza per i nostri clienti, per i nostri colleghi e nella società, creando un impatto a lungo termine. Vogliamo essere la prima scelta dei clienti, la prima scelta dei talenti e i primi a lasciare un segno.
 I nostri valori
 Incoraggiamo la collaborazione, la diversità di pensiero e la capacità di pensare fuori dagli schemi. Con questo approccio aiutiamo i talenti a esprimere al meglio le proprie capacità. Per noi la diversity è un valore e il rispetto è al centro della nostra cultura inclusiva.
 La Nostra Talent Experience
 Chi lavora in Deloitte, fin dal primo giorno, si sente parte di un network che supporta e incoraggia i colleghi. Il percorso di crescita e di carriera consente di sviluppare le competenze e le capacità per avere successo. In un ambiente di lavoro che incoraggia la collaborazione e la creatività, il benessere delle nostre persone e la flessibilità sono al centro di una talent experience distintiva.
 Il nome Deloitte si riferisce a una o più delle seguenti entità: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, una società inglese a responsabilità limitata (“DTTL”), le member firm aderenti al suo network e le entità a esse correlate. DTTL e ciascuna delle sue member firm sono entità giuridicamente separate e indipendenti tra loro. DTTL (denominata anche “Deloitte Global”) non fornisce servizi ai clienti. Si invita a leggere l’informativa completa relativa alla descrizione della struttura legale di Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited e delle sue member firm all’indirizzo www.deloitte.com/about.
 Primary Location
 Roma
 Other Locations
 Italy
 Organization
 ACCOUNTING & INTERNAL CONTROLS
