 Should you have any queries, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit. Send them this link!

At Jamf, people are at the core of everything we do. We do what’s right for our customers, our employees, our communities and our world. We take pride in simplifying technology for tens of thousands of customers around the globe and helping organizations succeed with Apple. Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose to work in the office, connect 100% remote from your home, or find the blend that works best for you. What you’ll do at Jamf: At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The Security Operations Engineer will work with the Cloud and Delivery team to continue to build, automate and maintain cloud security services. They will be responsible for Security Design and Architecture, Log Collection, Security Incident Management, Identity and Access Management, Vulnerability and Patch management. They will be responsible for maintaining operation of the environment in accordance with our service level agreements and providing support to both our staff and customers. Security Operations Engineer will work a 3x12 plus public holidays schedule. The schedule for weekend will be Friday, Saturday and Sunday (between 6 AM - 6 PM). This role is remote in Poland. We are only able to accept applications for those based in Poland or have sponsorship to live and work in Poland. Responsibilities: 
Provides security expertise and guidance to a set of Cloud and Delivery teams. 
Responsible for the tools, configuration, administration and related processes around Security Information and Event Management.
Responsible for Web application firewall and related prevention, detection and mitigation of DDoS attack.
Performs regular firewall audits in line with our procedures. Provides the appropriate documentation, supporting evidence and follow up on identified issues requiring remediation.
Responsible for tooling, processes and follow up actions related to our vulnerability scanning and external port scanning needs and practices.
Handles the identification, planning and implementation of cloud hardening needs. Works collaboratively with Operations and other internal teams to communicate, document and implement.
Performs security incident analysis, response and remediation.
Participates in design and implementation of security automation workflows.
Maintains the technical documentation of processes and procedures.
Performs scripting duties in BASH and Python.
Maintains an advanced level of knowledge of JAMF Cloud Services and related products.
Other duties and special projects as assigned. 
Skills & Requirements: 
High School Diploma or GED Equivalent. (Required)
4 year / Bachelor's Degree. (Preferred)
A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered.
Minimum of 2 years IT security principles, security operations, techniques, and technologies. (Required)
Minimum of 2 years experience working with Linux/Unix command line interfaces, including shell or python scripting. (Required)
Minimum of 2 years experience with industry standard configuration management and deployment tools (e.g. Ansible, Chef, Puppet or other). (Required)
Experience with Amazon Web Services. (Preferred)
Experience in a current programming language. (e.g. Python, Golang). (Preferred)
Advanced knowledge of containerization concepts and Kubernetes. (Preferred)
Basic knowledge of MySQL or Postgres. (Preferred)
Any of the following are preferred: RHCE (RedHat Certified Engineer), AWS Solutions Architect Associate, AWS Certified Developer Associate, AWS Certified SysOps Associate, AWS Certified Security. 
How we help you reach your best potential: 
Named a Best Workplace in Technology, Fortune Magazine 2021.
We know that big ideas can come from anyone, so we empower everyone to make an impact. Our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
You will have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 50,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
Our volunteer time off allows employees to support and give back to our communities.
We encourage you to simply be you. We constantly seek and value different perspectives to ensure Jamf is a place where everyone feels comfortable and can be successful.
23 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world. 
What is a Jamf? You go above and beyond for others, are willing to help, and support the team around you. You value and learn from different perspectives. You are curious and resourceful, a problem-solver, self-driven and constantly improving. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You are someone who cares about doing the right thing. What does Jamf do? Jamf extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. We believe the experience of using a device at work or school should feel the same, and be as secure as, using a personal device. With Jamf, IT and security teams are able to confidently manage and protect Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV devices, easing the burden of updating, deploying and securing the data used by their end-users. Jamf’s purpose is to simplify work by helping organizations manage and secure an Apple experience that end-users love and organizations trust. We are free-thinkers, can-doers and problem crushers with a passion for helping customers empower their workforce to focus on their jobs, not the hassles of managing technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We have over 2,500 employees worldwide who are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each and every day. Get social with us and follow the conversation at #OneJamf

 For additional information on iCapital Network, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc

Acreto is looking for an experienced Golang developer to join our team.
 This developer will work directly with Data/Analytics branch of Acreto, for the purpose of creating scalable data pipelines that will be used for both internal and external reporting, data analysis, and eventually, ML solutions.
 You will help us build our Acreto Cloud Security platform coined by Gartner as Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).
 Join us! Come with us on our journey to change the face of security. We’re thrilled to work with you.
 Responsibilities:
· Development of Golang-based backend system components
· Active participation in the architecture of the backend
· Participation in the Code Review process
· Creation of Automated data validation processes for the purpose of reporting
· Design and execution of pipelines into Acreto’s data warehouse for both long term and short-term analysis
· Creating indices and nodes in elastic for the purpose of time series analysis.
 Must-Have Skills:
· Golang
· Elastic Cluster (7 or greater)
· DB (SQL, ORM, NOSQL)
· REST API
· Message Broker / Stream Processing: Kafka
· Microservice Architecture
· Network Protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP)
· Git Versioning, Issue Tracking, Merge/Pull Requests
· Docker
· Basic Python Knowledge
· Basic SQL Knowledge
 Nice to Have:
· Design and Implementation of Distributed Systems
· Public Key Infrastructure
· IPv6 fundamentals
· VPN fundamentals
· Public Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP, …)
· Test Automation
· CI/CD workflows
 How we work:
· The majority of the team works remotely, but we have offices in the US and Europe.
· We need availability during European business hours
 This is a full-time, long-term position. We are NOT looking for agencies for this position.
 About Acreto
End-to-end, Zero-Trust security to protect anything, anywhere. One security from one provider to protect all your systems.Acreto seeks to democratize security. We have lived in a world where security consists of stacks of bulky, inflexible solutions that do not meet the needs of all users and require huge amounts of overhead to implement and operate. In a world of increasing insecurity, and with more and more assets being moved to a digital space, one of the great challenges of our time is securing our data, our businesses, and our lives. Acreto seeks to democratize the security of our digital spaces by providing an all-inclusive, robust, and customizable SASE platform for all.Join us on our journey to provide one of the most valuable assets in an uncertain world: security. As a member of the Acreto team, you will be engaged in an environment of brilliant, motivated problem-solvers, with a passion for building a game-changing security architecture; designing elegant and intuitive User front end control; crafting robust and meaningful representations of security data; and researching cutting edge cyber-security AI.

job_title: React Developer at people first s.r.l
description:
Chi siamo? Siamo una community di professionisti informatici, ricercatori di nuovi talenti e marketers con un obiettivo: le persone al centro del nostro futuro. Chi sei? 
Hai esperienza sviluppando con React.js da al meno 3 anni? 
Lavori con JavaScript in completa autonomia? 
Sei pronto/a ad accettare una sfida per un nostro importante cliente? 
Se la risposta è SI, sei pronto ad unirti alla nostra Community “Beije - People First”!! 
Chi ci piacerebbe incontrare? Per noi "la passione fa la differenza", ci piace lavorare con colleghi innamorati, come noi, del mondo dell’Information Technology (qui siamo Code Addicted!) La persona che stiamo cercando: 
Ha già una prima esperienza di lavoro su React.js in autonomia 
Ha una forte dimestichezza nell’uso di JavaScript 
Lavora autonomamente con HTML e CSS 
Dove lavorerai? 
Milano / Remoto 
Perché dovresti essere dei nostri? 
Per far parte di un team di persone alleate e collaborative 
Per affrontare sfide professionali con colleghi pronti a sostenere il tuo talento 
Per essere al centro delle attenzioni di un HR team sempre alla ricerca del wellbeing 
Per lavorare in modalità full remote ma non in modalità full alone! 
Per entrare in un percorso a sostegno della crescita delle tue skills e del tuo progetto professionale: Il nostro obbiettivo è mettere le persone al centro e vogliamo scoprire insieme a te, tutte le tue potenzialità. 
E in più offriamo... 
RAL competitiva e commisurata all'effettiva esperienza, sia per P.I, che per Contratto da dipendente 
Formazione continua con accesso a LinkedIn Learning. 
Webinar, Pillole, canale Youtube per essere sempre aggiornati 
Assistenza sanitaria integrativa. 
Il tuo viaggio insieme a noi sarà come consulente, ma la community “Beije” è sempre al tuo fianco! (Ti seguiamo anche dal cliente)

Your Mission
 The Sales Engineer will focus on partnering with the Sales Managers to generate revenue with technical ownership of the opportunity pursuits throughout the sales cycle. You, as a Sales Engineer, must possess a winning combination of business and technical skills, the ability to present and demonstrate our solutions to a broad spectrum of audiences while building strong relationships and handing technical objections and issues throughout the entire sales cycle.
 This role is based in Finland and will eventually require travel.
 What You'll Do At UiPath
  Deliver on UiPath’s value propositions in a persuasive and executive manner
Demonstrate ability to relate client business challenges to UiPath capabilities
Articulate high level solutions to fit client needs and environment during a deal process 
Learn the benefits of new and exciting technologies and how to integrate with UiPath
Drive end-user adoption of UiPath products through events, seminars, webinars, technical training, and other activities as appropriate
Work closely with the Customer Success and Professional Services teams to make solutions a reality for the customer
Support Marketing initiatives through evangelism activities, including writing blogs, speaking in UiPath webinars and other industry events
Contribute to clients’ business objectives by offering an industry-relevant perspective on markets and industries
Lead technical engagements across sales process
 What You'll Bring To The Team
  Ability to work in harmony with the UiPath values; Humble, Bold, Immersed, and Fast
Good balance of sales, business, and technical skills
Ability to build and maintain customer relationships that will be significantly leveraged in driving additional business
Ability to influence client technology decisions with a UiPath solution
Ability to validate proposed solutions and architectures, and create appropriate messaging for sales and technical staff
Fluent written and spoken English and Finnish
Excellent presentation skills
Previous experience working with UiPath, or another RPA platform is desirable 
 Legal Disclosure
 At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.
 UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ talentacquisition@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.
 This notice together with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use of this website and any other documents we mention here are meant to inform you on what personal data about you we collect, use, disclose, share or otherwise process when you are applying for a job at UiPath or when UiPath contacts you for recruitment purposes. Please read this policy carefully to understand our views and practices on how we protect your personal data.
 All applicants from United States have rights under Federal Employment Laws, including Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set. Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media. We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi  that makes Talend special. To support our growth, we are looking for a cloud developer to integrate the team in charge of developing new features for Dataops platform where we develop all services needed to store customers artifacts (custom logic implemented with tools like Studio, Pipeline Designer or Data Preparation) and their related configuration. The project is also in charge of scheduling those artifacts with their appropriate configuration and collect the output logs and metrics and the Engines where the executions take place. Millions of workloads run over this platform every week. The ideal candidate should be well-versed with the entire software development life-cycle. Apart from possessing strong technical skills, she or he should be opened to technical and non technical options that will help improve the product. You will work on Java with Springboot. It uses Docker, Kubernetes and modern CI / CD technology. The backends in use are PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka related backends (Kafka, Kstream, Kafka connect). 
 Integrate the team in charge of developing and deploying in production new features for Dataops Platform
 Pay attention to monitoring/alerting on service team is responsible for, and be able to act on them during business hours
 Design and develop the API for the new services under development with strong focus on performance
 Collaborating with other team members in investigating and resolving technical and performance issues
 Participate in architecture discussions
 Implementing tactical and long-terms product scalability, maintainability improvements (could be architecture, code, script or documentation related)
 Participate on Customer issues investigation 
 At least around 2 years of practical experience in software development
 Willingness to work in a large organization
 Eager to learn and progress on every aspect of software engineering responsibility
 In-depth knowledge and practical experience in Java and Spring
 Ability to communicate smoothly, effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing.
 Experience with services scalability, HA.
 Experience with messaging tools like Kafka and Active MQ
 Experience with DBs like Postgresql and MongoDB
 Experience in API design 
 Experience in working within a distributed & international agile team environment
 Ability to work independently, strong interpersonal and communications skills
 Strong ownership, proactively communication and identification of topics to work on
 Experience with Kubernetes/Docker/Helm/Flux would be a plus
 Experience with high demanding environments (SLA 99.5% and more) would be a plus
 Experience on Apache Karaf would be a big plus 
Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way: 
 7,250+ global customers rely on Talend for their data health
 Named a Leader for Data Integration Tools by Gartner (for the 7th year in a row)
 Named a Leader for Data Quality Solutions by Gartner (for the 5th year in a row)
 Named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Enterprise Data Fabric (for the 2nd time in a row)
 Top 100 best Leadership teams, compensation and benefits 2022 by Comparably.com
 Ranked in the DBTA “100 Companies that Matter Most in Data” 
We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built. As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, develop and retain the most hardworking people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of business need, merit, capability and equality of opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us via email to request an accommodation at accommodation@talend.com. We appreciate your interest in Talend. By submitting your application, you confirm you have read and acknowledge Talend’s Recruitment Privacy Notice . We may use automated decision making of your responses during our evaluation of your job application, for instance, to determine if your residence or proficiency fits the requirements for the job opportunity. You can exercise your privacy rights, including your right to object to automated decision making (if applicable), by filling out this privacy form or contacting privacy@talend.com . Notice to Recruiters and Staffing Agencies Talend does not accept any unsolicited applications from third parties – for our current agency policy please check here

Hi there! And this is our QA Engineer role for those who want to turn ideas into reality using test scripts, automation, and maybe a little magic. Tasks in the role 
To test the front-end and back-end parts of the tool (manual and automated testing, a bit of work with load testing).
Improving the quality of the product.
Making technical decisions and implementing them.
Developing and improving testing processes.
Helping the technical support team solve difficulties encountered by users when working with the product. 
Who we are looking for 
Strong knowledge of testing methodologies.
Good experience with Java 8+.
Knowledge of the TestNG and JUnit frameworks.
Experience with UI E2E testing.
Experience in API testing. 
They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if 
You have experience with MongoDB.
Experience with CI (Teamcity/Jenkins/Gitlab CI).
Experience with MQ.
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes. 
A Bit About The Team Our product has been really successful on the market, and now we’re looking for teammates who will help us expand our presence and reach more customers. The Lion Team consists of back-end and front-end developers, quality assurance, UI and UX specialists, and, of course, product owners. Our team is independent. All technical solutions for product growth and improvements are made by our team. SCRUM is our base development process. As a result, we have a team of responsible and self-motivated members. Technology we use 
Tests: Java 14, Junit5, AssertJ, Allure, Playwright, Moon, Postman
Back-end: Java 17, Spring Boot, MongoDB, Google PubSub, Kubernetes
Front-end: Javascript + typescript, React + Redux + Redux Saga. 
We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably 
Work format Choice: It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
Flexible working day start
Health insurance coverage
Working from a modern coworking space (or working from home)
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
English and Spanish courses
Gifts for employees

Position:
 Business Analyst Associate Manager
 Job Description:
 Business Analyst Manager is a connector between IT department and business (Arrow in Europe & US) as well as external customers & vendors. The purpose of the role is to implement and maintain application solution around ERP system and its ecosystem. The person will also manage Business Analysts.
 What You Will Be Doing at Arrow?
  Leading process and applications improvement initiatives through the disciplined use of measurements, accountability, analysis and discussion of process alternatives
Planning, managing, and controlling the activities of a team that provides operational support for a business segment
Managing staff of business analysts by insuring the respect of tasks and documents quality and respect of deadlines (BRD, FDD, UAT etc.)
Follow-up the Business Analysts targets against the whole DaVinci program planning or any other program that can be assign to the team
Organizing, leading and facilitating cross-functional project teams (sales/Ops/Compliance & potentially Finance domains)
Developing metrics that provide data for process improvement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities
Performing regular reviews with the Business stakeholders and the BTO management on your team project assignments
Measuring performance against business requirements, aligning improvement to performance shortfalls
Providing consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance inside the BTO organization
 What Are We Looking For?
  5 years of related experience
Previous experience in people management
Previous experience in project management
Knowledge of MS AX Dynamics or SAP or Oracle, Salesforce application, B2B EDI projects
Fluent English
Great communication and analytical skills
 What is in it For You?
  Permanent contract with 3 months' probation period
Interesting career development opportunities in a quickly growing environment
Working with people across the world
Private medical care program
 About Us
 Arrow's enterprise computing solutions (ECS) business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to the world's leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.
 Find out more about us in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5Za_pHRbzI

 PL-Gdansk, Poland (Aleja Grunwaldzka) 40 Hrs

 Full time

job_title: Empleo Flutter Mobile Developer | Trabajo Online
description:
En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares. Más de 400 empresas, incluídas Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., han contratado a desarrolladores de Turing.
 An early-stage startup committed to transforming sexual and reproductive healthcare for LGBTQIA+ individuals through a mobile-first digital clinic is looking for a Flutter Mobile Developer. The selected candidate will be responsible for sustaining the software throughout the product lifecycle, including the layout, development, verification, and bug fixes. The platform is boosting access to remote care and empowering users to take control of their health by providing them with customized services and features tailored to their needs. The company has managed to raise close to $2.5 mn+ in funding.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Create scalable Dart code and pages with high fidelity designs
Within the application, create and modify features
Use various algorithms to improve the user experience
Collaborate closely with the product manager to gain a thorough understanding of the requirements and functionalities to be implemented
Work on the existing app and iterate to develop and implement additional functionality in accordance with the business objectives
Make product enhancement recommendations and feature proposals to increase the business's commercial viability
Contribute to the development of the algorithm
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 2+ years of relevant professional experience as a mobile developer
Experience with Firebase services
Familiarity with the general mobile landscape, design principles, and emerging technologies
Understanding of the full mobile development life cycle, including building and testing
Experience in releasing Flutter Apps to both PlayStore and App Store
Knowledge of using version control and continuous integration
Experience in writing clean, maintainable, and testable code, following the SOLID principles
A portfolio of app development, especially within the Flutter framework, is nice to have
Curious about the future of healthcare and new technologies
Excitement to join a diverse team with a focus on delivering social impact
Fluency in written and spoken English with excellent skills in technical communication

job_title: Fruitz - Remote Freelance Spanish (Spain) Localisation Specialist
description:
We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. Bumble is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. 
 In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc). 
 Bumble is looking for an enthusiastic, creative and tech-savvy translator to work on a freelance basis for Fruitz, our dating app that focuses on the GenZ audience. You need to be able to localise and review all of Fruitz’s content into Spanish (Spain), targeting the GenZ audience in Spain to ensure that the brand’s voice feels and sounds natural in this market.
 You will be part of our Localisation team which focuses on localising Bumble, Badoo and Fruitz through the adaptation of linguistically and culturally centred messages and concepts to move our international users’ hearts and minds. Our mission is to spread our products’ messages around the world, making all our users feel as if the products were designed within their culture.
 You will need to be able to work remotely and deliver translations within our 24-hour/48-hour SLAs (depending on the market). 
   Localise and review content for web and mobile applications to reflect local jargon, phraseologies and nuances
Advise the team on unique regional requirements and cultural differences to maximise the impact of the products in the local market 
Transcreate marketing and SEO/ASO copy
Review, proofread and test translations within the context of the application/feature to continuously improve copy quality
   Fluency in Spanish (Spain) and a good command of English
Based in Spain would be a plus
Degree qualification in Copywriting, Translation, Journalism or other similar language-related area; or equivalent work experience
Experience in copywriting and writing for the GenZ audience on web or mobile applications
Understanding of local social media scene and dating industry
Highly committed Internet and mobile user 
   You are deeply passionate about Bumble Inc.’s vision and values
You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment where you communicate daily with your manager and other translators
You are positive and committed with a 'can-do' attitude and a flexible approach
You are a problem solver and a forward thinker
You have excellent time management skills and you know how to manage multiple priorities, breaking large projects into manageable pieces
You have great communication skills, both verbal and written

#railway #engineering #consulting IKOS is the European leading consulting firm specialized in railway engineering. We are committed to participate in the ecological transition and to develop the means of transportation of the future that are safe and durable. With 1200 consultants on our team, supported by our R&D hub IKOS Lab, we provide you the opportunity of an international career in a multicultural environment. The Group currently holds 24 offices in 12 countries (France, Spain, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Italy, the UK, the USA, Canada, Morocco and Portugal). Since our creation in 2005, we strive for excellence to meet our clients’ needs in signalling and control systems, rolling stock, low voltage and telecoms, energy and high voltage, as well as infrastructures and tracks. Your role To keep on building IKOS’ growth and strengthen our engineering team in Belgium, we are currently looking for engineers, keen to work on projects in the railway or energy sector. Your tasks will include: 
Be in charge of activities in railway projects
Manage a project in order to complete a work package
Analyze project requirements and define the appropriate strategy
Provide pieces of advice on technical problems
Monitor the progress of the project
Participate in coordinating activities in the field 
Your profile 
Master’s Degree in Engineering in the field of electromechanics, electronics, telecommunications, software, infrastructure, mechanics, electricity or construction
A first experience as an engineer is an asset
Flexibility, initiative, autonomy and team spirit are your key words
Excellent communication skills (professional and concise)
Good knowledge of French and/or Dutch 
We thank all applicants for their interest however only those under consideration will be contacted. #Belgium

We've been engineering powerful machines and transforming how the world works for more than 60 years. 16 countries, 32 nationalities, almost 3,000 employees, 175 dealers in EMEA, and a top-notch Innovation Centre. That's us. Doosan Bobcat EMEA.

Our heritage of innovative solutions and technological advancements, powered by our passionate people, place us as an industry leader. Our people are talented, smart and driven and work collaboratively to revolutionize how things get done. With us, you will be supported to be at your best and find career opportunities that will challenge, inspire, and reward you.

Sales Engineer - Portable Equipment
Home based with frequent traveling (Company car provided) in Paris and Lyon area mainly but not limited

Position Summary

You will be helping our French customers grow their business with clear ideas trough a day to day business relationship. In order to achieve this, your responsibility will be to manage, evaluate, develop, support, drive, grow, shape and consult several customers of different Doosan Portable Power product groups.

Role & Responsibility

Constant monitoring, development and evaluation of the network’s performance and development
Interpretation of the market trend and figuring out basic actions to adapt our structure to meet end users demands
Supporting the customers and developing their relationship with our brand
Demand planning & market forecasting
Network development and restructuration when necessary

Job Requirement

University degree in Engineering or equivalent
Fluent in English
Self-reliability and dependability
Experience in sales management in the automotive or industrial goods sector si advantageous
Willing to travel extensively (over 50% of the time)

Junior talented sales engineers are welcome to apply too !

WHY WORK WITH BOBCAT

International working teams (colleagues from 32 different countries)
Dynamic, inspirational, and innovative working environment
An opportunity to be a part of a global market leader
Possibility for further personal and professional development
Many different trainings and development opportunities
Career growth through internal mobility

At Doosan Bobcat, we support equal opportunities, value diversity of skills, perspectives and cultures and encourage applications from candidates from all backgrounds.

Are you interested? Do not hesitate and send us your resume!

Offrant des outils et des solutions pour lutter contre la fraude. As a leading expert for Digital Platform Building and Customer Experience Innovation, NETCONOMY is shaping the digital leadership of its clients. We help brands to build flexible and scalable digital platforms, with top-notch technologies by SAP, Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure. NETCONOMY has 20 years of experience and employs close to 500 professionals across Europe. By introducing and driving innovation initiatives around customer experience, we support clients on the road of expanding their core business in the digital world. YOUR JOB
  You are a CI and CD expert in a cross-functional team aiming to standardizing CI and CD practices across the company’s development teams
You improve developer experience and productivity

 Your Skills

 OUR OFFER 
  Benefit from a wide range of training or foster your talent in our in-house NETCADEMY

Whether in the chillout lounge at the pool table or in our modern furnished workspaces - our stunning offices keep you motivated
Best-tech equipment, a mobility subsidy, discounts at our partner companies and all the other standard stuff you would expect
 Note in accordance with 
9 Abs. 2 GlBG: The minimum monthly salary is € 3,455.00 gross / month when employed full-time as stated in the collective bargaining agreement. The actual salary depends on experience, qualification and education.

About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet. As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎 Do you have a weird thing for bugs? No, not insects – the computer ones 🖥 If so, you’re the one for us. We’re looking for a Junior Application Security Engineer to join our Information Security team. But, it’s not that easy – remember, we Never Settle 💪 You’ll need to be able to show your passion with bug bounty findings, community talks, certifications, and blog posts on your interest. If this is ‘so you’, you know where to find us… 👀 What You’ll Be Doing 
Providing knowledge, experience and support across all our security teams, and wider Technology and Business teams, as well as associated initiatives
Performing source code reviews across Revolut’s projects
Performing web and mobile app security testing
Managing and reviewing external testing and bug bounty programs
Innovating & building tools and solutions to add to our arsenal of security monitoring and testing procedures
Getting involved in the Software Development Life Cycle, embedding security architecture principles and efficient risk-based change review processes to support our product releases
Thinking of and implementing new ways to automate and improve security across our business 
What You'll Need 
1+ year of experience in the information security field
Experience performing security testing (code review and web/mobile application security testing)
Experience with Java, Swift, Python, Scala
An understanding of the technology stack
An ability to automate and script your work (Python, bash scripts)
A love for solving problems
SAST/DAST skills
The ability to explain complex things in an easy way
An eye for details
Experience developing security tools
To be familiar with automations
An understanding of DevSecOps 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. At G-P, our mission is to break down barriers to global business, enabling opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With remote-first and diverse teams all around the world, our people are the key to achieving this mission. That’s why we trust our Dream Team members with the flexibility and autonomy to do their best and most innovative work, encourage and support their personal growth and career development, and believe in recognition for a job well done. The work you’ll be a part of here will have a positive impact on people and their work/life possibilities around the world. Our industry-leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platform™ enables our customers to expand and grow into 180+ countries, creating more opportunities for global success – without requiring entity or subsidiary setup. Beyond the power of our platform, we never forget that behind every hire is a human being. And that brings us to you. Beyond a competitive compensation and benefits package, what we offer to all employees is the clear and simple promise of Opportunity Made Possible. Come expand your skills in new ways and experience the thrill of impacting the way the world works, today and in the future. As a Human Resource Specialist for our Shared Service Centre (Romanian speaker), you will have responsibility for supporting professionals we engage on behalf of our clients throughout the region and assisting in the management of the back-end HR, accounting, and legal service providers that support the infrastructure of our international entities. We are looking for someone with experience throughout EMEA region. 
Support key employee life cycle processes such as new professionals, data management, absence managements, transfers, leavers
Preparing global HR documentation, i.e. employment contracts, employment contract amendments, HR policies, benefits enrolment documentation, payroll enrolment documentation, country-specific onboarding guides, resignation letters
Organize and maintain employee records via our proprietary Platform: input, update and maintain customer & professional personal data, process various forms related to documenting human resources activities such as new hire, change of status, benefits, terminations, etc.
Benefits administration on behalf of customers & professionals
Assisting with payroll preparation by providing relevant data, like absences, bonus and leaves
Carry out audits and checks on data changes to ensure accurate and timely payment for the professionals
Participation in the continuous improvement of HR processes and assist in maintaining standard operating procedures and policies up to date
Communicate effectively both verbally and in written form with professionals and our customers to explain and resolve queries and concerns (via email, phone and other means of communication)
Support with review and renewal of company policies, and legal compliance
Communicate and liaise with GP partners/vendors, including insurance vendors, local service providers, pension providers
First point of contact for employees on any HR related inquiries 
3-5 years of HR shared service experience
Proficient in both written and verbal English
Romanian language skills required
Customer Service focussed
Basic knowledge of labour legislation throughout EMEA 
Ability to work in international team comprised of team members in different locations and from different cultures and 
G-P helps growing companies unlock their full potential by making it possible to build highly skilled global teams in days instead of months. Through our SaaS-based platform, we help find, hire, onboard, pay, and manage team members, quickly and compliantly, to expand growth opportunities for everyone, everywhere – without the hassle of setting up local subsidiaries or branch offices. G-P. Global Made Possible. G-P is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status. G-P also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at careers@g-p.com.

AddSearch is an innovative SaaS company providing advanced and easy-to-use search solutions for websites of companies of all sizes and sectors in over 50 countries globally. A well-designed site search solution helps companies improve online sales conversion and customer satisfaction and decrease customer support costs through easier and more accurate information discovery. Site search is a well-under-utilized opportunity for vast amounts of companies across the globe, and we are seeing a growing interest in this space. 
 We are headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, with a team of 20+ people worldwide. Our team is highly experienced professionals who together have decades worth of experience in creating online software.
 The role
 We seek a Dev/Sec Ops engineer passionate about information security and a cloud-first approach. You will be part of our international, fully remote developer team. Besides the hands-on work, it will also be part of your duties to contribute to the design and implementation of systems and processes that maintain and enhance our information security posture.
 Responsibilities
  Oversee the internal CI/CD pipelines.
Identifying vulnerabilities and weaknesses in our current network
Putting "Infrastructure as Code" into Practice
Keeping up to date and ensuring our continuous compliance with security standards and related regulations such as SOC2, PCI-DSS, GDPR
Overseeing incident response planning as well as the investigation of security breaches 
Coordinating activities related to security assessments and audits
Supporting sales teams on information security-related questions
Design, implement and document scalable infrastructures on AWS
Provide technical help and educate teams on the cloud infrastructure and security
Develop and document standards and best practices, and mentor junior engineers
 Requirements
  Located in EU
Degree in computer science or a technology-related field.
5+ years of hands-on experience in designing, testing, and operating secure and automated infrastructure
Solid knowledge of various information security frameworks, such as SOC2 and PCI-DSS and good knowledge of regulations related to information security, data privacy, and data protection (e.g. GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA)
Ability to educate a non-technical audience about various security measures.
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.
Experience with Docker
Experience creating and managing CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins
Knowledge of logging/monitoring/insights tools such as Prometheus and Grafana. Recognising, designing, and architecting modern, scalable, fault-tolerant SaaS frameworks
Experience running services in the AWS cloud
Knowledge of infrastructure provisioning tools like Terraform/Pulumi and IT automation tools like Ansible
Solid understanding and expertise in the Linux operating system
 Why AddSearch?
  We’re a Finnish company that strongly believes in creating a positive and collaborative work environment - we care about our employees’ happiness and encourage work-life balance.
We’re growing quickly and have a fantastic team that is easy to get along with.
We offer a competitive remuneration package - basic salary + bonus + options. 
We are 100 % remote, with the option to use the office in Helsinki if you want to. 
The company's language is English

Tridge (https://www.tridge.com/ ) is a global agricultural trading platform that makes cross-border trade easy and frictionless. With our proprietary global sourcing hub, we go beyond matching buyers and sellers of 15,000 agricultural goods. This is facilitated through our one-stop fulfillment service that includes due diligence, supplier certificate verification, contract negotiation, packaging, shipping, customs, and many more. Powering the global sourcing hub is our data and intelligence services. Our exclusive database covers 11 million data points of agricultural goods and collects 50,000 data points each day. With greater transparency and real-time updates in price, quality, and trade volumes, Tridge removes the information asymmetry prevalent in many markets. 
 Tridge career page: https://www.tridge.com/career
 Tridge official blog: https://blog.tridge.com/ 
Platform Sales Specialist will be responsible for business development and sales for platform solutions/products. 
 Manage the end-to-end sales pipeline and execute sales activities, including cold calling, emails, online meetings, and in-person meetings
 Account management and daily conversations with clients, deliver required results on business reviews through a data-driven consultative approach
 Collect, analyze, and deliver customer feedback to the management team and product team
 Work closely with sales manager by contributing sales strategies
 Collaborate with the Global Fulfillment Teams to conduct sales activities to convert & achieve Fulfillment Digital Integration
 Consistently manage enterprise sales accounts for seamless customer experience & strengthen long-term strategic partnerships
 Coordinate with the Platform Strategy Team to successfully align with Tridge’s global strategy & vision 
 Up to 3 years of sales experience in global B2B products
 Sales and/or marketing experience in global exhibition/medium-small size tradeshows in the agri-food industry is a big plus
 Able to lead platform solution sales at the frontline
 Prospecting skills, cold calling, business sales experience
 Excellent communication skills, business acumen, and Sales DNA
 Strategic planning ability to reproduce sales success cases
 Business Fluency in English 
 Self-starter who is willing to initiate new tasks
 Take strong ownership in utilizing the company asset to grow tremendously in his/her career
 Eagerness to finish the initiated tasks
 Believe in Tridge’s vision and potential, and is willing go through new challenges together as a team
 Open to new ideas and comfortable exchanging constructive feedback 
 Data-driven intelligence: +11.6B Product Data Points, +0.6 Billion Price Data Points and +11.5 Billion Trade Data Contact Management
 Global expansion: A 550-member team working in 60 countries around the world is planned to expand to 1,000 within this year.
 Trusted online reputation: Inflow of more than 1 million global top tier business traffic from multinational companies, consulting, universities, etc. due to Google SEO optimization
 Cultural Diversity: Working with people of various nationalities and aiming for a rapidly changing horizontal organizational culture
 Trade Digitalization: Leading the digitalization of the B2B global trade market 
Get to know more about Tridge from our press release: https://www-forbes-com.cdn.ampproject.org/c/s/www.forbes.com/sites/rubyleung/2021/07/13/softbank-backed-korean-agriculture-marketplace-valued-at-500-million-after-latest-funding/amp/ https://www.nytimes.com/2022/05/23/business/global-food-trade-tridge.html

A US-based global software company building innovative and refined device management solutions is looking for an Android Engineer. The engineer will be responsible for actively owning features or systems and defining their long-term health. The company is developing essential cross-platform solutions for mobile devices by leveraging the power of state-of-the-art technologies. This is a long-term full-time position requiring 6+ hours overlap with the PST time zone. The company has managed to raise more than $2.5mn in funding so far.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Develop advanced applications for the Android platform and devices
Transform designs and wireframes into high-quality codes
Ensure the high performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
Troubleshoot to identify bottlenecks and fix bugs
Keep discovering and implementing new technologies in the applications
Work closely with UI and UX designers and other cross-functional teams
Make sure the developed application conforms to user specifications
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as an Android engineer
Should possess proficiency in Kotlin/Java programming language
Must be well-versed with Android design principles, and Android SDK
Expertise in working with languages like React Native and Typescript is essential

Good understanding of the general mobile landscapes, trends, and architectures
A firm grasp of source control systems like Git, Merging, Branching, Pull Requests, etc. will be helpful

We are looking to hire a CPU Compiler Engineer for an exciting and fun role at NVIDIA. We craft outstanding compilers that realise the potential of NVIDIA's Grace CPU designed for the world's largest AI and HPC workloads: https://www.nvidia.com/en-in/data-center/grace-cpu/. Our compiler organisation makes its mark on every CPU, GPU, DPU and SoC product that NVIDIA builds. Would you like to be part of this outstanding organisation?
 We need you design, develop and tune optimising compilers for Grace. This C/C++ compiler will be key to performance of AI and HPC software that is deployed on NVIDIA Data Centres, on the cloud and at super computing centres around the world. In this role you will solve critical problems working alongside an outstanding engineering team with vision in Compiler technology and systems software, doing what you enjoy! If this sounds like a fun challenge, we want to hear from you!!
   Work with a geographically distributed partner organisation to understand, modify and improve CPU Compiler SW at NVIDIA.
Contribute new features and optimisation techniques.
Develop compiler SW that is optimised for compile time and code size.
Be part of a team that is at the centre of AI, HPC and data centre technologies.
   BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience
Compiler or related academic/project experience.
Knowledge of Language Front-Ends or Compiler optimisation and code generation modules.
Strong hands-on C++ programming skills
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
   Familiarity with Embedded Processors such as RISC-V, ARM or DSPs.
Familiarity with industry standard compiler infrastructure such as LLVM.
Knowledge of AI algorithms, scientific HPC applications and related code optimisations.
 With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people on the planet working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our world-class engineering teams are expanding fast. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a genuine passion for technology, we want to hear from you.
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

THE SCOPE With 30 years of history, today Gaming1 is one of the international leaders in both land-based and online games of chance (casino games, sports betting and poker). Its evolution at the heart of innovation is accompanied by a diversification and specialization of positions, with the creation of new cutting-edge jobs. As part of its sustained growth, Gaming1 is looking for a Software Engineer in Test Automation to join its QC team. As a Software Engineer in test automation, you will be part of the QC center that is in charge of testing the things we carry out. You will be part of a close-knit team made up of people with different skills. You will provide support within our product teams that use an agile working method. The team wants to welcome a new developer to be responsible for developing new automated tests. You will work independently on technical questions relating to development while communicating closely with your team members and collaborating with other teams. YOUR ROLE 
Continuously develop and maintain the test and analysis tools
Create automated test scenarios
Be responsible for planning and carrying out automated tests
Make reports about automated tests
Anticipate and hunt down bugs 
YOUR PROFILE 
Bachelor’s degree in IT and knowledge of javascript
At least 2 years’ experience in testing
Knowledge of ISTQB
Knowledge of automated testing tools (testcafe, cucumber, selenium, etc.)
Knowledge of at least one performance-oriented tool (K6, junit, load runner, etc.)
Open minded
End to end view capability
Stress resistant
Curious and quality oriented 
What We Offer As well as having a unique experience - centered around our values of pleasure, team spirit, performance, boldness and integrity - alongside 1,200 employees around the world, we offer: 
the opportunity to contribute to the international development of a family company from Liège
the chance to take part in a human and entrepreneurial adventure within a solid group
a friendly work environment that is adapted to reaching optimal performance
leadership by talents, values, trust and autonomy
the opportunity to progress and specialize with our internal mobility system
a competitive salary package with several perks
the possibility to work remotely up to 50% for a good work-life balance 
THE INTERVIEW PROCESS Gaming1's NEWS In May 2021, Gaming1 will move to the heart of the Ardent City. Immerse yourself in our new offices. We are certified Top Employers 2022! We are the first game of chance company (casino, sports betting and poker) to receive this certification, among some 80 companies certified in our country, and including only 15% in Wallonia. The health of our employees is our priority, we offer 50% remote working, as well as health and safety measures. Ort / Branche Nürnberg/ remote - IT-Dienstleistung Hast Du Lust auf spannende und vielfältige Projekte, die Du mitgestalten kannst? Hast Du zudem Spaß im Umgang mit Menschen und der Entwicklung von komplexen Architekturen und Lösungen? Dann werde Teil von uns. Höchste Qualität und Partnerschaft auf Augenhöhe – darauf setzen wir bei Cegeka. Denn kurzfristige Erfolge sind zwar wichtig, aber nicht das, worauf es uns als Familienunternehmen mit über 25-jähriger Geschichte ankommt. Mit mehr als 6.000 Mitarbeiter/-innen in elf europäischen Ländern identifizieren und erschließen wir die Potenziale neuer Technologien, ohne uns von Hypes blenden zu lassen, und entwickeln maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, die unsere Kunden den entscheidenden Schritt voranbringen. Beginn / Dauer ab sofort/ unbefristet Aufgaben 
Durchführung der Datenherkunftsanalyse – in enger Abstimmung mit den Business Analysts.
Konzeption und Entwicklung der ETL-Prozesse.
Monitoring von Systemabläufen, Schnittstellen und ETL-Prozessen.
Sicherstellung der Bewirtschaftung für das zentralen Data Warehouse.
Erarbeitung und Weiterentwicklung der Data Warehouse Architektur.
Mitarbeit und Umsetzung von Projekten im Bereich Data Warehouse.
Überführung von Anforderungen und Problemen der Fachbereiche in strukturierte Konzepte.
Überleitung betriebswirtschaftlicher Themen in die Konzeption von Datenmodellen.
Zusammenführung und Vereinheitlichung unterschiedlicher Datenquellen. 
Qualifikation 
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium, Schwerpunkt Informatik o.Ä. oder eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung und Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit Fokus auf Datenbanken und ETL.
Gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen ETL-Prozesse und ETL-Tools, bevorzugt Informatica.
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenbanken, bevorzugt Oracle.
Erfahrungen mit DWH-Konzepten.
Hands-on-Mentalität und ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen.
Idealerweise weitere Kenntnisse in der Software-Entwicklung, z. B. Java.
Hohes Maß an Leistungsbereitschaft sowie eine selbstständige, eigenverantwortliche und teamorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Deutschkenntnisse, mindestens auf C2-Level. 
Unser Angebot Was du allerdings sicher noch nicht weißt, ist: Warum Du bei uns arbeiten solltest: 
Du stehst bei uns im Mittelpunkt.
Deine Meinung wird gehört und Du kannst vieles selbst beeinflussen.
Wir bieten Dir den Freiraum, den Du brauchst, um Deine Arbeit richtig gut zu machen.
Dafür interessieren wir uns nicht nur für Deine Stärken, sondern auch für Deine Schwächen um sie zusammen mit Dir anzugehen.
Denn wir wollen Dir jeden Tag die Möglichkeit geben, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. In die Richtung, die Dir am besten gefällt. 
Hard Facts: 
We care about you! Dein Arbeitsort ist freiwählbar – Ob im Büro oder Remote, wir bieten Dir ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität.
„Duz“-Kultur.
Großes Unternehmen aber Start-Up-Feeling in Nürnberg.
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege.
Eigenes Budget für Weiterbildungen, welches Du selbst verwalten kannst.
Freie Wahl Deines Notebooks und Deines Smartphones.
Ein dynamisches Team und eine flexible Arbeitsumgebung mit modernsten Technologien.
Regelmäßige Fortbildungen und Zertifizierungen, damit Du immer up-to-date bist.
Ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit spannenden Aufgaben.
Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle nach Deinen Bedürfnissen für eine dauerhaft ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance.
Eine ausgeprägte Open-Door-Mentalität, in der neue Ideen gerne gehört werden.
Attraktive Prämienprogramme für gute Arbeit, gute Ideen und Deine eigenen Projekte

Description
 Hi, we are Storyteq! 👋🏼
 Storyteq is a Creative Marketing Operations Platform that empowers digital creative leads and marketing leaders, in top global brands and agencies to optimize and scale the way they create and manage digital creative assets. We believe creativity takes time, but creative production shouldn't.
 Since 2016 our mission has been to revolutionise the way creative assets are created and managed throughout global organisations. Magic happens when we let technology empower creativity in this way.
 Our endless curiosity and relentless commitment to our customers lies at the heart of our approach to solving problems. This common mission is weaved into our values: we take risks (be bold), thrive on change (move fast), and lead with trust (stay familiar).
 About The Job
 We want to grow even faster and create even more innovative and empowering tools for our users - for this our tech is essential! You will be a part of one of our development teams and work directly with other developers, DevOps Engineers, and Product Owners.
 Your role will revolve around all the different elements that will bring our product into that future. This includes implementing new features, scaling existing capabilities, and making our product more amazing every day for all our users.
 The team works in sprints where goals are always a combination of product roadmap features and your team’s own technology input. That way we make sure we always keep our technology modern and our product on track!
 Your main responsibilities:
  Building new features and technological innovations in our Node.js back-end as part of one of our Development Teams
Understand and help define our platform's architecture together with the team
Challenge our product and team members to continuously develop themselves and our product
 Besides fun to work with, you...
  Experienced with modern JavaScript (ES5/ES6+)
Have experience with Node.js
Have experience with Node frameworks like NestJS or Express
Have experience with message queues like RabbitMQ, PubSub or similar
At least 5+ years relevant experience working as a Backend JS Developer
Are great at modelling business domains into data models
Have a good understanding and experience with different database paradigms and when to use them
Have a deep understanding of APIs
You're pro-active, result-driven, and excited to work in a fast-growing tech scale-up
You're a team player and like to work together to reach our goals

A rapidly-growing company leading efforts in the healthcare industry and delivering a variety of services is looking for an Android Developer. The developer will work on designing and building functional and user-friendly Android applications. The company is dedicated to service and innovation and serves patients in partnership with physicians across 79 sites in 20 states. It is a full-time, long-term opportunity to join a funded, established team and rise quickly through the ranks.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Convert the designs and wireframes into high-quality code
Build and maintain reusable and reliable code
Enhance and boost the performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application
Identify bottlenecks and fix bugs to maintain the code quality
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Must be experienced in Android
Proficiency with APIs, Data Access, and UI development
Extensive knowledge of Android design principles, and Android SDK 
Experience working with third-party libraries

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set. Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media. We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi  that makes Talend special. We are looking for a Software Backend Engineer to join the Data Processing Platform Team. The Data Processing Platform sits at the center of data processing in Talend, working with product teams to design and build the data processing engines and APIs. We build the infrastructure layers required to handle the customers execution workloads wherever they need to be running. The Talend ESB Runtime is the framework that support the deployment of endpoints bound to data integration jobs defined in Talend Studio, within the customers infrastructure. This widely spread product involves several Apache framework such as Apache CXF, Karaf, and Camel. We are looking for a back-end developer to join the team as we need to prepare for our next-gen engine based on Kubernetes, as well as we need to keep on supporting our existing customers with regular updates. 
 Design, implement, test, and deploy fault tolerant and scalable services, mainly coded in Java;
 Document the design of all implemented solutions;
 Analyze and improve efficiency, stability and scalability of services
 Provide support to the customer facing teams on specific technical topics
 Work and communicate in a cross-functional geographically dispersed team environment comprised of software engineers, product managers, software test engineers, and product support engineers. 
 Graduated in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience;
 Proven experience in professional Java programming with RESTful, Message-/Event-Driven technologies, Multi-threaded applications;
 Experience with Karaf or others dependency injection frameworks is a plus
 You like most of our methods: Agile, continuous integration, automation, Iterative delivery
 Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing; 
 Join a passionate team and work with a wide range of technologies (Karaf, K8S, Docker, Kafka to name a few)
 A challenging but rewarding environment with international scope
 We give our employees space to further their technical knowhow
 Regular team events and company celebrations 
Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way: 
 7,250+ global customers rely on Talend for their data health
 Named a Leader for Data Integration Tools by Gartner (for the 7th year in a row)
 Named a Leader for Data Quality Solutions by Gartner (for the 5th year in a row)
 Named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Enterprise Data Fabric (for the 2nd time in a row)
 Top 100 best Leadership teams, compensation and benefits 2022 by Comparably.com
 Ranked in the DBTA “100 Companies that Matter Most in Data” 
We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built. As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, develop and retain the most hardworking people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of business need, merit, capability and equality of opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us via email to request an accommodation at accommodation@talend.com. We appreciate your interest in Talend. We may use automated decision making of your responses during our evaluation of your job application, for instance, to determine if your residence or proficiency fits the requirements for the job opportunity. You can exercise your privacy rights, including your right to object to automated decision making (if applicable), by filling out this privacy form or contacting privacy@talend.com . Due to Ideagen's exponential growth plans the technology team have created an exceptional opportunity for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Cloud Operations team in Sofia, Bulgaria! This is a remote position. You will be working amongst the globally distributed colleagues within the wider Ideagen Group with collaboration in the UK, Malaysia, Bulgaria and the US. The role will involve Managing, monitoring, and maintain our infrastructure platforms across a multi-cloud environment specializing in AWS/Azure technologies! Key Responsibilities 
Manage, monitor, and maintain our infrastructure platforms across a multi-cloud environment.
Manage design, development, and operational changes to cloud based infrastructure services.
Provide operational support and be able to co-ordinate with other teams during incidents that may impact service.
Work to improve the reliability, quality, performance, and scalability of our infrastructure.
Continually measure and optimise system performance.
Enable the engineering organization to innovate and deliver with greater speed and safety. 
Skills & Experience 
Experience in production 24/7 high-availability cloud-based SaaS environments using AWS and/or Azure.
Experience of working with orchestration and containerisation e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, EKS/AKS etc 
Experience of CI/CD such as Jenkins, GitLab, Azure DevOps etc
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation
Experience of working alongside development functions delivering software within an agile development environment. 
Strong scripting skills in various languages such as Python, BASH, and/or PowerShell.
Working alongside development functions delivering software within an agile development environment.
Proven ability to grasp new technical concepts quickly 
Behaviors 
Ambitious - Drive, Planning & Execution
Adventurous - Flexibility, Resilience & Savvy thinking
Community - Collaboration & Communication 
What's in it for you? While we take our work and deliverables seriously, we have a relaxed working environment and we want our people to be rewarded for their hard work. We offer benefits such as 20 days' holidays (exclusive of bank holidays), Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Pay, Free On-site Parking, Private Medical Insurance, Free drinks and fruit in the office, sports cords and many more! Who are Ideagen? If you have ever flown in a plane, been in hospital, or even given blood, there is a good chance we've helped keep you safe. For nearly a quarter of a century, we have been providing software solutions to thousands of customers such as the UK NHS, Virgin, PwC, Emirates, Heineken and even Harvard University. We are not a large faceless corporation, but we are not a fly-by-night dot com company either. With more than 1150 employees in multiple locations across the UK, USA, Dubai, Malaysia, and Bulgaria – not including our global Partner Network – we're one of the most exciting and fastest growing software companies in the world.
