Experience within a product focussed environment 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Ivanti is focused on helping our customers to reduce IT complexity, protect and manage assets and enable their IT organisation to provide a strong level of service to their business. 
IT Service Management
IT Asset Management
Unified Endpoint Management – Physical, virtual and mobile
User Workspace Management
Endpoint Security Management
Identity and Access Management
All bound together with a strong Automation and Reporting framework 
Ivanti was founded in January of 2017, when LANDESK and HEAT Software were combined. While LANDESK had acquired companies like Shavlik, Xtraction, AppSense and, most recently RES and Concorde, HEAT was created by a combination of FrontRange and Lumension. In order to gather all these brands under one roof, we needed a new identity - and Ivanti was born. Ivanti is the only vendor to offer solutions for Unified IT: By integrating Endpoint Security with Service Management and IT Operations, we provide everything for a fully automated and secured, digital workplace. For our strong and well-positioned Italy team we are looking for an experienced technical Pre-Sales Consultant who will also take over responsibilities for other technical areas of our solutions, and potentially more as the Ivanti portfolio is further developing. 
Collaborate closely with account managers from the sales teams to identify and drive projects towards successful closing. The focus is on technical closure.
Single point of contact for involved technical and business stakeholders from customer/partner side with focus on service and asset management aspects.
Responsible for driving both business and technical conversations, addressed by our products including key regulations, business drivers, evolving business needs, etc.
Responsible for preparing and attending customer meetings and tailoring communication to address business needs of potential clients as part of the pre-sales process
Scoping and analysis of customer requirements
Being able to quickly understand the customer’s needs in the areas of, Unified Endpoint Management – Physical, virtual and mobile, User Workspace Management, Endpoint Security Management and Identity and Access Management
Deliver effective product demonstrations to customers and prospects, if necessary tailored for their individual requirements
Preparing, conducting and summarising technical Proof-of-Concept (PoC) or pilot installations of our solutions
Assist in preparing and answering RFIs/RFPs
Prepare and assist at public events like trade shows, partner events, roadshows, user-group meetings, including the ability to act as a speaker in front of a larger audience
Being a technical representative of our software solutions, able to communicate complex IT dependencies in simplifying, clear words
Involve other specialists wherever necessary to successfully drive pre-sales projects, including Support Engineers or Development as well as a later project-handover to Professional Services/channel partners
Liaison with Product Managers and Development to understand details of vision, roadmap and product design and communicate information back to customers and the sales organisation
Responsible for providing feedback from the market to Product Management and Development regarding products including coordinating gaps between product functionality and market/customer demands
Responsible for staying current on competitive analysis and understanding differentiators between Ivanti and its competitors 
Experience in implementing complex IT solutions like UEM/Security within (Enterprise) customer scenarios
Experience in a presale role within a sales environment for a software vendor or a similar organisation
ITIL V3 certified
Practical experience working in customer environments 
Fluent Italian language
Business fluent English language
Extensive experience of creating and delivering presentations to large and diverse audience
Ability to create written documents in Italian and English language to assist potential customers in preparing or summarising activities within pre-sales projects
Team player with the ability to act as the focal point in identifying gaps and pulling in any other necessary resources to own and successfully drive pre-sales projects
Experience of working with: Networks, Operating Systems, Databases, Email and Systems integration 
The ideal candidate will have strong customer interaction skills enabling you to build credibility and trust throughout complex sales cycles. You’ll need to be well organised, self-motivated and focused on results. We have multiple offices in Italy but would be happy for the successful candidate to be home office-based anywhere in Italy with good airport links as they will be expected to travel up to 3-4 days/week throughout Italy with occasional international travel (Europe and US).

Are you an engineer passionate about building software and systems that improve the everyday work life of people around the world? Read on, this job might be for you! About Open Systems Open Systems delivers cybersecurity beyond expectations. We partner with organizations to boost the security performance of their digital transformations. Our award-winning Managed Detection and Response (MDR) and Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) services connect and protect customers today, while increasing their security maturity for tomorrow. Open Systems’ Mission Control SOCs and NOCs are staffed by certified, outcome-obsessed engineers who provide 24x7 global coverage. They leverage a platform backed by data science and years of finetuning complex processes to better understand and reduce attack surfaces. Deployed in nearly 10,000 locations across 184 countries, Open Systems has earned an out of this world 97% retention rate. No wonder our customers call it crazy good cybersecurity. Discover more at www.open-systems.com. Join us and empower our ambitious Site Reliability Engineering team as: Site Reliability Engineer (80% - 100%) Your mission: As a Site Reliability Engineer for our Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) service, you empower Open Systems to deploy and operate a reliable, distributed service at scale, across multiple platforms. You will: 
 Work closely with engineering teams, product owners, and other stakeholders to define service operations, identify operational issues early and prevent them 
 Help define Service Level Objectives to assess release readiness of all services 
 Develop software, tooling, and processes to automate our operations 
 Measure and optimize system performance 
 Participate in incident management on-call rotation and drive root cause analysis 
At Open Systems SREs are driven by improving the operations of our services, measured by the level of service that we provide to our customers, the resources that we need to operate our services, and the interest of our operational work in our Mission Control NOC. SREs work in partnership with platform and service engineering teams in different capacity—from consulting to joint engineering projects—to drive the operational improvements across the entire lifecycle of our services. As part of your SRE responsibilities, and through the Open Systems training and courses, you will become certified as a Mission Control Engineer, providing you with knowledge in a wide area covering networking and security topics. This will give you the opportunity to visit our Mission Control NOC in Honolulu for deployments of 2 to 3 months, where travel and accommodation is also afforded to your partner and children. Your qualifications: You are strong in either Software Engineering or Networking and Security Operations and have an interest in developing your skills and solving problems at the intersection of both. You are motivated to learn new skills and expand your existing theoretical and practical knowledge in training programs offered by internal domain experts and team colleagues, and ideally, you bring some of the following skills to the table: 
 University degree in Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience 
 At least 2 years of SRE, software development, DevOps, or security automation 
 Strong conceptional understanding of scalable system design 
 Full ability to design, test, and release code in general-purpose languages such as Go or Python and scripting (Bash) 
 Familiarity with GitOps, Terraform, Kubernetes, Prometheus, as well as major clouds (Azure, AWS, GCP...) 
 Interpersonal skills, ability to collaborate and build trust across teams to design and deliver shared solutions 
You may already have experience with the whole breadth of the SRE role already, but do not let it stop you if you do not. We also support you making a transition to SRE from a strong skillset in software engineering, DevOps, or platform engineering. In that case you should be able to explain why would want to make this transition. What we offer: You will join our growing SRE team, and work with agile method in coordination with software and product engineering teams. You will have the opportunity to work remotely from Switzerland, Germany, Austria, the Netherlands, or the United States, or be based in one of our offices in Zürich, Bern, Düsseldorf, Vienna or Redwood City. You will have the option to work full-time or part-time 80%. Open Systems will offer you interesting challenges in the dynamic and global environment of SD-WAN and cybersecurity. You will be in a work environment in which innovative solutions, rapid development times, creativity, and open communication are practiced and continuously fostered. The pursuit of technical advancement is at the center of our attention. Our employees are known as enthusiastic, humorous, and passionate individuals. It’s all about people because it’s them who make us stand out in the marketplace, not our technology. We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you have to compress your application into two attachments). For further questions and inquiries about applications, please feel free to contact Martin Blecher at +41 58 100 10 10. Only direct applications will be considered. Come as you are! We search for amazing people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Open Systems welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Lokalita: Praha, Česká republika Název pozice: MS Dynamics CRM support engineer Pro tým, který vyvíjí obchodní aplikace MS Dynamics CRM, hledáme další zkušené vývojáře pro vývoj workflows/extensions pomocí CRM SDK v C#/.NET. Vedle toho vyvíjíme také front-end portály v ASP.NET MVC pro interakci zákazník/partner/zaměstnanec... Koho hledáme? Jste absolvent magisterského nebo bakalářského studia, máte alespoň 3 roky praxe jako vývojář C#/.NET, zkušenosti s webovým vývojem .NET (ASP.NET MVC, Bootstrap, CSS) a s nástroji Dynamics CRM/365 a SDK Dynamics CRM, jste komunikativní týmový hráč s dobrou angličtinou, ale umíte pracovat i samostatně, velkou výhodou je zkušenost s agilní metodikou vývoje a chtěl byste se také naučit nové věci a sdílet své znalosti s kolegy v mezinárodním týmu. Co u náš můžete očekávat? Zázemí a podporu úspěšné a rostoucí společnosti, sídlící v The Greenline (Kačerov), práci na mezinárodních projektech pro prestižní značky v ČR a EU, HPP na dobu neurčitou nebo spolupráci na IČO, odpovídající finanční podmínky, prostor pro trvalý osobní, odborný i kariérní rozvoj, řadu firemních benefitů (stravenky, příspěvek na penzijní připojištění, fýden dovolené navíc, flexibilní pracovní doba, home office...). Nástup asap - podle dohody.

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Application Platform team) - Engagement Pillar
description:
Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including: 
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising 
Content, offering a headless CMS 
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions 
Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI-optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com. We are currently expanding our Application Platform team and we are looking for Backend Software Engineer. Is "security", "curiosity" or "growth" your middle name? Then you are a good fit and you can be one of us. You can work remotely or from one of our local offices. The salary starts at €3,000 based on your experience level. About your role and the team: The Application Platform team empowers other engineering teams to build their services effectively and with security and compliance built-in by designing, implementing, and maintaining the magic solid foundations and the core frameworks of the Bloomreach Engagement. Examples of the initiatives driven by this team are: 
Integrated zero-trust authentication and authorization management system.
Platform for collecting and processing audit logs in a distributed environment.
Notification center, which allows other teams to communicate information to customers through a single unified channel (upcoming project). 
What you might like about this role: 
Wide reach - we deal with teams across the company - product, security, architects, engineers, even customers.
Security perspective will be a key element of your day-to-day work
Developing Cloud Native services consumed by customers as well as other engineering teams 
What your typical day might look like: You start your day with a code review of your colleague’s tasks while sipping a cup of fresh-brewed tea or coffee, looking for any signs of problems and possible optimizations. Then you join your teammates on a quick daily standup, where you discuss what you’re currently working on and the plan for the next few days. After the meeting, you get into “the zone” and spend a few undisturbed hours working on the new authentication framework while making sure it’s safely covered by a suite of unit tests. With a few clicks you quickly spin up a brand new instance of the system in the development cluster, deploy your change and notify the frontend engineer that it’s ready. You grab a snack and take a little break from coding. Instead, you help a fellow backend engineer from another team figure out the best way to integrate their new service with the audit logging platform. In the meantime the frontend engineer gets back to you and confirms that all the new endpoints work as expected, so you create a merge request and ask your teammates for a code review. It’s a complex piece of code, so you go through it together. After your code is approved, you merge it, automatically deploying it to the staging environment where it receives further testing by the QA team and automated integration tests before being released to production. You end your day in a short meeting with a product manager and the director of engineering, where you flesh out the idea you had over lunch yesterday for a new approach to release management that would make the whole process even faster. Our tech stack: 
Python & Go
MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka
Kubernetes (GKE)
Various Google Cloud Platform services (Pub/Sub, BigTable, DataFlow, ...)
Gitlab CI/CD, Prometheus and Grafana 
What we expect of the candidate: The ideal candidate has: 
At least 3 year experience developing in Python or Golang
Designing and implementing production-grade REST APIs 
Having experience with operating services in production is beneficial
A working understanding of fundamental web security principles (OWASP), Authentication and Authorization practices
Experience with database systems of different kinds (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka) 
Regional benefits: 
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region 
More things you'll like about Bloomreach: Culture: 
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one. 
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication. 
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style. 
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents. 
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead. 
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5 
Personal Development: 
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions. 
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins. 
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)* 
Well-being: 
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.* 
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.* 
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones. 
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other. 
Compensation: 
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.* 
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.* 
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts. 
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!* 
(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.) If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful! Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Twój zakres obowiązków: 
 weryfikowanie poprawności projektów reklamowych od strony kodu,
 tworzenie kreacji reklamowych w technologiach HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript na urządzenia stacjonarne i mobilne,

Mile widziane

znajomość Javy. 
To oferujemy 
 pracę w firmie wiodącej w swojej branży,
 atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie,
 możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w dziedzinie RTB - najszybciej i najlepiej rozwijającym się obszarze reklamy internetowej,
 ciągły rozwój zawodowy oraz możliwość podnoszenia kwalifikacji 
HTML5, CSS3 ,JavaScript, JSON

We’re Looking for Trainees to Join Our Team!
 At Suvoda, we’re not only passionate about the work that we do and the impact that it has on human lives, but we’re passionate about the people who make it happen! Every day, it is our priority to bring in talented and motivated individuals and create a workplace that drives, engages and retains them.
 What Makes Suvoda a Great Place to Work?
 Here are just a few highlights:
Our Office: located at University Square, newly renovated, modern with relaxation and games room
Our Company: see how software is created and tested at one of the most innovative companies in the eClinical field
Our People: opportunity to increase your network, expand your professional branding and ability to have references that can help you in the future
Strengthen Your CV: having great grades is not enough to get a job. More important is to build your experience and basic knowledge of the most utilized methodologies, technologies, and tools in the field, assume responsibility is a professional work environment, and learn to work as part of a team.
 Job description
What Should You Expect?
 As a Software Developer Trainee, you’ll be part of a class that learns the basics about software development and, learning about web applications used by pharmaceutical and biotech clients during the clinical trial process. You will work with .NET C# and MVC, Entity Framework, LINQ to SQL, Workflow Foundation and SQL Server.
 What you’ll learn through this experience:
Technologies: C#, ASP.NET MVC, WF, Entity Framework, SQL Server, Git
Learn proper use of software development design patterns and adhere to clean coding principles in enterprise level products.
Explore creative solutions, learn to analyze risks and improve your critical thinking abilities
Hands on experience on a real project by the end of the internship
As part of the recruitment process, you will receive a skills pre-test before the first meeting.
 Essential requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or last year student in computer science/cybernetics or equivalent
Strong critical and analytical reasoning skills
High achieving, exploratory nature
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new processes, technologies and tools
Ability to conduct in-depth investigative research and select the best solution for a problem
Proficient in spoken and written English
Passion for web development in .NET Framework
Good knowledge of OOP principles
  Company details
Suvoda is a software company that develops software used to streamline the clinical trials process for our Pharmaceutical and Biotechnology clients.
 At Suvoda we are more interested in innate talent than years of experience, as we create an appropriate environment in order to facilitate the know-how transfer and to assure access to technology and encourage personal evolution.
 We are:
• A growing technology company, providing innovative solutions to the pharmaceutical and biotech industries, with a relentless focus on creating engaged customers;
• Talented individuals who value high performance yet also like to have fun at work;
• Determined to build an organizational culture characterized by highly productive and highly satisfied employees in an inclusive, diverse, and collegial environment.
 We want you in our team if you think we can accomplish great things together!

job_title: Field Service Engineer Bioprocess Solutions HU| PL (m|f|d)
description:
Please apply in English only.
   Carry out the validation and commissioning of our complex Bioprocess solutions portfolio at our customers' sites
Installation, qualification, maintenance and repair of our systems in the pharmaceutical and biotechnological industry
Complete professional qualification documents, test reports and certificates to a Good Manufacturing Practice standard
Work closely with our technical support teams in Germany and UK to solve complex technical issues
Collaborate with the Sales department in order to enable new opportunities
   Successfully completed technical education (electronics, mechatronics or comparable education) and relevant professional experience as a service technician, ideally in the pharmaceutical, biological or chemical environment
Knowledge in automation technology and experience with calibrations is an advantage
Excellent communication skills and a strong service-oriented customer approach
Organizational skills, with ability to adapt to a dynamic schedule
Willingness to frequent travelling within Hungary and Poland
Excellent oral and written communication skills in Hungarian or Polish and English
Identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment
  Our ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. So that more people can obtain access to better medicine. Nearly 16,000 employees at more than 60 production and sales locations worldwide are committed to this vision. And together, we have grown strongly over the past years. Do you also want to contribute to our vision? Grow with us and benefit from working with a Global Player that has kept its familiar atmosphere:
  Enjoy the trust and autonomy of the company to self-organize and drive your service region to success 
Attractive remuneration, company car, home office
Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths
Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration
Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years.
 We look for employees who would like to grow with us and move the innovative life sciences sector forward. In the process, we focus on agile project work, mutual support within teams and working as equals. Sartorius thrives as a company with people who give their very best every day and who are eager to develop personally and professionally.
 Further insights into our world of work can be found

job_title: Empleo Backend Software Engineer | Trabajo Online
description:
En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares. Más de 400 empresas, incluídas Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., han contratado a desarrolladores de Turing.
 A fast-paced company promoting belonging by operating and nurturing specialized online communities is looking for a Back-End Software Engineer. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating scalable integration solutions by analyzing project needs and making recommendations. The company offers its clients growth tools, staff to scale their content production, paid acquisition skills, and proven community growth frameworks. This will be a long-term, full-time role that requires some overlap with the U.S., European, and Indian time zone.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Analyze project requirements and make recommendations to create scalable integration solutions
Transfer acquired businesses to the authorized technology stack
Contribute to the engineering organization's broad efforts to create best practices and optimize business onboarding procedures
Collaborate with business managers to improve operations by using the existing technology stack and developing procedures for enhanced capabilities
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Extensive knowledge in documenting technical designs and scoping out producible solutions
Experience with large-scale, high-performance systems
Knowledge of Python and Django
Knowledge of working in a high-growth startup environment
Expertise in designing, building, testing, and operating services, APIs, and databases
Familiarity with JavaScript is a plus
Proficiency in English

Design and build advanced applications for the iOS and Android platforms using the Flutter framework
Lead Flutter development working closely with other mobile app developers ensuring a consistent approach for all platforms and maintaining parity in features
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features
Unit-test code for robustness, usability, and general reliability
Identify and correct bottlenecks, fix bugs and improve application performance
Help maintain code quality, development processes, and automated testing
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
  Chabre IT Services is a global professional IT services provider, building long-lasting relationships with Enterprises. We specialize in the delivery of tailor-made solutions, smart outsourcing, try&hire, and success fee services. We are a smart IT boutique with unique knowledge, which will deliver your ideas into reality.
  Our client is an accounting, auditing and consulting services company. It is a network of more than 250,000 employees in 158 countries focused on providing the highest quality services in the areas of audit, tax consulting, consulting and technology development.
 It carries out IT projects such as design, construction, implementation and post-implementation support of IT systems, analysis and development of functional specifications, analysis of data in source systems, definition of business requirements, dedicated to support modern business processes, support in UAT end-user testing, development of mobile applications.
   2-4 years of working experience in mobile app development, demonstrating successful delivery of mobile apps integrated with cloud-based services
Good knowledge of Flutter
Good knowledge of Git, Dart 
Experience with RESTful APIs to connect apps to back-end services
Knowledge of cloud message APIs and push notifications
Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and ability to work in both international and multifunctional teams
Knowledge of Android Studio environment, JIRA
Experience working with google maps
Nice to have: Riverpod, Clean Architecture, TDD, Auto rououter, 
 We offer
  Rate to 160,00 PLN/h + VAT
Remote work
Subsidy for peripherals in the amount of 500,00zł
Working tool (MacBook Pro or Lenovo Legion 5)
Co-financing of courses related to the position
Benefits: MultiSport, Medicover

job_title: Software Engineer - Identity Management for Canonical Products
description:
Summary This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company. Bring your Python and Golang skills to bear on identity, authorization and access management across Canonical's suite of enterprise products and web services. As a software engineer for Identity Management products of Canonical, you will modernize and expand the capabilities of the identity management solutions we use for authentication and authorization in our products, as well as our canonical.com and ubuntu.com websites. Your work on Identity Management will directly impact the users of all Canonical products. Technical excellence and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to own the design and delivery of the system, facilitate integrations and work with your team on strategy and execution. What you'll do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). 
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. 
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. 
Create and enhance management, authentication and authorization API endpoints
Craft end-user authentication flows from design to implementation
Modernize the identity stack of our websites and products by driving adoption of best-of-breed IAM technologies 
Deliver great products that users love by maintaining a culture of quality and engineering excellence
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events 
Who you are 
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are a software engineer, with specific experience building identity and access management products 
You are familiar with the open source software, standards, protocols and concepts in the identity space (e.g. OpenID, OAuth, LDAP)
You have experience implementing authorization frameworks in distributed systems
You value secure coding and standards, and enjoy working on teams that do the same
You have solid experience working in an agile development environment
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. 
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. 
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You love embracing new technologies and pushing the boundaries of what is possible, with a view to building products that improve how people operate software and infrastructure everywhere 
About Canonical Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace. What Canonical offers: 
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology 
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration. #stack

Satisfly - kim jesteśmy?

Aktualnie Szukamy React Developera Twój Dzień Pracy w Satisfly Wypełni

Jako agile software house działamy aktywnie w branży e-Commerce od 2010 roku, dostarczając najlepsze rozwiązania dla biznesu.

stylowanie nowych funkcjonalności w istniejącym projekcie
dbanie o wysoką jakość tworzonych rozwiązań
doradztwo w zakresie dostępnych rozwiązań - realny wpływ na działania!
rozwiązywanie codziennych wyzwań oraz dzielenie się wiedzą i doświadczeniem z React Developerami
przygotowanie dokumentacji technicznej
bliska współpraca z zespołem backendowym
uczestnictwo w spotkaniach sprintowych z Klientem
W związku z tym powinieneś/aś:

mieć min. 2 lata doświadczenia (mile widziane wdrożenia e-Commerce)
doskonale znać JavaScript oraz posiadać praktyczną znajomość OOP / ES6
bez problemu poruszać się w HTML5, CSS3
mieć za sobą kilka komercyjnych projektów z wykorzystaniem React.js
mieć doświadczenie z komponentami klasowymi i funkcyjnymi
znać biblioteki do zarządzania stanem aplikacji (Redux/Mobx)
znać korzyści i potrafić używać GraphQL
rozumieć potrzebę stosowania systemów automatyzacji pracy (np. Webpack)
znać i korzystać z narzędzi takich jak: Babel, Docker
umieć wykorzystywać preprocesory CSS (np. SASS, LESS)
znać GIT'a (korzystamy z własnego Gitlaba),
lubić pracę zespołową (trafisz do jednego z naszych Teamów;)
język polski - min. B2 - must have
chętnie dzielić się swoim doświadczeniem i być otwartym/ą na nową wiedzę :)
mieć podstawowe poczucie estetyki
mieć doświadczenie w projektach opartych na Magento 2 (mile widziane)
Poza tym na Twoim stanowisku oferujemy:

forma współpracy: B2B
preferujesz UZ? UoP? Pewnie, porozmawiajmy :)
wynagrodzenie 10 000 – 18 000 + VAT /mc (w zależności od Twojego doświadczenia)
współpracę w siedzibie firmy w samym centrum Wrocławia (Globis), bądź praca zdalna
elastyczne godziny pracy
minimum 25 płatnych wolnych dni
benefity tj.
opieka medyczna,
karta Multisport (dofinansowanie),
język angielski na wszystkich poziomach zaawansowania, w trakcie pracy,
certyfikacje,
szkolenia,
lunchday...
a nad resztą pracujemy :)
Do zobaczenia w Satisfly!

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Application Platform team) - Engagement Pillar
description:
Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including: 
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising 
Content, offering a headless CMS 
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions 
Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI-optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com. We are currently expanding our Application Platform team and we are looking for Backend Software Engineer. Is "security", "curiosity" or "growth" your middle name? Then you are a good fit and you can be one of us. You can work remotely or from one of our local offices. The salary starts at €3,000 based on your experience level. About your role and the team: The Application Platform team empowers other engineering teams to build their services effectively and with security and compliance built-in by designing, implementing, and maintaining the magic solid foundations and the core frameworks of the Bloomreach Engagement. Examples of the initiatives driven by this team are: 
Integrated zero-trust authentication and authorization management system.
Platform for collecting and processing audit logs in a distributed environment.
Notification center, which allows other teams to communicate information to customers through a single unified channel (upcoming project). 
What you might like about this role: 
Wide reach - we deal with teams across the company - product, security, architects, engineers, even customers.
Security perspective will be a key element of your day-to-day work
Developing Cloud Native services consumed by customers as well as other engineering teams 
What your typical day might look like: You start your day with a code review of your colleague’s tasks while sipping a cup of fresh-brewed tea or coffee, looking for any signs of problems and possible optimizations. Then you join your teammates on a quick daily standup, where you discuss what you’re currently working on and the plan for the next few days. After the meeting, you get into “the zone” and spend a few undisturbed hours working on the new authentication framework while making sure it’s safely covered by a suite of unit tests. With a few clicks you quickly spin up a brand new instance of the system in the development cluster, deploy your change and notify the frontend engineer that it’s ready. You grab a snack and take a little break from coding. Instead, you help a fellow backend engineer from another team figure out the best way to integrate their new service with the audit logging platform. In the meantime the frontend engineer gets back to you and confirms that all the new endpoints work as expected, so you create a merge request and ask your teammates for a code review. It’s a complex piece of code, so you go through it together. After your code is approved, you merge it, automatically deploying it to the staging environment where it receives further testing by the QA team and automated integration tests before being released to production. You end your day in a short meeting with a product manager and the director of engineering, where you flesh out the idea you had over lunch yesterday for a new approach to release management that would make the whole process even faster. Our tech stack: 
Python & Go
MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka
Kubernetes (GKE)
Various Google Cloud Platform services (Pub/Sub, BigTable, DataFlow, ...)
Gitlab CI/CD, Prometheus and Grafana 
What we expect of the candidate: The ideal candidate has: 
At least 3 year experience developing in Python or Golang
Designing and implementing production-grade REST APIs 
Having experience with operating services in production is beneficial
A working understanding of fundamental web security principles (OWASP), Authentication and Authorization practices
Experience with database systems of different kinds (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka) 
Regional benefits: 
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region 
More things you'll like about Bloomreach: Culture: 
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one. 
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication. 
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style. 
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents. 
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead. 
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5 
Personal Development: 
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions. 
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins. 
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)* 
Well-being: 
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.* 
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.* 
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones. 
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other. 
Compensation: 
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.* 
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.* 
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts. 
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!* 
(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.) If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful! Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Who we are?
 We're ITSG Global - a modern and experienced software development company. We've been using the latest technologies to help our Clients to grow effectively since 2007. Our experience in Big Data, VR, IoT, UI/UX, and other fields allowed us to deliver high-quality services for companies like Starfish Storage, Device Insight, Craftguide, BEN Energy, and many more.
 We are currently looking for a Fullstack Developer (Java+React) who will be part of the team for the development of a booking platform belonging to the world's largest travel club present in over 20 countries on three continents. The company focuses on strategic development, modern processes, Agile methodology, and test-driven development.
 As a Fullstack Developer, you’ll be responsible for working with the team to refine and deliver features and improvements to our users. You will be improving key areas of our web application to help our users book the holiday they dream of. 
   Write high-quality code using test-driven development. 
Work on both frontend and backend codebases. 
Be involved in the full lifecycle of the ticket, from ideation through to QA and release.
Review others' code and mentor less experienced members of the team.
Be involved in architectural discussions.
Contribute to the direction and continuous improvement of the team. 
   Expertise in web application development using Grails or similar technologies, e.g. Spring Boot and Hibernate.
Fluency in Java or Groovy. 
Experience in working with relational databases such as MySQL. Some knowledge of NoSQL storage solution like Remis and MongoDB would be beneficial as well. 
Frontend skills - React.js and other Javascript libraries and frameworks, CSS, HTML. 
Experience with object oriented programming, design patterns and distributed systems design. 
Excellent communication skills with the ability to adjust your style based on the audience. 
 We offer:
 We are offering superb career growth opportunities, great compensation, and benefits.
  Cooperation based on B2B:  150 – 200 + vat/h 
Possibility to choose a working system (100% remotely, hybrid or on-site in Warsaw).
Work in an experienced team of experts.
Using the latest tools and technologies in everyday work.
Individual training and the possibility of promotion.
Benefits: English lessons, Multisport cards, and private medical insurance, integration events, training budget.

As a Unix Software Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining a large Unix network. Troubleshoot day to day issues and support production operations. You will write scripts that help automate processes. Closely work with the Software engineering teams and release engineers.
    Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field. 
 At least 1-3 years experience working on Unix systems. 
 Exposure to Software Development Life Cycle including CI/CD will be beneficial. 
 Excellent customer service and communication skills. 
 Aptitude to learn new technologies in a fast-paced environment. 
 At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.
 Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Python Developer - 100% Remote - SaaS company|Engineering of productivity team - Data integration SaaS
 About Our Client
 SaaS company with more than 10 years of experience. They have create a SaaS product focused on ETL, Data Ops and Data integration. Their product is an ETL SaaS connected with multiple connectors (Big Data, BBDD, Cloud, CRM, ERP...).
 They are more than 200 people, and 50 in Barcelona.
 More than 2 years working together and +25 hiring made and close to 0% turnover in 4 years.
   Design and implement new functionalities and architectures using Python and Dockers.
Design and implement solution architecture to meet functional and non-functional requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical deliverables.
Develop additional features on existing applications.
Modeling, designing, coding, testing automation, scripting, packaging
The Successful Applicant
  Highly proficient with Python programming language.
Proficient with, SQL/NoSQL databases and REST/SOAP webservices.
Experience or an interest in microservices / cloud environments (Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience in integrations with different connectors like AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Hive, MongoDB, SQL, Oracle, Salesforce... will be well valuated.
Fluent English.
What's on Offer
  Possibility of working remotely 100% or hybrid.
+ 260€/month for food.
+100€/month for transportation.
Up to 37€/month for Wi-Fi.
The best medical insurance from AXA for you and your family. 
Laptop and hardware needed.
Contact: Pierre Rivenc
 Quote job ref: JN-112022-5846104 Brand: PP

 W Polsce ugruntowaliśmy pozycję lidera wśród kalkulatorów kalorii - z aplikacji korzysta obecnie 1 300 000 aktywnych użytkowników, którzy generują 30 mln zapytań do api/dzień!

 Oferujemy
  wynagrodzenie 15000 - 23000 zł + VAT na B2B, w zależności od doświadczenia,
26 płatnych dni przerwy w świadczeniu usług,
11 dni w ciągu roku na rozwój i realizację własnych pomysłów w firmie,
budżet na szkolenia / konferencje / lekcje języka angielskiego,

bardzo dobrze skomunikowane biuro w ścisłym centrum,

About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet. As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (20+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎 We’re looking for Backend Engineers that want to change the world. If you like to work at a steady pace with no surprises, keep scrolling. If you want your work to change the global financial landscape, you might be just who we’re looking for. We have a minimalist approach to using external frameworks, with emphasis on maintainability and fast turnaround with TDD, DDD and Continuous Integration & Delivery. Sound like your speed? Let’s chat 👇 Our technology stack: 
Java 17, Kotlin
SparkJava, Javalin
GCP, Kubernetes, Grafana, Prometheus, NewRelic
PostgreSQL, Redis
JOOQ, Flyway
RSocket 
What You’ll Be Doing 
Enhancing and building Core Platform
Improving the developer experience by upgrading internal libraries and frameworks
Contributing to our Eventstore Platform
Contributing to open source internal libraries 
What You'll Need 
Fluency with Java
Experience with distributed systems, CI/CD
6 years (or above) experience in back-end development
Bachelor's Degree (or above) in Computer Science/Maths/Physics/similar
Quick learner with an ambitious and results driven personality
Work well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Fluent English 
Nice to have 
Experience with Kotlin and Scala
Experience within Finance
Experience within a start-up or scale-up
Experience within a product focussed environment 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

job_title: Entry Level Back-End Developer (Work From Home)
description:
Keyvoto is now looking for a young Back-end Developer, to help us build functional systems that improve customer experience in Retail Tech. You will be responsible for the server-side of our web applications and you will work closely with our engineers to ensure system consistency and improve customer experience. If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you!
 Your daily activities:
  Back-end web development 
Collaborating with fellow engineers to innovate, develop and scale our products with the use of modern technologies and best practices 
Cooperation with developers, front end developer,s and the marketing team 
Work on bug fixes and improvements during each cycle 
Participate in daily activities of the software department such as code and design reviews, project planning, periodic meetings, etc 
Follow up on best practices and procedures as established by the company 
 Responsibilities:
  Working on a variety of client projects across different industries and sectors 
Maintain components system for websites 
Improve and develop internal tools for handling incoming requests 
Implement functional and technical solutions 
Writing clean, testable, maintainable code 
Understanding and addressing performance concerns including SQL Databases 
Working with DevOps and CI/CD tools to build, release and monitor platform 
Troubleshooting of technical problems 
 Requirements:
  No work experience is required but previous work experience is a plus. 
Knowledge of scripting languages such as HTML5, CSS 3, and Python is considered an asset 
Knowledge of scripting languages such as ASP.NET, Entity Framework, Blazor is considered an asset 
Knowledge of scripting languages such as SQL, PL/SQL is considered an asset 
Understanding of C# / .NET 5, .NET Core, .NET Framework is considered an asset 
Strong Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint 
Excellent verbal and literal use of English and Greek language 
Fulfilled military service obligations (for male applicants) 
 Nice to have:
  Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering or another related field 
Basic programming / mathematical understanding is considered a plus 
 Benefits:
 We believe that a culture built on trust, respect, and equality will enable us to live our values, achieve our ambitions and deliver our purpose. We share a passion for creating opportunities for our people to flourish & succeed whatever their background. So, we seek that kind of passion and want you to be part of our team, teach you anything we know, invest in you, build a fundamental partnership and accompany you to achieve your greatest potential.
  Working Remotely 
Career development opportunities 
Unique employee experience 
Friendly casual environment and open culture 
Huge opportunity to fast track your career as the team & company grows 
Work-life balance 
 So, why Keyvoto you might ask: 
 Keyvoto is a product experience platform, that is the meeting point of retailers with their suppliers. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we foster a collaborative culture with talented individuals coming from diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. That’s why we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. As a company, innovative thinking, diverse insights, and, genuinely, a distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism, is our main goal.
 PS: The safety and well-being of our candidates and employees remain our priority. Please note that the recruitment process will be conducted only via online format, during the current period. 
 For any questions please reach out to the responsible Recruitment team at vasilis.skoulakis@keyvoto.com.

 If you like challenges and would love to be part of one of the fastest growing B2B scale-up then BizAway is the company you have been looking for. 🤩
 We are looking for

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet Who We Are Frontiers is the 3rd most-cited and 6th largest research publisher and we publish groundbreaking discoveries by the world's top experts. Scientists empower society and our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery by making science open. We place the researcher at the center of everything we do and enable the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet. Join the publishing revolution. What we have to offer: Frontiers is a young, technology-driven company with a large IT department that supports its goals. Our publishing platform consists of tens of web applications serving the diverse needs of our users. All the content of Frontiers journals is also available to everyone on our public-facing website that has millions of views every day. We are always aiming to give the best experience to our users, continuously optimizing and improving our websites and applications. About you: We are looking for a senior backend engineer to join us as part of a newly formed team. Here you will contribute to the building of a new version of an existing product, with a new code base and an extended feature set. Key Requirements: 
Minimum 4 years of commercial experience
Excellent programming skills in C#
Enthusiasm for modern approaches to software development and the latest technologies
Passion for clean and pragmatic design
Experience building and maintaining REST and GraphQL APIs
Experience designing and implementing scalable solutions using SQL and NoSQL
Familiarity with distributed systems, e.g. microservices
Excellent English-language communication skills
Driven and pro-active, with a “Get things done” attitude
An appreciation of working as part of a remote-first multi-cultural team 
Nice to have: 
Experience with Dapper
Experience with Apache Kafka
Frontend experience with Vue.js or similar SPA framework 
Benefits With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe. Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees. 100% remote working Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office). Learning and development All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time. Wellbeing We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance. Volunteering opportunities Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya. Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

job_title: 🔎 Data Scientist | Digital company based in lively Barcelona
company_name: Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services
description:
Ofertia is a digital company based in lively Barcelona. Our mission is to revolutionize the way people do shopping, covering the gap between the online and offline shopping worlds. We help retailers to drive more customers to their stores by publishing digital circulars on our mobile apps and web portals, where consumers can find the best offers from their favorite stores around them. Ofertia is now part of the Mediapost Group with a strong presence in Spain. Moreover, we operate in Mexico, Colombia, and Sweden.
 What makes working at Ofertia great
  The opportunity to bring our IT platform to the next level.
Ofertia is one of the most exciting digital companies in the heart of Barcelona with a disruptive product.
We support your personal and professional development with challenging projects and training programs.
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work 100% remotely (within Spain).
A company culture is driven by pioneer thinking and talent that crosses departments through flat hierarchies and short communication channels.
 Project
 This well-known app for brands, retailers, and consumers is looking for an experienced Data Scientist (m/f) who is, like them, passionate about delivering the best product and user experience to our customers. As a key member of their cross-functional and agile team setup, you will leverage your skills and ability to extract valuable insights from various data sets. You will work with a variety of challenges that touch all parts of the business. Their goal is to design a better product that customers will love, enabling them to get meaningful data for them to make the most accurate decisions.
 Role
  Identify the best state-of-the-art algorithms and libraries to solve complex problems.
Ad-hoc data analysis to answer critical business questions and to identify potential growth and development opportunities.
Enriching the company’s data with third-party information when needed.
Improving data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building better analytic systems.
Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional groups, initiatives on methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data.
Improve our internal data science tools and frameworks.
 Qualifications
  Strong programming skills in Python
3+ years of prior experience in a Data Scientist role including statistical modeling, simulation, and analysis, machine learning algorithms like predictions, recommendations, object recognition
Good knowledge and experience in image recognition, text extraction algorithms 
Good knowledge of libraries like Pandas, PuLP, Matplotlib, seaborn, sci-kit-learn
Experience working with Linear Programming and Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Experience with TensorFlow 2
Good knowledge of SQL
Comfortable with Data Engineering skills
Good knowledge of AWS Services like EC2, S3, Data Pipeline
Basic knowledge of third-party API integration to read data from external sources
Experience in executing data science projects
 Personal Skills
  Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to explain complex effects and impacts of ML/DL insights in simple business terms
Entrepreneurial mindset, self-starter, and ability to operate independently

WatchGuard embraces a Flexible Work Philosophy. Most of our employees can choose to work from the office, at home, or any combination of the two. We’ve built a global workforce of outstanding team members and a flexible culture built on trust, collaboration, and belonging.
 A Day in the Life
 As a member of the development team, you will participate in the maintenance of all the services that we provide in WG Spain (Provision, billing, integrations, reports, etc). as well as in the development of new services. In your day to day, you will be involved in all the steps of development of these services in collaboration with the Project Manager and the rest of the teammates (learning the functionality and implementation of each application or service, analysis, estimation, development, testing, code validations, continuous improvement… up to delivery and production).
 About The Position
 You will be part of a leading global security company. You will find an excellent work environment, surrounded by a team that wants to continuously improve. The position is for a computer engineer with verifiable experience in .NET with C# and .NET Core technologies and advanced development in MS SQL Server. Additionally, knowledge of Azure, experience in TFS code repository, MS Integration Services and using Jira will be valued.
 The ideal candidate should show interest in continually updating their knowledge of new technologies, business processes, communication skills, responsibility, and proactivity.
 You will grow and evolve as the Project grows.
 30/60/90 Day Plan
  At 30 days – This is a training period. We will train on our internal procedures, the platform, and services. Code and documentation review and pair programming happen in this period.
At 60 days – Training continues. They can already perform easy tasks in services already known in their own. Pair programming continues and supervision is needed. They will interact with other employees as part of the training.
At 90 days – Training continues but they should be able to perform tasks on their own. Working as independently as possible but still with some supervision and other team members’ help when needed.
 Responsibilities
  Create clean code applications.
Find solutions to problems that may arise.
Make the necessary tests to detect anomalies.
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance.
Code reviews
 Skills And Qualifications
  3-5 years of experience in a similar role
Minimum medium-grade professional training in IT related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
.NET Framework 
 .NET Core
REST and SOAP services
Microsoft SQLServer advanced development
Microsoft Visual Studio
Unit tests.
Pattern-based design.
 The following knowledge is valuable:
  Microsoft Team Foundation Server
Entity Framework
Build automation
DDD
Clean Code
Microsoft Integration Services
HTML5, css3, jscript, ajax and jquery.
Microsoft Azure
 Why Work for WatchGuard?
 WatchGuard is a global leader in network security and intelligence, advanced endpoint protection, multi-factor authentication, and secure Wi-Fi. Our award-winning products and services are trusted worldwide by more than 18,000 security resellers and service providers to protect more than 250,000 customers. Our technology keeps our customers ahead of increasingly sophisticated hackers and has fueled record revenues at WatchGuard.
 WatchGuard is headquartered in Seattle, Washington, with team members working remotely and in offices worldwide.
 Our company culture places an intense focus on our customers and employees. From the newest employee to our CEO, you'll find that each person at WatchGuard embodies our Core Values: Accountability, Community, Belonging, Action, Innovation, and Customer-Centric. Learn more about our company culture at www.watchguard.com/wgrd-careers.
 WatchGuard provides equal employment opportunities for all qualified employees, regardless of their race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, creed, pregnancy, age, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression or identity), marital status, mental or physical disability, honorably discharged veteran or military status or any other category protected by federal, state or local laws. Our equal employment opportunity (or EEO) policy focuses solely on the talent, hard work, contributions, and actual results achieved by each WatchGuard employee and on the potential of employment candidates to make such contributions. We consider focusing on an employee's protected characteristics rather than on talent, hard work, and actual work results to violate our EEO policy. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to a diverse workforce. WatchGuard participates in E-verify.
 WatchGuard is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. Please let us know if you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability.
