job_title: Collaboration Engineer / SharePoint / Office 365 (m/w/d) - Vollzeit / Teilzeit
description:
DANK IHNEN ARBEITEN UNSERE TEAMS BESSER ZUSAMMEN 
Als Collaboration Engineer übernehmen Sie die Konzeption, Entwicklung und Implementierung von modernen Arbeitsplatz-Lösungen, die auf unserer Collaboration Plattform (Microsoft SharePoint & Office 365) basieren. 
Zusätzlich unterstützen Sie das technische Projektmanagement bei der Weiterentwicklung bestehender Collaboration-Plattformen und Abwicklung konzernweiter Kundenprojekte. 
Sie sind die Schnittstelle zwischen internen Kunden, externe Lieferanten und der Softwareentwicklung. 
Die professionelle Abwicklung von 2nd & 3rd Level Support zählt ebenfalls zu Ihren Aufgaben. 
Qualifikationen 
IHR KNOW-HOW IM BEREICH SHAREPOINT IST DER SCHLÜSSEL ZUM ERFOLG 
Eine IT-technische Basis-Ausbildung (FH, Uni, HTL) ist unabkömmlich. 
Außerdem bringen Sie Know-How im Bereich Microsoft Collaboration (SharePoint und/oder Office 365) mit. Wenn Sie außerdem Kenntnisse in der .NET-Entwicklung, im Bereich C#, Java Script und PowerShell haben, ist das von Vorteil. 
Sie überzeugen uns mit ersten Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und ihrer kundenorientierten Denkweise. 
Sie arbeiten gerne selbständig, lösungsorientiert und analytisch und haben Spaß daran Ihre tiefgreifenden IT-technischen Erfahrungen unter Beweis zu stellen. 
Wir sind ein internationaler Konzern. Englisch ist daher ein „Must“. In der Abteilung sprechen wir auch Deutsch.
 Zusätzliche Informationen 
Sie gestalten Ihre Arbeitszeit von 38,5 Stunden eigenverantwortlich und flexibel, es gibt bei uns keine fixierten Kernzeiten. 
Sie können gerne zu 50 % im Homeoffice arbeiten oder alternativ ihren Arbeitsplatz in Amstetten oder tageweise unsere Shared Offices in Linz oder Wien benutzen. 
Doka bietet Ihnen ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld z.B. Mitarbeiterkantine mit frischgekochtem Essen, Vital- und Sportangebot, super Betriebsklima. 
Für diese Position wird ein marktkonformes Gehalt geboten, welches sich an der konkreten Qualifikation und der adäquaten Berufserfahrung orientiert. Wir sind gesetzlich dazu verpflichtet ein Mindestgehalt anzugeben. Das jährliche Bruttomindestgehalt für diese Position beträgt laut Kollektivvertrag (holzverarbeitende Industrie) EUR 31.577,28(auf Basis Vollzeit). 
Haben Sie Lust in unserem jungen (Team-Durchschnittsalter ca. 40 Jahre :-) und dynamischen Team mitzuarbeiten?

We’re looking for outstanding and dynamic Supply Chain graduates to join our graduate scheme to begin in September 2023. We are a forward-looking company with a desire to remain both innovative and sustainable in an increasingly global market. We are looking for highly motivated, emotionally intelligent, hardworking, articulate communicators like you to help us achieve our growth aspirations.
 This role will be based on site at our Neuville-aux-Bois Packaging Plant. 
 We are the leading provider of packaging solutions and Europe’s biggest recycler. We have a unique supply cycle strategy with an industry leading approach to sustainability: we want the brightest new ideas to continually improve our design, innovation and entrepreneurship. That’s where you come in; every role at DS Smith plays a part in helping us reduce that carbon footprint.
  About the programme
Our scheme runs for two years and will give graduates the foundations to succeed in either Supply Chain disciplines, with different placements across the course of the programme. You’ll go on a rigorous development programme to give you the skillsets to succeed in these areas, whilst also developing you into becoming a DS Smith future leader. You’ll be paired up with a mentor and be given first class training from our external partner to develop leadership capabilities and be offered opportunities to put everything you’ve learned into practice.
 Our Supply Chain graduates will ensure we have the right materials in the right place, at the right time, at the right price, linking our sales team to our operational team to maximise use of stock and avoid waste, ensuring everything we do is cost effective and efficient.
 You’ll work in different locations for each part of your placement, therefore full mobility in terms of location will be required to be considered for this role (in some cases this may be a change in country), but don’t worry, we’ll support you with any moving costs.
 Alongside the role specific skills you’ll develop, you’ll be in a cohort of graduates and together we’ll offer you a world class development programme which will support you in becoming one of our future leaders.
  In year one the focus is on understanding yourself; your skills, your strengths and how to realise your potential.
In year two your development will be about understanding others, how to work effectively in teams and how to support others.
 You’ll then be in charge of your own career pathway, whether you grow into a leadership role or a specialism.
  About you
To be considered for this scheme you must have as a minimum:
A degree within Supply Chain (or due to achieve your qualification before September 2023).
Speak fluently in English and French (minimum B2 level).
Hold the relevant right to work within the country you’re applying within.
Be fully flexible and geographically mobile.
 Benefits
A competitive salary.
A range of other benefits depending on the country you’re applying within.
 *Assessment Centres will take place in March/April 2023 and candidates will need to be able to attend this virtually.
**Successful applicants will need to be available to begin their first placement on September 4th 2023.

job_title: Full Stack Developer - Application / Python / Kubernetes / Gitlab / Remote (m/f/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. We are looking for reinforcement at the earliest possible date Full Stack Developer - Application / Python / Kubernetes / Gitlab / Remote (m/f/d).
 Sounds interesting? Then we look forward to receiving your application via our partner Workwise.
 Smart communication with artificial intelligence is our specialty. To remain on the road of international success with innovative products, we are looking for reinforcements of our international development team as now of.
 Your tasks
 You will work as an all-round talent in a highly qualified development team. The following tasks await you in detail:
  You will realize powerful chatbot applications from the conception to the production launch.
You optimize user experience by selecting the right components and frameworks.
You develop your own applications for our Conversational AI Analytics Dashboard.
 Your profile
  You are a team player, curious and proactive in proposing new technical solutions
As a proactive problem-solver you leave code and processes in a better shape than when you first encountered them.
You are fluent in English; German is a nice to have.
 OUR STACK
  Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
Web Dev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 We offer
  We offer you the opportunity to take the next big leaps together with us. Let’s shape together technologies of the future. You will grow with us and receive your own projects right from your start.
Your tasks are broadly diversified and offer you enough challenges and variety even as an experienced developer.
At our company, you can arrange your working hours flexibly on a basis of trust. You can also move into your home office by prior arrangement.
Attractive salary models are a matter of course.
Your workplace is located in a generously equipped old building. Your own Desktop-PC and laptop are part of the basic equipment.
You will have your own parking space or can use the good public transport connections.
A good working atmosphere and good coffee complete our offer.
 Our job offer Full Stack Developer - Application / Python / Kubernetes / Gitlab / Remote (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

job_title: Senior Backend Developer (PHP), (Remote, Spain based candidates ONLY)
description:
One of the companies we work with is looking for a Senior Backend Developer (PHP) to join the team.
Remote candidates must be living (or willing to live) in: Spain.
 Job description
  🛂 Work permit required
📍 Remote in Spain, preferably near Barcelona
🤑 40-50K €
🛠️ +5 years with PHP
🔊 Fluent English and Spanish
 ➡️ The job
 We want to keep creating a great product that changes the way in which the world parks. Would you like to join us in this adventure? We are searching for a software engineer who wants to develop his/her professional career in a startup environment with the possibility of becoming a team’s lead, an architect or even perhaps a CTO!
 🧑🏼‍💻 The stack
  We use Docker, and you should too!
Our stack is mainly based on PHP, and our framework pool consists of Silex, Symfony and Laravel.
We rely on cache services (like Memcached and Redis), queues (SQS), databases (MySQL), oAuth and other rocket-science technologies.
We constantly deploy our code to AWS using our in-house Ansible pipeline.
We monitor our platform with New Relic and Sentry.
 🎯 The methodology
  We are agile and follow SCRUM.
We code applying SOLID, Clean Code and Hexagonal architectures.
We try to use TDD, but we know it's hard sometimes.
We test our code with PHPunit and Behat (Gherkin!).
 🛠️ Requirements
  You are autonomous, you lead by example, you are a finisher, not a starter.
You really try to create code that is maintainable and scalable.
You are proficient in PHP and modern frameworks.
You believe in TDD, you have experience in unit testing.
You know how to create data structures and write decent SQL queries.
You are not new to the Linux console, and you have experience with Docker.
 🤗 We offer
  CREATE: Freedom to make choices in a really agile environment.
SCALE: To be part of a large project, with millions of users and a big future ahead.
LEARN: Trying out new things, time for learning, attending congresses and courses.
GROW with us: develop your professional career here.
LIVE: Schedule flexibility and optional remote.
TEAM: A team of developers who will take your opinion into account. Where debating and making decisions together is a reality.
 Hiring Process
  1️⃣ Cultural Fit with Manager HR: This is a first contact and is used to get to know the company and the candidate first hand.
2️⃣ Technical Interview: The candidate is evaluated through technical questions by one of the backend developers.
3️⃣ Technical test: With the backend team, the candidate will have to share the screen and perform a test where the main purpose is to demonstrate how he/she programs and how he/she develops as a future colleague.
4️⃣ Meeting the CTO: The candidate will meet with the CTO and HR Manager to deepen the cultural fit.
 Joppy is a tech recruitment platform built for developers by developers.
 ✅ No CV required. Just say what you know and what you want.
✅ Anonymous profile by default.
✅ You choose who can talk to you. Companies can't write to you until you accept their offer.
✅ Only relevant offers matching your preferences. No more Javascript offers for Java developers.
✅ Get a reward if you get hired.
 Keep an eye on tech job opportunities anonymously and match the job that makes you happy.

Vendo (https://www.getvendo.com/) is a all-in-one SaaS eCommerce platform for marketplaces. We'd need your help to develop new features & integrations while keeping bugs under control.
 This is a long-term and 100% remote work position in a fast-growing, high-intensity SasS product company. We are passionate about our product and are excited about the opportunity to be a market leader.
  So, what will I do?
Work in a team with fellow engineers and stakeholders
Design, Implement, Gather Feedback, Iterate - this is not a task-taking job, this will require you to implement, improve and deploy features from A to Z. And talk to people.
Our team is composed of people all around the globe and English is the primary language of communication.
We keep our meetings as short as possible (usually a daily standup and occasional pair programming) to create a distraction-free zone.
You can freely speak to the CTO and CEO at any time, you should speak to them as often as you can.
Work with modern and well-proven tech-stack
We use Ruby 3 and Rails 7 with Hotwire to build great interactive UIs for our customers as well as integrations with a number of 3rd party APIs - e-commerce platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, Magento, etc), payment gateways (Stripe), tax services, and many others with REST and GraphQL
This will require both backend and some frontend skills to develop features end-to-end
We process millions of jobs with Sidekiq
TDD and CI & CD to deliver the best quality code (which will also be tested via static analyzer tools)
 Requirements
Must-haves
Product-oriented approach
At least 3 years of commercial experience working with Ruby on Rails
Good team player skills
Great communication skills
Excellent knowledge of Sidekiq and background processing of large volumes of data
Hotwire experience, we use both Turbo and Stimulus
Efficiency in writing automatic tests (Capybara/rspec) or similar
Experience working with 3rd party APIs such as payment gateways, fulfillment providers, tax services, analytics, marketing automation
Good knowledge of building performant SQL queries
Ability to deliver the feature from 0 to 1 and take ownership of it
Nice-to-haves
Experience working with Shopify, Woo Commerce, BigCommerce or Magento/Adobe Commerce API
Experience developing Spree or Solidus apps is a great plus
ElasticSearch and Redis knowledge is a big plus
 The recruitment process:
Get-to-know call with our CTO
A Test Task. This task shouldn’t take more than 4-5 hours to complete. The goal is not to have a fully implemented solution, work-in-progress is more than enough! We just want to see how you would approach this challenge
Feedback on your test task solution
Job offer and paperwork
 Compensation & Benefits
Compensation $3,800 - $5,150 to your bank account
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
20 paid vacation days a year
Paid sick leave up to a week a year
Evaluation Process every 6 months (your job satisfaction survey, your team feedback, your manager feedback, compensation review)
 Privacy Note
The controller of your personal data is Vendo sp. o.o. seated in Warsaw, at Jasna 15 Street (‘Controller’ or ‘Vendo’). Contact e-mail with the Controller is possible at gdpr at getvendo.com
Your data, if you wish to conclude a contract of employment, will be processed for purposes related to the fulfillment of legal obligations (labor code). If you want to cooperate under B2B contract or contract of mandate data will be processed in order to carry out the recruitment and analysis process CV in terms of the possible conclusion of the contract. Irrespective of the grounds indicated above, your data will also be processed for the purpose of setting the conditions employment/cooperation, as well as Vendo claims or defense. Processing for these purposes is carried out on a legal basis Vendo's legitimate interest in obtaining information on the expectations of the candidate, in particular the expected one remuneration and availability, as well as a possible investigation, establishing or defending against claims in court and out of court. If you send us more data than required by labor code or by Vendo data will be processed on consent expressed by sending a recruitment application. Your personal data may also be processed on the basis of consent for the purpose of future recruitment.
Your data will be processed by our partner, providing the platform for submitting recruitment applications. Out partners may transfer your personal data outside of the European Economic Area.
You have the right to request from the Controller access to your data, rectify your data, demand its erasure, restriction of processing, object to processing, and data portability. You also have the right to lodge a complaint to the President of the Personal Data Protection Office.
You also have the right to withdraw your consent (to the extent that processing was based on consent), but the withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing which was made on the basis of consent before its withdrawal.
We process your personal data in order to recruit for the position indicated in the announcement and possibly longer for the period of limitation of claims. When you have agreed to participate in future recruitment for a period not longer than 6 months from the moment of collection (or until you withdraw your consent for future recruitment).
Providing personal data to participate in the recruitment procedure is voluntary. Failure to provide personal data required under the Labor Code (in the case of a contract of employment) or data required by Vendo (in the case of B2B contract or contract of mandate) will result in the inability to participate in the recruitment procedure. Failure to send additional data, not required by the Labor Code or by Vendo, will not affect the possibility of participating in recruitment proceedings.
If you have any questions, you can contact us at e-mail gdpr at getvendo.com

job_title: Software Developer - Full Stack / PHP / Python / JavaScript / Remote (m/f/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. We are looking for reinforcement at the earliest possible date Software Developer - Full Stack / PHP / Python / JavaScript / Remote (m/f/d).
 Sounds interesting? Then we look forward to receiving your application via our partner Workwise.
 Smart communication with artificial intelligence is our specialty. To remain on the road of international success with innovative products, we are looking for reinforcements of our international development team as now of.
 Your tasks
 You will work as an all-round talent in a highly qualified development team.
   You will realize powerful chatbot applications from the conception to the production launch.
You optimize user experience by selecting the right components and frameworks.
You develop your own applications for our Chatbot Analytics Dashboard.
 Your profile
  You are a team player, curious and proactive in proposing new technical solutions
As a proactive problem-solver you leave code and processes in a better shape than when you first encountered them.
You are fluent in English; German is a nice to have.
 OUR STACK
  Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
Web Dev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 We offer
  We offer you the opportunity to take the next big leaps together with us. Let’s shape together technologies of the future. You will grow with us and receive your own projects right from your start.
Your tasks are broadly diversified and offer you enough challenges and variety even as an experienced developer.
At our company, you can arrange your working hours flexibly on a basis of trust. You can also move into your home office by prior arrangement.
Attractive salary models are a matter of course.
Your workplace is located in a generously equipped old building. Your own Desktop-PC and laptop are part of the basic equipment.
You will have your own parking space or can use the good public transport connections.
A good working atmosphere and good coffee complete our offer.
 Our job offer Software Developer - Full Stack / PHP / Python / JavaScript / Remote (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

AKKA & Modis, jetzt Akkodis, ist ein globaler Vorreiter für Technologien und digitale Lösungen in der Smart Industry und zählt zu den führenden Anbietern. Mit über 50.000 Ingenieur:innen und Digitalexpert:innen in 30 Ländern unterstützen wir unsere Kunden und Partner weltweit in den Bereichen Life Sciences, IT und Digital Engineering. Wir suchen Talente, die gemeinsam mit uns auf Augenhöhe Innovation und digitale Transformation für eine intelligente und nachhaltige Zukunft vorantreiben. Unsere Mitarbeitenden stehen bei uns an erster Stelle und wir glauben daran, gemeinsam viel bewegen zu können. Dies bestätigt auch der dritte Platz der Modis als bester Arbeitgeber Deutschlands 2021 im Bereich Beratung & Consulting. Sie möchten an innovativen und zukunftsorientierten Projekten arbeiten, die unsere Art der Fortbewegung revolutioniert? Unter einem hochmotivierten Team bringen Sie zielführend Ihre Kompetenz mit ein? Dann suchen wir exakt Sie als Software Integrator ADAS (m/w/d) für einen unserer Automotive Kunden am Standort Koblenz. Diese Vakanz ist im Rahmen der Arbeitnehmerüberlassung zu besetzen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt. Ihre Aufgabenschwerpunkte 
Planung, Steuerung und Koordination der Integration in- und externer Softwarekomponenten 
Entwicklung von Strategien zur Absicherung der Integration und Kontinuierliche Verbesserung des Integrations-Prozesses und dessen Präsentation in Audits 
Erstellung, Anpassung und Erweiterung von Integrationsabläufen sowie der hierfür benötigen Tools und Erweiterung und Analyse von Software Tests 
Analyse von Integrationsproblemen sowie Koordination der Abstellmaßnahmen 
Interne Abstimmung mit den relevanten Stakeholdern (SW-Architekten, SW-Projektleiter, SW-Entwickler) hinsichtlich SW-Integration und SW-Test sowie externe Abstimmung mit dem Kunden bzgl. der Anforderungen und des Timings an die Integration 
Konfiguration von AUTOSAR Software-Komponenten für eingebettete Systeme unter Verwendung von Modellierungswerkzeugen 
Ihr Profil 
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Elektrotechnik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation und erste Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung insbesondere in der Programmiersprache C 
Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Konfigurationsmanagementtools wünschenswert (GIT, PTC Integrity) 
Kenntnisse von ASPICE, ISO 26262 und AUTOSAR und erste Erfahrung in der Entwicklung PC basierter Software zur Identifikation/Umsetzung von Automatisierungspotenzial (JAVA/C#/etc.) von Vorteil 
Ausgeprägtes analytisches Denken, Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsstärke sowie strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie gute Koordinationsfähigkeit 
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse erforderlich 
Das erwartet Sie 
Möglichkeit im Homeoffice /remote zu arbeiten
Flexibles Arbeiten im Büro und von Zuhause (hybride Arbeit)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm 
Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits. Sie möchten gerne mehr über uns und über diese und eventuell noch weiteren Stellen erfahren? Dann senden Sie uns gerne direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen. Ihr Kontakt Herr Leo Jarzabek recruitingcenter-frankfurt@modis.com Modis GmbH Engineering Theodor-Heuss-Allee 108 60486 Frankfurt am Main Telefon +49 69/668194400 www.modis.com

We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for a Managed Cloud Junior AWS Engineer. Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud. 
Handling monitoring, troubleshooting, debugging, and load testing of cloud-native services
Developing automation and IaC for customer’s infrastructure and applications
Improving performance and availability of applications running in the public cloud
Keeping and improving the level of customer satisfaction (including on-call) 
Participating in the development of standards and best practices 
Basic technical knowledge and experience in AWS
Basic technical knowledge and experience in managed Kubernetes
Some experience with at least one scripting language (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell)
Some previous professional experience in OS administration (e.g. Linux, Windows)
Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., subnets, VPN, firewall, DNS)
Fluent communication skills in English 
Your super-powers (we’d consider any of these as a big plus): 
Experience in managing incident resolution and change fulfillment
Experience in working with Jira and Confluence is welcome
Knowledge about IaC concept and tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible) 
If you don’t meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let’s find out together if we are a good fit for each other! What do we offer in return? 
A highly skilled multinational team
Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Poland
Local benefits such as health care, life insurance, a cafeteria system, and a virtual assistant (AskHenry) 
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Poland. If you’d like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile. Ukrainians and those fleeing the Ukrainian war, are welcome to apply, we will support you with your work visa process. Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It’s a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects. Learn more at nordcloud.com

Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.  Summary / Role Purpose Ansys develops complex simulation software on a whole range of physics domains. Our team at Ansys creates the state of the art simulation software that enables our customers to design their optical systems and sensors and then simulate their performance in the virtual world without the need for costly prototypes. As an R&D Engineer II you will contribute to the continuous evolution of Ansys Speos, our best in class optical system design simulation product. You will be regularly collaborating with a team of expert professionals to understand customer requirements and accomplish development objectives.  Key Duties and Responsibilities 
 Research, design and contribute on implementing features in a state-of-the-art Computer Aided Design (CAD) software application
 Understand, employ and contribute towards software engineering best practices with guidance from Senior Engineers.
 Perform moderately complex bug verification, release testing and beta support for assigned products.
 Research problems discovered by QA or product support and develop solutions
 Participate in scrum meetings. Interact constructively with colleagues, providing constructive feedback and insight to support the team goals.
 Work under the general supervision of a development manager 
 BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 3-5 years of commercial software development experience
 Solid experience of design and implementation of object-oriented application features in C# on the Windows platform
 Experience with Unit Tests (MSTest, NUnit, or xUnit.Net)
 Experience in using Microsoft Visual Studio and Software versioning management tools (GIT)
 Experience in integrating with 3rd party SDKs 
 Technical knowledge and experience working with CAD or 3D software platforms
 Experience with Pyhton scripting
 Experience in Windows UI technologies
 Knowledge of agile development methodologies
 Solid written and oral communication skills in both French and English
 Ability to learn quickly and to collaborate with others
 Exposure to scientific simulation software 
Req: 11671 CULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. 
 Customer focus 
 Results and Accountability 
 Innovation 
 Transparency and Integrity 
 Mastery 
 Inclusiveness 
 Sense of urgency 
 Collaboration and Teamwork 
WORKING AT ANSYS At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished”. It’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics. At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines. Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100. For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

About NCR NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a leader in transforming, connecting and running technology platforms for self-directed banking, stores and restaurants. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Ga., with 38,000 employees globally. NCR is a trademark of NCR Corporation in the United States and other countries. POSITION SUMMARY & KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY: 
Position responsible for installation, maintenance and repairs on equipment within an assigned territory/region to assure continuity of customer operations and high levels of customer satisfaction
Responsible for ownership of customer problems or incidents until the situation has been resolved to the customers satisfaction and or in compliance with agreed upon Service Level Agreements
Required to perform work on products and services of low complexity, specifically financial/ATM products; Make minor repairs and replace components on Tier I equipment such as PCs, workstations and peripherals, printers, front-end POS systems, First Line Maintenance on ATMs and kiosks, and single pocket proof encoders
Responsible for assisting in site preparation, including installation of cable, staging of equipment, and minor testing of equipment; May also perform required modular swaps and unit replacements
Customer Engineer responds to all customer concerns or problems by resolving them or by escalating them to the proper associate, team member, territory manager, or the Control Tower
Build working relationships with customers and develop informal communication channels with customer account at the local level; Represents NCR in a manner that reflects positively on the image and reputation of the company
Performs periodic preventative maintenance on assigned products; Diagnoses problems, makes minor repairs, and replaces components (at the module level); Follows appropriate security procedures when working with ATM's and or within financial institution
Responsible for all NCR assets that will be used in the delivery of customer services (i.e. tools, software, vehicles, documentation, and intellectual property), or as assigned by management; Maintain an appropriate parts inventory as well as parts record keeping
Responsible for accurate and prompt reporting of calls and activity, as well as other reporting as required; Responsible for tracking and reporting all expenses incurred in the delivery of services, including telephone, private automobile, and/or public transportation
Responsible for capturing detailed customer asset information and other data required to complete any invoicing or billing activities
May be dispatched daily on a call-by-call basis or may establish his/her own daily schedule on the basis of automated reports
May require prolonged travel, carrying and lifting tool kit/parts of varying weights (1- 50 lbs.); May require bending/squatting, walking/standing /sitting for prolonged periods; May be required to work on rotating shifts
Ensure staff productivity measures are achieved; Work together with Call Center Staff via PDA to recover machines; Work together with Security Escort Officer
Retail EPOS maintenance or install experience is required; Strong desktop hardware experience may be considered if EPOS experience is limited 
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 
High School Diploma or equivalent
years of related experience
Ability to work with Microsoft Office suite; Experience on Windows XP, Windows 2000 operating systems required
Experience in PC Hardware Maintenance and support
A+ Certification
ITE or Polytechnic in Electronics and Communications Engineering
Works well with minimal supervision; Good problem solving skills; Ability to pick up new skills quickly; Ability to work under pressure; Ability to meet deadlines and produce high quality work
Excellent interpersonal skills/customer relationship skills required
High level of mechanical/electrical aptitude; Experience on maintaining computer hardware (Desktops, Servers, peripherals), routers, networks, switches, hubs required
High level of personal integrity; Support and promote teamwork and cooperative effort
Must have the ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends, overtime, flex shifts, and on-call 
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
Associate’s Degree preferred
Previous experience in NCR or similar equipment is a plus
CCNA preferred 
Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job. EEO Statement Integrated into our shared values is NCR's commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment. Statement to Third Party Agencies To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR employees, or any NCR facility. NCR is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

There has never been a better time to join Extreme, with several acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the region.
 Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace. Having Diversity and Inclusion as part of our core values and beliefs, we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive because of their differences, not despite them.
 The SE provides specific technology/product consulting, technical sales support for major account opportunities, performs in-depth and high-level technical presentations for various departments / locations at the global account and potential affiliated businesses. The SE also performs technical consulting, support for RFI/RFP responses and upper level management and/or in-depth presentations on Extreme Networks technology solutions in context of the Global Account.
 You will also be required to participate as a specialist on an assigned virtual team. Travel is required.
  Good presentation skills (fluent in German and English)
 Strong, successful pre-sales engineering track record in the industry and territory in a similar position is necessary
 Understand Data center fabric designs using Clos based designs knowledge of BGP EVPN, Vxlan. (very important)
 Virtualization technologies VMware, VMware NSX, Microsoft hyperV, Nutanix and openstack. (not mandatory for all of these –basically data center experience)
 Working knowledge of Linux
 Integration of systems using APIs
 Previous work with mobile carriers desirable
 Work with customer project teams on design and PoC labs, setting criteria for successful PoCs etc
 Tenacity and perseverance (customer advocate facing internally to Extreme)
 Ability to build, develop, and maintain a network of people at the customer/partner side independent of sales being accepted as the trusted advisor
 When growing the business the willingness to assume a team-lead role for the account team when/if business requires additional resources.
 Service Provider Market and direct sales engineering experience is ideal with emphasis on verticals of Mobile and cloud DC. With experience of working with/for large (prefer global) organizations.
 Experience working with Channel is a plus for technical training on products. Major account experience and experience in closing deals is necessary.
 Extreme Networks certifications is desirable, but not mandatory
 Recognized certification from a major vendor is a plus
 Strong Gigabit and 10 Gigabit Ethernet LAN switching and routing technical skills
 Ability to demonstrate a broad knowledge of key protocols and technologies, such as MPLS, Routing Protocols, Ethernet and Wireless Technologies
 Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of future trends and market directions
 A sound knowledge with Layers 2-7 of the OSI model along with strong data communication network design experience
 A good understanding of two or more of the following networking technologies:
 Network Access Control (NAC)
 Voice/Data Convergence
 Wireless LAN
 SDN OpenFlow/OpenStack/VXLAN
 IPv4/v6 Routing Protocols (RIPv1/v2/v3, OSPFv2/v3, VRRP, MPLS, BGP, PIM, etc.)
 Layer2/3 Switching ( 802.1Q , 802.1D , 801.x, Policy)
 Experience in Virtualization and Cloud computing would also be very desirable
 Understanding programming languages and scripting (Python/TCL) is a plus, previous education in software development is very desirable.
 Ability to support customer evaluations, demonstrations and detailed design requirements
  Domestic/International travel will be required
 At Extreme, we value your contribution
 Training resources: you will have various resources to choose from for your technical & personal development
 Technical equipment and work resources: you will be staffed with newest top technology and any equipment needed for feeling comfortable at your workplace
 Direct participation at company’s success: aside commission earnings, you can voluntarily enroll to our subsidized Employee Stock Purchase Program
 Flex First: our flexible work model is engrafted into our culture as we endeavor to have a global workforce that is seamlessly connected no matter where we are
 Recreation time matters: our working time model gives you major flexibility on taking time off when you need it – in addition to your 30 vacation days a year (considering a 5-day-work-week)
 Employee Assistance: we provide you with lots of programs and activities, but also individual support as desired
 On top insurances: you will be enrolled to our insurances on Business Travel, Pension Scheme and Life & Occupational Disability
 And so much more…
 Extreme Networks, Inc. ( EXTR ) creates effortless networking experiences that enable all of us to advance. We push the boundaries of technology leveraging the powers of machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, and automation. Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before. For more information, visit Extreme's website or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.
 We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. Come Advance with us! In keeping with our values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Extreme Networks also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our organization. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Extreme Networks.

En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares. Más de 400 empresas, incluídas Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., han contratado a desarrolladores de Turing.
 A US-based technology company looking to make a difference in the digital healthcare sector is looking to hire a new front-end developer for their team. The selected developer will work alongside a suite of cross-functional teams to utilize data-driven insights to help make informed decisions and develop strategies. The organization is looking to drive a big change in the health of people with cardiovascular ailments by using digital services to expedite help and regular support. Developers must also overlap a minimum of 4 hours per day with US time zones for coordination.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Help to design and build intuitive front-end components for applications
Collaborate on a daily basis with product managers, designers, and engineers to deliver quality products
Communicate with clients’ technical leadership to understand necessary requirements and execute them
Utilize a wide range of systems and technologies to build out end-to-end solutions
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 5 of experience working in front-end development processes
Must have proficiency in working with technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Should be well familiar with the core principles of React or Angular
Familiarity with complex code bases, systems, and source code control systems like Git is essential
Must have experience in building and supporting mission-critical user-facing processes
Fluency in English and excellent communication skills to collaborate with engineering managers and other stakeholders

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join us remotely. You contribute to the development of our SaaS product and act as domain owner for analytics services. Your code will help customers grow based on data-driven decisions and algorithmic recommendations.
 Together with your team, you focus on software development, establish high-quality code and influence architecture decisions.
 Are you ready for your next challenge? Apply now!
 Your Tasks
  You develop and maintain the Analytics Service backend including purpose build database technology and APIs 
You build components required for ETL, query logic and enriching of customer data to facilitate insights, recommendations and benchmarks across our served industries 
You oversee relevant parts of the user facing analytics infrastructure and produce scalable and maintainable solutions 
You work closely with PM, UX/UI and other functions, using modern agile software development methods
 Your Profile
  Several years of experience in backend engineering with a strong desire to specialize further in big data, data engineering, and analytics
Strong track record using Golang for cloud-based applications, SQL is part of your daily routine (experience in Python and/or PHP is a plus)
Experience with different data storage systems like MySQL, DynamoDB, S3, Redis, Druid, Snowflake, etc.
Love for algorithms, design patterns, unit testing, SOLID and modular development as well as numbers, statistics and more complex calculations
Global view of architecture and business logic
Open and team-oriented personality and passionate about working in a cross-functional team
Fluent English skills
  Remote first!
 We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam, Berlin or Munich. You decide!
 Xentral feels like home!
 For us Xentral is not just a workplace. We make sure that our team feels at home even during work. We offer flexible working hours and home office.
 Unique culture and structure!
 We believe in flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and appreciative communication at eye level.
 With us to the very top!
 With us there are many career paths and development opportunities for you, what you can't do yet, you can learn with us!
 Planning ahead!
 For our permanent employees in Germany and the Netherlands we offer 50% subsidies to your private pension plan.
 You have what it takes? Then apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile.
 We look forward to your application!
 About Us
 We are an established tech startup with major tech investors Frank Thelen, Sequoia Capital and Visionaries Club on our side. We are aiming at defining a new SaaS category and empower entrepreneurs and e-commerce vendors to automate their resource planning and focus on the things that matters most to them: their business. We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam or Munich. You decide!

Agil zusammenarbeiten, schnell auf Veränderungen reagieren und immer wieder Wettbewerbsvorteile ermöglichen: In der ROSSMANN-IT wird aus vielen klugen Köpfen ein einzigartiges Team! Mit unseren Bereichen Agile Entwicklung, IT-Betrieb und IT-Kaufmännische Dienste sind wir der smarte Partner unserer Fachbereiche. Ob in der Logistik oder an unseren Lagerstandorten, ob in unseren Filialen und im eCommerce-Bereich: Mit unseren Dienstleistungen schaffen wir echten Mehrwert. Und das gelingt uns vor allem deshalb so gut, weil wir mit Spaß ans Werk gehen und unseren Spielraum für eigene Gestaltungsideen voll ausnutzen. Das gibt’s bei uns obendrauf 
IT Pate
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
37,5-Stunden-Woche
30 Tage Urlaub
Weihnachts- und Urlaubsgeld
Betriebsrente
Umfassendes Onboarding
Personalrabatt & Einkaufsgutscheine
Corporate Benefits
Mitarbeiterorientiertes Familienunternehmen
ROSSMANN-Lernwelt
ROSSMANN Einarbeitungstage
Attraktive Produktboxen Das bewirken Sie bei uns 
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Multi-Hybrid-Cloud Architektur
Anforderungsumsetzung und -beratung bzgl. Kubernetes
Weiterentwicklung des IaaC stacks mit Terraform und Ansible
Implementierungen von Virtualisierungs- und Containerlösungen
Optimierung von Cloud Infrastrukturen unter dem Aspekt Verfügbarkeit und Performance
Unterstützung bei der Migration bestehender Anwendungen in Cloudumgebungen
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Entwicklungs- und Infrastrukturteams Das bringen Sie mit 
Abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder Studium im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder vergleichbare Ausbildung. Alternativ mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in vergleichbarem Aufgabengebiet
Sie kennen sich aus mit: Azure Cloud
Sie haben Erfahrungen in Infrastructure as a Code mit Terraform und Ansible
Erfahrungen in Kubernetes Administration und Containertechnologien
Erste Erfahrungen bzgl. Helm Charts wünschenswert
Eine hohe Team- und Kundenorientierung zeichnet Sie aus Im Fließtext unserer Stellenanzeigen wird auf die gleichzeitige Verwendung der Sprachformen männlich, weiblich und divers (m/w/d) verzichtet. Sämtliche Personenbezeichnungen gelten daher gleichermaßen für alle Geschlechter.

Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs?
 The Lead Software Engineer at Relativity develops software and leads a team to apply software engineering best practices to deliver high-quality, maintainable, reusable, reliable, performant, and scalable software. They will work with business stakeholders to support the development of products, features and services that drive and evolve our SaaS offering. You will serve as a technical liaison between your team and other internal and external development teams to identify and resolve dependencies, to identify, improve, and apply software engineering best practices and processes, and to identify and mitigate risks to the on-time delivery of software.
  Web Hosting team is responsible for the delivery of a stable platform used for handling content to customers and allowing them to run their extensions to the system. High performance of the solution directly impacts customer experience and is critical for the organization. The team takes care of whole lifecycle of the solution from the design to sunset. It is responsible for constant monitoring and improvements of the solution as well as preparing the transition to new technologies.
 Here you will have the opportunity to solve significant complex scalability, availability and performance challenges while learning new cloud development best practices using technologies like Azure, .NET core, Serverless Compute, Chef, PowerShell, and Jenkins.
   Lead technical development projects 
Assistance and lead the effort on architecture, design, and development of a performant, scalable, and secure cloud platformMake high-impact contributions and provide technical guidance to a software development team to ship high quality software that operates on data at massive scale. 
Lead the design of software using abstraction, low coupling, high cohesion, modularization, encapsulation, information hiding, interfaces, and separation of concerns. 
Specify, analyze, and estimate non-functional software requirements 
Provide input into system software architecture development by working with Staff, Advisory and Principal Engineers. 
Lead the implementation of software using the practical application of algorithms, defensive programming, exception handling, fault tolerance, design patterns, and best practices of Object-Oriented Design and Programming such as SOLID 
Enable best practices of Test-Driven Design and the use of autonomous frameworks and Continuous Integration and Continues Deployment. 
   Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar technical degree, or work equivalent experience 
8+ years of professional software development experience on commercial-grade systems and applications with a proven track record of building and shipping successful software 
Experience designing and developing highly scalable solutions in a cloud platform (Azure, AWS, Google) Azure experience is a plus 
Experience developing systems and applications, or related experience 
Experience in .NET software development using C# or related technologies 
Experience working in highly automated test environments 
Strong knowledge of Agile software development methodologies (SCRUM) is a plus 
 Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.
  Comprehensive health plan
 Flexible work arrangements
 Two, week-long company breaks per year
 Unlimited time off
 Long-term incentive program
 Training investment program
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Description Position 
Azure (Integration) Developer 
Department 
The Cloud team at HSO International, the global partner for multinational companies 
Aiming for 
Seasoned Azure Integration Developer looking to take the next step at Global scale 
Location 
Europe, Amsterdam and or remote 
Start date 
Anytime 
Work across the globe Take the next step! Are you looking for a job in which you develop yourself quickly and immediately receive a lot of responsibility? Are you a seasoned Azure (Integration) Developer? Then we are looking for you. The business Founded in 1989, HSO specialises in implementing, integrating, optimising and maintaining enterprise solutions based on Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Dynamics AX, Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Microsoft Office 365 with a focus on multinational enterprises in industries such as Distribution, Retail, Manufacturing and Services (Construction, O&G, Professional Services, Field Service, Equipment Rental). Leading Microsoft Partner HSO belongs to the elite Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, restricted to the top 1% of all Microsoft partners worldwide, and has delivered successful implementations in almost every country in the world. Today the business employs c. 1.220 professionals and maintains a worldwide presence with locations in Europe, North America and Asia. What does that mean for you? We don’t just want you to join HSO International, we want you to stay! We don’t want you to have a job with us; we want you to have a career with us. We are ambitious to continue to be a world class global implementation company. Our people are ambitious for the company and they are ambitious for themselves. We’ll hire you not just because of where you’ve been and what you’ve done, but of where you can go and what you can do in the future. Requirements When do you match up? You have… 
 A good understanding of Azure services used in integrations (Logic Apps, Service Bus, Event Grid, Function Apps, API Management etc.)
 Have experience implementing one or several of the integration services, using either l low-/no-code or .Net Core (.Net framework also) primarily in C#/JavaScript/PowerShell
 Have experience integrating primarily with Microsoft first-party services and non-Microsoft services like SAP, AWS, Salesforce and other 3rd party applications.
 Have a data-driven mindset when it comes to integrations to facilitate the decoupling of applications and services
 Understand key integration architectures and how to apply them, for example, Enterprise Messaging, CQRS, micro-services etc.
 Recommended, have experience with Azure DevOps and CMMI/Scrum/Agile methodologies.
 Optionally, understand or have experience developing and deploying ARM templates, using Git repositories for source control, and using YAML pipelines.
 Optionally, have experience integrating with the Power Platform, specifically Dataverse (or Dynamics 365 Sales/Customer Service/Field Service etc.)
 Optionally, I have experience with Azure IaaS components, mostly Virtual Machines, SQL Databases and some understanding of cloud networking. 
This function does (not) suit you! ✓     You are convinced that data is the key to improving processes and making the right strategic choices. ✓    You like to take on challenges and complex issues!  ✓    The enthusiasm of colleagues ignites you, and your efforts are just as inspiring for others. ❌  You  do not like working in a team and supporting others. Key Responsibilities 
Designing and delivering Azure API and associated data platform solutions 
Designing and integrating Azure platforms in a manner which allows the management and provision of data in a secure and reliable manner 
Documentation of solutions (e.g. data models, configurations, and setup) 
Research emerging technologies and trends to ensure the best possible outcomes are achieved 
Evaluate architectural integration options in terms of cost, benefits, risk, and systems fit to provide recommendations 
Communicate the integration strategy with key stakeholders to gain input, buy-in and influence decision-making 
Work with other functional leads to understand the constraints, assumptions, issues and imperatives relating to their domain and determine how to address these over time 
Own and actively manage the integration platform roadmaps and associated designs 
Produce project integration architecture deliverables and review lower-level design documentation 
Benefits Why should you choose HSO International? Leading Microsoft Partner You work with Microsoft’s Azure cloud platform, Dynamics 365 and our unique, industry-specific solutions to develop the best strategy for a digital transformation and design, implement and manage innovative cloud solutions of our customers. With +200 colleagues at HSO International, you are a point of contact for companies that understand the big picture and oversee cross-border implementation issues. You follow the HSO Excellerate methodology to execute projects predictably, delivering high-quality results most efficiently. Development and growth You get a job with plenty of career opportunities with a leading provider of innovative enterprise business solutions and a distinct Microsoft Global Solution Integrator who perceives your motivations, talents and ambitions. Fun and success You work in a professional and pleasant working environment with colleagues ready to help each other because success cannot be achieved without cooperation and pleasure! A good reward You receive an excellent salary (fixed and variable) and good benefits, such as a leased car, laptop and mobile phone. Freedom and responsibility You get a lot of freedom and flexibility to organise your workdays, especially to shape your career.

job_title: Database Engineer, Cross-Cloud SaaS Platform - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description:
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity? 
 We provide and operate hundreds of managed databases instances for critical teams in VMware and a growing number of other customers. Most of those database servers are PostgreSQL which is not surprising since it is the most popular database in the World. Over time, we will encounter every possible performance, scalability, and reliability challenge that a PostgreSQL operator may face.
 As a Database Engineer or administrator, you will design how to solve those challenges. That will help you grow to be a world-class expert on PostgreSQL and similar relational databases. You will join a motivated team with solid expertise in software development and you will deliver together with us the next groundbreaking database-as-a-service product.
 Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? 
 In 12 months, you will apply your existing experience in operating PostgreSQL to define how we configure and deploy the database, including:
 Deployment topology and replication configuration for high availability. Selection and configuration for off-site, incremental and schedules backups. Adapting the configuration of PostgreSQL to different types of workloads.
 In all cases, you will work with the rest of the team to automate the application of those designs and monitor how they impact the performance of customer databases.
 What type of work will I be doing? What assignments will I be performing on a regular basis? 
 Typical assignments for your position will be:
  Research how to configure and deploy PostgreSQL, and in the future other databases, to achieve the outcomes above. 
Automate in your tool of choice – Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes Controllers (Golang) – applying that configuration. 
Define metrics for each outcome and test configuration changes at scale. Troubleshoot database issues that occur in our test environment or in the deployments of our customers.
Adapt your design accordingly. 
 Who is the hiring manager? What is the structure of the team/organization I will be working with? 
 You’ll be joining a growing team of engineers located in Bulgaria, Ireland, India and the US. The larger team is split into several sub-teams with local management, focused on the different areas of the platform.
 We are looking for individuals who are self-driven and have the passion to learn new skills and solve complex technical issues. The leadership for this role believes in creating a pleasant and inclusive workplace and building strong relationships and collaboration within the team.
 Where is this role located?
 The location of this role is flexible within Bulgaria. Work will be done from an office some days during the week and other days from a non-VMware building with the employees having the option to choose the option of working fully remote.
 Category : Engineering and Technology
 Subcategory: Software Engineering
 Experience: Manager and Professional
 Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
 Posted Date: 2023-02-13
 VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Are you growing with us?

At TGW Benelux we are expanding the Lifetime Services team with a Technical Sales Engineer. In this new position, you will get the opportunity to be in the front seat of learning all of what the intralogistics world has to offer and see how the daily operations of our sites in the Benelux run.
If you want to start your career in a leading international provider of intralogistics solutions, than this is your opportunity!

The Technical Sales Engineer supports in creation of customized Lifetime support services (LTS) offer and contracts, renewals of existing LTS support contracts and Lifecycle management offers (Obsolescence, repairs, site improvements). The Technical Sales Engineer will work closely with Central Services team to drive upsell of Lifetime services product portfolio.

Main Responsibilities
You will support in preparing Lifetime Services offers in the sales phase of a project.
You are accompanying and supporting our Service Specialist at new customers, incl. preparation of service packages, quotations and presentation of those (when required).
You will prepare, initiate and doing sales of LTS product portfolio offering (site audits, system health checks, obsolescence, FMECA, etc) at existing and install base customers.
You will support marketing events for LTS such as webinars, attendance at industry trade shows, etc.
You support development of existing systems with feedback from customer sites (e.g. TGW CMMS, On-Site, Augmented Reality, Smart Glasses, etc.).
You’ll have close cooperation with counterparts in other units, especially TGW BNL, TGW UK and TGW Nordics.
You will be obtaining feedback from Customers when tenders are unsuccessful in order to improve in future activities.

About You
Preferably, you have a Master degree in Engineering.
You have clear communication (Dutch, English) and good networking skills.
You are able to manage multiple sales bids simultaneously.
You are an entrepreneurial and a self-starter.
You have excellent attention to detail and presentation skills.
You are reliable, punctual and keep commitments made by the organisation to our customers.
You have stakeholder management experience.
You are willing to travel for work within Benelux (sometimes to UK and Austria).

We offer

A dynamic, open and informal working environment with pleasant colleagues.
Immediate a permanent contract with a market conform salary and 8% holiday allowance.
Lease car or car allowance.
Laptop and Mobile phone.
Collective Labor Agreement Metaal en Techniek, Technisch installatiebedrijf applies.
Annual salary review.
32 days off.
Extra age days in accordance with the Collective Labor Agreement.
Dual Employee Participation Plan (https://www.tgw-group.com/en/career/about-us/benefits/dual-employee-participation); a profit sharing scheme of the company based on the EBIT of the past year.
Attention to personal development and advancement with an individual training budget.
Unlimited online training through GoodHabitz.
Extensive training programme for the equipment you will be maintaining.
Support programme for employee and family, both business and private.
Excellent secondary employment conditions, including collective health insurance, contribution for gym, discount on private car lease, a bicycle plan and generous employee insurance.
