This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company. As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code. Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations. This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time. What You'll Do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality code to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Ensure the success of OpenStack and Ceph on multiple architectures
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events 
Who You Are 
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have experience with Python
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following:Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, AI/ML, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, scalable web services
You have experience with non-x86 architectures, including s390, arm64, power and others
You have experience with OpenStack, OVN, Openvswitch and other related cloud technologies 
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. Keywords: python, agile, lean, distributed systems, openstack, ceph, containers, kubernetes, docker, scale-out, orchestration, linux, ubuntu, cloud, devops, open source, serverless, networking, home, remote job, software development, software engineering, openstack Reports to: OpenStack Product Engineering Manager Job location: Remote, home-based, Americas

This is where you save and sustain lives At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients. Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare. Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work. Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission. Baxter Medical Systems ermöglicht Spitzenleistungen bei Verfahren und Konnektivität in allen Pflegebereichen. Von der Notfallversorgung über die chirurgische Versorgung bis hin zur Intensivpflege und der medizinischen Notfallversorgung liefern unsere Lösungen Erkenntnisse in Echtzeit und helfen den Pflegeteams, hervorragende Ergebnisse zu erzielen. Damit chirurgische Teams und Pflegepersonal effizient arbeiten können, sind digitale Systeme und automatisierte Geräte unerlässlich, um Prozesse zu rationalisieren, den Benutzerkomfort zu erhöhen und die Patientensicherheit zu verbessern. Baxter trägt dieser Entwicklung Rechnung und setzt mit seinen intelligenten und vernetzten Lösungen neue Maßstäbe. Für unseren Standort in Saalfeld (Thüringen) oder in München suchen wir Sie als Embedded Security Engineer (m/w/d). Ihre Aufgabe 
Durchführung interner Sicherheitsaudits bestehender Hardware- und Firmware-Produkte, zur Überprüfung, ob Best Practices befolgt und Sicherheitsanforderungen erfüllt werden 
Verwaltung der Cybersicherheitsergebnisse für Regulierungsbehörden und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung wichtiger Standards/Leitfäden 
Kritische Überprüfung des Designs neuer Hardware und Software, um Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten zu identifizieren und vorzuschlagen 
Pflege relevanter SOPs und Bereitstellung von Leitlinien für das Testen von Produkten, um die Einhaltung der gesetzlichen Anforderungen sicherzustellen 
Unterstützung bei der Durchführung von Sicherheitsrisikobewertungen anhand des Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) 
Kooperative Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Divisionen und Funktionen, um unternehmensweite Ziele zu erreichen 
Untersuchung von Hardware/Geräte und Analyse auf Einstiegspunkte und Schwachstellen 
Schulung und Unterstützung des Teams in Bezug auf Hardware-Penetrationstests 
Durchführung eines Reverse Engineering der Firmware des Embedded-Gerätes, um Schwachstellen zu identifizieren und auszunutzen 
Ihr Profil 
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbarer Abschluss 
Erfahrung mit Penetrationstests, mit besonderer Relevanz im Gerätebereich 
Umfangreiche Kenntnisse über ARM-basierte Mikrocontroller und wie man darauf basierende Geräte angreift/verteidigt 
Erfahrung mit der Benutzung von Sicherheitsfunktionen auf Hardwareebene wie Secure Boot, Encrypted Storage 
Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie C/C++ und C # 
Erfahrung mit Netzwerken und relevanten Sicherheitspraktiken und -kontrollen 
Kenntnisse über Linux-Sicherheitsmodell und Härtungstechniken wie ASLR, DEP, SELinux, AppArmor usw. 
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung oder Handhabung von eingebetteten Systemen, Treibern oder Betriebssystemen Erfahrung mit WiFi-Sicherheit, Secure Boot, ARM-Architekturen und TPMs 
Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Sicherheitstest-Tools wie Disassemblern, Flash-Dumpern und JTAG-Findern 
Kenntnisse von Low-Level-Protokollen wie SPI, JTAG und UART sind wünschenswert 
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse 
Ihre Bewerbung Bitte bewerben Sie sich unter Angabe Ihrer Entgeltvorstellungen und des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Als international tätiges Unternehmen bieten wir Ihnen interessante berufliche Perspektiven, ein kooperatives Arbeitsumfeld sowie ein leistungsorientiertes Entgelt. Genießen Sie die Vorzüge flexibler Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie unsere Programme zur Weiterbildung, Gesundheitsförderung und betrieblichen Altersvorsorge. Noch Fragen? Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen Herr Julian_kunz@baxter.com aus unserem Talent Acquisition Team gerne zur Verfügung. #IND-DACH Reasonable Accommodations Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to Americas_TTA@baxter.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Recruitment Fraud NoticeBaxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice. 070251

Het bedrijf
DMP is dé bekendste datamanagement specialist in Nederland, maar ook wereldwijd is DMP hard op weg naar een opmars. Met ruim 90 specialisten verdeeld over vestigingen in Nederland, Duitsland, Spanje en Zuid- Afrika, bedienen wij ruim 350 klanten over de hele wereld met betrouwbare en kosteneffectieve datamanagement oplossingen.
 Sinds 2020 is DMP overgenomen door Broad Horizon groep, aanbieder van IT-, data- en cloudoplossingen. Met deze overname groeit DMP (internationaal) nog sneller. Groei jij met ons mee?
 Dit zijn wij
DMP-ers zijn gedreven, gezellige en zeer vakkundige collega’s. Wij werken elke dag met plezier aan het leveren van onze expertise aan de klanten, zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband.
 Wij zijn altijd op zoek naar initiatiefrijke nieuwe collega's, vakkundige teamspelers die passie hebben voor het werkgebied waarin wij ons in bevinden. Mensen met ambitie die graag willen groeien en willen blijven ontwikkelen. Die lef hebben en zelf de eerste stap durven te zetten.
 Dit ben jij
Je wil voor elk probleem een oplossing vinden! Sterker nog, jij ziet kansen waar anderen problemen zien. Je vindt het prettig om anderen te kunnen helpen en wil er tegelijkertijd voor zorgen dat problemen zo min mogelijk voorvallen. Je bent klantvriendelijk en servicegericht, zelfs als je met je verkeerde been uit bed bent gestapt (en laten we eerlijk zijn, dat gebeurt ons allemaal wel eens).
 Ook al los je het probleem misschien niet direct op, je vindt het belangrijk de klant tijdig en volledig te informeren over de status van een ticket. Je weet hoe belangrijk een klant dit vindt!
 Zo ziet je dag eruit
Je stapt uit je bed, gaat naar kantoor of gaat thuis achter je pc zitten, waar je, na een kop koffie of thee, de lopende zaken met het team bespreekt.
 Na deze call ga je aan de slag met een openstaande supportticket t.b.v. van onze back-up oplossing. Het is een ingewikkeld probleem waar je even flink je tanden in kan zetten. Je duikt in logs en jouw beste troubleshooting skills komen naar boven. Informatie haal je uit eerdere ervaringen of documentatie van de leverancier. Na een tijdje puzzelen heb je het probleem gevonden en los je het ticket op. Heerlijk, weer een ticket minder!
 Op naar naar het volgende ticket. Dit is weer een heel ander probleem maar waarin jouw kennis nog niet toereikend is. Gelukkig kunnen jouw directe collega’s op de afdeling support jou helpen of vind je iemand anders binnen het bedrijf. Jij kent immers iedereen en zij kennen jou. Misschien niet meteen, maar wel wat later.
 Bij het derde ticket weten jij en je collega’s het ook niet en ga je naar de leverancier. Jouw onderzoek is van zo’n kwaliteit dat hun supportafdeling jouw onderzoek alleen kan bevestigen en je ticket moet doorzetten naar de ontwikkelaars. Daar blijkt dat er een bug zit in het product, kudo’s voor jou. Nu is het nog zaak om de boel scherp te houden en de klant te informeren.
Ondertussen belt een klant. Het zijn er niet veel op een dag, maar om een probleem op te lossen moeten we er eerst één krijgen!
 Dit keer is het een vraag welke jij direct kunt beantwoorden. Nog even registreren en klaar. Nu is het tijd voor wat fris en misschien een spelletje te spelen met een collega.
 Werk je vandaag thuis? Dan zorg je tussendoor natuurlijk dat je af en toe even je benen strekt en je ogen van het beeldscherm haalt (we kennen onze mensen: voor je het weten zitten ze 24/7 achter het beeldscherm)! Eet je boterhammetje bijvoorbeeld even tijdens een wandelingetje..
 Ben je op kantoor, dan schuif je gezellig met collega’s aan in onze gezellige bedrijfskantine waar een heerlijk huisgemaakte lunch wordt bereid. Elke dag weer anders.
 In de middag ga je met je collega kijken naar het ticket waar je eerder niet uitkwam. Samen lossen jullie het op. En weer een ticket minder! Jammer dat er net weer een klant belde met een ander probleem. Of toch niet ;-)
 Er is alweer een einde gekomen aan deze zeer dynamische en afwisselend dag. Je kijkt nog even wat je op de agenda hebt voor morgen, sluit af en of je nu gaat sporten, een filmpje kijken of een drankje doen met vriend/vriendin: je probeert vooral even niet aan werk te denken!
 Morgen ben je vrij gepland, dan heb je tijd voor die zaken waar je even geen tijd voor had of kun je eindelijk die training doen die je de hele tijd al op je lijstje had staan.
 Werkzaamheden:
In deze functie is het telefonisch aannemen en registreren van tickets marginaal! Je bent 90% van je tijd bezig met oplossen/troubleshooten van incidenten.
Het registreren en oplossen van supporttickets van onze klanten, tbv back-up oplossing en storage van o.a. Commvault oplossingen. Gartner Magic Quadrant: Commvault Is A Leader For The 10th Time
Naast Commvault verkopen en supporten wij ook producten van Netapp, Komprise en Cohesity. Hierin willen wij ons ontwikkelen als begin-en eindstation voor een klant zoals wij dat ook zijn voor Commvault. Je krijgt de kans je hierin verder te ontwikkelen samen met je collega’s!
Het ondersteunen en begeleiden van jouw collega's op technisch vlak.
Aanspreekpartner zijn voor onze klanten om datamanagementvraagstukken op te lossen en hen op diverse andere gebieden te ondersteunen.
Adviseren, begeleiden en ondersteunen van onze klanten bij problemen met back-up, archivering, contentindexering en opslag.
Contact leggen met verschillende leveranciers om problemen te escaleren als het gaat om bugs in de producten.
Klanten adviseren over installatie, configuratie en optimalisatie.
 Je back-up wordt wel eens je beste monitoring tool genoemd. Zit er iets fout in het netwerk, draait een applicatie niet dan zie je dit meestal terug in het falen van een back-up. Je kennis gaat dus verder dan alleen de back-up applicatie.
 Waarom dit (n)iets voor jou is:
+ Je bent analytisch sterk;
+ Je hebt MBO/HBO werk – en denkniveau. Je hebt passie voor servicegerichtheid, beheer en een proactieve klantvriendelijke houding;
+ Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal;
+ Je hebt kennis van Microsoft-applicaties;
+ Je hebt ervaring met Back-up oplossingen;
+ Je hebt ervaring met Commvault (pre).
 Ben je nog niet ervaren in deze rol, maar klinkt het wel heel erg leuk en zou je dit prachtige vak willen leren? Neem dan ook contact met ons op: er is bij ons ook plek om dit vak te leren onder begeleiding van ervaren support engineers! 
 Wij zijn natuurlijk ontzettend blij met jou als nieuwe collega!
Naast een uitdagende functie op unieke locaties bieden wij jou daarom een salaris dat aansluit bij wat jouw collega’s in de branche verdienen en hebben we goede secundaire voorwaarden zoals:
Uitstekend pakket in lijn met jouw ervaringsniveau;
Mogelijkheden om te groeien (certificering, training, webinars en kennisdeel sessies), omdat we jouw potentieel net zo waardevol vinden als jouw huidige vaardigheden;
1 op 1 begeleiding in de vorm van een buddy;
Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
Hybride werkmogelijkheden;
Diverse nevenactiviteiten binnen DMP (bootcamp, sociale projecten, incentives);
 Als je bij ons komt werken, dan kom je terecht in een professioneel team dat van resultaten houdt. De sfeer is informeel en de lijnen zijn kort. Jouw groei vinden wij belangrijk en hier krijg je ook alle ruimte en tools voor om jouw groei te stimuleren! Wil jij meer weten over deze uitdagende functie of DMP? Neem dan contact op met Bart Uittenhout via buittenhout@dm-p.com of telefonisch op 06 510 44 898.

ENTWICKLE MIT UNS DIE ZUKUNFT DER MOBILITÄT. IT-Architekturen für Connected Car, Fahrerassistenz, Infotainment und Elektromobilität zählen zu den spannendsten Zukunftsthemen einer sich immer rasanter entwickelnden Branche. In unseren Teams arbeitest du auf Augenhöhe mit ausgewiesenen Experten an diesen Herausforderungen. Finde zukunftsweisende Lösungen und entwickle dich und deine Skills in einem dynamischen und teamorientierten Umfeld weiter.
 WAS DICH BEI UNS ERWARTET?
Für den OPS Bereich suchen wir Dich um uns bei fachlichen und technischen Analysen, Testfallspezifikationen, manuelle bwz. automatisierte Absicherungen und Support Themen zu unterstützen. Hierbei erwarten Dich folgende Aufgaben: 
  Fachliche Einarbeitung z.B. Redaktions- und Publikationssystemen oder Call Services für Backendanwendungen 
Anforderungsmanagement 
Analyse und Spezifikation von fachspezifischen Geschäftsprozessen 
Spezifikation von Testfällen mit Beschreibung von Testdaten und Testläufen 
Testdurchführung mit Protokollierung und Reporting 
Fehleranalyse, Erstellung von Fehlermeldungen mit Beantwortung von Rückfragen und Nachtest von gelöste
  DAS BRINGST DU MIT:
Technisches Hochschulstudium der Informatik o.ä. 
Erste Berufserfahrung im oben genannten Bereich, insb. in der Testmethodik und Testprozess
Erste Kenntnisse mit JIRA und JIRA XRAy
IT Erfahrung Testspezifikation z.B.Cucumber wünschenswert 
Gute Erfahrungen mit JIRA und JIRA XRay
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift 
  DAS BIETEN WIR DIR:
AB IN DEN URLAUB! – 30 Tage Jahres-Urlaub für eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance
ARBEITSZEITENREGELUNG – FLEXIBILITÄT wird bei uns großgeschrieben. Arbeite zwischen 06:00 und 23:00 Uhr und nutze dein Gleitzeitkonto zum Freizeitausgleich.
WORKING@HOME – Bei uns kannst du bis zu 100% remote arbeiten! Präsent, hybrid, remote - was für dich dabei?
UNTERNEHMENSERFOLGSBETEILIGUNG – Du bist Teil unseres Unternehmens, deshalb sollst du auch an unserem Erfolg beteiligt werden!
JOBRAD – ES KANN LOSGERADELT WERDEN! Du bist sportlich und möchtest der Umwelt zuliebe mit dem Fahrrad zur Arbeit kommen?
WEITERBILDUNG – Bilde dich weiter! Unsere Cognizant Mobility Academy bietet interessante Schulungen sowohl im Softskill- als auch im Hardskill-Bereich. Zudem arbeiten wir mit Udemy zusammen.
ALTERSVORSORGE – Schon jetzt an die Rente denken! Profitiere von einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge und vermögenswirksamen Leistungen!
EDENRED-KARTE – Dein Guthaben zur Einlösung bei zahlreichen Partnerunternehmen. Ob Tankstellen wie die Total, Restaurants wie die L´Osteria oder Baumärkte wie Hornbach. Nutze die Partnerunternehmen, die zu dir passen!
u.v.m.
Wir stehen für Vielfalt, Diversität und Chancengleichheit unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion und Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter, sexueller Orientierung und Identität.
  Bei uns sind alle Jobs auch in Teilzeit machbar (ja, auch Führungstätigkeiten). Ihr könnt lokal im Büro, mobil oder beides -neudeutsch hybrid- arbeiten und dies in begrenztem Umfang auch aus dem Ausland. Werdet Teil unseres Teams!
 INTERESSIERT? Dann bewirb dich gleich. Bei Fragen hast du jederzeit die Möglichkeit, uns zu kontaktieren.

job_title: Software Engineer II (Frontend - Open to remote)
description:
Your opportunity We are looking for an experienced front-end engineer to join us in building The New Relic One! The platform will be used by your coworkers throughout the company and will help make their lives—and the lives of the customers they work with—easier and more enjoyable each and every day. Some of the problems we work on involve frontend API’s to interact with the internal framework, extensible architecture solutions, UI components and deal with modern frameworks and libraries such as ReactJS or Redux. What you'll do 
Implement rich, interactive data visualizations using modern JavaScript and software development techniques in conjunction with the team members.
Select the best frameworks and tools needed to do the job done quickly, while also optimizing for codebase stability, product stability, and target use case growth.
Work with our product manager and a team of data engineers to ensure data exploration products accurately render complex data that are aligned with the needs of our internal customers.
Produce highly performant and flexible user interfaces.
Collaborate with designers and other UI engineers across the company to learn from others and to ensure you stay up to date on the company’s UI best practices.
Learn and improve your skills to continuously push us to deliver higher quality data products and improve how we view data visualization as a company 
This role requires 
4+ years of experience working with modern JavaScript front-end frameworks
Familiarity with modern development and build tools such as git, npm, babel, and webpack; experience with front-end JS testing tools and a comprehensive understanding of UI testing techniques
Experience integrating the UI with data from service endpoints and expertise in modern HTML and CSS, including extension languages like Sass 
Bonus points if you have 
Passion about the whole stack a complex modern application requires!
Interest in learning new languages, platforms, and ideas.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment focused on delivering production code at a regular cadence using Agile techniques, tools, and methodologies. 
We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes. We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. Flex First allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid. Read more about Flex First. New Relic currently has offices in Germany, Ireland, Spain, and the United Kingdom, and based on business needs may approve work in Belgium, France, Italy, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, UAE, and other locations throughout the region. Some of our opportunities are limited to specific hiring locations. Talk with your recruiter about your goals and how we can work with you in our Flex First approach! Our hiring process Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic. New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.

Hoe lever je een bijdrage als System Engineer NH90?
 Als System Engineer voer je integratie / system engineering werkzaamheden uit voor de NH90 in samenwerking met je counterparts in Airbus Germany, Airbus France en Leonardo Helicopters Italy. Je bent met jouw berekeningen aan de voorkant van de veiligheid van onze luchtvaart. Dankzij jouw input vliegen vliegtuigen en helikopters over de hele wereld veilig rond. Je hebt een helicopterview nodig om besluiten te nemen, initiatief te tonen en in teamverband Fokker | GKN Aerospace internationaal te vertegenwoordigen. Je focus ligt vooral op veiligheidstechniek en composietconstructies. Als onderdeel van het NH90 team heb je 6 directe collega's in je team. Je bent gevestigd in Papendrecht.
 Wat worden je verantwoordelijkheden in deze rol? 
 Je houdt je bezig met de vertaling van technische en functionele eisen vanuit luchtwaardigheid en klant op H/C niveau naar eisen op Fokker component/part niveau. Verder zorg je voor een compleet en consistent eisenpakket zowel op H/C-systeemniveau als voor alle GKN/Fokker-componenten. Hier is afstemming (van de eisen) met onze Partner Companies, klanten en de werkmaatschappijen binnen GKN/Fokker belangrijk want je dient de technische engineeringswerkzaamheden (analyses, testen, simulaties); nadruk op veiligheidsanalyses acuuraat en nauwkeurig uit te voeren. Men kan op jouw vertrouwen dat de belangen van GKN/Fokker worden gerespecteerd in het internationale consortium en richting de klant. Het technisch beheer van werkpakketten en onderaannemers alsmede de identificatie van technisch risico op GKN/Fokker scope vallen onder jouw verantwoordelijkheden.
 Verder Werk Je Op Taakniveau Aan
   Downflow van systeemniveau naar componentniveau van technische gegevens;
 Specificatie van vereisten op systeemniveau tot specificatie van componentvereisten en voorgestelde wijzen van naleving;
 Oplossen van afhankelijkheden (technische inhoud);
 Technische vertegenwoordiging van Fokker in het internationale veld;
 Technisch generalist voor contract / project;
 Technisch (veiligheids)specialist internationaal voor GKN/Fokker NH90 artikelen;
 Integratie van component tot H/C-systeemniveau inclusief aantonen van conformiteit.
 Dit breng je mee voor deze rol?
 Met een Universitair diploma in bijvoorbeeld; Wiskunde of Natuurkunde of Lucht- en Ruimtevaarttechniek, Werktuigbouwkunde kun je deze rol aan. Er komt namelijk flink wat analytisch vermogen bij kijken.
 Verder ben je bereidt tot het opdoen van meer kennis of je beschikt over het volgende:
   Uitgebreide inhoudelijke kennis voor de (integratie van) disciplines van H/C-systemen.
 Ervaring met het opzetten en uitvoeren van Systems Engineering Processen.
 Ervaring met het beheer van werkpakketten en onderaannemers.
 Ervaring met het uitvoeren van veiligheidsanalyses.
 Bekend met EASA deel 21 en/of EMAR deel 21.
 Goede interpersoonlijke vaardigheden (o.a. nauwkeurig, diplomatiek, organisator).
 Goede onderhandelingsvaardigheden.
 Goede mondelinge en schriftelijke beheersing van het Nederlands en Engels.
 Over Fokker | GKN Aerospace
 Fokker | GKN Aerospace bestaat sinds 1759 en in meer dan 260 jaar zijn we wereldwijd uitgegroeid tot een van de grootste spelers op het gebied van engineering binnen de vliegtuigindustrie. De mensen van Fokker | GKN Aerospace hebben o.a. vliegtuigonderdelen, motorsystemen, elektrische bekabelingssystemen tot wereldklasse niveau ontwikkeld. Daarom produceren wij 90% van de meest geavanceerde vliegtuigen en vliegtuigmotoren. GKN Aerospace ontwikkelt, bouwt en levert een uitgebreide reeks geavanceerde lucht- en ruimtevaartsystemen, componenten en technologieën – voor gebruik in vliegtuigen variërend van zakenjets, helikopters en militaire vliegtuigen tot de meest gebruikte enkele gangpaden en de grootste passagiersvliegtuigen ter wereld.
 Fokker | GKN Aerospace Defense
 Voor onze defensieklanten over de hele wereld leveren we van systemen en componenten die vliegtuigen sneller, verder en groener laten vliegen. Ons portfolio varieert van de F-16 tot en met de NH90, de meest succesvolle Europese helikopter. Onze betrouwbare systemen en componenten variëren van aerostructuren en elektrische bedradingssystemen tot motorcomponenten. Onze langdurige betrokkenheid ondersteunt de groei in UAV / RPAS (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle)/RPAS (Remotely Piloted Aircraft System) van de defensiemarkt. Het markt- en technologisch leiderschap van Fokker | GKN Aerospace op het gebied van geavanceerde aerostructuren, EWIS en lichtgewich technologieën, heeft aangetoond goed aan te sluiten bij de vereisten van de UAV OEM's.
 Ambities en Talenten
 De jonge Anthony Fokker had altijd al grote plannen, en is zijn nalatenschap nooit verloren. Want het aanpakken van grote uitdagingen ligt nu nog steeds geheel in lijn met de huidige uitdagingen. Zo ook op het gebied van duurzaamheid. Momenteel werken we aan een emissievrij regionaal vliegtuig voor 48 passagiers. Het vliegtuig vliegt dan met nul CO2-emissies en nul NOx-emissies. Met als enige bijproduct: water. Dus we staan als Fokker | GKN Aerospace niet aan de zijlijn van de huidige transities, maar we maken het ook echt werkelijkheid. Hier zitten de talenten met de juiste vaardigheden en passie voor hun vak die bezig zijn met de hoogste kwaliteitseisen.
 Groei en ontwikkeling
 Fokker | GKN Aerospace groeit hard en met geweldige mensen houden we de lucht in beweging. Hier werken we samen met passie en vastberadenheid om vliegtuigen verder, sneller en groener te laten vliegen. We putten uit elkaars expertise en ervaring om het hoogste te bereiken en we bouwen onze teams op vertrouwen en respect.
 Wat zit er voor jou in?
 Een uitdagende werkomgeving: Een baan waarbij je samen de lucht in beweging houdt en waar je deel uitmaakt van een divers (internationaal) team van experts.
 Salaris en meer: Uiteraard een meer dan goed salaris dat past bij de inhoud van deze rol, en flink wat goede secundaire voorwaarden zoals:
   Vakantiedagen en ADV-dagen (40 - 42 per jaar)
 Pensioenregelingen bij PME
 Reiskostenvergoeding woon-werkverkeer
 Winstdelingsregeling
 Extra Informatie
 Waar kom je te werken?: Deze rol is een internationale rol en vereist internationale reizen.
 We werken 50% hybride. In overleg met je manager en je team werk je deels thuis en deels op kantoor.
 Fulltime/ parttime?: De functie is fulltime (40 of 32 uur per week).
 Onderdeel van de selectieprocedure is het uitvoeren van de nodige checks en screenings om te kunnen voldoen aan eisen die klanten, partners en leveranciers van GKN Fokker stellen binnen het programma. De checks en screenings zullen beoordeeld worden aan de hand van kaders die door onze afdeling Export Compliance & Security gesteld worden. Iedere medewerker binnen GKN Fokker moet uiteindelijk geautoriseerd worden om inhoud te kunnen geven aan zijn of haar functie. Beoordeling van checks en screenings kan er toe leiden dat er geen inhoud gegeven kan worden aan de functie en er zodoende geen dienstverband of inzet kan volgen. De onboarding bij Fokker neemt doorgaand 3 weken in beslag.
 De eerste gesprekken voer je met de Talent Aqcuisition Specialist eventueel eerst online en daarna een fysieke ontmoeting met de Inhurende Manager.
 Als we na deze gesprekken allemaal positief zijn, dan zullen we je een mooie aanbieding doen.
 Happy?! Fasten your Seatbelts want dan maak je onderdeel van een sterk, leuk en goed team van specialisten!
 Hoe kun je solliciteren?
 Heb je interesse in deze rol, en voldoe je aan de eisen? Wacht dan niet, en reageer gelijk. Nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met onze Talent Aqcuisition Specialist François Roskam op francois.roskam@fokker.com.
 Diversity Inclusion and Belonging (DIB)
 As a global engineering company, innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success.
 A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.
 GKN is an equal opportunity employer.
 We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Remote Indeed : Peddinghaus Corporation- Software Engineer Jobs | Turing
description:
A US-based company that has established itself as the leading equipment manufacturer for structural steel fabricators is looking for a Software Engineer. The selected candidate will be tasked with taking ownership of features, fixing bugs, performing implementations, and helping out with integrations. The company's innovative software interfaces between structural engineering and the customers’ machines that process structural steel beams and columns before they are assembled on construction sites. This will be a full-time position.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Cross-disciplinary teamwork is essential for success
Create, test, and debug software programs
Engineering standards, tooling, and processes should all be improved
Examine the current infrastructure and make recommendations for improvements
Troubleshoot production issues across different services and stack levels
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
3+ years of experience in analytical software design and development
Thorough understanding of compiler design, advanced algorithms, operating systems, and computer theory
Solid understanding of algorithms and data structures, compiler design, and object-oriented programming
Exceptional experience with file parsers, data mapping, interfaces to structural design software, and graphic user interfaces
Extensive experience working with C#, Windows Forms, ASP.NET MVC, and Microsoft Visual Studio
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Functional experience with programming, machine learning, or pattern and image recognition
Ability to solve challenging problems with impacts in the physical world
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with other engineering disciplines
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills

Project Description
 We are looking for a Lead Front-End Developer for our client - one of the world's largest natural resource companies.
 You will be a part of cross-functional team responsible for maintaining and modernization of existing trading platform. It is a long-term project that will require close collaboration with business and IT stakeholders and implementation of new new features.
 Responsibilities
 • Assess business requirements and provide development estimates
• Translate user requirements to user stories and technical task
• Work closely with BA and QA teams to deliver fit for purpose technical solutions
• Deliver quality code changes according to timescales provided
• Provide regular updates regarding development progress
• Act as part of the project team and be fully supportive to other members within the team
 Skills
  • Proven experience on large enterprise project is a MUST
• Degree in computer science/engineering (or equivalent)

The role is a key function for supporting our sales teams and customers by being a technical acumen for our HMI techno-commercial solutions.
   Support the Sales Team in preparing and submitting technical and commercial offers to customers.

We make your perspectives matter - Different points of view are what drive innovation and collaboration, and at Eaton, innovation begins with top-to-bottom diversity. Our senior leadership is made up of individuals from diverse groups to help create an environment where employees feel represented and heard at every level.
We make your growth matter - We invest in our employees for the long term – not just with salary and benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities made available through Eaton University
We make your contributions matter - reliability, safety, efficiency, and sustainability are at the core of our dedication to improving people’s lives and the environment through power management technologies.
  Eaton is an intelligent power management company dedicated to improving the quality of life and protecting the environment for people everywhere. We are guided by our commitment to do business right, to operate sustainably and to help our customers manage power ─ today and well into the future. By capitalizing on the global growth trends of electrification and digitalization, we’re accelerating the planet’s transition to renewable energy, helping to solve the world’s most urgent power management challenges, and doing what’s best for our stakeholders and all of society. Founded in 1911, Eaton has been listed on the NYSE for nearly a century. We reported revenues of $19.6 billion in 2021 and serve customers in more than 170 countries.
  Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030.
  Eaton is committed to having a workforce that is diverse and non-discriminatory at all levels, reflecting the diversity of our customers and the varied environments in which we conduct business around the world. Our success depends on our ability to attract and retain the very best people unlimited by race, color, social or economic status, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any protected status. Eaton follows relevant non-discrimination laws and regulations in the countries where we operate. It is the policy of the Company to make all decisions regarding employment, including hiring, compensation, training, promotions, transfers, or lay-offs, based on the principle of equal employment opportunity as defined above.
 Job: Sales
 Region: Europe, Middle East, Africa
 Organization: EPG CHD HAC Hazardous Area Communications
 Job Level: Team Leader/Supervisor
 Schedule: Full-time
 Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?: Yes – Hybrid

We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for a Managed Cloud Junior AWS Engineer. Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud. 
Handling monitoring, troubleshooting, debugging, and load testing of cloud-native services
Developing automation and IaC for customer’s infrastructure and applications
Improving performance and availability of applications running in the public cloud
Keeping and improving the level of customer satisfaction (including on-call) 
Participating in the development of standards and best practices 
Basic technical knowledge and experience in AWS
Basic technical knowledge and experience in managed Kubernetes
Some experience with at least one scripting language (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell)
Some previous professional experience in OS administration (e.g. Linux, Windows)
Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., subnets, VPN, firewall, DNS)
Fluent communication skills in English 
Your super-powers (we’d consider any of these as a big plus): 
Experience in managing incident resolution and change fulfillment
Experience in working with Jira and Confluence is welcome
Knowledge about IaC concept and tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible) 
If you don’t meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let’s find out together if we are a good fit for each other! What do we offer in return? 
A highly skilled multinational team
Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Poland
Local benefits such as health care, life insurance, a cafeteria system, and a virtual assistant (AskHenry) 
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Poland. If you’d like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile. Ukrainians and those fleeing the Ukrainian war, are welcome to apply, we will support you with your work visa process. Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It’s a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects. Learn more at nordcloud.com

job_title: C++ Audio Applications Developer (All levels, Multiple roles / Remote)
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. C++ Audio Applications Developer (All levels, Multiple roles / Remote) About Avid At Avid we create the digital audio and video technology that creative professionals use to make the most loved media in the world. Our tools are used every day by the best and most celebrated media professionals and artists to create films, music, live concerts, TV shows and broadcasts among others, which has earned us some thrilling awards along the way including two Oscars, a Grammy, and 18 Emmys recognizing our innovation in the industry. Just like our customers, our colleagues are creative and inventive. This makes our mission more personal and real, and our work more meaningful and fun. For more information about Avid and our products, visit . ABOUT THIS JOB POSTING: We are looking for talented C++ developers of all levels of experience (from Junior level all the way up to technical leads) who want to have an impact in the future of the music industry by contributing to the Avid Pro Tools product family and surrounding products and technologies. If this resonates with you and if you meet the minimum requirements listed below, do not hesitate to apply, someone from our recruitment team will review your application as soon as possible. Although our main hiring locations are Spain and Poland (any city), other countries will also be considered on an individual basis. WHAT WE OFFER: Here are some of the things you can count on when working for Avid: 
Being part of one of the most recognized brands in the movie, music and broadcast business (when we perform, Earth shakes and superheroes fly!). 
A competitive salary, bonuses and benefits (such as private medical insurance, life insurance and sport package subsidies, depending on location). 
Full employment contract. 
Flexible working hours. 
A modern work from home policy. 
Visa sponsorship and relocation support (depending on the position). 
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: 
Solid foundation in computer science and object-oriented programming principles, both in theory and in practice. 
At least intermediate level of proficiency in C++, including familiarity with common libraries and frameworks. 
Experience using an integrated environment to write, build, and debug software applications. 
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written and verbal English. 
To be successful in this role you must feel comfortable using available resources independently as well as asking colleagues for help when needed. 
Desirable Skills And Experience While not required, we are always looking for engineers with experience in the following areas. Some of these may be expected for higher seniority levels: 
Experience developing real-time Audio applications. 
Advanced level of proficiency in C++. Examples: templates, modern C++, parallel programming. 
Ability to design code that is clean, maintainable, reliable, and efficient. 
Experience applying practices to ensure quality such as unit testing and integration testing. 
Experience developing system level software, such as device drivers for macOS or Windows. 
Experience using tools such as code analyzers, sanitizers, and profilers. 
Audio and/or video domain knowledge (digital signal processing, music technology, codecs, broadcast formats, etc.) or previous experience developing audio and/or video application software or devices. 
Familiarity with Git tools and workflows. 
Previous experience working as part of a multi-cultural, distributed team. 
Avid is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet Who We Are Frontiers is the 3rd most-cited and 6th largest research publisher and we publish groundbreaking discoveries by the world's top experts. Scientists empower society and our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery by making science open. We place the researcher at the center of everything we do and enable the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet. Join the publishing revolution. What we have to offer: Frontiers is a young, technology-driven company with a large IT department that supports its goals. Our publishing platform consists of tens of web applications serving the diverse needs of our users. All the content of Frontiers journals is also available to everyone on our public-facing website that has millions of views every day. We are always aiming to give the best experience to our users, continuously optimizing and improving our websites and applications. About you: We are looking for a senior backend engineer to join us as part of a newly formed team. Here you will contribute to the building of a new version of an existing product, with a new code base and an extended feature set. Key Requirements: 
Minimum 4 years of commercial experience
Excellent programming skills in C#
Enthusiasm for modern approaches to software development and the latest technologies
Passion for clean and pragmatic design
Experience building and maintaining REST and GraphQL APIs
Experience designing and implementing scalable solutions using SQL and NoSQL
Familiarity with distributed systems, e.g. microservices
Excellent English-language communication skills
Driven and pro-active, with a “Get things done” attitude
An appreciation of working as part of a remote-first multi-cultural team 
Nice to have: 
Experience with Dapper
Experience with Apache Kafka
Frontend experience with Vue.js or similar SPA framework 
Benefits With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe. Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees. 100% remote working Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office). Learning and development All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time. Wellbeing We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance. Volunteering opportunities Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya. Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

job_title: Elixir / Erlang Developer (Consultant) - System developer / Programmer
description:
About PSC Biotech Ltd
 Who we are?
PSC Biotech is a leading Biotech Consultancy firm founded in 1996, headquartered in Pomona, California, USA, with Global operations in Ireland, India, Singapore, Australia, and the US, serving 350 clients in more than 23 countries worldwide. We provide cloud-based software solutions for Quality Management and Regulatory Inspections, pharmaceuticals contract manufacturing professionals, and metrology services to our clients.
 ‘Take your Career to a new Level’
PSC Biotech disrupts the conventional consultancy model by aligning our EVP as one of the unique selling points which includes the opportunity to work with the most talented cohort of like-minded professionals operating in the Pharma/ Biotech Industry. Our client is currently looking for a highly talented professional to join their team on a permanent basis with an attractive benefits package.
 Employee Value Proposition
We believe in creating high performing teams that can exceed our client’s expectations with regards to quality of all scalable and business unit deliverables, staying under budget and ensuring timelines for our deliverables are being met.
 Job Description
 Elixir / Erlang Developer (Consultant) - System developer / Programmer
 Municipality: Stockholm
 Brief facts about the job
Qualifications - Work experience
Requirement
System Developer / Programmer - 2-4 years’ experience
 Training - Requirement
Post-secondary education two years or longer in Data
 Competencies - Meritorious
Erlang, programming language
 Language - Requirement
English
 about the job
Do you love working and succeeding with customers?
Do you enjoy developing reliable, secure and scalable software systems?
Do you want a varied, exciting job where you work with the experts in the field?
Do you want to evolve the Elixir / Erlang / OTP open-source eco-system - used by e.g. Klarna, WhatsApp, Pinterest, Discord, Ericsson and Cisco - with passion and joy?
Then, you are in luck, since the client is continuously looking for the right consultants at all levels to grow with us!
 Responsibilities
Versatility and flexibility are the whole point of being a consultant, and we guarantee you will learn, grow and get out of your comfort zone since our customers have different business logics, technologies and environments.
Skills and Experience
In this setting, your ability to be a team player is at least as important as your ability to learn new things quickly and solve tricky problems, as is your passion for working with Elixir / Erlang / OTP technology, and building reliable, secure and scalable systems serving millions of parallel users, handling billions of transactions per day. Finding joy in sharing what you have learned is also something we are looking for.
 Requirement
System Developer / Programmer - 2-4 years’ experience
 Training - Requirement
Post-secondary education two years or longer in Data

Company Overview At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class. As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways. At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters. Department Overview Motorola Solutions provides trusted security solutions to the global market through its Video Security and Access Control Division. Motorola Solutions designs develop and manufactures video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions. Motorola’s solutions have been installed at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers. Job Description As a member of the Sales Engineering Department, the Sales Engineer will work closely with the Sales Organization to develop and position solutions involving Motorola Solutions products. The Sales Engineer is responsible for technical aspects of the sales process and works closely with the Sales Department involved to develop and position solutions involving Video Security & Access control Division products, writing specs for tenders, also answering to tenders, driving product tests and complex scenarios and internal/external training among others. During the needs analysis process, confirm that the products meet the prospect’s requirements and assist in technical qualifications. Throughout the proposal process, articulate the technology and demonstrate Motorola’s solutions to both business and technical users. Position Motorola products relative to competition and formulate system designs that conform to both technical and budgetary requirements. As this is an international position, international travelling may be required. Your key responsibilities will include: 
Effectively disseminate product knowledge by providing thorough training to Sales Teams when required. 
Manufacturing Representatives, Integrators, and End-Users
Support Sales Teams in responding to RFP’s and designing, specifying, and quoting systems
Develop and maintain strong relationships with Sales Teams, customers, and partners 
Collaborate with the Technical Support team in providing post-sales support to customers
Have positive attitude and can properly manage time and tasks
Perform related duties as assigned
Validate from a technical point of view any quote delivered by ISR team. 
Onsite activities including international travelling when required. 
Basic Requirements 
5+ years’ experience in Sales Engineering for a technology company 
Strong understanding of the video surveillance, body worn cameras and access control market
Self-motivated and focused individual with a passion for technology and an aptitude for customer satisfaction
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in:
English
Excellent presentation skills, especially with remote technologies such as teleconference. 
Possesses strong analytical and troubleshooting skills 
Has a pleasant, friendly style of verbal and written communication 
Driving License and Car are a must. 
Technical: 
Intimate knowledge and experience with Windows troubleshooting tools and techniques 
Excellent knowledge of networking principles and IP communication 
Experience with computer hardware configuration and troubleshooting 
Experience with network equipment configuration and troubleshooting 
Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience: 
Experience in access control
College degree or diploma of technology 
Prior experience in surveillance industry 
Microsoft and/or Cisco certifications 
Certification for any competitive products 
Travel Requirements Relocation Provided Position Type Referral Payment Plan No

iTech Media is a high growth marketing and product development company which started with a simple mission: to help people make smart choices online. We build digital products that inform and entertain a global audience across the most competitive comparison markets in the world: iGaming, Sports Betting, Personal Finance, and we’re expanding into new verticals.
We bring to life a network of over 150 products across 50+ countries, serving 130,000,000 users annually. Founded in 2015, iTech remains bootstrapped, and is scaling up rapidly with a proudly people-first culture. We’ve got big ambitions for the future, continuing to help the world’s top brands to grow their brands, and we need talented people who share our ambition to join us for the next, most exciting part of our journey.
Why we need you:
You'll join our team that develops and supports the core commercial finance system of our business. Every day, you'll have the opportunity to work with engaged stakeholders and users and see the value your work brings. Working with your scrum team you will ship high quality code that is maintainable, performant, secure, has meaningful test coverage and either documents itself or is well documented. We’re a supportive team that care deeply about each other’s well-being and growth.
iTech Media builds, maintains, and runs a broad portfolio of websites worldwide, and our vision is to build the #1 online media company globally in gaming and other sectors. By joining our incredible team, you will be crucial in helping us achieve this vision.
What you’ll be doing: 
Collaborate to improve system architecture with an aim of increasing performance, improving the UI and scaling the solution.
Maintain the system and support its users.
Work within your scrum team and with key stakeholders to interpret business requirements and deliver product value.
Apply problem solving skills together with the team to arrive at the most efficient solutions.
Recent and ongoing projects include our AWS infrastructure migration, rebuilding and decoupling our front end, and rearchitecting a monolithic codebase into Microservices.
Create and maintain documentation about any systems design and changes to it.
Implement and write tests along with partaking in code reviews. 
Ticket to play: 
The most important thing to us is that you’re an empathetic and collaborative engineer.
For technical skills we’re looking for someone who matches most of the below:
A pro with modern JavaScript frameworks such ReactJS or Vue. js with great working knowledge of PHP (Symfony) or Python.
Strong knowledge of SQL with MySQL, Postgres or a similar DBMS.
Best practices for writing Clean Code, including SOLID principles.
Solid experience working with REST APIs, HTTP and Web Scraping.
Version control software (GitHub, Bitbucket or similar).
Agile methodologies (SCRUM), DevOps and CI/CD practices with Docker.
Knowledge of basic AWS cloud services (S3, EC2, RDS).
Our Process:
Here at iTech Media we’re real believers in an interview being a two-way process, this is as much about you finding out everything you need to know about us as well as getting to know you. To help you understand what the process will involve: 
Initial Conversation Talent Team – approx. 30 mins
1 st Stage Interview with Engineering Manager and another member of the Chapter – 45 mins
Take Home Test (we’ll email you some details)
2 nd Stage Interview (Task discussion) with Head of Engineering and another member of the team – 60 mins
All the interview stages are held over Zoom. If you have a disability, a learning difficulty as dyslexia, a medical condition or other individual need for an adjustment to our process; and you believe this may affect your performance in selection, we’ll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you. Please let us know in good time, so that we can support you to perform at your best. 
What does success look like? 
30 days: 
Learn the system and its architecture. 
Demonstrate this knowledge by: 
Getting up and running locally. 
Resolving 3 open defects. 
Sharing your new understanding of the system through any medium that suits you, your working style and skills. 
60 days: 
Suggest system and/or process improvements in a thoughtful and considerate manner. 
Where possible meaningfully support the team in their BAU activities. 
90 days: 
Enact small incremental and impactful change. Examples of this could be: 
A team process improvement such as a change to our “ways of working”. 
Improving our test coverage. 
Shipping user stories that deliver product value. 
 What we can do for you:
Flexible working hours – “work your way”
26 days holiday, regardless of tenure, plus we close over end of year holiday period. You also get two days for your birthday and a life event, and two paid volunteering days a year.
Private healthcare including dental, wellbeing and talking therapy
Annual training budget of €1,000, plus regular training days to support your growth and development
Eligibility for our discretionary bonus scheme
Company-wide share option scheme
Pension contribution matched up to 4%
Life insurance cover up to 300,000PLN
Diversity, equity and inclusion at iTech Media 
iTech celebrates diversity in our teams, and we take inclusion seriously here. We’re creating an unrivalled opportunity for our teams to grow and belong, and as we scale, we know we need the most talented people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills. If you’re good at what you do, come and join us. The more inclusive we are, the more epic experiences we can create for our communities.
Please take a moment to read iTech Media's privacy policy

Company Description
 Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specialises in the delivery of unique, personalised customer experiences across platforms and devices. We call it ‘people-based’ marketing, and with over 25 years’ experience, we are proud to be recognised as a global leader.
Merkle’s heritage in data, technology and analytics is the foundation for our understanding of consumer insights that drives our people-based marketing strategies. Combined with our expertise in performance creative and media, we can then offer our clients content-driven, contextual and compelling customer experiences that drive business growth.
In 2016, the agency joined dentsu, one of the world’s biggest media companies to form the Customer Experience Management (CXM) Line of Business.
 Job Description
The Role
As a SFMC Campaign Developer you will lead a team of consultants in helping our clients achieve their aims of enriching their customer experiences using Salesforce Marketing Cloud. You will work across the full transformational journey including requirements gathering, technology selection and enablement, migration and operationalisation of the software.
 The Platform Enablement team is responsible for delivery of the following services:
Front-end platform configuration;
Campaign/journey migration;
New client onboarding and transition to Managed Service team based on Merkle WoW;
In-house client team set-up
Platform-user role definitions, career frameworks, placement and training;
Process design and operational handbooks;
Deployment of workflow and MI tools;
Platform usability audit and optimization.
 You will act as a Salesforce evangelist helping grow the practice within the business and work closely with other Principle Consultants to evolve our offering and deliverables.
 Life as a SFMC Campaign Developer at Merkle
You’ll act as a consultant on any new client campaign projects, offering support in the following remit:
Migration and Implementation planning – plan the lift and shift of campaigns from one tool to another, working closely with the client’s project team to capture, document and translate business requirements to actionable tasks.
Campaign design – utilize existing and develop new campaign briefs, journeys, diagrams and campaign lifecycle documentation for both peers/colleagues and clients.
Data design – display excellent understanding of the client’s data requirements and availability to support campaign execution during workshops, meetings and day to day activities.
Campaign operations stage gate – encourage best practice campaign process adoption including campaign RACI and ways of working (WoWs).
Campaign execution – independently build, test, QA, deliver, measure campaigns, sometimes across multiple client accounts.
Governance and control – lead on QA, testing, proofing, peer review tasks.
Training – buddying, desk-side support, bespoke campaign training, technical skills assessment and benchmarking.
Best practice consultancy – stay on top of industry news, optimisation techniques, controls, measurement, DPA and privacy, GDPR.
You could also lead a team of 2-4 Campaign Consultants (pending agreement and opportunities to do so); providing training and support to the team as and when required, discussing career progression and opportunities to grow as solution experts.
 Qualifications
What we are looking for in you
At least 5 years of experience in manipulating, segmenting, selecting data, and activating customers through Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
Experience in leading migration projects from start to finish.
Previous responsibility of managing day-to-day client relationships with the ability to carefully manage client expectations and build excellent working relationships.
Experience in assessing client requirements, providing recommendations, and estimating the cost of delivery.
Good understanding of relational data and database marketing, campaign, and reporting tools.
Excellent written/verbal communication and time management skills.
Excellent organisational skills to deliver against the required deadline.
Excellent attention to detail and appreciation of the need to follow process/treat data securely.
Good team working skills with the ability to work collaboratively and flexibly. 
Previous experience in managing a small campaign team is desirable.
 Additional information
A few of the benefits
Whether it’s the joy of working with people at the top of their game or the Merkle social calendar, people love working here – and we hope you will too
Attractive and competitive salary;
Spanish/English lessons;
Free life and health insurance;
Career development through Dentsu University and LinkedIn Learning;
Day off on your birthday;
Annual wellness days;
Merkle Care Employee Assistance Program;
Merkle Benefits Club;
Reduced fee in Andjoy;
2 volunteering days per annum;
Flexible salary remuneration scheme.
 Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. At the point of application, the candidate must have the legal right to work in Spain as we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.
As part of our Diversity and Inclusion agenda, and as an Equal Opportunities employer, if you require reasonable adjustments during the selection process please engage directly with your Recruiter.

En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares.  A rapidly-expanding multinational company offering cutting-edge IT and technology solutions to a worldwide customer base is looking for a Back-End Developer. The NYSE-listed company makes and distributes a high-quality, superior variety of goods to consumers, including personal computers and enterprise on-premises data center technology. This position requires 7+ hours of overlap with the CST time zone.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Work closely with the team to write automation tests, understand requirements, build solutions, deliver functionality, and build continuous delivery pipelines
Integrate front-end elements with server-side logic and functionalities
Effectively collaborate with product teams and engineering professionals to meet product requirements and build innovative solutions
