We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for Software Developers. Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud. 
Working as part of our team of software professionals, building applications that are at the core of our client’s businesses, creating e.g. effective electronic customer service and distribution channels, information services, online stores, and applications for the industrial internet
Helping with technical and architectural planning of the application
Sharing your knowledge among team members and supporting them with their technical challenges 
For us, it’s important to find interesting projects matching your career goals, be they more front-end, back-end, or data-heavy. Based on your interests, there are possibilities for various career paths, including team lead, coding cloud applications architect, data-driven developer, delivery or pre-sales support, solution architect, tech ambassadorship, cloud strategy consulting, etc. 
Strong tech skills, agile ways of working, and at least a couple of years of experience with some of the following programming languages/frameworks: Javascript/Typescript, Node.js, React, Python, C#, .NET, Serverless and cloud-native solutions
You value code that is easily read by humans and efficiently executed by machines
Fluent ways of communicating with the customer and your team members
Motivation to learn new, share your knowledge and grow to the next level
Fluent communication skills in English and Finnish 
If you don’t meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let’s find out together if we are a good fit for each other! What do we offer in return? 
A highly skilled multinational team
Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Finland
Local benefits such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits 
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland. If you’d like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile. Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It’s a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and it has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects. Learn more at nordcloud.com

About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet. As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role The Financial Crime Operations department is at the forefront of Revolut’s efforts to keep customers and their money safe 🥷 Those ninjas work directly with customers to resolve issues and flag potential concerns. Using cutting edge technology, we aim to prevent financial crime in a way the banking world hasn’t seen so far 💫 FinCrime Analysts is the key person to ensure we’ve got it under control, working with the Revolut Compliance team. It’s only for the most responsible, conscientious, brave individuals. The ones who aren’t afraid of challenges of the complex financial world 🕶 👉 We’re a global financial super app, so we have to be available 24/7. That sometimes means working nights and weekends. We’ll compensate you for night shifts but we understand this still isn’t for everyone so please bear that in mind before applying. What You’ll Be Doing 
Liaising with law enforcement
Responding to Court Orders, DPAs and POs and complying with legislation like POCA & DPA
Ensuring that all requests are completed within the applicable time scales
Liaising with the legal team as necessary or prepare documentation for third party requests.
Conducting fraud-related investigations based on the reports received
Generating reports and create alerts for suspicious activity
Discussing FinCrime concerns with members of the company across all levels 
What You'll Need 
Proficient English language skills 
Flawless German (exceptional communication and writing skills)
Prior experience in a Retail Bank environment
Legal experience desirable
Experience of dealing with external law enforcement and other government agencies
Knowledge of the Court Orders, DPA, PO and preparing witness statements
Confidence in communicating with people at all levels both externally and within the organisation
Close attention to detail 
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

job_title: IT Install & Upgrade Specialist High Acuity Care
description:
Job Description Summary The IT Install & Upgrade Specialist will take care of the implementation and upgrade of High Acuity Care products focusing on anesthesia, intensive-care and operation room management. This job will include sales support and close cooperation with other functions like Application Specialist, System Integration Specialist and Project Manager. You will be part of a strong Healthcare team.Patient Care Solutions develops medical devices and technology that help sustain life, and support patient care in every setting throughout the hospital environment. Our teams use every moment to provide clinicians and frontline caregivers with a variety of life-changing medical solutions in monitoring, diagnostic cardiology, acute care, anesthesia and respiratory care, and maternal and infant care. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world Job Description Responsibilities: 
Implementation and upgrade of High Acuity Care products for Eastern Europe and European projects.
Be part of the internal project kick-off.
Work directly with Healthcare customers and third parties on the implementation of the High Acuity Care products in the existing hospital IT environment.
Design & evaluate non-standard implementation on project level.
Handover of technical equipment and server environment to customers incl. technical training for IT department.
Be involved in the demo system creation.
Close collaboration with other functions such as Sales, Service Delivery Manager, Project Management, Application Specialists, System Integration etc.
Close collaboration with other departments like Sales, Service Desk, Product Management. 
Required Qualifications: 
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
Expertise in installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of Microsoft SQL Server.
Deep knowledge in Microsoft Server and Workstation Operation Systems like Windows 2016/2019 Server and Windows 10/11.
Knowledge in Virtualization like VMWare ESX and SAN.
Knowledge in setup, maintenance and troubleshooting of Terminal Server / Client environments.
Experience in common network protocols and industrial standards like TCP/IP, XML, Active Directory, HL7 etc.
Good analytical skills.
Good communication and presentation skills.
Fluent in English.
Valid driving license.
High Acuity Care projects will be managed on-site and remotely. Travelling to customers in Europe is required. 
Desired Characteristics: 
Proactive way of working.
Excellent team spirit.
Strong process orientation and a firm commitment to quality.
Experience working in the Healthcare IT industry and with knowledge of Hospital IT Systems. 
Inclusion and Diversity GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity. Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: No

job_title: Software Engineer I – Java Backend Engineer
description:
Hello all,
 We are happy to assist the product and service company “Saras Analytics” in creating new multinational remote team. We are open to meet people who are able to work 8 hours in between 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. CET, based in Bulgaria.
 Now, a little bit about the company and the product:
 Saras Analytics is a “home” for a passionate group of engineers, analysts, data scientists, and domain experts building products to accelerate the adoption of data as a strategic asset. “Daton” is a flagship ETL platform built for analysts and developers. Daton is an automated data platform that replicates data from SaaS platforms such as Google Analytics, Salesforce, Amazon, and Facebook Ads to cloud data warehouses like Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, and Snowflake. Daton empowers analysts to focus on generating insights rather than worrying about building and maintaining a data pipeline.
 How Saras Analytics describes your role:
 We are looking for a Software Engineer with good basis and knowledge in data structures, algorithms, core java, and distributed systems. If you are someone who is a creative thinker, deliver on aggressive timelines, have the hunger for growth, don't like giving excuses, contribute to product features, be hands-on and deliver a world-class product, then we want to hear from you. Our backend services are written in Kotlin and CDI, our front-end in Angular. We are looking for a software engineers to work on Daton with proficiency in Kotlin, Java, CDI SQL, NoSQL and REST APIs. This role is a strategic role for our company, and it provides a great opportunity for a driven developer to build a product from the ground up and to be a critical part of our growth.
 And you are:
 You are a great teammate with proven capabilities working on SaaS product and a passion for writing exception code.
 You are hungry for an opportunity to join a start-up and become a member of core platform team driving the company forward.
 Has good analytical and problem-solving skills and is able to break down a solution into smaller units of work and produce a solution roadmap.
 Has written high quality, well-tested shared components that can be leveraged by multiple systems. Can step into specific projects to supply additional management, coding and engineering capacity as needed.
 Has expert knowledge in distributes systems and high-volume transactions.
 Understand the product mission, goals, and tasks and execute with the team to achieve them.
 Understand the design and architecture and build modules in accordance with it or recommend and make the necessary changes that adds more stability to our product.
 Improve the quality of our front-end code and our overall front-end user experience.
 Takes requirements (business features, technical debts and internal enhancements) and designs resilient solutions.
 What you bring with you:
 1+ years of hands-on experience in Java/Kotlin.
 Demonstrable understanding of Design Patterns.
 Experience in Context & Dependency Injection or Spring framework, Hibernate/JPA.
 Experience in RESTful/SOAP web services in integrating with 3rd Party API Integrations.
 Proficient in SQL (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases.
 Nice to bring:
 Experience in multi-threading and concurrency is a plus Experience in JMS messaging using Apache Zookeeper and Kafka is a plus.
 Experience in Angular is a plus. Knowledge of modern CI/CD environments: Git, Gradle, GitLab Familiarity with tools like Postman, SOAPUI, IntelliJ
 Eligibility:
 Willing to learn our tech-stack (Kotlin | CDI | Angular).
 Develop API integrations using RESTful/SOAP web services.
 Significant technical academic course work or equivalent work experience.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 Knowledge on cloud infrastructure is a plus.
 Willingness to work under B2B contract.
 Dedicate 40 hours/weekly to Saras Analytics.
 Let’s connect and check if we match!
 You can state your interest by sending your CV and we will get in touch with the short-listed candidates.
 We treat your personal information with respect and confidentiality, guaranteed and protected by the professional ethics, the Bulgarian and European law.
 “InVisions” agency license № 2420 from 19.12.2017.

job_title: Projektleder til Bravida Fire & Security i Kalundborg
description:
Med baggrund i stor aktivitet inden for Fire & Security søger Bravida en professionel projektleder til vores afdeling i Kalundborg. Med reference til afdelingslederen for anlægsafdelingen, får du ledelsesansvaret for egne medarbejder og dine egne projekter. Projekterne udføres for en storkunde i Kalundborg, men kan også forekomme på installationssteder andre steder på Sjælland. Dit primære mødested er Kalundborg. Men da du bliver en del af et stort team af projektledere i Brøndby, vil der kunne forekomme en del kørsel. 
Detailprojektering og tidsplaner
Kvalitetssikring og D&V i samarbejde med vores kunde 
Deltage i udarbejdelse og beregning af tilbud, herunder mersalg til eksisterende kunde
Projektstyring og projektledelse, herunder økonomi og ressourcer
Erfaring med at arbejde og være i dialog med større kunder
Direkte ledelsesansvar for erfarne teknikere – både indenfor Sikring og ABA
Der arbejdes med en bred palet inden for ABA produkter, samt sikringsprodukter og derfor vil kendskab til produkter på det danske marked være en fordel. 
Kvalifikationer og erfaring 
Vi forventer, at du har en teknisk baggrund og erfaring med projektledelse
Det er en fordel, hvis du har kendskab til ABA, og meget gerne sikringsprodukter
Branchekendskab samt erfaring med ledelse og styring af projekter
Du er forretningsorienteret og har en god økonomisk forståelse, der sikrer at du kan planlægge og overholde budgetter
Du har erfaring med at læse og forstå kontrakter og du koordinerer dine projekter kvalificeret i forhold til kontrakten
Da arbejdsstedet er Kalundborg, vil det være en fordel at du bor indenfor en fornuftig radius af Kalundborg. 
Personlige egenskaber Som person er du ansvarlig og har forståelse for projekterings- og byggeprocessens forskellige tidsfrister. Du har gode kommunikative evner og begår dig forståeligt på forskellige organisatoriske niveauer. Du er målrettet og handlingsorienteret og du motiveres af at skabe resultater. Du er bevidst om din lederfunktion, hvormed du handler situationsbestemt overfor såvel medarbejdere som kolleger. Du sætter pris på udvikling og er motiveret for at lære nyt. Samarbejde er vigtigt for dig og du bidrager til en positiv stemning på arbejdspladsen. Vi tilbyder Et alsidigt og interessant job hos en af Nordens bedst etableret leverandør af tekniske installations- og serviceydelser. Der er gode udviklingsmuligheder i jobbet og du vil løbende få opdateret din tekniske viden inden for sikringsområdet. Du får frihed under ansvar samt en bred kontaktflade med dygtige kolleger og kunder fra hele landet. Vi har gode og stabile arbejds- og ansættelsesforhold, herunder pensionsordning og helbredssikring. Ansøgning Upload din ansøgning sammen med dit CV på Bravidas hjemmeside snarest muligt, da vi vurderer ansøgninger og løbende indkalder til samtaler. Er du interesseret? Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte projektleder Søren Hostrup på mobil: 2525 1884 eller afdelingsleder Jesper Andreasen på mobil / mail: 2525 1870 / jesper.e.andreasen@bravida.dk [162]

Bullhorn is the global leader in software for the staffing industry. After more than 20 years , more than 10,000 companies rely on Bullhorn’s cloud-based platform to power their staffing processes from start to finish. Led by the original co-founder, partnered with venture capital, and powered by seasoned leaders across a global workforce with an eye toward innovation, Bullhorn has had year over year growth, making it the market leader in the recruitment software space while allowing for new opportunities for over  35% of our employees to advance their careers in 2021.
 We are a remote-first organization and over 30% of our employees reside outside the United States. Headquartered in Boston, we also have offices in St. Louis, London, Brighton, Rotterdam, Frankfurt and Sydney (just in case you’re in the area to stop by). Whether you’re local or remote, our vision is to ensure every employee has a sense of belonging, a voice that is heard, and a clear path for success. Your incredible experience as an employee will consist of flexible work hours to ensure a positive work-life balance and use Zoom, Slack, and other tools to stay connected.
  Reporting to our Technical Lead, the Java software Engineer will have the opportunity to write custom applications and integrations, learn and explore new technologies, and work with a talented and growing team.
 A typical day will include
  Writing and unit testing clean, performant and reusable Java and Ruby.
Debugging complex Java problems to find simple solutions.
Working on minor enhancements and bug fixes in Ruby.
Working with the team to design solutions for our customer’s problems.
Participating in code reviews and giving feedback to improve our code standards.
Providing direction on future-looking technical, architectural and software design.
 This role is a fit for you if
  You have 2+ years of experience as a Software Developer.
You live and breathe Java.
You have Domain Driven Design experience. 
You have experience with RDBMS (PostgreSQL) and Message Queues (Sidekiq, RabbitMQ ).
You love solving problems with code and are driven by best practices.
You are a stickler for the right solution, and want to expand your technical prowess.
You are a team player and would rather ask for help than stay stuck for hours.
You have experience working with Docker.
You have experience working with modern cloud providers (such as AWS).
You have a deep understanding of SQL.
You have a Github account with code examples. Show us what you can do!
   Pension
EAP
Commuting Reimbursements
Unlimited Vacation
Full Access to LinkedIn Learning
Quarterly paid volunteer days
Lucrative Employee Referral Program (eligible for prior to your first day)
Career development opportunities up/across Bullhorn
 Bullhorn's core purpose is to create an incredible customer experience, which starts with first creating an incredible employee experience. Our vision is for every employee to have a sense of belonging, a voice that is heard, and a clear path for success. We are committed to building diverse and inclusive teams, and our culture is shaped by our five core values: Ownership, Energy, Speed & Agility, Service, and Being Human.
 We’re looking for real-life humans, each with their own unique set of thoughts, beliefs, cultures, identities, and a background and body that is completely individual. We also love humans who have taken less traditional paths of education and believe that experience and learning come in many forms. Together, all these unique individuals make Bullhorn stronger. If you’re reading this, you’re probably applying for/considering applying for a job with us, and we want you to know that Bullhorn is an equal opportunity employer. For us, that means we always have, and will always, strive to be as inclusive as possible in all aspects of employment and that we do not and will not tolerate discrimination of any kind.

Who We Are

In our Embedded Technologies department, we are focusing on client projects in the Automotive sector. The top-class services we provide consist mostly of software development and testing solutions for products such as Instrument Clusters and Head-up Displays, Control Units, Active and Passive Safety Systems (with a particular focus on Advanced Radar Systems) or even Low Level Drivers.

We are a friendly and distinguished community where colleagues are empowered to act, can choose their future development path and are great team players that truly care about the work they do in the industry.

What You'll Be Doing

Contribute to the development of our client innovative and complex Radar applications
Establish a stabile interface to our external customers and with your team colleagues from other departments
Software design and programming of embedded systems, software test, version management
C/C++ programming and AUTOSAR configuration is required

What You'll Bring Along

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
Min 3-5 years of experience in Embedded SW Development
Able to work independently in a structured and process oriented way
Very good programming skills in C embedded and AUTOSAR experience
Knowledge on EtH and of SysStack
Good knowledge of Microcontrollers, Drivers, Sensors, Communication/Diagnostics Protocols (CAN, UDS), OBD, Motor control, Bootloaders
Good communication skills and proactiveness in communication with different stakeholders
Good written and oral skills in English

What’s In It For You

✔ New beginnings can be a challenge. We promise a smooth integration and a supportive mentor

✔ Pick your working style: choose from Remote, Hybrid or Office work opportunities

✔ Early bird or night owl? Our projects have different working hours to suit your needs

✔ Nobody is born an expert. Sharpen your tech skills with our sponsored certifications, trainings and top e-learning platforms

✔ We want you to stay healthy! Enjoy our Private Health Insurance ⁠– it’s custom-made for you

✔ A clear mind is a healthy mind. Attend individual coaching sessions or go one step further by joining our accredited Coaching School

✔ Make the most of our epic parties or themed events – they’re lovingly designed for our people and their families

NTT DATA Romania is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants regardless to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.

Should you have any queries, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit. Send them this link!

Job Description
 NATEK poszukuje DevOps Cloud Engineerado projektu w banku komercyjnym, który oferuje usługi finansowe dla klientów indywidualnych i przedsiębiorstw. Zapewnia proste i bezpieczne usługi finansowe, dostępne tradycyjnie i cyfrowo.
 Your responsibilities
 ▪Minimum kilkuletnie doświadczenia w dostarczaniu rozwiązań w otoczeniu zaawansowanej architektury IT,
 ▪Praktyczna znajomość usług dostępnych w chmurach publicznych,
 ▪Znajomość narzędzi do automatyzacji (Terraform / Ansible),
 ▪Znajomość narzędzi CI/CD (Git,Azure DevOps itp),
 ▪Umiejętność programowania w językach skryptowych: Bash / PowerShell/ Pythonitp.,
 ▪Doświadczenia w projektach z obszaru technologii chmur publicznych,
 ▪Wysokie umiejętności interpersonalne, umiejętność współpracy z ludźmi z różnych szczebli w organizacji,
 ▪Certyfikat w jednym lub więcej ww. obszarów.
 Our requirements
 ▪Zarządzanie i monitoring środowisk chmurowych dla całej organizacji (landing-zonesdla Azurelub/iAWS),
 ▪Wsparcie w projektowaniu, optymalizacji (kosztowa i jakościowa), doborze rozwiązań oraz technologii przy uruchamianiu rozwiązań / migracji do chmur,
 ▪Wsparcie wdrożeń aplikacji w środowiskach deweloperskich, testowych, produkcyjnych na środowiskach chmurowych organizacji,
 ▪Współ praca z architektami korporacyjnymi/developerami/inż.chmurowymi, uzgadnianie rozwiązywanie problemów,
 ▪Automatyzacja czynności i procesów realizowanych w środowiskach chmurowych banku,
 ▪Opracowywanie dokumentacji technicznej dostarczanych rozwiązań.
 Benefits
 ▪Długofalową współpracę̨ o partą o nasze wartości: edukacja, partnerstwo i odpowiedzialność́,
 ▪Możliwość́ wymiany doświadczeń́ w międzynarodowych środowiskui rozwoju w projektach realizowanych w Polsce, lub innych krajach: Słowacja, Czechy, Bułgaria,
 ▪Pracęw nowoczesnym środowisku z innowacyjnymi technologiami,
 ▪Elastyczne godziny pracy,
 ▪Prywatną opiekę̨medyczną,
 ▪Kartę̨ Motorsportlub My Cafeteria, Ubezpieczenie na życie,
 ▪NATEK LoyaltyClub,
 ▪Możliwość́ dołączenia do społeczności odpowiedzialnej społecznie i uczestniczenia w inicjatywach firmowych,
 ▪Dla kontraktorów-uprawnienie do 23 dodatkowych dni świadczenia usług w roku.

Ort / Branche Nürnberg/remote Hast Du Lust auf spannende und vielfältige Projekte, die Du mitgestalten kannst? Hast Du zudem Spaß im Umgang mit Menschen und der Entwicklung von komplexen Architekturen und Lösungen? Dann werde Teil von uns. Höchste Qualität und Partnerschaft auf Augenhöhe – darauf setzen wir bei Cegeka. Denn kurzfristige Erfolge sind zwar wichtig, aber nicht das, worauf es uns als Familienunternehmen mit über 25-jähriger Geschichte ankommt. Mit mehr als 6.000 Mitarbeiter/-innen in elf europäischen Ländern identifizieren und erschließen wir die Potenziale neuer Technologien, ohne uns von Hypes blenden zu lassen, und entwickeln maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, die unsere Kunden den entscheidenden Schritt voranbringen. Beginn / Dauer Ab sofort/ unbefristet Aufgaben 
Du unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von iOS-Apps mit den Programmiersprachen Swift (und Objective-C).
Bei der Konzeption und Neuentwicklung von Apps bringst du deine Ideen ein.
Du entwickelst bestehende Apps weiter und hilfst bei der Optimierung des Nutzererlebnisses.
Bei deinen Aufgaben arbeitest du eng mit Product Ownern, Design, Test und Entwicklung zusammen.
Mit Tests und hoher Code-Qualität stellst du die Funktionalität der Apps sicher.
Aufwandsschätzungen von technischen Arbeitspaketen und Spezifikationen, sowie Dokumentation und Qualitätssicherung gehören zu deinen Aufgaben.
Mittels CI/CD sorgst du dafür, dass die aktuellen App Versionen stets verfügbar sind. 
Qualifikation 
Du hast mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von nativen iOS-Apps.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Swift und Xcode und Grundkenntnisse in Objective-C.
Die Anbindung von REST-Services ist für dich nichts Neues.
Du hast Interesse an neuen Technologien und Trends in der mobilen Entwicklung und die Bereitschaft, dich weiterzuentwickeln und fortzubilden.
Der Umgang mit Cocoapods/Swift Package Manager und gängigen Frameworks für iOS gehört für dich zum Alltag.
Fastlane und CI/CD sind keine Fremdwörter für dich.
Du bist teamfähig und erledigst deine Aufgaben selbstständig.
Du hast ein Grundverständnis für User Experience (UX) und User Interfaces (UI).
Du sprichst und schreibst sehr gutes Deutsch und mindestens gutes Englisch.
Nice to have: Erfahrung mit Android Entwicklung. 
Unser Angebot Was du allerdings sicher noch nicht weißt, ist: Warum Du bei uns arbeiten solltest: 
Du stehst bei uns im Mittelpunkt.
Deine Meinung wird gehört und Du kannst vieles selbst beeinflussen.
Wir bieten Dir den Freiraum, den Du brauchst, um Deine Arbeit richtig gut zu machen.
Dafür interessieren wir uns nicht nur für Deine Stärken, sondern auch für deine Schwächen um sie zusammen mit Dir anzugehen.
Denn wir wollen Dir jeden Tag die Möglichkeit geben, dich weiterzuentwickeln. In die Richtung, die Dir am besten gefällt. 
Hard Facts: 
We care about you! Dein Arbeitsort ist freiwählbar – Ob im Büro oder Remote, wir bieten Dir ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität.
„Duz“-Kultur.
 Großes Unternehmen aber Start-Up-Feeling in Nürnberg.
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege.
Eigenes Budget für Weiterbildungen, welches Du selbst verwalten kannst.
Freie Wahl deines Notebooks und deines Smartphones.
Ein dynamisches Team und eine flexible Arbeitsumgebung mit modernsten Technologien.
Regelmäßige Fortbildungen und Zertifizierungen, damit Du immer up-to-date bist.
Ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit spannenden Aufgaben.
Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle nach deinen Bedürfnissen für eine dauerhaft ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance.
Eine ausgeprägte Open-Door-Mentalität, in der neue Ideen gerne gehört werden.
Attraktive Prämienprogramme für gute Arbeit, gute Ideen und deine eigenen Projekte 
Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann lass‘ uns herausfinden, wohin unsere gemeinsame Reise gehen soll. Melde Dich dafür einfach bei Habibe. Habibe Ali, HR Ansprechpartnerin am Nürnberger Standort, verrät Dir, warum Cegeka vielleicht auch Dein perfekter Arbeitgeber wäre. Hier das Video dazu: Warum Cegeka? Kontakt Cegeka Deutschland GmbH Habibe Ali Tullnaustraße 20 90402 Nürnberg Tel +49 911 43453 512 Mobil +49 170 7904751 Email Habibe.Ali@cegeka.com Wir möchten Dich selbstverständlich auch in Corona-Zeiten persönlich kennenlernen. Aber uns liegen die Gesundheit und das Wohlergehen aller sehr am Herzen. Daher möchten wir Dir hier unsere wichtigsten Regeln im Rahmen des Bewerbungsprozesses nennen.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams am Standort Detmold, Bielefeld, Hamburg oder im Homeoffice - nach entsprechender Einarbeitung - suchen wir zur Festanstellung einen TYPO3 Entwickler (m/w/d) in Vollzeit.
 DEIN PROFIL
  Ein (Wirtschafts-)Informatikstudium, eine Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker/In Anwendungsentwicklung bzw. eine gleichwertige Ausbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich PHP Web-Entwicklung, idealerweise in einer Agentur
Gute Kenntnisse in objektorientierter Programmierung mit PHP
Fundierte TYPO3 Erfahrung
Erfahrung mit der Erstellung von TYPO3-Extensions auf Extbase-Basis sowie von Fluid-basierten Templates
Gute Kenntnisse in TypoScript, PHP, MySQL, Flexform und XML
Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollen wie Git wünschenswert
Erfahrung mit Unix/Linux wünschenswert
 DEINE AUFGABEN
  Aufsetzen, Betreuen und Optimieren von TYPO3-Projekten im Team
Konzeption und (Weiter-)Entwicklung von individuellen TYPO3-Extensions und Features
Erstellung und Anpassung der Templates für das Frontend-Team
Entwicklung von Im- und Exportschnittstellen
Dokumentation erledigter Aufgaben

Gerne neueste Technologien im Bereich TYPO3 kennenlernen und anwenden möchtest
Selbstständig und eigenverantwortlich arbeiten möchtest

Zuverlässigkeit, Flexibilität und Eigenverantwortung als selbstverständlich empfindest
Eine agile und qualitätsbewusste Arbeitsweise hast
Ein junges Team mit Ihrem Wissen und Ihrer Persönlichkeit verstärken möchtest
Kurze Entscheidungswege und flache Hierarchien schätzt
Dich gerne dank regelmäßiger Schulungen und Weiterbildungen entwickeln möchtest
 DAS BIETEN WIR DIR
  Gerne neueste Technologien im Bereich TYPO3 kennenlernen und anwenden möchtest

 NOCH EIN PAAR FAKTEN

40 Stunden Arbeitswoche bei einer Vollzeitstelle
Vertrauens- und flexible Arbeitszeit. Stimme Dich einfach mit Deinem Team ab!
Arbeite in der Agentur, im Home Office oder mach Remote Work
Du hast die Wahl: Apple MacBook oder Microsoft Surface Laptop
Telefoniere über Microsoft Teams - also völlig standortunabhängig
 WARUM ZU UNS
Bei LOUIS INTERNET erwartet Dich ein Team aus Generalisten und Spezialisten, die eine Sache gemeinsam haben: wir brennen für das, was wir tagtäglich tun und wie wir es tun.
  Wir arbeiten in Teams. Agil. Meistens nach Scrum.
Wir arbeiten miteinander und füreinander.
Wir lernen voneinander und zusammen. Teilen unser Wissen und unsere Erfahrungen.
Wir tauschen uns aus. Entscheiden und organisieren vieles in Teams.
Wir zählen von Anfang an auf Dich. Unsere Kunden auch. Bei uns übernimmst Du Verantwortung und bist Motor für den Erfolg unserer Projekte.
Wir sind mutig und probieren Neues. Fehler sind für uns menschlich. Wir lernen aus ihnen.
Wir wollen immer einen Schritt voraus sein. Lassen uns dabei von unseren Ideen antreiben und sind gespannt auf Deine Impulse.
Wir arbeiten wo auch immer wir uns am produktivsten und kreativsten fühlen. Das schließt auch dauerhaftes Homeoffice ein.
 Und wir brennen für die enormen Potentiale der Digitalisierung. Also helfen wir unseren Kunden bei der erfolgreichen Umsetzung von digitalen Projekten und Kampagnen. Automatisieren Prozesse. Erhöhen Reichweiten. Optimieren Kundenerlebnisse. Erleichtern den Zugang zu Informationen. Digitalisieren den Vertrieb. Intensivieren Kundenbeziehungen. Steigern Sichtbarkeiten. Und so vieles mehr!

job_title: Empleo Mid Level Front End Engineer | Trabajo Online
description:
En Turing, ayudamos a los programadores a construir la carrera de sus sueños poniéndolos en contacto con empleos de tecnología muy bien pagos en EE.UU., con un salario en dólares. Más de 400 empresas, incluídas Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., han contratado a desarrolladores de Turing.
 A rapidly-emerging company that enables protocols and organizations to have scalable governance and decision-making is looking for a Front-End Engineer. The engineer will take charge of creating sets of features from scratch and working with frameworks within the JavaScript stack. By integrating webhooks and bridges, the firm aims to break down barriers across chat platforms such as Discord, Telegram, and Riot. The company has managed to raise close to $25.5 mn in funding.
 Job Responsibilities:
  Own and design feature sets from the ground up
Convert wireframes, mockups, and prototypes of site/app designs into actual, functional interfaces
To create web pages, use a variety of markup languages
Maintain the site regularly and optimize web pages for optimal performance, scalability, and the greatest user experience
 Job Requirements:
  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Experience in designing patterns around data
Knowledge of web design
Expertise in JavaScript and its frameworks
Familiarity with Web3 is nice to have
Proficiency in English

Project Description:
 Hirschmann Automation and Control is the Technology and Market Leader in Industrial Networking. Part of the Belden Inc Group from 2007, Hirschmann develops innovative solutions, which are geared towards its customers' requirements in terms of performance, efficiency and investment reliability. Covering markets like Transportation, Energy, Oil&Gas, Manufacturing, Automotive Hirschmann has become the leader in data communication and automation systems offering high quality, high availability line of industrial networking devices and systems. Our projects are including the full cycle of software development, for the entire line of products: starting with BSP and driver development for new HW components, OS integration (both Linux and VxWorks), feature development and integration (L2-L3 Ethernet-based communication protocols or Industrial Protocols), bug fixing and support ending with manual or automated testing using an internal in-house developed framework. Runs on cutting-edge HW platforms designed in-house using the newest technologies from Broadcom, all the software is developed under Agile methodology using a modern continuous integration approach. The local team consists of 65 members organized in 7 Scrum teams. Each team can either take the responsibility of an entire release, including management or work with several teams to the same product line or software release.
 Responsibilities:
 Feature developing and bug fixing for Client's Industrial Switches Platform family
 Mandatory Skills Description:
 - Experience in embedded software development, preferably for network equipment
- Experience with C programming on VxWorks/Linux/Unix environments
- Experience with cross compilers, debuggers, etc.
- Good understanding of Ethernet and IP networking
- Familiarity with git
- Knowledge of RTOS application development (VxWorks / NetBSD / Linux)
- Understanding multi-process system software architectures
- Experience with one or more of the following: POSIX threads, SNMP, XML
- Shell Scripting
 Nice-to-Have Skills:
 -Agile/Scrum experience
